reviews.review: Awesome attraction . We went to look at the castle. Inside we found an amazing village with church, restaurants overlooking Budapest. Try the hot chocolate yum! It's kept a traditional feel to the village.

Great place to visit. I walked up there 3 times during my 5 days stay in Budapest - once with the Free Walking Tour, second time by myself to tour inside the art gallery, third time with the cruise group.
Great day out. Great views, craft stalls and restaurants to suit all. Allow at least half a day to take it in. Can get there by bus or the venicular railway at the bottom of the year

So much history. Please make sure when you visit you've either got a tour guide or have done your homework. The history behind this building is immense! Visit at night for the full effect and don't bother going inside. The essence of the palace has been killed by a sterile art gallery that now lives within.
The hunting scene statue/fountain was unbelievable

Great Building and Excellent View. After crossing the Danube from the Chain Bridge, we took a slope upward (Sikló u.) for a casual 20-min walk via Medieval bastion "Rondella" to the Buda Caslte. The views along the way was nice. The Castle itself was just magnificent. It's just too bad that we arrived too late for the art gallery and the museum. Nevertheless, the court and the garden and the views were just so wonderful.

Stunning. Buda Castle offers stunning views of the city (Pest) as well as offering you the chance to walk around the amazing grounds. For those with mobility issues, take the Fenicular up as the assent is quite difficult

Amazing place. Buda Castle, Bastion and other wonderful places on Buda Hill is the second place you have to visit after Chain Bridge. Avoid using funicular. One way tickets ir a little bit cheaper than 24h public transport card. From central square is running a bus directly to the hill.
visit the museum. as you get to the castle you can see great views o Budapest the castle itself is big but take time to go to the museum as it is well worth it and take a good 1.5 hours to visit
Imposing. Imposing Castle overlooking the city, i did not go inside but a lovely place for photos or a drink at the open air bar on the ramparts .

A MUST SEE while at BUDA City. The Buda Castle which was built in 1265 consists of a number of complex palaces and castles. Many of the buildings were destroyed throughout the years but there is still quite a lot to see. Stroll along the streets and admire many monuments of past kings, the Fisherman's Bastion, Matthias church, the Holy Trinity column, the National Gallery, the History Museum etc...you can watch the funicular in action. You can admire the many souvenir shops, cafes, restaurants and hotels. Take breath taking pictures of the marvelous views from the top. It's worth a visit!!!
amazing views of the city!. did not have much time to sight see on this trip however it was recommended to me to see the castle which i was so pleased i did, the views are stunning. has to be seen
A very nice replication. Not entirely historically accurate but very interesting museum with lots of replicated objects from the various structures that have stood in the castle district.

My friend took me around for a day. And this was one of the best places we visited that day, it s a must see if you like castles and amazing statues, some hot wine and the traditional Hungarian Kurtos cake which is baked in a small shack there by a lovely old couple, simply amazing Hungarian experience
Unappealing. It is a lovely area to walk around, but none of the attractions appealed to us. Just wander and wonder.
What a delightful experience. This is certainly a must for a visit. So much to see. Do go down into the basements they are a real revelation.
Interesting. Take your time around the castle and museum; there is much to see, and it is well laid out. The museum, in particular, contains a lot of interesting artifacts and information,
Nice building. Since you came all the way to Budapest, you might wanna see this place. It's a nice building and you can find museum inside the same building complex. The view is nice for sure.

Gorgeous place to take a walk through. I went to the castle yesterday and was surprised to find that you can just wander through most of the grounds. I was absolutely gorgeous, with unbeatable views of the river! I'm sure taking a guided tour for the history and looking in the museums is well worth it, but if you don't want to spend any money, an hour to have a look around is a great option. I loved it!

Stunning. We took the funicular to the top which was fun. It can get busy with queues but worth the wait. The views are amazing and such a beautiful area to explore. The Fishermans bastion is nearby too. It looks so impressive any time of the day but especially at night when lit up.
Castle . A very good castle Clean and safe I enjoy the view from the mountain You should visited day and night time

worth going for a look. when we got there we were told that this was the kid and adult free day so we were able to go into the castle for nothing. we then went on an hour long tour of the Gothic art. really good to see 600 year old art work. you have to see it to appricate it.
very impressive building. it is a very impressive cuilding with historical importance. we did not enter the museums, but prefer to stroll all over buda.
Beautiful and hugeeeee. You can easily spend a whole day strolling around the area, but breathtaking views of pest and Danube River at every turn. A must see!
Wine festival!. The yearly winefestival is held at the Buda castle. Nice festival, but make sure to buy enough tickets so you can buy/try many glasses of different hungarian wine! Wear good shoes!

Beautful classic castle. It's huge and beautiful and up on the Castle Hill complex. Unfortunately time did not permit us to enter. I believe there are some tours allowed inside, but am unsure of how comprehensive they are. Still, it was wonderful to see close up, and, again, you have some amazing views from there of the city and Danube.

Amazing view!. The Royal Palace is simply a masterpiece of architecture! No wonder they call Budapest the little Vienna. So much history about the monarchy and the Astrian-Hungarian Empire. The gardens outside are beautiful and the view is breathtalking.

Stunning views of historic castle and beautiful city for free!. The views of the castle and city are spectacular at night when lighted up. The best part is that you can easily walk up, down, and around the huge castle grounds for free! So if you are of average fitness, you do not need to pay for the funicular ride up. It was awesome walking around a castle with so much history and beautiful architecture, all without any crowd. Will definitely come back to this castle if I'm back in Budapest!

Magnificent. This is a beautiful building to visit and there is so much to see inside and out.....the gardens re lovely the views are fantastic and you are only a short distance from the Fishermans Bastion which is stunning

Amazing views and some interesting history. The easiest (and most fun!) way to get to it is via the funicular, although you can walk ~30min up the hill, but for the ~3 euro fee it's worth it.The views are stunning from the walls, you can see a long way up and down the river. The statues and buildings are beautiful to see up close, and there are museums within the structure that you can visit (for an extra fee). Only thing to note is that some of the walkways are a bit narrow, but they have handrails and feel sturdy, so even people who don't like heights should be fine. There are also lifts to get up and down the different levels.

should worth your time when you visit Budapest. Disclaimer: we only went to the museum part of the castle. We didn't have time to go to the library and the national gallery.Even though the museum is not the caliber of its Viennese Austrian counterpart, I think it's still worth it. From the outside the castle is very imposing, reminding us of the power of the Habsburg.
Beautiful Building - Great view. Best way to get an overview of the three distinct areas of Budapest. The building is great and its history interesting.
Swindon visits Buda Castle. What a beautiful place and some wonderful coloured tiles on the roof. The views from the turretts are fantastic.

Beautiful. If you love sightseeing or love architecture, or just Europe landscapes, take a visit. It's beautiful and we didn't spend a lot of time here but it really was great to learn the history of the castle.
Amazing. Beautiful castle full of history and art .. it's a must visit when in Budapest.. castle history museum and Royal gallery are fantastic

Send an entire day here. You'll find plenty to do and enjoy. It is easy to access Buda Castle from bus 16 or 16a. Start with a tour of the Cathedral then meander down the street past the shops and restaurants to the museums at the far end of the castle.Stop for lunch and enjoy a hot bowl of goulash, mail a post card at the convenient post office and perhaps buy a souvenir or table linen across the street. Finish your day with a tour of the museum.We are not fans of Modiliani but did enjoy the other permanent exhibition. Jump back on the bus and return to your hotel.

Fantastic views of Parliament Building and the Danube. I went to the Buda Castle twice during my short visit. It has fantastic views to the Danube below and the Parliament Building across the river. The museum was hosting a really nice exhibit as well...check to see what is being exhibited. I took the funicular up and down one day. Very good time and energy saver with good views as well while not being expensive.

Impressive - not be missed . Vast and impressive well worth a visit , climb to the top on the winding footpath, or take the cable car or the Number 16 bus . Coincide your visit at midday to see the changing of the guard . Ample opportunities to admire the view across the Danube to Pest.

Highly recommended. The castle overlooks the city from its elevated position atop Castle Hill, some 48m above the Danube. It is the former residence of Hungarian Kings but is now home to the National Gallery, Budapest History Museum, National Szechenyl Library, which bother the Lion's Courtyard, the central courtyard of the castle. The Lion's Gate gives entrance to the courtyard, is monumental and is crowned by the Hungarian Crest. Steps away from this gate is the Matthias fountain, a favourite spot of photographers. The Natiaonal Gallery has a comprehensive collection of Hungarian artwork from the Middle Ages to the present day. Budapest history museum covers the history of Budapest from prehistory to modern times. The National Szechenyi Library holds a copy of every book published in Hungary. Do look out for the statue of a large bird perched atop a tall pedestal , the mythical Turul bird of death, a symbol of the kingdom of Hungary. Do also keep a look out for other statues and fountains in and around the garden.
Very Nice Castle. A must visit place in Budapest I liked views from here to the city, especially at night it's very fascinating. The funicular train is also worth a trip.

Great restoration of the exterior. Beautiful during both the day and is lit up at night. Wonderful sight for display only. There is nothing on the interior. The locals are proud of it, but it truly is a tourist sight with numerous buses taking visitors there on a daily basis. Take time at the top to walk around and see the views. Beautiful.

Brilliant views of not so blue Danube. Took the vernacular up and down, although the walk down looked interesting. Brilliant views of the river and Pest town, interesting display of hussars. On the hour guard changes, looking very theatrical. Good display.

Do the walk! . Don't wait in line for the funicular do the walk! The view is worth it! This is one of the most beautiful castles I've seen, the whole area is stunning. We spent a good 5 hours just wandering round and taking photos - stunning! And the views of the city and river are breathtaking.

Castle on Buda Hill. Buda Castle, with museum inside, was a "must-see" tourist spot in Budapest. As it was located uphill, thus it has the advantage of having panoramic views over nearly the whole city. After crossing the Chain Bridge, you could either walk uphill or use the funicular. We were early enough this time (9 am) to see the "change of guards" performance at the entrance and tour around the castle taking pictures on all the statues around as well as the scenes on the other side of River Danube prior to proceed to the Fisherman's Bastion. Highly recommend this spot to other tourists.

Interest castle with a great museum inside. Interesting castle on the Castle Hill site, within walking distance from the Fisherman's Bastion. There is a great museum inside that describes the various civilizations that have been in Budapest and the history of the castle. You can see the older castle in the basement and more recent history upstairs. There's even artifacts dating back to the Neolithic times from near the city.
Beautiful Inside and Out. This is a great location, and the museum inside is very interesting. The several centuries this castle existed are well represented.
Walking visit. We were on a cruise last place was Budapest stunning view of the castle walked over bridge to the castle did not actually go in it had a walk around it

Best views anywhere. This castle is definitely a must see. The castle itself is fabulous to see and here the history of the castle and the views of the Pest side of the city are spectacular. Loved being there.

Don't bother with the funicular. When hearing about and seeing the queues for Castle Hill funicular we found a little tip that further south along the river just a short stroll away was the Varkert Bazar. It has 2 lifts and an escalator that will take you to the top FREE OF CHARGE. the first lift appears to be for a car park but takes you to an escalator which in turn gives you access to a rather plain looking lift. You step out to a wonderful vista and access to the Castle. You walk down, but we took the funicular no queuse going down. My wife's knees and mine aren't what they used to be.

A whole new world! . I visited this the last day of our trip. The next time I go I would take more time.. It was beautiful. It reminded me of Prague. You can see the country from a whole new level. It is located directly across the chain bridge. Next time I will take more time because I'm sure I missed a lot! This is a need to see!!!

So much to see!. We spent several hours touring the entire castle district (Castle Hill). To get to the top, you can walk it, but it is very steep...or take the funicular...or just take a cab from your hotel and they will drop you off at the top. We opted to walk down which was easy and enjoyable. After we were dropped off, we explored the Fisherman's Bastion, a beautiful and fairytale like terrace to see great views of the Pest side of Budapest. From here we walked around Matthias Church with an ornate roof. From here we wandered into the residential area that includes lots of shops. I highly recommend Litea: Literature & Tea Bookshop. The manager was so nice and so helpful. My mother found lots of great books about Hungary. I found beautiful prints from children book illustrator Karoly Reich. From here we wandered into the castle grounds. I highly recommend a self guided tour found in most tour books and online...this will point out and explain the many beautiful statues and sights you will come across. The interior of the castle is now museums including history and art. There is no fee to wander the castle grounds and surrounding area, but there is for the museums. There were lots of restaurants from elegant sit down to gelato to a Starbucks. We did have difficulty finding a public restroom. We had no difficulty walking down from Castle Hill, but it looked like a hard walk up...take a cab or the funicular. There are tons of photo ops of Buda and Pest so don't forget your camera!
Amazing view. Well worth the visit. Gorgeous view to the Danube River and the Chain Bridge. Easy access to the top but with options for those who prefer a long walk.
Buda Castle. We did not go inside but walked around it. We opted for a gentle stroll around the castle. Beautiful.

Amazing views of the city. Came here on a sunny afternoon. Didn't go inside the museum because it was going to close within the hour. Definitely glad we came here to wander the grounds and admire the stunning views of the Danube and Pest.
Lovely!. Lovely building (more of a palace than a castle) but we didn't make it inside. Great views from outside, worth seeing!

This is a palace, IMHO !. You cant miss Buda Castle. Its up ther on the hill, overlooking Budapest and the Danube, and must be the biggest building there, by some margin. BUT its not a castle, its a palace, IMHO. And its difficult to get into. The part we managed to access contained an art gallery, so we backed off. And we just could not find the treasury, which was one part I still wanted to visit, after we found out it was not really a castle. Its also quite a way up the hill (we passed a funicular at one point). We walked uphill a lot, we walked across a lot, we never really found what we were looking for, so for us a waste of valuable time.

Most Boring Museum Ever. Ok, maybe it was because I was tired from all the other sites we had visited that day already, but Buda Castle was a major snooze. I expected it to help clarify the history of Budapest (since its many occupations can get confusing) but the interior of Buda Castle is really just a museum about the actual building—which, for the record, has also been occupied and destroyed numerous times. The exhibits themselves are really dull (and this is coming from a person who usually LOVES musuems) and we wandered around for a while, but really didn't get a lot of the experience. It was really inexpensive to visit, so nothing lost, but still, I'd spend my time elsewhere. It's also worth noting that the national art museum is housed in a separate section of the castle. Also, the monestary that was next door is undergoing a major renovation, so it's closed.
Exterior is beautiful. We didn't go inside the building but my understanding is that the interior is nothing special to write home about.

Great views of Pest.. We visited Buda Castle when we were going to see the National Gallery . It is fun to just walk around. It is not a sneaky well restored as castles in other major European cities, but you should definitely go if you are in Budapest.

Its ROYAL !!. Very rich History of this Central European Culture . The Panoramic view is excellent.The buda castle is a wonderfull place to walk through and the sight from the castle toward the danube is lovely specially in the evening when the sun goes down and the lights come up on the bridges

Great place to visit and stay. Stayed in Hilton in Buda Castle. Amazing views day and night! During the day the bridge of chains is in view and the river is beautiful. At night the views are spectacular! The parliament building across the river is lit up and the sea gulls in flight above look like fireflies in the light.
Must See Area. The Buda Castle and its surroundings are a great place to walk around .. The architecture is impressive and the views from the area are great .
Long climb. The castle is a long climb to the top however there is a fenicular train that goes to the top. Worth the walk to the top even in 30 degree heat.
Nice building. Nice building and architecture, with a lot of thing to see inside the Gallery and the area around the main building. The view of Danube and Pesta is also very nice.

Much to see here. Took the funicular to the height of the land to find the Royal Palace, the National Gallery, the Castle Gardens and to the many scenic city overlooks. This can be a four hour activity but don't worry as you will find everything you need on "The Hill". I enjoyed the changing of the guard. These young men in their uniforms standing there in the heat were most impressive.

lovely place to spend a few hours. Try and go with a guide as you really get a feel for the history of the place. We went into the church here although they charge for this. Lovely square to soak up the atmosphere, or take photos (take a long lens) of the beautiful city below. You can go to the shops or stop at the cafe, although of course the prices are steeper here. Unless you are super fit I wouldn't recommend walking back to Pest on foot in the heat. We did it previously and were exhausted by the end of it. This time we came on the coach as part of a tour and it was lovely.
One of the best city views. amazing place, even that it^s not that old, it has a onderful architecture, and the city view from the top is a must see.

Amongst the most impressive of all the beautiful Budapest architecture.. The complex houses museums and is walking distance from the quaint old town of the Buda side of the city. Magnificent views of the city below and a lovely visit to a memorial to another age.
OK. The castle complex seems like a place to walk around rather than pay money to get into. A crowded area.

Like something from Disney. Incredible castle still 100% intact. Although packed full of tourists it's still worth the visit itself.. Some of the better views are unfortunately owned by the hotel opposite for food service but there's still plenty of other great spots. Well worth the long climb up there.
Wonderful museums. This area is packed with various museums and the architecture is amazing. There are bronze statues dotted all around this area.

Beautiful. Such a beautiful place, we were enthralled and captivated by it. Wonderful views of the city below. Highly recommend that you get there early, we got there at 8:30 am and beat all the crowds.
Great view . This place is very beautiful... Specially during the night when it's not so crowded with tourists. It's worth the visit.
Meh. After going to the prague castle a few days earlier I was not very impressed, but you should give it a try especially if it is your first time in a castle

Impressive of the Danube and the city (Pest): do no miss it.... Get ready to climb stairs (or take the funicular): impressive views from the castle. A not-to-miss point of interest.
My recommendations:
1- Comfortable shoes for the walking, climbing the stairs (up-hill and down hill).
2- Take plenty if pictures to share with friend and family at your return.
Heard a concert there that was fantastic!. the complex is very worth visiting, but for us, the highlight was a concert we came back to that night... fabulous!

Wonderful experiences breaking clouds. Astonishing buildings where you can alive again the Hungarian historical centuries. Permanent and temporary exhibitions and many high visibility events. Let's visit!

It's OK. The art gallery is OK. It has some very agreeable exhibits but there isn't a huge amount to admire of the things that we liked. The cafe is fine for a light bite and there is a more expensive restaurant.
Must see. Great tourist attraction Centrally located near the Chain bridge. Spend about an hour viewing. Great photo op.

Obvious that it has been restored almost all but it is beautiful the same!. I have visited the castle shortly and took great photos of the city from here. It is beautiful but one of the most attractive sides about the castle is the statue of S. Stephano if I do not remember it wrong. The worst thing about the castle is that there is a Starbucks nearby. And the area behind the castle is worth seeing, it makes you feel the history around you and under your feet to those who walk around.

just a great place to visit. Strolling or looking at art exhibitions, the day will still be great. You can feel the history, the dome is rebuilt after being totally bombed out in II WW and there are plenty of remnants from the Communist era.

Impressive building. . Impressive from the outside.
Surrounded by old ruins.
The view is absolutely spectacular!
Don't miss the nice fountain.

Amazing Views, Great Exhibit. After a 20 min walk from our hotel and a short funicular ride up the hill (too hot to fo it by foot but many people did) we truly enjoyed the visit to the castle. The panoramic views of the Danube and the Pest side of the town, especially the Parliament and the Chain Bridge, were spectacular. The architecture is also very impressive. Formerly home to the Hungarian kings (like Mel Brooks said, "it's nice to be King"), this amazing palace is now home to the Hungarian National Gallery. The art museum itself could use some remodeling to make to improve the flow and the looks (looked a bit "sovietish" inside) and I was not particularly impressed by the art, mostly Hungarian. But the Modigliani temporary exhibit was outstanding. The audio self guide, available in many languages, was great.The castle is also located in a hill full of restaurants, bars, galleries, and shops, which can be combined into a packed half day of visits, at least. The only drawback was the multitude of tourists. Even in mid-September the area was PACKED, so be ready to fight crowds and long lines.

Great View. Great area to stroll around. See the guard change. View the city. Take pictures in the garden. The museum is showing Modigliani right now. I believe would be best with a TOUR, not alone. You'll miss all the importance and history- which is essential to truly appreciate.

DISAPPOINTING THIS TIME. We visited Buda Castle last year and it was very interesting. The art gallery and museum were good to see. Unfortunately, this year there had been some sort of exhibition and the grounds were full of kiosks and cables so we did not stay.
Budapest . What an amazing place. With it's village and Castle at the top of the hill over looking the city. Stunning

Visit to Buda Castle with young kids. We visited the Buda Castle complex with our 6 yr old. It is a massive complex with a lot of sights to see. We took a tram to the castle complex from our hotel near St. Stephens Cathedral, which was really convenient. The castle complex has museums and churches, so you have to decide what you want to see. There is also a 10 minute 3-D movie on Hungarian history that is showed in own of the churches. It was worth the money, very educational. We skipped the museums and churches as our son is on the young side. Plus the lines were long and even though it was 9 AM it was crowded.

Nice views some delightful museums and galleries. If you're visiting after Prague you might be a little disappointed however Buda castle is a collection of beautiful buildings in its own right. It also has a lot of museums, my personal favorites are the Museum of history of Hungary and the Arms museum. The national gallery is also part of the complex as are a host of hotels and restaurants. Its like a tiny town which has some hidden gems like the House of Houdini a definite visit if you're into magic. All in all a good way to spend a day in Budapest.

2016 Summer Vacation. I happened to be in Budapest when they had their International Folk Art Festival enclosed inside the Buda Castle, with hand crafted Jewelry, Home décor, various foods (everything was excellent); traditional hand made bags and clothing and much much more. Plus visited the Hungarian National Gallery and History Museum

Spectacular view across the Buda part!!. This is the place to get a wonderful view for Buda part of Budapest. we used the old funicular to clime and reach the Castle.It is really a huge castle with many courtyard at the back which seem to belong to medieval period. There are many museums inside, but not for free.

The best of Budapest. You can NOT miss this. Do yourself a favour and hire a private tour guide. It cost about $120AUD for the whole day. Worth EVERY cent. It's big, it's beautiful and it's one of the most picturesque places in the world. The view a cross the Danube is incredible. I would go back to Budapest in a heart beat. A look into days gone by. Young med dressed in medieval costume some holding a hawk.....Yes there is history in Budapest and lots of it. At night it's great to take a ride on one of the boats....seeing the castle lit up at night is gorgeous.Oh and don't forget your camera!
Buda Castle. We visited the food and wine festival and had an amazing time. The wine was delicious and so much to chose from and set in the most amazing setting.

Beautiful. High up on the hill and gives magnificent view of city. Nice walk from there to cafes, church, and nice buildings.
Visit near chain bridge to get a night view of lighted castle.

Beautiful . I enjoyed walking around the Buda Castle, the views are beautiful and it is a massive castle. We walked up, and believe me it's not that hard! I would recommend this instead of the cable car (we did both) We went the day after the wine festival so they were still cleaning up and getting rid of the stalls. Other than that I enjoyed it, there is so much to look at! I would take a good 4 hours to look around!
Ineffable !!. Whatever I say wouldn't be enough for this magnificent place !! And how much more grand it looks in the night all lit up..
Beautiful view!. I believe this is the best view yiu can get for Buda & Pest ... the fenucular ride is also rly cool ... u'll get to see some rly nice views on ur way up and down. It's a must c
Magnificent view across the city. The castle is well maintained and the view from the castle walls is well worth the walk....even in 33 degrees heat.

Huge and Grand. We visited via one of the hop on hop off tours so we didn't have the time to do the complex it's full justice. I could easily have spent another 3-4 hours on top of the 2-3 we spent exploring the area.

Great castle in the hill. We are using old funicular (Budavari Siklo) to climb up there, it reminds me on Grand Budapest Hotel movies! The way its moving is not used electricity quite impressed me. the place is very wide, perfect place to take a photo here!
Massive. The Castle was so huge I was not able to see all of it as time was an issue. It was so beautiful looking at the paintings and even seeing the wine cellar. Worth going back to see the rest.
Wine festival. We went for the wine festival which was a great experience. Its the perfect setting for the festival and couldnt have asked for more. If youre in Budapest, its a must

Worth a visit. We were there for the Festival of St Stephen in August, which included a terrific food fair on the road directly in front of the castle. For vegetarians (as was anticipated) you're at a disadvantage - so much of Hungarian cuisine is meat - but that didn't detract from an exciting day. Just be aware that the organisers like to charge, and charge big, for entrance to the various castle-based attractions.

Danube views. Looking from the Pest side to castle hill is a great . We accessed the castle using the funicular. The castle itself has a lot to look at but the most impressive thing about it are the wonderful views you have of the Danube, Budapest and the chain bridge. It is well worth the visit and can be up to a couple of hours of information and picture taking.
A palace. Not the Disney style castle like you see in Germany. This looks more like a palace. Its size is very impressive.

Beautiful area, but there is no longer a Castle!. To be clear there no longer is a castle. The reviews here are misleading. There is a walled complex of the Castle Hill area with a ton to do and see, but the castle itself is no longer there (it was mostly destroyed during WWII). Two wings of what used to be the castle are now the National Library and the Budapest History Museum which are worth visiting. There are some very neat ruins nearby the library and museum which show foundations of rooms. The Castle Hill area also has Fisherman's Bastion and Matthias Church both of which are beautiful. There are a ton of shops and restaurants. If you go, plan to spend most of your day there. The views from the Castle Hill area are beautiful. We didn't take the funicular, we walked and took the stairs. To do this, walk through the tunnel to the right of where people are waiting on line to get tickets to the funicular, then walk to your left and up the stairs. There is a sidewalk in the tunnel.

So much to see!. Spent a very interest few hours inside the castle. Lots of historical information and artefacts. Fabulous views over the Danube and Budapest. Tip: the Funicular Railway is interesting but to save money walk along about 250 m south along river to the Castle Gardens and there is a lift and escalator that will take you to the top for free! This was kindly explained to us by a fellow Brit who was selling tickets for the hop off hop on bus but told us this for nothing as we didn't need the bus service! Very nice man!

Fabulous view of the Danube river and Pest. If you look up from Pest side of the river, this is high up on the hill. When I went there, there was a market on the castle, so it was so busy. The view from the castle down the Danube river was magnificent. The castle is huge, so make sure to allocate enough time to see everything.

Fantastic views of Budapest. Worth effort to go to the castle. The changing of the guards is great o watch (change every hour) and there is something for everyone, arts, crafts, cafes, bars and of course the church's and history. A must do!

Beautiful views from the top. Love the views from here. Take the stairs , it's not too hard. The castle is in great condition and a nice place to visit. No noble or royalty has ever actually used this building for its purpose.

Beautiful. The castle is really beautiful and you have just an amazing view of the city. After the war the building was rebuilt very poorly by the comunists (it has plastic windows instead of original glass windows for example) so the building is much better looking from the outside and far.
A great day out!. An excellent castle well worth the visit. Allow at least a couple of hours to explore it in detail. Enjoy!
A nice castle. A very nice castle. We didn't go in but its lovey outside and there are amazing views from the terrace. Fun to get the funicular up to it.
A must do in Budapest!. This is something you NEED to do when in Budapest. A nice walk to the top you will have a great view of the city from many vantage points along the way.

A Palace, Not A Castle. Let's get it right, this is an ornate palace, not a castle. If you visit the west side, you will think it is a very pretty building, but nothing special. You must visit the east (water) side. The views are superb. Worth seeing at night too, when it is well lit.

Beautiful Vistas. We took the little known
Escalator and elevator
Up To the castle grounds The vistas
of the Pest side were wonderful. The castle itself a pleasant walk with
a lot of history. Don't miss the
Fountain!
Nice. Nice place.It is one of emblematic place in Budapest.I was impresed.They are rebuil a lot.Very nice.

Stunning views. I would recommend a visit to the Buda castle as the views from there looking at Pest is fantastic. We went to the cafe terrace there as well for lunch which had great views as well along with the food.

Worth a visit. We spent 2 hours here. Very interesting. So much early history is lost in Hungary due to invasion and political unrest. What is left is on view here. Plenty to read and see if you are history buffs as we are.

Beautiful . Came here after walking too the citadel. This is a pretty little spot too have a look around and see out over the cities. You can get a lift or escalator to get up here too. They do a tour off the museum but we arrived too late in the day too see this. Great view

Such a pretty place, lots to do and see. I stayed in a hotel opposite this wonderful location. There was a Picasso exhibit on in the art gallery when I visited. But you don't have to go in. This is certainly worth a visit just for the views of the Castle as well as the views of Budapest. Buda castle is on a hill so provides a great panorama. Best to view it at night for all the pretty lights!

Trace of History. The Palace and the surrounding show you a little trace of the History. Inside the Palace there are: 1. The National Gallery - with mostly hungarian paintings, 2. the Szecheny Library and 3. the Budapest Historical Museum.Outside the Palace Building - there is the "hungarian white House" - the residence Building of the President of Hungary, the Siklo - a funicular but also som ruins. If you walk around the Paace you can find some stone pattern. The pattern mark the Walls of the Palace in different centuries. The ruins are partly renovated and show buildings, but there is also a ruin field which is not renovated. If you visit the Palace don't miss the big Matthias fontane

Spectacular Buda Castle. Located on Buda Hills, exploring Buda Castle is a good opportunity to explore ancient Hungarian Architecture and is a nice day out. I would not recommend taking the Funnicular. Instead use bus 16 or do a segway tour from bottom to top of Buda Hill. It can get very hot during the day. So night time is the best time to visit Buda castle when it is lit up.

Nice place. Buda castle is situated on the Buda side in the 1st district overlooking the pest side, the castle offers a nice view, you can also visit exhibitions while there or enjoy lunch, coffee or desserts in one of the restaurants. Specially there is a restaurant just inside the castle where you can enjoy the beautiful view of the city

Best views of Budapest. When you reach till the castle, you are sure to feel a sense of history within it and the best views that Budapest has to offer As its on a hill, try and take a segway tour to the castle and nearby monuments. Trust me , you'll thank this review one day
Must See. The view is to die for. Must see when in Budapest. It's a long climb to the top but definitely worth it as the view is breathtaking.

Get an amazing view of Budapest. The castle itself is magnificent with museums and exhibitions of high quality.More importantly, it is the best place to get a breathtaking view of Budapest. Bus 16 runs frequently between the city centre and the mountain top, very convenient.

Hop on hop off stop. It is definitely work a walk around! The view from the castle is wonderful. The gallery was interesting, I would skip that the next time though. (If you are crunched for time you may want to prioritize) Go on the river cruise at night and enjoy the grandeur!

Delightfule visit to Buda Castle. This was one monument that was listed as a must see, As a part of our short break.Precincts were nice and the access from lower level was pleasant. We took the Funicular on the way down. All in all good to walk around in.

Never a royal palace.. The highlights here are the view of this castle from the Pest side at night. It is magnificent. The Danube overlook gives you unobstructed views. The grounds are fine but not impressive. Walk around until you find the Mathias fountain. That will be worth the effort.

Illuminated impressive set. One of the most known images Budapest.It is also known as a Royal Palace. In it you can visit the National Gallery, the Museum of History and Széchenyi Library.You can take the funicular if you want to save you the walk

Beautiful views!. Buda Castle was gorgeous and from the top I was able to see gorgeous views of Budapest. Keep in mind that it closes at a certain time (I think 6pm?). It's a pity I couldn't watch the sunset from there (but the sunset was gorgeous from Fisherman's Bastion which isn't too far from Buda Castle and is open all hours). There's also a good spot for pretty fast free wifi near the bottom of the Castle.It's fit for everyone to do because although there's lots of stairs and the stairs are quite steep, there's also lifts and escalators. The castle itself was also very beautifulEveryone should see Buda Castle!
Magnificent. Beautiful architecture that stands the test of time. An integral part of Hungary past and history. Highly recommend.

Breathtaking view. I think the Buda Castle is definitely worth exploring! It represents so much in Hungarian Legacy and culture and it also has a lot to offer! The view from the danube was beautiful , truly magical.

Beauty of Danube :). River Danube, as true gentelmen, dance with beauetes during it way from the very begining to the Black Sea. One of them is tall white Castle of Budim. Position of Castle give beautiful sights at Budapest at both sides, even above Danube to Pesta, or at hills of Budim, on the other side. Enjoy walks and atmosphere, and try famouce Hungarian food at great restaurants on Budim!

Amazing view and beautiful setting. We went up the hill with the little iconic train right opposite of the white bridge and can very much recommend this little, (but costly) ride. It is however inadvisable to book a return ticket, as it is convenient to walk back over one of the nice ways, leading up (or down) to/from the castle.

Called the Castle, but it is really a museum. By all means include some art in your trip... the permanent collection includes works by Hungarian Artists, all of which are quite lovely. The museum also does a wonderful job with temporary exhibits, while we were there they had a show of Picasso, and Modigliani....the Modigliani show had a wonderful timeline of his interactions and influencers and those he influenced....a terrific way to put his life and work into perspective.

It's huge and rather ugly but a fascinating place!. The Castle much more represent Austro-Hungarian Empire than Budapest itself. And possibly, because of that it is so interesting. And in general, Buda is just fascinating!
Good. This is again a museum kinda attraction. If youre a history buff go for it otherwise choose something else over it

Fun Place to Explore. This was a nice place to walk around and explore. We went into the museum that started underneath the castle and walked around. It had some really cool architecture and you learned a lot about the history of castle!

Beautiful!. Buda castle grounds consists of a collection of wonderful buildings & battlements. Shops, restaurants, ice cream parlours & art galleries live in many of the premises. When we visited there were street food stalls to enjoy a choice of Hungarian delicacies. The cherry & poppyseed strudel is yummy!

Must visit place. Nice views and fine architecture. However, the visitor information should be clearer. While people stayed in lines to get to the furnicular and paid money to go up to the castle, some others got the information that there are free elevators. We were among the lucky ones. Need more organized and integrated tourist information

castle . To visit Buda castle is situated on a small hill you can take a funicular railway which will charge you around 1700ft for a round journey and there are some public transport which can also be used, but one can also walk up the hill, there are various places that is there on the hill like museum, castle, sovereign shops etc I would recommend not to visit during afternoon in a humid weather other than that This is worth a visit.
Beautiful place. Worth a visit to take in the view of the city and for a nice walk around where the officials work. A pretty short walk to other nearby sightseeing places.

Beautiful!. Castle Hill is bery beautifull and worth the visit, easily accessible by bus no. 16 from Deak ter, or down at the Chain Bridge area. Beautiful St. Stephen ( Istvan) church dating 1,000 years. worth seeing the restoration.
Wonderful Holiday. This is what you need for a good holiday.Nice view, romantic place and also our little one enjoyed as much as we did to spend time there.Loved it!

Beautiful Outside Experience. This is, indeed, a beautiful and historic place. The inside is not accessible, but the exterior architecture is fabulous, and offers good views of the Pest side of the river. Go early and wander around the place before the crowds build, then go on to some of the other sights on Buda Hill (Hospital in the Rock, Mathias Church, etc.). Going early also allows you to avoid the long lines at the funicular. We walked up to the ticket booth alone, but when we returned, there was a line of at least thirty yards long waiting to buy tickets.

Worth trying. The Buda Castle is a great way to spend a couple of hours. There are fantastic views over the city and river and nice walks around the grounds. Avoid the cafe though, we order one snack with drinks, it took nearly 20 minutes for the food to arrive (bruschetta with tinned tomatoes topping), it wasn't great and very expensive for what we had. Kids will like the funicular trip

Great view. Go to the Buda side of the chain bridge and take the funicular to the top. Don't pay extra to Q jump with ticket touts. Buy a single ticket for around £4 and take the walk down through the castle. The view is amazing over the chain bridge, Danube and Parliament.

Seen better places. Buda castle is not very impressive. I ve seen much more beautiful castles but if you have spare time in Budapest you should visit itIt s on the other side of the Danube and you have a beautiful view over the city and ParliamentIt s free to visit it s walls and you have to pay for the history museum.

Huge ground, beautiful gardens ..good for resting tired feet. This is really huge ground. You don't need to pay to walk around the castle (or now is museum). You do need to pay a fee to enter Museum. The front garden terrace is big enough to let all tired feet to rest..basking under the sun & enjoying the Danube views. We walked around the compound...strolling into every corner of castle (except the inside of museum) and got lost (in a good way). Re-living the glory of castle in the old days..

Historical center from the Middle ages. This Castle is very important in the Hungarian history. It was building in the 15th century under the regnum of King Mathias. You can see the beautiful panorama and can visit the Varkert Bazar.
Nice building. Nice building but nothing to see inside. Went there as part of a walking tour. Very busy and touristy area. Some building work taking place in vicinity.

Great Castle, Great Views. Buda Castle towers over the Western bank of the Danube and offers fantastic views over the beautiful city of Budapest. Contrary to what might be said about reaching the castle, the ascent up the hill is nothing compared to that encountered in Prague etc. For those who are worried about the walk, there is a funicular available for a few euros return trip. From atop the castle, there are fantastic views over the city incorporating the Danube, Szechenyi bridge and the Houses of Parliament. Furthermore, one can also explore the Buda old town which lies adjacent to the castle. There you can find Fisherman's Bastion and Matthias Church as well as plenty of good restaurants, bars and souvenir stalls.

Worth the climb. You can ascend by this attraction by Funicular train, but we like many others walked up. The castle is now used as an art museum. It's great for views and nice to walk around. The general area of castle hill is stunning and well worth a visit.

A Classic Must. Though construction work going on during our visit it was still worthwhile. You can not visit the Castle district without visiting the Castle. Ques may be a hinderance if you are not early because of tour groups arriving by the busload
Fab! . This was ace. Loved it. Definitely something you need to visit and check out! In a good location of other buildings that are good to visit!

A long way up the hill. It's on a big hill, and you need to walk there, its pretty long and a little bit hard. You have some points to stop and see the view before you get to the top. There are people who sells water and lemonade at the beginning of the hill, they sell for a really high price!
The views. This was a quite a walk but worth the view when we got there.It is such a big castle, very beautiful. This is where we had our first Tunnel cake! soon good!

Worth the climb. Very warm morning, but worth the climb up to here. Views were amazing and although there appears to be a fair bit of building works going on in the surrounding area we were glad we visited.

Museum, not a Castle. We crossed the river to see the castle only to find out it is no longer a castle but an art museum. We were very disappointed,as we were expecting to have a tour of the castle rooms, jewels, etc. In August the featured exhibit was Picasso of which I am not a fan, so we skipped the admission and went to visit St Matthias Church and the surrounding community.

A lot of walking. There was quite a bit of walking to get here, possibly because we are not good with directions and cannot speak Hungarian or possibly there is just more walking to do than we are used to. Either way, it is a very nice place to be and it has some amazing views.

summer beauty. it's always nice to visit historical spots and this was no disappointment.....
beautiful architecture and nice square!

Magic place, very beautiful, I saw a traditional hungarian music concert. I visited Buda's Castle twice when I was in Budapest. First, from outside during a walk going up from the river. The sunset, sights to Danubio are wonderful. You don't need a sophisticated plan, it's perfect and very romantic to go with your partner and also in family. It has an elevator but I recommend to use stairs and slopes.I went second time to a concert inside the Castle. It was absolutely amazing. Great acoustic place, elegant people and unforgettable remember of lights in the night becaming a golden city.
Great place to visit. After a long climb up. The views are amazing & well worth a visit. We enjoyed a drink overlooking the Danube river & Pest . A beautiful place with Awesome views.

A "must visit" experience while in Budapest. Buda Castle sits high up on a hill overlooking the Danube River in Budapest just very near to, in fact overlooking, the famous "chain bridge"... that bridge that you see in all the tourist brochures. My partner and I did not go inside the castle, but opted to purely enjoy the outdoor experience surrounding the castle.Apart from the wonderful views over the Danube, and the Pest side of Budapest, the areas surrounding the castle are actually very pleasant, with amazing colonnades, and pedestrian areas. a series of paths and plazas takes you around the castle complex itself, and then eventually takes you back down to the river level again. For those with some disabilities, there are elevators available that can lift you from river level, to the high plaza area near to the front of the main castle complex.Alternatively, for others, you can take the long sloping roadway, that comes up from near to the Funicular Tram station... this tram also being yet another means of getting to the top, although there is a fee to use the funicular tram, whereas the lifts a the far opposite end of the castle complex are free.There is a lot to see just walking around the castle surrounds without ever going inside, which would be another experience. As mentioned, we did not go inside the castle, which I believe incurs an entrance fee. But you can spend at least an hour or two for free just walking around the various levels of the grounds and plazas that surround the castle. This is definitely one of the special places to visit when you are in Budapest.

What views! Tourist trap area. Paid toilets. Went through here with a walking tour on a really warm August day. Take a snack and water for both up and down. Quite impressive architecture and views of Pest on the way up and the entire city once on top.The walking tour guide reminded us about the tourist trap pricey restaurants in the area, and that the tram/gondola isn't really worth the price of walking up,What got me was that the bathrooms at the bottom and top are 200 FT or 1 Euro in coin! Bring some.Do stop on your way up and on top and snap photos. Assuming you'll go on a clear day, you'll get some stunning views.I'd rate Gellert Hill/Citadel and possibly Parliament as potential higher priorities if you are stretched for time.
Great view of Budapest. This lication gives you a great view of Pest below but that's about it. The architecture i nice but not stunning.
Great for the Views. Rich in history and away from the hustle and bustle. Best part is the views above the Danube. It is worth the trip.

Great collection of museums in a beautiful building. The Buda castle is enormous, especially since most of it was built by the Hapsburgs. The castle was destroyed at the end of the Second World War by the Russians because it was the last stronghold of the Germans. It was reopened to the public in the late 1970s, early 80s. There is a great view over the Danube.
Houses the art gallery!. Very beautiful views from Buda castle, however we only went in to look at the gift shop. If you like art then this is the place for you.

Worth a wander round. Spectacular views across the Danube and Pest. Lovely to just wander around and soak up the atmosphere. Go down the stairs at the far end to find secluded gardens with very few people.

Massive and Amazing . The review title says it all. It's huge and really a castle. The Castle is just beside my hotel so for the length of our stay in Budapest we kept going through the Castle .Can't describe all details seen or felt in this review . You need to visit or read about the Buda Castle to know more. Minus 1 star: Reason, mostly tourist everywhere, no one could explain or direct you correctly except you are with a tour guide.Will still recommend.

Worth the walk up. The funicular was closed for servicing when we arrived so we opted to walk up. The views over the river of parliament on the way up are great. If you go up and round the castle and then walk over to fisherman so bastion you can come down the other side of the road.

A MUST TO VIEW. As this building dominates Budapest it is a must to visit and explore. The funicular is an expensive luxury so suggest you take the stairs or ramps (with escalator) nearer to Elisabeth Bridge rather than queue for the Funicular

Nice views. The castle is worth the walk because you get amazing views and can continue your walk to the bastion and church.However it is not worth visiting inside unless you are interested in art as it is just a gallery. We visited the history museum but it was disappointing so i would not recommend it.
Lots to see. You can walk around the grounds free of charge. To see inside you need to pay. There is a lot around the grounds and the funicular railway to the top is worth paying for.

A lovely historic place to visit. We were on an organised tour of the castle and grounds with a local guide who was able to tell us all the history. Very interesting and not to be missed. Very busy with tourists. Don't miss the gardens though. Lovely walk back down to the river.

Expected More. Visited here today. Was disappointed the castle was nothing more than a gallery. I couldn't believe there were no tours of the facility on offer. I found it all a little stale. From Pest, the castle looms over the Danube in grandeur but that's where the facade ends unfortunately. I enjoyed the castle district for the views over the city. There were also some nice cafés to relax in.
Nice piece of history. Quite big and with lot to see. Especially worth is the view over the Danube river and Pest part of the city across the river.

Nice views. We got down at this stop from the hop-on hop-off bus and walked it up to the Buda castle. The view is spectacular!! It is worth just for the view. We didn't go into the Palace, however, spent a long time walking around and looking at the various statues and the views.Also, take the night cruise along the Danube, you get to see the Buda Castle brilliantly illuminated.

Immense building to look to and from, a focal point of the city. Taking a steep walk, or the rail up is worth while to get to The Castle. Not much around inisde the grounds, but from here a great point of multi historical sites, great places to eat, drink, relax, take in breathtaking views.Plan more time on the Buda side and find lots of hidden places of unique interest.

Beautiful. This is yet another beautiful building in Budapest, the city is full with them!
This place we visited by night and it is very beautiful and it has a great view and the place is huge!
Definitely a look worth it!
Nice views. Wish you could actually roam inside the castle.. but walking around the grounds is worth it.. Take your camera!

Beautiful. We were advised to visit the castle and allow 2/3 hours time. I was amazed it was free to get in. The grounds are beautiful and you can get amazing views of the city from here. It's defiantly a must visit!

Great views from Buda Castle . We went to Buda Castle as part of our city tour at the conclusion of our Viking River Cruise. It is not as spectacular as Versailles or Schonbrunn Palaces, but it is still impressive and has great views of the Danube, Parliament and Pest. It is worth a visit while in Budapest.

Great Views. Beautiful, gorgeous views, clean, spacious and a wonderful place to walk around and explore. Every road, every lane and every building was beautiful and interesting, especially when you know the history. Mathias Church is also beautiful and adds to the charm of the Buda Castle!

Nice overlooks. Hop on Hop off stop. Very enjoyable to walk around the grounds of the castle. It was a stop with the hop on Hop off bus, so it was extremely convenient to get to. The overlooks were gorgeous and worth going to see.

Great views . This is a spectacular building which simply must be viewed on any trip to Budapest. Unfortunately, we were quite silly and visited on a Monday, meaning a lot of the various activities available on the castle grounds, such as the art gallery and the Hungarian history museum, were closed. It is more than sufficient, however, to simply sit with an ice-cream at the castles cafe and gaze upon the spectacular views of a beautiful city, rising from the turquoise waters of the Danube or weave your way around the various gardens and grounds the castle has accessible free of charge. Would definitely recommend going on a day that is not a Monday in order to avail of all that the castle has to offer, also, bring coin change due to the fact that, similar to elsewhere in Budapest, you can expect to pay a small fee to use the WC facilities.

Dizzy heights of Buda Castle. During our tour of the sights Budapest we travelled to Buda castle, you can access Buda castle via the many stairs to the right of the castle or you can take the Funicular for a small fee. We chose to go up via the funicular which gave great views over the Chain bridge. Once up on to the Castle grounds you are free to look around and take in the sights. The castle is now a national gallery and you can choose to pay to look around the great gallery within. Definitely worth a visit.
A 'must visit' place. Definitely a place to pay a visit to even if you don't go inside. It's a lovely walk around the outside and there are great views of the city.

Took a paid tour. It does not seem like a real castle after seeing others in Germany and Austria. The views are great and it is interesting. Beautiful palace and the castle area with many places to see.

So beautiful and old place. It was my 3D visit to Budapest. Before I didn't go there. This time I walk around the castle, see the old walls. Architecture of castle is beautiful. I recommend to do visit there. There is the great view to the river and bridges.

Interesting Building. Large building with views over the Danube and Pest. Various statues around the place the most interesting being the 'hunting' scene (Matyas fountain) The building houses the Hungarian National Gallery but I didn't venture in. To get up here you can use public transport, the funicular railway or walk. I walked and it took about 10 mins (taking the path through the doorway in the wall) or follow the road around and this will take you twice as long. If you walk you can take in vies as you go and access a viewing platform over the funicular.

Nice looking not a traditional castle sense as we know it . Buda castle is very nice looking perched up high. It is not a traditional looking castle as we would know it in the UK. It is now an art gallery and as I hate art we didn't go in but is worth looking at just for the building on the outside.

ENJOYED OVERALL CASTLE. Many people get confused between the overall castle which is very nice and the Palace within the castle. Buda Castle is very nice but to me the Palace, while very attractive, is best viewed from a distance where it dominates Castle Hill. The best parts of the overall castle are Matthias Church, the Military History Museum and the various lookout points, especially Fisherman's Bastion. From Buda Castle you have a great view of Parliament, St Stephens Basilica and all of Pest. Be sure to catch the changing of the guard that takes place on the hour every hour (believe starting at 1000). Best viewing point is in the small square between the Palace and the top funicular station. Buda Castle is reached by either walking up the many paths leading to Castle Hill, the public bus from Szell Kalman ter or, the best option, via the funicular at the foot of the Chain Bridge.

Amazing view. I take the hop on hop off buses during all my vacation to Budapest (i have only 2 days there)., with a valid ticket for 2 days (extra discount for students)The castle is free to see it outsideAnd of course it has amazing view to Danube and to the whole city. 1000% to go

House upon the hill. Make that castle, not house, though this once was the royal residence. Buda Castle houses the Hungarian National Gallery, a fine arts museum in the center of the building, beneath the dome. Wings of the castle are under restoration and are not accessible. There are restaurants along the walkways on the grounds, and ramparts jutting toward the river that once were used for firing artillery now provide excellent vantage points for photo ops and spectacular views. It cost nothing to walk along this palace/castle, but there is a modest fee for entering the National Gallery. Enjoy! I certainly did.
Very nice. Budapest is a very lovely city, full of cultural and old buildings. If you are visiting one of the places you really must see is the Buda Castle. Amazing statues and panorama.

Worth the walk. Buda Castle was a bit of a walk from our hotel, but worth it. Once there, we took the funicular to the top. Turns out the walk up there wouldn't have been to bad, but it was a pretty warm day. Great view of the river and city.

Excellent view and Palace. It is better to take the tram up to the palace and thane walk all the way back. From the top you have excellent view of Pest side especially Chain and Liberty Bridges. Beautiful palace and the castle area with many places to visit. There is a coffe shop and souvenir street sellers. There was a Picasso exhibition in July which was nice too.
Out of Game of Thrones. Probably the most beautiful and sprawling castle ever. You can literally spend days there visiting all the attraction and museums the castle can offer

Fantastic. The Buda castle is just one big gallery. Stay and hour or stay the day.
My son and I went for the Picasso exhibit and my mouth was open catching flies
And entire gallery of Pablo Picasso. I think with the exchange it came to $20.00 USD per person. Great investment
Lovely area to explore. This is a very impressive building on the Buda side. Along with the castle is the National Gallery with great views, the Fisherman's Bastion and other sites to enjoy.

What a view. Excellent view of the entire city. Beautiful architecture of the Hapsburg period. Plus a Picasso exhibition centre and a wonderful drive up using the furnicular. Or one can even go up using very smart electric cars. Book furnicular online for a special discount.

Beautiful castle!. The castle is now an art gallery I believe, although I did not actually go in. The castle is stunning to walk around and has fantastic views of the city so definitely worth a visit.

Lovely and well worth it. We took train bus and tram to get here from pest. Not sure why as we walked back down the steepy stairs. We had a good tour guide, a local from budapest. So we were in good hands.The place surely is beautiful. The view is breathtaking. Especially when the sun is setting in the evening. Some lovely pictures were taken here.It's peaceful and romantic.There was a wedding taking place while we were here. It's highly recommended.

Gorgeous view from the top roadways.. I thought, wow. What a great day to exercise. I walked and jogged and I enjoyed watching the beautiful ambiance from the top of the Budapest Hills through the castle.

Of course you should see there. You should definitely go there to see old Hungarian history and culture. If you dont like these kind of places stay away from the inside but seeing there from the outside also very nice.

One word: marvelous!. It's a really great place to visit, since not only you can walk around it and make amazing photographs, but come inside and see marvelous things. But wait, there is more, If you are a studend you get 50% off of ticket. So a must visit+++++

Not just another European castle!. Took a tour through Viking River Cruise and guide top notch as was the castle. Don't miss it! So much to see and no rush -- spend as much time as you like, soaking it all up --

Spectacular . We really enjoyed visiting Buda Castle despite the rain. There are lots of things to see and do inside. There is also a cafe called Palota hávégó cafe where you can get refreshments during your visit.

Worth to visit.. Worth to visit. The half of the museum was closed, so the ticked was 50% off. I visited one hour before closing, so that was not a big problem. I didn't visit the modern "art" part because it was just too ugly. :-) I liked the picture of the man with tattoos (attached). :-)

Arrive Early for the Funicular . My wife and I visited the palace, which also hosts the Hungarian National Museum. The day was hot and we waited in a morning line for the funicular about a half hour. We saw an exhibit on Modigliani I really enjoyed.
Beautiful. We really enjoyed Buda Castle area. The whole site is very picturesque and enjoyable. Definitely recommended if staying in Budapest.

Very tiring to walk up the hill, but is worth all the effort. You can see the Buda Castle from the opposite side of Danube river. The first thing you think is to go there and have a good look closer. The National Gallery is a gorgeous building, and if you like museums you have to go inside. The views from the top are nice . The back side with fountains is also beautiful.. From there, It' s easy, to reach The fisherman's bastion.

Royal destination. There's a PICASSO exhibition there now, It's worth to see, very rich! There's the State Library, and museums. The view is awesome, must to go up there! New: from last year you can go up by lifts from beautiful VÁRKERT BAZÁR (it's next to the Danube). You can take a lot of catchy pictures of the city: the Parliament, main bridges, Danube etc. MUST SEE!

Confusing ticket system. Upon arrival we were ushered in to a big queue waiting to buy tickets. The ticket board was very confusing and the ticket staff very impatient so the ticket we ended up buying did not allow us access to the exhibit with the Picasso or Modigliani which was very frustrating. The permanent exhibit was nice to stroll around but I was disappointed overall.

Magnificent. This is a must see destination. The building is wonderful, well kept and the views are fantastic. Allow a lot of time for seeing the surrounding buildings and streets.Walk across to the 2 museums that are on the same level. Many people wait for the funicular which is well preserved and efficient but the walk up winds slowly and is not steep. Avoid the bars for a refreshing beer as they charge 3 times the price but the supermarket nearby is normal price.

Great collection of Hungarian Art Masters. The National Gallery in the castle is well worth a visit for the collection of Hungarian art masters alone. When we visited, there were also collections by Mogdiliani and Picasso on view but the Hungarian artists provided what we felt was the best collection.

A collection of information regarding history and art. From my point of view, it is the best attraction for tourists. For those who like museums, this is definitely a must see. We were lucky to see the temporary exhibitions of Picasso and Modigliani at the Art museum, but the museum also offers a wide collection of Hungarian art. The history museum of Budapest also is suggested for its wide collection of information. But please note that it is more a museum of history of Buda castle and what is important to be noted is that the underground is actually the remains of the original Buda castle. It represents the medieval part of the castle which remained intact.
Impressive castle. Go up to the top and you will be amazed!The Buda Castle is nice with beautiful buildings. It is a very nice program to discover not only the castle but also the medieval streets.

Buda Castle Labyrinth. Quite a scary experience as it is quite big labyrinth and the signs to guide you out are not all that comprehensive. Definitely not for the claustrophobic. There is a display of Verdi opera waxworks, with music, and some information about Dracula and tenuous links.A totally black passage is an option, with only a hose pipe to guide you. Don’t bump into the well on the right the way out – keep left. Was spoilt for me by idiots with a mobile phone torch who decided they needed a light.
One of the highest places in the city. I spent most of the day wandering around the castle and its beautiful district. It has a panoramic view over the Danube and the city.

A wow factor every way you turn. Either walk up castle hill or take the fenicular. We opted to walk in order to take photos on the way and it proved to be surprisingly easy and I'm seventy next birthday. However once you get there go left to the front and after you have enjoyed all the views go through the arched tunnel to the rear of the building where a great deal of work is currently being carried out on this World Heritage site. Once completed it will be an even more impressive place to visit.
Beautiful castle. This was a great activity, the castle is gorgeous and surrounding area so much fun to wander around in.

Interesting to see; did not go inside. Buda Castle is very imposing and a beautiful structure. We walked around it but did not go inside. If you're on Castle Hill you will see it and Castle Hill is certainly worth a visit.

Great View looking over Pest and the Danube. If you are in this area you have to check this out. There are numerous attractions to see here including the art museum in the castle, the labyrinth, an incredible church, and lots of shops and restaurants. The markets is OK but you can get cheaper in Pest./

ok. its the only place that dissapoint me.not a big deal.nice view from there.you take the teleferik to go.the ticket price is 1200huf you can get down from the stairs or elevators.if you are interest in paintings is a great place that you have to visit.
Castle on a Hill. Awesome building and grounds. Buda Castle is a World Heritage Site and the museum is worth a look. There's also a great view of the city which overlooks the Danube.

A must see. If you are in this area you have to check this out. You can take the funicular up to the castle if you don't mind waiting in line for 20 minutes- in tourist season of course. The walk is actually not bad and you get there in less time. If you do take the funicular, only take it up, because it's fun and easy to walk down. There are numerous attractions to see here including the art museum in the castle, the labyrinth, a cool church, and numerous shops and restaurants.

It won't disappoint . Make sure you allow yourself at least half a day to explore this. There are many ways to get to the castle, we used the fennicula but you can access it by bus. There is so much to see along with the addition of art galleries and museums. You need to be fairly fit to be able to enjoy all the castle has to offer but you can still enjoy loads as there is a handy elevator and lift. One of my favourite bits was the impressive fountain

A must see!. We spent an entire day in the Castle district. There is so much to see (the Castle itself, Fisherman's Bastion, the Tower and the Cathedral) so don't rush it. We had a light lunch at a cafe overlooking Pest (the most amazing views).

Well worth the hike and walk!. An imposing castle atop a hill, magical by night, but equally impressive in the day time!Set aside a day to explore the castle, see some of exhibits and take gorgeous pictures of the facade.There is a charge to go up by funicular or you can walk it, the outer buildings can be seen for free, but the museum and exhibits are free.You won't regret spending the time up there, but do remember to carry water and wear a hat, it is hot up there with the sun beating down during summer.
Sightseeing. One of the most beautiful place is in the EU, especially in the evening. We can visit museums, participate Palika Festival and we have amazing view to the captial.
Must see in Buda. This vast building needs plenty of time to explore. It does get very crowded even on a wet day. There are a range of rooms and exhibitiions.

Everything on a silver tary. A showcase of Hungary's history, the Castle district has everything a tourist likes. May be reached by foot, buses (from Széll Kálmán tér or from the Pest side or even from the Buda side of the Lánchid) or a funicular. The Fishermen's bastion, Matthias Church, the Royal Castle, the President's palace, the Labyrinth, Wine Museum, the Castle Theatre, the Museum of Defence, State Archives the Széchenyi National Library, the Museum History, the National Gallery (that often houses temporary exhibitions) and finally the varying "markets" with folklore are all "must" attractions. On top of this, the tourist will find some good restaurants and cafés.

resurrected from the ashes. The casle, which was totally burnt out during WWII is now the Hungarian National Gallery, It houses a collection of paintings by Hungarian Artists, spanning artistic movements from impressionist to post modern. It is very well curated and signage is also in English.The galleries are spacious, and the grand staircase impressive. The views from the forecourt over Pest, the bridges and Parliament are not to be missed.
Enjoyed my visit. It's now a big art museum. I really enjoyed the permanent exhibit and also the Picasso one. You could spend there hours! It was cheaper for EU citizens.

Lovely location. Interesting visit the castle high on hill with good views of Budapest and the famous parliamentary building There are lots of local shops and restaurant a quaint cobbled area well worth a visit

Lovely outside, inside OK if you like art and the weather is bad. The outside is lovely and good views over the Danube. Inside, the rooms are plain and just the Hungarian national art gallery. So, if you really like art and the weather is bad then you might like inside as well. We went in because entry was included in our Budapest Card ticket but didn't stay long because the weather was so good outside. We did want to visit the Picasso exhibition but that weans included on the card because it was a special exhibition!
dont be misled. The castle is actually a ruin in the shadow of the domed National Gallery But the old buildings surrounding it on the hill and the great views out over the Danube are great

Gorgeous views. Gorgeous view as one walks higher & higher. Each elevation offers yet another beautiful angle overlooking the Danube & the Parliament House. The quieter spots in the castles premises are worth seeing too.

More for the museum and history buffs.. There is so much to do in Budapest, for a small nation the capital has so much to offer. We enjoyed perusing the market up in the castle. We did not go into the museum side as our little one had enough. But will go back another time for a fuller tour, what we saw and di we enjoyed.

Castle and Funicular!. We baught tickets for the Hop on Hop off Big Bus tour which then included tickets for the Funicular list up the hill to see the castle. We ran out of time to go in to the castle itself but we enjoyed the gardens and scenery.

Scenic . Very pretty and good views of the city. Not very access friendly as it is a long way up and lots of cobbled streets!
Free to walk around but cannot go in as far as we could see!
Interesting and beautiful place. Definitely worth a visit. Here is a lot to be seen. Both exhibitions, walking around and feel the atmosphere of the habsburg empire.

Newer than Many European Castles. The Castle is newer than many of the European castles, but it has a lovely garden/ground area. We enjoyed the statues, the fountain and the fantastic overlook. There are some ruins on the grounds as well. Take time to stroll back in time and enjoy the beautiful sights to see. From here it is only a short walk to the fisherman's Bastion. There are a few souvenier shops along the way, as well as some quaint houses. If it is as hot as it was the day we visited, you might want to stop in at the Primo Grocery store for a cool water (much more reasonably priced than some of the vendors) and be sure to stay on the side of the road that has the shade.
Beautiful. A great site. It is an amazing place in itself as it offers such a wonderful experience, but the views over the city are also breathtaking. Something not to be missed.

the view outside is better than inside. it's worth visiting just for the view over budapest although very hilly and cobbly in the surrounding areas so be careful to wear comfortable shoes! the architecture on and in the castle isn't too different to any other european castles but if its what you're into you can easily spend all day around the museums!

The Castle without a Castle. The Buda part of Budapest is stunning although I would rather stay on the Pest side. Buda Castle consists of Buda Hill (the Hungarian National Museum), fisherman's bastion & Matthias Church; there isn't a castle per se but you can immerse yourself in the beauty surrounding you while getting a great view of the Danube & Pest; so get your cameras ready. We decided to walk up to Castle Hill instead of taking the funicular coz we didn't want to waste time in the line. the walk up is pretty straightforward near the funicular. Once up there make sure to walk around the peaceful alleys of Buda. You can enjoy the peace & quite walking down by taking the path near the Hilton then take a left to Franklin U. all the way down. So have your walking shoes ready and your cameras charged & enjoy.

Visiting Picasso exhibit. Spectacular views, castle, history, scope and splendor, and exhibit. Simply remarkable. The museum takes hours to go through. Make sure you go to the Budapest History Museum on the South end of Palace. Be ready to spend several hours there, we only had one and missed a lot.

A Must Visit when in Budapest. The view of the two cities is truly awesome. Make time to see the Castle and the fabulous architecture and enjoy walking through history. The Castle has been declared a World Heritage Site.

Changing of the Guards in the Buda Castle. The changing of the Guards in front of the Hungarian Presidential Palace takes place daily
