Mon – Sun: 8:30 am – 5 pm, every hour by the hour (e.g. 10 am, 11 am, … 2 pm, 3 pm, 4 pm) on the square beside theFunicular.
Must see. Just very interesting place to walk around. Easy way up is from Siklo by funicular. Beautiful view to city over Danube.

The Castle of Buda....The view of Pest. A well built architecture showcasing the richness of the country's culture and history. One has to walk inside the castle which is an experience in its own. The view of Pest city from the Castle is marvellous.

Wonderful place for a walk. Whilst walking g we came across the castle and decided to go in and have a look around, it was a great place to meander for a walk, with all the old buildings and the grounds were beautifully kept

Great district. Great district to walk with nice museums and spectacular views. The walk up is quite heavy, if you really want there is a bus and a funicular (but the walk up is actually fun and free). The Hungarian art gallery is splendid

a must see in Budapest. This is one of the biggest and most famous tourist attractions of Budapest. One can spend 3 to 5 hours there to walk around and see the place . Dont miss out on a ride in the fernnicular as well

Good architecture. I went here on February with some of my friends. It was a bit tricky on how to reach it though it turns out because we used the wrong way to go to. I could say that they do have a good architecture on creating the building. I recommend people who loves arts to come here because there are a lots of good paintings inside the museum

Not really a castle. The castle was largely destroyed in WWII and rebuilt into two museums and a library. The interiors are almost entirely modern. If you want to go to the art or the history museum, great. As a castle, not much going on.
Prefer night. You must go at the night. Unbelivable view with the light over the city. One of the best spots in this city.
Amazing place.. We spent all day wandering around this area, and Buda Castle was one of the many stunning attractions we found. Well worth a visit.

Amazing view and plenty of culture. Going up to the hill with the tranvia was nice. Then we found an exposition of Picasso at tne national museum where also the history museum and the Library.
The sculptures are astonishing.
A visit to the hill is a must

Good to see but the inside is underwhelming . The inside of the buda castle is not amazing and quite expensive to see - there was a Picasso collection on display which is good but if you are not into paintings than better just view it from outside and walk around the area - it's fun

A Must See!. If you're going up to Buda Castle you might as well do the whole area and see the Cathedral and Fisherman's Bastion at the same time! All are within walking distance, offer incredible views of the city both day and night and all are beautiful to see up close! Easily accessible by tour bus as well!

Pleasant. We took the tram up to the castle, lovely views from the top nice for a stroll around. We walked down lots of steps not ideal for small kids or older people as some of the steps were sticking out and loose but hey ho the HSE doesn't seem to exist in Budapest .. Be careful is all I can say

Amazing place.. We spent about two hours touring the castle and it was beautiful. Our 10 year old daughter let her imagination run wild. The exterior is also beautiful and the views great. An absolute "must do."
If you have time. If you have time the castle is worth visiting. We did not do any of the museums. Just walked around the outside. Beautiful views. Cool facade. There is a little cafe
Worth a visit.. Sometimes music events and markets take place in the vicinity. Can take a while to walk round. The tour bus stops here.

Walk of the history. I only read about the history of Buda ,but to experience the greatest and one of the bloodiest defence from the Turkish ottoman was breathing. The museum is well worth to visit .Take the ride up from the street ,it's a steep claim .The museum is well informed to the history dating back to the Bronze Age .The scenery is breathtaking from the castle,there is a caffe inside the building ,and the cakes are delicious Get there early as in 10 am otherways there is a long wait for the lift up .

Budapest could be called the heart of Europe. It´s really a beautiful place, there are a lot of tourist but you can also enjoy with the citiziens¡ I strongly recomend to visit Budapest and take a break in its fameous spass.

The Castle district is a walk through history... I live in the shadow of Buda Castle and it is like my back yard....It can be approached in many ways..The Fernicular Railway at Clark Adam Square ..A No 16 Bus from Clarke Adam Square but it can also be accessed on the Pest side of the river..or a 15 minutes walk passing a few coffee stops..The Castle district extends from the Fishermens bastion to a descent into the wonderful new gardens of the Varkert Bazaar..Mathias Church is perhaps one of the great gems and not to be missed..There are delightful antique shops in the small alleyways but you need to consult the latest tourist calendar for the many events that occur through the season..The balustrades overlooking the city and river laid out below is the perfect photo opportunity . Statues and monuments dominate the whole area..On most days apart from Monday there is the National Museum and as I write (June 2016) there is a wonderful Picasso exhibition..It is a riot of rococo statues and fountains..and worth any effort you may take to arrive there..There are often concerts in the grand theatre which will be advertised in the many information desks.There is a restaurant overlooking the panoramic views ..All in all it is a venue that you must include in your itinerary..PS Night time is a magical time to visit..
Castle. The castle itself is a remarkable building but I thought the content was poor. It is well worth visiting if only for,the stunning views over the city.

A must see for every tourist. A beautiful structure, there is a very good and reasonable restaurant in the courtyard. I would not take the funicular to the top as it is quite expensive, and the walk up and down is quite short and worth it to see the views.

Must visit!. İts a must see place in Budapest. The view was fantastic. We went there by funicular. Very good experience. And stay there around 2 hours. Drink beer through to Danube river. We could not find a chance to visit during evening, but if you have chance don't miss it. I can imagine it with the lights. :)

A bit of a modern film set version of history..... All very pretty, charming, picturesque & photogenic, but....... apart from the odd brick & carving, the whole hilltop citadel is a movie set recreation of what some Central European dreamers imagined/hoped life was like back then. Great to visit, in that fairytale Disneyland castle kind of way. Lovely place, lovely people, lovely weather, lovely beer & fun, lovely, lovely, lovely, but empty.

MAGNIFICENT VIEWS OF BUDA AND PEST.. You just can't miss the views from up on high and there is no need to queue and pay for the funicular nor walk up the hill.Thanks to some local knowledge shared by two Scot lassies we rode two lifts and an escalator to the top.After you walk across the chain bridge and are looking at the funicular, turn left and walk 200 meters approx past some bars till you see multiple archways. One will have a glass elevator which goes up one floor. Exit that and you'll see an escalator which takes you higher. Get off that and walk straight ahead into a wooden vestibule and take the lift one more floor and there you are. Right at the top. Enjoy the views etc.

A must see in Budapest. Beautiful gallery to visit and familiarize with Hungarian history through art. The walk around the castle provides magnificent views of the city, not to mention that you will be surrounded by one of a kind architecture. Highly recommend to plan the visit during the sunset.

You need a lot of time to see it all. There are so many aspects of this place to consider visiting. there is the outside which is full of interesting things to see and then there is the inside. The art is wonderful and need time to browse. The cafe is good too!

Amazing view of all Budapest, MUST GO!. The Castle is part of Unesco for its cultural and historical meaning. The first castle was built on the hill around the year 1200, as protection from the Mongols attacks. Over the centuries, several other castles were built to serve as residences or fortresses of the rulers, but were subsequently destroyed by oppressors, during the attacks of the World War II and the Hungarian Revolution. The reconstruction took place during the second half of the 20th century and created the current structure of 300 meters. Besides being home of the Royal Palace, also places the History Museum and the National Gallery. I visited both and I must say it’s quite interesting. Inside the museum, you can see caves from medieval times, a bit claustrophobic… Walk around the surroundings to see the gardens, the statues and the neighborhood that still retains traces of the Middle Ages. One of the highlights is the view of the Danube River, which runs through the city, and the beautiful Chain Bridge in front of the luxury hotel Four Seasons. From there you can walk to the Gellert Hill, to see Citadel and all its splendor. To get to the Castle, you can go walking, and then you will be losing some pounds due to the heavy food you’ve been eating since you arrived at the city, or, take the charming cable railway, right in front of the Chain Bridge. I did this ;p

Gorgeous architecture . As I had a couple of hours to spare before my flight home, I decided to visit Buda Castle. The castle and the palace complex used to house the Hungarian royalties and what gorgeous architecture! Buda Castle is worth the visit to simply walk around, enjoying the amazing buildings, the court yard, statues and splendid views. After walking over the chain bridge from Pest to Buda you are faced with the choice of going up Buda funicular or taking the steps.I chose the funicular wich costs 1800 forintas for up and down. Quick and smoooth. This brings you to castle hill where I strolled around taking in the beautiful architecture and atmosphere.There was a Picasso exhibition in Buda Castle during my visit, that I viewed quickly - one of my favorite artist and I enjoyed it tremendously. Heads up - lots of cobbled street, so please wear sensible shoes!

We saw. Picasso exhibition
Great show
You can spend here many hours watching the paintings and many other art
Be aware of that the building is on a hill
a must in budapest. The castle is very impressive complex. including some interesting museums. There are beautiful views from there. Take the funicular or walk down through the garden

Get a great view of Budapest from here. It sure is a castle because it is huge. Great for a walk-around and take in the beautiful view of Budapest from the top. Went into the museum for our company's private party but found it boring. To be fair, I'm not crazy about museums though I was expecting to see more items on display. It's so gorgeous on the outside and so much to see you probably won't miss a thing if skip the museum. Definitely worth a visit and I don't think I'd ever get bored with the view.
Construction. This was under a huge construction while we were visiting on the exterior so we did not get to enjoy an outside view, but that happens.

the building is great, what's inside is better. It's an incredible, classic building, great grounds...walk up to and skip the tramthe museum is just right...great exhibits, diverse and you'll see some painters who would probably be more famous if they weren't from hungarygood size...you get variety, quality, but it doesn't take forever

Beautiful and Scenic. The Buda Castle is a must see if in Budapest. It's got a great scenic view nearby of the river and the rest of the city and the castle itself is a wonder of architecture and history. Definitely recommend.

Walk around. Walked around this Castle as it is currently filled with Museums. My kids dont'enjoy museums so we skipped the inside. Outside grounds are pretty, great views of Pest and the Danube. The Matyas fountain is a bit hidden but gorgeous when you find it!

Grand and Beautiful. I fell in love with Budapest as soon as I saw the Parliament building and the chain bridge. Then I went over to the Buda side and went up to the Buda Castle.. my love for this city grew even more! This castle is beautifully breathtaking spread out among an incredible property. The view overlooking the Pest side from the castle is amazing and is even better to be seen at night.
Picasso Paintings . Went over and found out that there was a Picasso exhibition! It was fantastic and its a must do visit !!!! Dont miss it if you are around and see such nice views

Good restoration going on. This was fun to see though sadly some bits shut the day we were there. It only cost us the equivalent of £1.50 therefore and there was enough to see to please us. Great views, good illustrated manuscript facsimiles, nicely restored chapel, good exposed old parts and nice outside too

Great Views of Budapest . Ride the funicular up and back for 1800 forints. Beautiful building with great views of the Danube and across to Pest. A restaurant is available on grounds as well as a few vendor stalls for souvenirs. You can spend quite a bit of time exploring the grounds and surrounding area.

Stunning views over a wonderful city. Budapest is just gorgeous! What better way to see it than from the castle itself!This is not just one building but a collection of buildings built over 100s of years all together at the top of the rise overlooking the stunning river!Head up for a day trip or to watch the lights come on over the city on the other side...God this is a stunning city!!

Historical Must See. Must see in Budapest, even if you only have limited time for an indoor-tour. You can still marvel at this architectural and historical wonder, if only on the outside. And it makes a great background for selfies and wefies. ;)
Beautiful views!. Definitely worth visiting this castle! The views are gorgeous and its nice to walk around and enjoy the scenery!

Amazing views . A fantastic piece of history in Budapest with superb views of both sides of the Danube. On a sunny day the eye can see so far it is simply wonderful to behold such a charming city with such character. Absolutely breathtaking architecture.
Terrific views. Fairly steep climb to get to the castle. We did like the castle in itself but even better is the views of the city .

Excellent trip. cable car to the top was goo to view the city. The castle itself was full of history and there was a medieval courtyard where you could do archery. Fountain was good and the sights of the city were worth the trip
Get up there. Such a great view and a really interesting place to visit. Take your time and enjoy the architecture and the sights. Try to visit towards dusk

Excellent!. We visited the place only outside as we were running out of time in the evening. but we managed to enjoy the magnificent façade and atmosphere. there is a fairy tale beautiful fountain, that can be visited.
Bring a comfortable shoes! Huge!. You can get to this attraction by hop on and hop of bus. Great gardens, big area to cover and lots to see! The Picasso exhibition ads to the art ambiance.

Nice monuments nearby , plan a 2hrs trip minimum. Take the big BIG. Buses (better than Giraffe) and one can see 95% of essential Budapest all in a day. The buses are cheap and practical way to visit the places of interest.
Brilliant Buda. I combined the visit to the Caste with Fisherman's Bastion and the Mattathias Church. It has beautiful architecture and was great to see up close.
Great views from here. This castle gives fantastic views of the city and is the site of a Picasso exhibition. Another must place to visit
Great building. Great building we saw from the outside when walking on Castle Hill, houses different museums. When we visited the building itself was closed the public
Lovely views of Danube. Didn't go inside the castle itself but lots of areas to walk around with magnificent views of the river Danube below. Watched changing of guard - interesting.

A must visit place. Buda Castle is a UNESCO World Heritage site and there has been a castle on the hill for around 800 years. it is a beautiful building, and the remains of former castles can be seen in the grounds. There is a museum, which is well worth a couple of hours, and the whole castle area is full of interesting houses, shops and cafes.

Worth a visit for the history. Buda Castle is worth the visit to simply walk around without the need of spending any money. After walking over the chain bridge from Pest to Buda you are faced with the choice of going up Buda funicular (which had a huge queue when we were there, or walking up the steps). We chose steps, which wasn't too bad at all. This brings you to castle hill where we strolled around taking in the beautiful architecture and views. There was even a market there which we didn't buy anything from - just nice to walk through and enjoy the atmosphere. I would definitely recommend walking slightly down from castle hill to the bridge above Buda Funicular. Great view!!

History - alive!. It feels like you are surrounded by history. Wherever you turn your eyes is caught by another fascinating detail, a column, a statue, an arch, a pathway. Plus the rewarding view of the whole city on both banks of the Danube. We only visited the outside, but will definitely go back.

Awesome Place with excellent view. It is a beautiful place to be in. perfect architecture, nice museum , and on top of all you can have an exceptional view over the Danube river and Pest area. A must visit while in Buda Pest. to get there you can take a cable car from down near the river.

Worth a walk around. You can walk around the outside for free and enjoy the views. We went in the museum which was free on the day we went. Starting in the medieval bit in the bottom you move up through the years.

Worth a walk by if you are there. We didn't actually go inside as it looked like the inside was mainly art galleries which didn't interest us.The outside architecture is amazing and the grounds are also very beautiful. You can get some good pics from the top outside the castle of the Danube and Parliament and there is also a little cafe you can stop and have a drink at too.
Excellent Tour. We had a great tour guide who informed us well of the past history of this beautiful building. would recommend this highly.
Enjoyed every minute!. I love my time in Budapest and past a lot of time around THE Castle. I spend hours of writing along the wall. Great view from the city!
Fantastic views. Went early morning 9am so could walk around freely without crowds, market stalls etc started setting up around 10.30 very interest eating.a

Truly stunning. I was on a photography visit to the city and wanted to capture a shot of this beautiful building at night. The climb up Gellert Hill was tiring but I hope you agree that it was worth it. Having said that, this building looks amazing at all times.

A secular and fascinating monument. Also called Royal Palace and Royal Castle, Buda Castle is the historical castle and palace complex of the Hungarian kings in Budapest. First completed in 1265, over the centuries has been expanded and enhanced with various architectural styles. It is a monumental site which reveals an extraordinary cultural beauty, being absolutely worthy of an extended visit.

buda castle. the building and its surroundings are very, very nice. the panoramic view from atop is fantastic. they were doing some renovations at the time I was there, including one of the art wings. you need to spend a few hours to abandon yourself. going up and down using the "little train" is a real fun. the whole city is gorgeous, although some places are al little filthy, depending on the part of the city you are in. I did not have a chance to spend time on the buda part of the city, just the pest part. the architecture is absolutely unique. most people smoke like chimneys over there, so be prepared if you are not one or if you are bothered by that. it is a very cosmopolitan city, so you see people from all over Europe and hear different languages all the time, mainly german. a place not to miss, definitely.

Nice site. Only a short walk across the river from most of the hotels situated on the Pest side of the Donau. There are several shortcuts you may take to get faster to the top. The castle itself is a wonderful building, and the area is vast. You may easily use a few hours on the castle, fishermans bastion and the St Mathis Church. All worth exploring.We all loved watching the changing of the guards in front of the presidential palace. They really knew their drill.

Nice view and architecture . I didn't spend much time here because I wasn't too interested in the museums, but the architecture is beautiful, and there's a nice view of Pest just down the ramp in front of the building.

Very beautiful views. Buda castle is situated on a hill which looks across stunning views. There is a bit of a climb to get to the castle however you can pay to take the funicular. The castle itself is currently under refurbishment so some areas were closed off. On a positive note, the entrance was reduced to accommodate for this. Also be aware that the majority of the castle was destroyed(I think it was something to do with the Turks) so only parts of the castle remain.Next to the castle is a very nice art gallery/museum and if you walk a few minutes further you'll see the Fisherman's bastion, which is also stunning.

this was an amazing walk. When we arrived to the top it was enormous! Lots op people on top making pictures of the beautiful view and of the parliament right in front. There is also a cafe on top to relax and chill after your long walk. We really liked this castle!
Nice view. We didn't spend a lot of time here but the view from here is stunning. The building itself is also really nice. It's really a worth visit.
Visit Buda Castle/Palace. Extensive Art Museum which was too much to see and absorb in one visit. Also had Picasso Exhibition which was very well presented. T
For history uffs. Hoped to see an intact castle, but was pleasantly surprised to see a museum filled with history of the area. Beautiful grounds, great spot for photo ops of the Danube and Pest.

Very grand . The reason I rate this 4 is because we only walked past whilst strolling down the Danube. This grandness of this castle standing strong along the Danube can't be ignored. I highly recommend visiting the area just to see this amazingly constructed castle.
Worth the visit. We didn't spend very long here due to time limitation but it was worth the visit just to see the building and the views.

Nice view!. The view from Castle Hill is very nice. There are two musea in the Castle: the nationaal gallery and the history museum. We chose to visit the latter. It is a nice museum about the history of the Castle and it displays some old furnature and art. Go to Castle Hill for the view and to eat Some lagos on the square of the castle.

Breathtaking views from stunning Castle. Everything you want from a visit to a castle. Statues, courtyards, and beautiful views of Budapest along the Danube. Very open for you to walk around and explore at your own pace. We did not go inside the castle to the art galleries due to time but plan to next time!

Stunningly grandiose!. Visited as part of a city break, The funicular railway is a bit short to get up there, but when you do, The architecture, sculptures and view are well wort the visit!We went just as the sun was going down and the lights and views came to life!
Buda Castle ?Hill ? Citadel. Confusing names , But thus us the jewel of Buda . Very grand and majestic building in a strategic place.
Breathtaking. IF I was going to build a castle for myself, I would put it on the hill overlooking the river. The views from the top are amazing. Must see for its architecture and the history.

Best attraction at Buda Side. The Buda Castle and the adjoining area comprising Fisherman's Bastion, Mathias Church are very beautiful and most marvelous in night with illuminations. Even though the castle is not accessible for public, the view of the pest side from the top of Buda hill is wonderful. And there is a change of guard on every hour which is also very attractive. There are three options to reach the Castle; by climbing the steps and by funicular or there is lift available at the Várkert Bazár,
Buda Castle. It's a amazing achitecture stand on to of the Buda Hill over view the Budapest. That is most beautiful place in Budapest. You should never miss it.
Beautiful Views. The whole precinct has great views, and it is worth being there for the changing of the guards. Part of the castle is now home to an art gallery.
Nice building. From this location you will have a wonderful view of the city and is Parliament . We didn't visit the inside but it was a nice walk to go there
Grand. Really nice experience. There is an amazing perch where you can overlook the bridge and river to see the pest side; great for taking photos.

Beautiful day and night!. I would recommend visiting it, it is a must see attraction, although most young attractions are at the pest side the palace provided us a great look over the city! And the bridges.I would recommend to take a look on the National gallery, the big main building!We didnt took the cable cart and decided to walk the way up, it was a good decision.It was full with people but still we took some great photos. Next stage: the view from the church in pest :)
Impressive. Buda around the castle is a nice day's walk. there is plenty to see here, we didn't go in the castle, however its a nice walk round the castle.

Okay, if you like art. We visited here expecting to see and hear something of the history of the castle. We were a bit disappointed to find that is essentially an art gallery. Great, if you like art but we prefer history!

The guards march is totally worth the climb. I came up here with my walking tour group. After a long climb we made it right on time the gaurds swiched shifts. There was a super cool marching show with drums and flags and the works- totally worth seeing. Also, you can see a lot from this high up.

Nice Castle. The Castle is located on the top of the hill on the Buda side. There is a couple of nice shops to visit in this area. I did see a few restaurants but didn't have a chance to try one since we were limited on time. I recommend for those that would like to spend more time at the castle is to take a private tour. The views from the top were beautiful.

Lovely early morning walk. The place opens at around 9 so if you arrive earlier you get free access to some areas where you otherwise have to pay ;) it's a long walk and everything is closed until 10am so bring your own coffee:)Anyway it's worth the few euros if you're not a student.

This is now a art museum. This was really surprising. It had a wide variety of exhibition with some rare masters like El Greco, Rodin and Gauguin. At the time they also hosted a Picasso exhibition. The inside of the building is really worth seeing.

Perfect Respite on a Winter Day!. We spent a lovely afternoon wandering the castle on a bitterly cold winter day. The views are spectacular and definitely worth the trip up to see them on the funicular. There is also a museum on the grounds which showed the history of the city, battles that were fought over it and the many Nations that occupied the city and shaped its future. It was a fascinating insight in to Budapest and we thoroughly enjoyed it!
Buda castle. watched the changing of the guards whilst there, then we into the castle was brilliant loads to see and do.

Do not miss it!. This really does have it all! Not only do you have the magnificent building with spectacular views to enjoy but also the castle museum inside which you pretty much have to yourself! Where you can walk through the castle into all the different areas such as the chapel. And it's all free! This really is somewhere you can spend the day with the option of various cafes, restaurants surrounding it as well as gift shops and archery games to play. Breath taking views and just an amazing historic castle in remarkable condition. You really do feel like your taking a walk through time. Highly recommend a visit.
Beautiful Castle. Need to go up the Hill and see this beauty - best to go to this attraction during the night - gets very beautiful
Amazing to see. This castle is filled with history and beautiful artifacts. You will enjoy the history of this lovely place.

A massive structure that dominates Castle Hill. Fabulous views from the front terraces but also check out the statue of Eugene of Saxony who finally "saw off" the Turks from Hungary & the impressive Mathias Fountain

Interesting display of Budapest history in Wing E. Enjoyed most of day seeing museum and history display in Wing E. Good views form the terrace at the back of the cafe. Needed more time to see Art Exhibitions
National Gallery location. Amazing location on the top of the hill giving most breath-taking views of Budapest! Exteriors are just as grand as the National Gallery collections inside.
for a special birthday. lots of intresting things to see and an amazing view from the top.lovely little stop in a cafe for some goulash soup and a little apperatif
Beautiful historic place. Great place to spend walking and exploring about continental Europe history. Recommended for any time of day, rain or shine. Beautiful views from the castle.

Beautiful Sight. The castle is located on the Buda side and has amazing views of Pest. The castle itself, is beautiful. Be sure to visit the little shops further away from the castle for little unique gifts.

Beautiful Place. While there is a cable car to take you to the top, I opted in to walk along the stairs and it is even more beautiful. You can look back to the Chain Bridge and the view is breath-taking. Night view is also amazing.
Great tour. I enjoyed my tour through Buda Castle. Lots of interesting things to see inside the castle and on the grounds
Must visit. Must visit if you are visiting in Budapest. Beautiful castle and castle area too. Great views to river Danube and Pest side.
Well worth the walk from Pest. Beautiful setting and brilliant views across the river to the rest of the city. Steep walk to get there but well worth it.

Very boring as castles go. And extremly difficult if you have troubke vlibming stairs. Not at littering at all. And avoid rhe castle as it has no redeeming features. A waste of 3 hours traveling and climbing nothing but stairs to an empty shell

Gorgeous castle. This is a gorgeous castle from outside and quite a popular tourist place. Since its touristy, souvenir finds around is quite expensive. You can certainly find same items in the souvenir shops all over.

Can't miss this during your visit.. Buda castle is a fantastic place well worth of climbing the stairs up. It offers amazing views, pleasant coffees all around and real touch with Hungary's history. I loved my visit and walking all the way up to the Fisherman's bastion was my favorite part of the visit.
Amazing. I must admit that I was amazed by the historical importance and the beauty of Buda Castle. A must visit.
Buda Castle. Nice stroll in spring at Buda Castle. Hava a look at King Matthias in disguise among the hunters and the Hungarian dog vizsla.

Fantatstic views. A great experience wandering around the terrace on Buda castle. The views of the Danube and the rest of Budapest cannot be beaten. The whole area, including the town, is worth a day long trip. Not to be missed.

Budapest is my favorite European city. The castle is a large part of that. Great for walking around and exploring and enjoying the weather. I spent the better part of the day checking out little shops and churches and finally snapped this picture which summed up my entire trip...
Gigantesque. All the pictures do not describe enough this basilica. A good camera from the dom would be a great idea for memorable landscape. Too high and long the stairs for week bodies.
Costs too much . Too expensive to look round a castle. The views at the to were incredible though. And the changing of the guard was spectacular to watch!! Go but don't pay!
No inside tours. Nice to see if you're up at Buda anyway but unfortunately you can't go into the castle (just into the museums which are part of the building) - nice enough to see.

Buda Castle. We visited this castle and walked up through the gardens and spent time going round the grounds and looking at the statues and buildings. We also saw the soldiers in the sentry boxes on duty and read about some of the history. We did not pay to go inside any of the buildings but there is plenty to see if you like to look in more detail.

No tours of the Castle. Be forewarned: there is no internal tour of the Castle. There are 2 museums in the old castle: art and Hungarian history. If you just want the view, go to Fishermans Bastion instead...or to Lady Liberty hill. Of course, if you want to see the museums, this is the only place. The grounds are pretty neat as well.
Beautiful to see. This is a lovely place to stroll around and look at the beautiful architecture. Make sure you hang around for the changing of the guard which is a really cool thing to watch
Great views over the city!. definitely worth a visit! restaurants cafes and ice creams up there too! Great views out over the river and can get great photos of parliament building!

Plenty to explore. We took the hop-on hop-off bus to Castle Hill to make it a day trip. Buda Castle is one of the famous attractions there located beside Fisherman Bastion and. Matthias Church. The castle went through a splendid glorious time and also a ruinous time, abandoned. Now it’s the home of museums, National Library and National Gallery. In front of the Castle is a spacious terrace with a breathtaking view of the River Danube and the Pest side of the city. There are a few points of interest: like the Matthias Fountain, Statue of Prince Eugene, Fishing Children Fountain, the entrance “Ornate Gate” and the mythical bird “Turul” beside the Ornate Gate. One note, the most expensive washroom I ever used was here and I have traveled in Europe quite a bit. Happy Travelling!

Must see sight. Do not leave Budapest without seeing Buda Castle! There is a cable car which takes you up the hill for 500 Forint but as it was a lovely sunny day we walked up - easily walkable. The castle itself is lovely with a great view of Pest and the surrounding area as you walk over towards fisherman's village is worth exploring too!

Huge . We went to buda castle and used the funicular. It was so big! We couldn't believe the vastness of the castle. The trip up on the funicular was something to behold in itself. Many cafes around the castle and reasonably priced meant you could enjoy lunch with some spectacular views!

Take the funicular and go during the sunset. I would not say it is a must-go place because, in terms of the view, I think that from the fisherman's bastion is even better. I would recommend travellers to take the Castle funicular up to the hill and walk down the hill. I would recommend going during the sunset because the view of the chain bridge is far better when the lights of the bridge are on.

Well worth the effort to visit this castle. We took the funicular up to the top of the hill to investigate the castle and were not disappointed the views are magnificent and with the sun shinning on the river quite breath taking. The castle itself in interesting as are the statues that are all around it. There was a nice café as well as snack bar and souvenir stalls to examine.
Nice. Nice historical place it could be another option to discover the city and get to know about its culture

good place to hike and birdview the city. if it's nice weather, I would say plz go. it's a nice hiking for me, and I didn't take bus going up. when you reach the peak, you can birdview the city, including parliament and chain bridge.
Must do while in Budapest!. Buda castle was a fantastic experience. Do the headset, as there is great information to be learned.

Massive. We only walked the grounds (which were huge). There is a cable car/furnicular that can bring you up but there seemed to be a big queue and it costs 1000ft. You can walk up for free via the paths or steps. Provides a great view throughout of the river and has a history museum inside, Architecture is a combination of classic and modern.

Visit in the Buda Castle. It was a very nice castle with great view of the river and Pesti. It was ideal for a nice walk. Also, there you could visit the national history museum and the national gallery. You could have a coffe or a wine watching the beautiful view. At last, it was not necessary to use the teleferik and pay for it, you could go on feet it was not far from the chain bridge.
Take Your Time. You need to spend an entire day at the Buda Castle. Not only looking at the architecture but the museums inside. A must see while in Budapest!

Stunning view. No matter what time you go there the views from the Castle are amazing, and the Castle is not less impressive. Spare a day to appreciate the Castle and the district with all its beauty.
Another symbol. The best place to take photos of palace and the pest side budapest. So huge area nice statues and history. One of my favorite places in budapest.

A castle, a stunning view and Budapest just under your feet. If you climb up there you will catch more than one sparrow...You will see the Castle, the National Gallery and all of Budapest from the Hill...You could combine with Gellert hill, Matthias Church and Fishermen's Bastion...It is normally full of crowds but that is not a problem...
Worth a visit. The architecture of the castle is lovely to look at with the gates and everything all in detail, plus the views of Pest and Buda of both cities.
Wow. We had the chance to visit the castle during the Ironman-weekend so we didn't really make the fullest out of it but it was, seriously, a magnificent sight to be seen.

Great view of Budapest and Hungarian grande building. Location: you can reach there by 10-15 minutes hiking and walking from the nearest bus stop of Adam ter (just beside the bridge)Experience: it is a perfect place to photograph Budapest from above. The building are also beautiful and worth to see. If you are into art, it's highly recommended you enter the museum, if not there are cafe and souvenir shop you can access just in the area.

Astonishing!!!!. It is a must visi!. You can take numerous photos from every corner of it, great building and histrory behind it.There are also tree museums in it. If you are uycky, you can also see the change of the guard which is another excellent experience!

Not the castle you expect!. the home to the national gallery which is a must visit! The top 2 floors of the museum were not to great as modern art is just stupid. A TIN OF SOUP IS NOT ART. The portraits and landscapes on the first 2 flors were stunning. Dont appreciate art? you will! Dont expect to visit a castle like you would normally. Royal furniture and rooms full of gorgeous architecture, all of this was burnt in a fire many years ago. Enjoy you trip and the views from Buda castle!
Worth the climb. Steep climb up, but good exercise and the view is worth it (there is a also a lift but always a big queue for it) The views over the city are amazing
Must go. Is one the most important and beatifull places to view in bouda... Choose a nice weather day because you will walk a lot...

Amazing! The best Europe has to offer. Buda Castle has been one of the most beautiful places Ive ever been in Europe. Very easy to spend a good few hours wandering around the medieval castle and square. The cathedral is also a masterpiece (see my pics). This area really is like no other in Europe. I visited a couple of days ago and the sky was really blue, it felt like a movie set. If you're a history buff or just appreciate beautiful architecture then you won't be disappointed. There are lovely little 'french-style' patisseries and cafes (or maybe I shouldn't say french, but 'Hungarian-style'). Regardless, the cafes offer delicious pastries and world-class coffee. I stopped by Ruszwurm and had an espresso and their signature 'vanilla cream cake'. The pastries are really incredible at Ruszwurm and the coffee is lovely, a great little pick-me-up while you explore the beautiful surroundings further. I noticed just down from Ruszwurm there was a soup cafe with those big bread-bowl soups, next time I go I will try the soup, they looked delicious as well.
Excellent, magnificent .... Buda Castle is the combination of architecture and beautiful scenery. We spent a day in Buda hill and still eager to spend more time here. Absolutely recommended.

Castle that keeps you in the Air. Budha Caste is one palce that I kept going back to during my stay in Budapest. The place is worth visiting both during the day as well as the night. The bridge and the footpath leading to the castle provides an endless stream of visitors and places to take photographs with the castle in the background. The castle itself is beautiful with all its stone façade and the traditional architecture.
great place to see. Great place to see. Highly recommended! Just walk around and enjoy the view of the city. We have not gone inside though.
Incredibly beautiful. Just walk around, get lost in it.. Fantastic place to visit, so many areas to explore. If we get back to Budapest, we will definitely spend some more time in the area

WRONG LOCATION. We walked around the castle area at night (after it was closed so cannot comment on the interior) and it was beautiful. It was all lit up and there was a little stall selling hot mulled wine. There were also incredible views over the city. Trip advisor does have the location wrong for the castle. We followed the link for directions from the tripadvisor page and ended up walking quite a way into a residential area to a block of flats which wasn't ideal. Whilst I would definitely reccomend a visit, find alternate directions!

Grand place with a grand view . From the castle top you have a beautiful view of the city and the incredible Chain Bridge. The towers of the churches and the far away palace gave it a surreal quality when viewed from the top. Scenic and gorgeous.

Pretty during day and night!. Buda Castle is located on the top of one of the Buda Hills. As a result, it has a spectacular look, especially if you are staring at it form the Pest side during night.Hungarian National Gallery is located inside the Buda Castle that also might worth to visit. Even if you do not like art, you can still enjoy the interior of Buda Castle by visiting the gallery.Come visit this place by walking on the hill or by looking at it from the Pest side. We (a couple) recommend you in any way!

Must-see place in Budapest. The Buda Castle is one of my top places in Budapest.Located by the banks of the Danube river, the castle has had a very long history and has been expanded many times throughout history.Unless you're in a rush, taking the funicular to get to the top of the hill where the castle is located is not something I would suggest. The castle can be accessed from the back of the hill, as well as from the bottom for free. Walking will allow you to grasp the majestic of the whole walled area and it may only take 5 to 10 minutes to get to the top. You can enjoy the view towards the Danube river, the Parliament as well as the Liberty Statue. Using the funicular would take 1 minute or less, plus the waiting time, which I'm assuming would be close to 5 minutes.Entrance to the actual castle was not very expensive and is worth it if you're interested in the history behind it.
Great experience. Great experience and lots to see and do in the area, views from this location down across the Danube 7 Chain Bridge upto Parliment is truly lovely and a must on your visit.

Interesting. This was a very interesting visit, with lots to see. A lovely walk around, and not too busy too. WE got off from the hop on/off bus, as it is stood at the top of a hill. We came down on the vernacular lift also

Number 1 place to go when visiting Budapest.... We were there with a group of people and the view alone is worth it. In addition there is plenty to do :) Just go and see! Tip: If you want to use the Budapest Castle Hill Funicular, there are sometimes long lines at the bottom station. A ride back down alone is possible just as well and usually there is hardly any line at the top.

Wonderful Castle. We got to Buda Castle by using the Funicular Railway, which was a lovely way of getting up the hill. The grounds of the Castle are lovely with amazing views of the city. Strolled back down the hill through the gardens.
Good. Do visit the Buda Castle in the night and also in the day beautiful place don't miss The Climb by the trolley car to the castle

Best of the City!. My #1 recommendation when visiting Budapest. There are several museums on the Castle Hill area. If you'd like to see them all plan on spending more than 3 hours. Even if you skip the inside of the building, it's still an amazing place to walk around.You could easily walk up the hill or ride the Castle Hill Funicular (tram). I recommend walking at least one way. The cobble stone path leading to the top offers some great photo ops! Make sure you walk around the back of the building to take in all that the area has to offer.Truly one of the most beautiful sites in Budapest.

Usual Castle in a city. Hop on hop off bus tour took us here, much what you would expect from a city castle tour, soldiers changing the guard, breath taking scenery over the city and River Danube makes it worth while, usual souvenier shops etc

Buda Castle. This was probably my favourite place to visit in Budapest. We watched the changing of the guard - in fact, spent most of a day walking round the whole site. We even went back at night (it doesn't close until 10pm) to see it lit up!

a must go tourist destination. BUDA CASTLE is without a doubt one of the main tourist attractions in this beautiful city.Although the view from afar is superb such as from the mighty River Danube on a boat getting up to the castle and seeing the magnificent architecture is much better. The sheer scale of the building is awesome and the stunning views of Chain Bridge and the river are unforgettable. Viewed at night and the castle looks amazing bathed in light.This is a great attraction and well worth a visit on any holiday to Budapest.

Nice but very expensive parking. The castle is beautiful and looks really nice and at night it gets really creepy, combined with the 'lantern-tour' it's really awesome, but watch out for the RIP off parking! First 30min are free, the next 30min are around 549 forint but if you stay longer than 1 hour it is ~5000 forint!

Brilliant. Had a fabulous experience going up on the Funicular a tram thing that goes up the hill to t h e castle. It w a s -11 freezing so would have like to have seen more but so cold. Will return in spring or Autumn. Well worth a visit.

Impressive building, information overload. Impressive building, however the exposition was badly organized and the order to follow unclear. If interested in the history of the city from prehistoric times until modern times, it is the place to go, otherwise have a look at the building, snap a picture and go enjoy the old town.

A must see in Hungary. You can see it from afar, but it is nothing like getting up close and IN the castle. This is a beautiful piece of history, from which you can get amazing views, fantastic pictures and wonderful memories. It is all very open so children can get some energy out while mom and dad enjoy the view. The history of the castle is even more interesting when you are standing in it!

Beautiful and interesting. I toured the exterior of Buda Castle with my COSMOS tour group. The architecture is fantastic, very well maintained and peaceful. As one might expect it offers a great view across the Danube. This is a must see on your visit to wonderful Budapest.

Great views. Great views across the river to Pest. There is a changing of the guards every hour at the top of hour which takes all of 5 minutes. Nice too see if you happen to be there at the correct time but not worth a major effort to do so.
1,000,000 $ worth view. Take a metro M2, than go for a walk on Buda castle. And enjoy in view on beautiful Budapest. Great place, wonderful atmosphere.

Closed on Mondays. We were unable to enter the castle on our visit but it dominates Castle Hill across the river from Pest and looks lovely when lit at night . Nice to walk around the grounds and you can see the changing of the guard at building next door on the hour
Gorgeous Views. Stunning close-up views of Buda Castle, Fisherman's Bastion to the North, and the Chain Bridge and Pest to the East. Highly recommend.

High point of any Budapest visit.. The location, scale and architectural beauty of the castle make it a must see. Offering spectacular views and a fascinating glimpse into Budapest's imperial past, a visit to the castle is a guaranteed highlight of any trip to Budapest. We were fortunate to attend the annual 'sausage and palinka festival' - held within the castle precincts - and it was a truly memorable experience. Highly recommended.

In love. It´s an amaizing place with incredible views! if you go to budapest you have to visit this place if is in a walking tour or just you is amaizing you will love to see budapest from there and see the castel <3
Must see!. Generally I don't really like the touristic places, but this castle is very imposing! Full of musums, galleries and with a bonus: a beautiful view!

Interesting museums, great architecture. So lovely this part of Budapest, from the Castle Hill you got the most marvellous view on the city and Danube including Gellert hill. Classical architecture and around the museum old charming streets. If it is sunny it is wonderful to do photos and it is free, you can also decide, in rainy days, to visit some of interesting museums for a nice entry price.
Great place . Fantastic views and lovely day of culture. Visited museum too which was interesting. Worth it to just see the views of the city. A must see place to go in Budapest.

Go see it. Even just for the views. . You can walk around it all for free and there's a visitor cafe inside. If you pay entry you can go around the gallery which is impressive. It's a great taste of Renaissance history until the scrapped the royal family in 1918. I've no idea what I'm looking at but the descriptions are in English and the exhibits are impressive
Beautiful building. Beautiful building set on a hillside amid parkland, visit at night when it is lit up for some very pretty pictures. There are great views from the top over Buda and Pest
A must. Don,t visit Budapest without taking the time to cross the river and take a close up view of Budapest castle.it is a lovely place to stop off from the hop on hop off bus and stroll the area

A must-see attraction!!. What a beautiful castle and the view of the Danube, Chain Bridge and the House of Parliament is absolutely breathtaking!It's a great photo opportunity, as one doesn't want to forget pretty Buda Castle with its stunning white-grey stones. Matthew's Church (Matyas Templom in Hungarian) is next to the castle, another example of breathtakingly beautiful architecture with its neo-gothic style. It is a gorgeous, must-see attraction that I highly recommend to everyone visiting Budapest! Enjoy!
Worth the walk. After walking up steep steps the views from the castle are beautiful. Great for photographers even on a cloudy/rainy day
Beautiful. We actually did not enter the castle, it was enough to see the outside, but the view i'ts amazing and you can walk around and have a great time!

A must. The buda castle or budai var in hungarian is a must see in any visit. The view, the history, the festivals every once a while just making it a must. You can also visit the fishermans bastion at the same time, only 5 mins by walking.

Not to be missed. Obviously you are going to go to Buda Castle, although I think it was one of the attractions with the fewest interesting-things-per-the-hour-you-spend-there. Good views, nice white walls, some sculptures, little booths selling gluhwein and awful tourist tat, a few different ways to walk up which was cute. A little attraction with archery for a few hundred forints which was a fun ten minutes. If you are rushed for time, do the Fisherman's Bastion first, there's more to see.
Buda castle - Too much History. If u r a history lover and love architecture, dont miss it...Awesome view.. Beautiful castle...Too hot in summer though...

Budapest Attractions. Budapest straddles the Danube River. The first bridge linking Buda on the west bank and Pest on the east was not built until the 1840's. Buda and Pest became a single city in 1872.The famous Heroes Square is in Pest along with the beautiful Hungarian State Opera. You will need you walking shoes on the Buda side, as no buses are allowed in the castle district but there is a funicular railway from Clark Adam Square at the end of the Chain Bridge. At the famous Fishermans Bastion, you will see one of the most beautiful views of Budapest.The Budapest market is worth a visit, it is an amazing 19th century building with high metal columns, walkways & ramps. So many different varieties of food. Budapest zoo, the famous Gundel restaurant, and amusement park and the amazing Szecheny, baths are all contained in the City Park. Vajdahunyad Castle is set on an island in the middle of the lake.The many museums and churches are all worth a visit.At night walk along the Danube River and see the buildings all lit up, a wonderful sight.

Breathtaking Sights . What a beautiful castle. The whole area is just a feast for the eyes. You could see it from far away but up close it's even more magnificent in all its splendor and grandeur. You can't miss this in Budapest.

awesome!!!. we had a great time here at the buda castle. It was just what you would think it would be.Very cool war memorabilia up higher on the grounds.\we dont usually get tours so we just walked around and explored, it was absolutely beautiful. A must see if you are visiting budapest.
Another World Heritage Site of Budapest. Perhaps a bit over sized to the Country, showing however the past grandeur of the Empire. Definitely worth visiting for its wast array of attractions.
LOVED this!!!. Loved every aspect of wandering around this majestic place.. from the amazing views, to archery, to the museums.. don't forget to visit Dracula's layer.

It is a "must" for any traveller.. This attraction is good in any weather. It has many museums inside, cafes, towers to visit even in rainy day. Great view from the Fisherman tower to the Danube and Parliament.

Nice to walk around. We didn't actually go inside but walking around and looking at the view of Pest was lovely. We were there in winter but I bet in summer you could stroll around for quite a while. Downside is that I expect it would be very crowded as it was already busy on this dreary winters day.
A must see when in Budapest. A great view of the city on top of the hills of Buda. Quite busy in the summer. We were there in Aug. 2015. Very hot at 35C.

Breathtaking!. Buda Castle was unbelievably gorgeous. Walking around and seeing the fountains, gate guardians, and restaurants around the square was amazing. The stone work and architecture and views were worth the sore feet and the heat! I highly recommend taking a tour of the Labyrinth of Buda Castle as well.

A must see but a little confusing . My father and I found the path to the top of the castle a little confusing but this is still something not to be missed. You can take a cable car up and down if the walk isn't your thing, but expect lines. The food outside is very expensive. We didn't go inside or to the museum that is there.

Now used as an art museum. Visited here on a rainy day because they had some of the art on loan from the fine art museum that is closed for renovations. That section of the museum was smaller than I'd hoped, with the rest of the museum dedicated to Hungarian artists ranging from mid-14th century to modern times.
lots to do, worth visiting.. Plenty to see and do, the castle is not really a castle now a days but museums. Try and be there for 12 when the changing of the guard takes place.

This was a big dissapointment. The castle is actually just ruined walls behind the current modern building. What you can see in the pictures is needing a lot of maintenance. The windows are all plastic and the walls are white washed. The best part about this location is it can be accessed by a lift and escalator and then a short walk to the right to the nicer parts of the hill.
Holiday2016. Beautiful views and architecture. Well worth a visit and at night the illuminated castle is outstanding
Great building. We enjoyed our visit around the grounds of Buda castle. It wasn't as impressive as Matthias church- but it is only 10 mins away so it's a must whilst you're visit Buda.

Great to look at, wonderful to look from. Buda Castle has undergone numerous renovations in its history, but one thing remains constant. It is impressive to view from the Pest side, and Pest looks even more inviting when viewed from the Castle.

Awe inspiring architecture. Another winderful example of opulence and times when money was (apparently!) no object, this is a beautiful building...which needs a bit of TLC ro restore to its full former glory, which is still very definitely evident. It is a must visit!

Unforgeable by night!. The baroque castle is beautiful and the views are quite spectacular. You can take a funicular on your way up - great views on Danube river while you're going up! Walk around after dark, take in the aura and history of this place. We did not go inside but the surroundings are as amazing as the castle itself.

Magnificent !. The whole area oozes History and we lucked in with a sunny day with reasonable crowd numbers. You could easily spend two days exploring the hill top but on our budget we flew through it ! Superlatives don't do it justice , so just take my word for it and go & enjoy , would I Lie To You ??? Sorry Annie & Dave !
Amazing views. It is such a grand building and has amazing views, even when the city is covered in a layer of fog. It's worth going to twice once in the day and once at night. I highly recommend it!
Lovely Walk Around beautiful views.. Loved the Church and surrounding Castle area. What a great time for a sunny Sunday, lots to see and learn about.
The Castle. Great Danube, parliament, and Pest view. The building is awesome. Take a walk there. It is aesily accecible by the public bus with no 16. Leaves you just outside the building

Historic amazement!. The city is steeped in dramatic history and the castle district wraps it all up into an extraordinarily architectural sum. It was once the only source of safety during the war and at its dizzy height, maintains its watch over Budapest.A must see!
Try to catch the change of guard. I have raved about Budapest at night but this is nice to see at day and to catch the change of guard which happens every hour, on the top of the hour.
A large place. This castle is great, a must see when you come to Budapest. We saw it on a tour and it was very interesting and full of history.
Amazing. We went in the evening took the cablecar up , stunning views of the city below , next time will walk up , spectacular

Amazing views. We walked to the top and showed ourselves around in the evening. Great time to go as the city is lit up which makes the view even more incredible! You can see the chain bridge, parliament and the synagogue from the top so it is a great way to end a day exploring this part of the city. There appears to be some sort of tram system in operation in the day to help you get to the top, so if traveling with children or OAPs I would recommend going in the day.

Great view from top. Buda castle is located in the hilly side, we ride the funicular (cable railway) going on the top. We have to pay 12€ each for single trip or 18€ for back & forth. From the Buda castle you can see everything, the chain bridge, parliament, elizabeth bridge with really great view.The buda castle is closed, they used it for art gallery with an entrance fee as well. We expected to see the castle but unfortunately its arts only. But we bought some souvenirs outside and have a walk around the castle.Going up there is also an escalator if you don't want to pay for the Funicular at the other side of the castle.
Looks great at night. Great view of the city during the day, and the castle it self looks great at night. There is a coffee shop inside as well.

Wear comfy shoes!. It's worth walking up there.. We got a bit lost trying to find the main entrance for the Gallery since we artived there on the other side and went in some corridors in the grounds by mistake.. The gallery is bigger than it looks in the map they give you.. We've spent there at least 3 hours! But me and my husband love art so it was worth it.. My feet hates me though! People told me it's cold in Hungary so I'm wearing this thermal tights and knee boots and I'm regretting it! Boots are great but not at all combined with swollen feet after a couple of days walking everywhere! I'm thinking I'll deserve that lovely baths visit later on..

The royality of royals!. Seeing it from outside at night was a stunning experience, going there was immemorial.You can't be in Budapest, and not visit the Royalty of it, this palace like the topping fruit of Budapest cake! Simply Magestic.
A must-do. The view of the Budapest is great. We didn't visit the gallery inside, but the castle is worth a little hike. It's beautiful from the other side of the Danube river (especially at night).
Allow a full day for the walk and vist. Worth the walk, (far better then using the funicular rail) steeped in history and beautiful views of the City
Nice museum . This is an enjoyable eclectic museum with a range of art. Fortunate to visit when a choir was doing a recital which further added to the ambience
Stunning. So much fun! The castle has plenty photo opportunities and cool gift shops. the area has many english-speakers as well.

Even on a wet day worth the visit.. Unfortunately on the day we had set asdie for sightseeing started with rain but we decided to make the most of it.We took the vernacular railway which is £5 return to the top of the hill.The castle itself strikes you immediately with its size and the imposing nature it has over the city from the Buda side overlooking Pest is just increased when up close.There are two museums that you can avail of when there, the Art and History museums. Due to time and my interest being more of history we chose the latter. Approx £4 each entry here.The museum is a labyrinth of passages and floors taking you from the medieval history of the hill, the city and the archaeological digs that helped re-discover the story of it all through to the more recent years that tell of the German occupation and then Soviet control of the country.I would say we easily spent 90 minutes in all taking in the story and exhibits and it is well worth the visit.Afterwards take a walk around the walls and get a good view of the Buda side and it is chalk and cheese from the Pest side.On a nicer day we could have walked the top of the hill to various sites and statues but alas the rain dictated that lunch was preferable and time to dry out!

Buda's gem.. Buda is a great place to visit for a day if you include lunch in one of its many pleasant restaurants. The Castle is the gem of the tour that will include Fishermen's Bastion, Mattias church and fountain, The Palace and their national guards, museums, the funicular railway and the market. Great views of Pest and the Danube.

You can easily combine this tour with the Mathias Church in Buda,. If you are fortunate to be staying near the Matyas Church, this castle is nearby. Buda is on a hill and if you are inclined to walk, I recommend that you have comfortable shoes so you can visit this impressive building that allows you to view the Danube and the Pest side. Visit it during the day and the evening to fully enjoy this beautiful site,

Step back in History. We spent most of the day here as there is so much to see. The views across the Danube to Pest are spectacular and you can see all of the bridges and Parliament from here as well as the Gellert Baths. We went into the Hungarian National Gallery for a couple of hours - as it was minus 9 C outside it was good to go inside to warm up and you can leave your coats etc - if you are a pensioner you get half price admission & over 70 is free entry

Amazing. Visiting this castle is a must for anyone visiting Budapest.The view from here across the city is stunning.We waited for the changing of the guard which is wonderful to see.All pomp and ceremony .
Great castle!. Not only the castle but also the whole area around it is worthy seeing. It carries a lot of history and gives a beautiful seeing from the river and Pest side.
What a castle and the view of the Danube, fantastic!. I really enjoyed the tour of the castle, there is a lot of history here not to mention the view of the Danube from atop the hill!

If you want to feel Hungaria indeed. Everybody should visit it! Amazing architecture, the greatest museum inside with exposition of hungarian artists. Also you will enjoy the perfect panoramic view of the city!
Great. Again used hop on bus . I think you had to pay to get in.there was a carriage lift to take you up to the castle.get there first thing in am.ques can be long.
Good Way to Spend Half a Day. Interesting architecture and history. Museum is informative. Complex is quite extensive and views of city are very good. Can get a bite to eat and a beer while there.
A whimsicle wander in time. We trekked the steep slopes from the foot of Castle Hill up to the historic centre of Buda and enjoyed the views, the cobbles and many aspects of the castle from below.

Beautiful and a Must-See!. Buda Castle sits high on the cliffs overlooking the Danube River from the Buda side of the river. You can walk up to it via stairs, winding paths or take the funicular, which doesn't cost much money. The castle is a fairytale come to life and can be seen from all over Budapest. It doesn't cost any money to see the outside, and we did not go inside, so I cannot comment on that.We went up the the Buda Castle on our first night in Budapest to get a feel for the city and to be able to see the city from one of the highest points possible. I've always felt you can see so much more from above than from the ground. The castle sits right on the edge of the cliffs, so you can get great views of the Pest side and see all the famous buildings and sprawling city.The Budapest Wine Festival was going on at Buda Castle while we were there, which added to the magic of the castle. Make sure to plan time to stroll around the grounds and look at the beautiful buildings, fountains and architecture. Take time to just hang over the walls and see the river and city below. Buda Castle cannot be missed when in Budapest. It is spectacular and one of the most beautiful buildings in Europe. Add this to your itinerary. And make sure you eat a delicious langos in Clark Adam Square at the base of the funicular. The lady who makes them is incredible and clearly loves her craft.
City on its own. The area of buda is where the castle is which is actually a palace.lots to see you could spend all day on castle hill. Spectacular views

Fairytale Castle!. We took a public bus to the top and then walked around. We'd visited Budapest previously and, although the funicular is direct, we prefer to mix with the locals and see a bit more of the winding road to the top! The castle ramparts are beautiful and the views excellent. It's free just to wander about and there are plenty of interesting buildings and cafes nearby. There are some interesting squares slightly off the beaten track with lots of colourful houses etc. Lots of history here - look out for the plaques identifying historic landmarks.

Great views, stunning castle. . Wonderful views of the Castle, and from the Castle. Shacks for hot wine and goulash are nice, prices not too bad and good fun to drink some wine whilst taking in the view. Worth combining with the Bastion, Labyrinth, Hospital in the Rock, and other things at the top of the hill.

Magic Castle. Do not miss the chance when in Budapest to visit one of the best castles of its type in this part of the world.If you are on the Pest side have a walk up to the Chain Bridge and then catch the Funicular for the short but enjoyable ride ( Budavari Siklo ) up to the museums and the wonderful castle on the Buda side. If you can time it so that you are there after dark you will see a wonderful site almost like a fairy castle dream.

Beautiful . It's not a long walk up to the top so worth walking and taking in the views rather than paying for a lift. Get a hot dog and hot chocolate at the top if it's cold. Definitely worth going to the art gallery inside the castle.

Historic place. The large Royal Palace on the top off the hill, next to the Danube river, is one of the most historic places in Buda(pest).Make sure you visit this area with a guide, who can tell you all about the history and the famous inhabitants. You can't visit the Palace from the inside, but that doesn't makes this place less interesting.
Funicular railway up to Castle. Take the funicular (usually long queues in summer!) to get up to the Castle for great views of the city. Surprisingly peaceful walk around some beautiful buildings.

Fantasy looking in the evening. Buda Castle was really pretty in the evening with the lights. And there are statues which are also very very fantastic. I felt like I am looking at a photoshopped picture with amazing lights and amazing buildings!

Go on a clear day. The day we visited was bitterly cold with snow on the ground and a mist in the air. We didn't, therefore, get particularly clear views back over the Danube to Pest but very worth the visit all the same. It is a large area to walk around with lots to see and appreciate the architecture.

Buda Castle. Stunning views from the castle and a lot of interesting history. Although the city was pretty much destroyed in the wars this castle is pretty much the same. You can get there via the 16/16a bus which is free of charge with your Budapest card! I'd highly recommend this card as we got a free walking tour around pest at 11 and around Buda at 2. You can see the whole city and there is a big bird watching down on it. Exceptionally cold in the winter we were there -12 degrees Celsius and cause it's very high up it is truly freezing.

So much to see. This place is amazing. So much to see on the outside as well as the inside. I didn't do the museum tour, but I did walk around the outside. It was a bit chilly that day. But the views were awesome.
Interesting!. We walked around the castle gardens at our own pace and found it really interesting. There are plenty of hidden nooks and cranny's.

A Must See!. Loved Buda Castle - walked over the Chain bridge and took a trip up via the Funicular railway, only because we knew we would be on our feet for most of the day, and I use a stick. Pricey trip. However you arrive right outside the gates of the castle. There are lots of huts selling mulled wine, coffee and hot chocolates. However we went into the building and bought our tickets to see the art gallery.Firstly we dispensed with our coats and went into the cafe. Nice coffee, hot chocolate and snacks which were reasonably priced. You can use the toilets here, free if you show your entrance tickets, if not you have to pay.The gallery is well laid out and houses a vast collection of Hungarian art over several floors. There is a lift here and lots of seating around the building. The staff are incredibly pleasant and helpful. Again, the architecture here is as much an art form as the paintings, sculptures etc. My partner is not as enthusiastic about galleries as I am but he was wowed by most of the collections. Also the views from the Windows just adds to the pleasure and experience of Budapest. You get so much for your money for a visit here! And on so many levels, literally. We walked around the grounds, took lots of photographs as the opportunities of finding different angles are endless! We finished and went back down on the curricular train then turned right at the bottom and ascended the path back up towards the castle but ventured along the contour of the hill, dropped down into some gardens and followed these to the end, walked across the bridge, got a tram back to the Parliament buildings. But a spectacular day out!

Interesting Museums and Nice View. Inside Buda Castle, there is a nice museum covering the long and interesting history of Budapest. My husband and I spent a few hours there, and felt like we learned quite a bit. It's not the most interactive museum, so it would be a difficult place to keep most small children entertained. We were happy we spent an afternoon enjoying the hilltop views of the city.
Nice place. Easily recognizable from a distance. Located by the side of the Danube river. More beautiful at night, specially for the photo lovers. Good, relaxing walk to the place.

Buda Castle. This is a historical palace where the Hungarian royals stayed. The architecture is Baroque and was completed in the 13th century. Because this is such a huge to castle to visit, you need at least 2 to 3 days to see everything.

Underrated icon. A really lovely walk up Buda hill will get you to this very underrated monolith of old grandeur. Not the largest palace in Europe, but worth the visit. A great spot to take those award winning pics of the city. But why oh why is this great tourist icon in such average condition, with little or no signs showing any of the historical background of any of the areas within the palace grounds?

Well worth a visit. Thought initially it was disappointing ,but then realised it went on and had much more to offer covering most of the areas history. Can take as long as or as little as you want. Nice cafe

great views. Really a nice place to take pictures. You have a nice view on the Danube and the Parlaiment and the city center from there. The statues could be maintained a bit better hence not 5 stars...
Nice building. This building is one of the most attractive building in Budapest. You can enjoy goid view of Buda and Pest from there.

Beautiful even in sub-zero temperatures!. A major tourist attraction, the castle is situated on top of a hill, providing a panoramic view of the Hungarian Parliament on the opposite banks of the Danube River. Give yourself at least two hours to explore the Castle complex and take all those wonderful selfies and panoramic shots of the spectacular views including the Szechenyi Chain Bridge – one the few bridges that connects the two halves of the city. And depending on how ambitious you might feel on the day, you can walk to the next hill and explore the Fisherman’s Bastion & St Matthias Church or make your way down and visit the Calvinist Church. You can pack a lot in one day with many of these sites being within close proximity of each other. I was surprised at the number of the tourists who had braved the -6 centigrade temperatures to visit the castle.

Very nice! And very beautiful on a sunny day!. We spent around two hours here. Didn't see everything but found this place really interesting and beautiful. A must-place-to-see if you asked me. However, the only negative feedback i'd give is that the only place we found rest rooms was in the "main building" (?). There were so many tourists there and so few restrooms. Otherwise very beautiful place :).
If you like artitecture, this is a great place to see. We didn't go in as we were short on time, but just roaming the grounds was very impressive. We saved time by taking the tram up the hill!
Impressive castle. Impressive. Just sit and walk. Look at the building, the walls, the statues, the city skyline... and relax

Very Beautiful, Closes Early. We could not enter the Castle because although the closing time is 4:00 PM they would not sell us tickets at 3:30. But the grounds are worth the visit, they are lovely and grand and definitely a beautiful stroll to admire the architecture, fountains and statues.

You'll love this in-depth museum. Budapest has a rich past, and a somewhat tragic history. This wonderful museum encapsulates this and presents it in a very accessible way for the tourist. If you want to try and understand modern day Hungary I would say that this museum should be added to your Must See list.
Museums. If you are a museum lover that is a place well-worth a visit. At least 3 museums enclosed in very close proximity.

Great Place. Use the funicular to go up or just walk or take the bus, is a stunning structure with an interesting Museum inside (the outside is free and for the museum you need to pay, but is very nice to see the Baroque and Gothic construction and also the King Throne)After you saw it all, just take a walk to the Fisherman Bastion or take the bus 16.
Amazing views and history. Perfect views of history, use the hop on hop off bus or cruise and learn the history of all the places. So easy to get around

Excellent!. Magnificent castle in the Buda side. Accesible via funicular after the Chain bridge (or climbing around 190 steps) or via the red metro line and bus. Excellent view of the river and the bridges. Many important museums there. Fire up the camera!
Another great thing on the hill. Is is another thing that is located on the hill by the city from which you can have a great vies on the city

Looks great even at a distance. We wanted to see the castle as we can see it from the hotel bedroom window. We went up on the hop on off bus but it was new years day and the actual rooms were not open. Despite the snow flurries it is a very impressive building.

Extrordinary . The place is really big ,to take a walk around it it wouls take 40min. Because its really big. It has a lot of monmuments to watch over,and if the sky is clear you can watch all the city ..

Beautiful!. Well worth seeing this lovely building and the guards who have to stand at attention for a full hour before being afforded a short break! Unfortunately it was very misty on the day we visited so we didn't get to enjoy the lovely view.

great. i just walked by, during the walking tour and was lucky enough to see the change of guard! they have a whole routine that lasts about 6 minutes where they do a choreography with the riffles . a must see :)

Exceptional architecture. Cross the Danube via Chain Bridge and head up walking to Buda Castle for one amazing journey. Upon completing this feat, Buda Castle will shock an awe the onlooker as one great structure! Don't miss out on the four colossal lions adorning the entrance to the inner palace square!
