Hungarian history in brief. Excellent museum on history of Hungary. Planned to visit for two hours, took four. Bus number 16 from Deak Ference Ter or try the Budapest Castle Hill Funicular (Budavári Sikló)
Highlight on the Buda side. The caste on the outside is very nice. The museum inside is quite extensive and worth a visit. Could take several hours if you want to see it all
Best attraction of Budapest . I really recommend to visit the castle and the art exhibition inside! The view is stunning. I think that is the best attraction of Budapest

A must!. If you have a day to spend in Budapest, this old caste is a must-see attraction. Use the funicular to go on top then enjoy the castle, the history museum, the church and the view! That's the best place to see the Chain bridge and the Parliament building.

Buda Castle Ok but not more. The most great with the castle is the stunning view. The overview of the Danube and the Pest side is really great. Inside the castle I find the museums pretty boring and they are not really worth a visit unless you have the Budapest card or have vey narrow specific interests.
Beautiful. Really nice building and interesting story surrounding the castle ... Amazing views over the area looking out to Budapest itself

Beautiful building and views. The buildings and views Castle are outstanding, however the building is in need of some tlc.
It is such a grand building and has amazing views, even when the city is covered in a layer of fog.
This is well worth a visit and the trip here either walking or via funicular is a must!

Great view of the city, easy walk up.. The view of the city is great and there is a lot to do up on the hill (such as fishermens bastion). It's worth going to twice; once in the day and once at night. We debated using the tram, but decided to save money and walk, and I'm glad we did. Not only are there elevators a couple minutes away from the tram, but the walk is quick and easy.
A Budapest must-see. Great architecture in this art museum that offers great background on Budapest. Located on a cute part of town with great views. Takes a little time to climb up or via bus.
Nice area to walk around. The area is beautiful and a nice place to just walk around and enjoy the architecture and the views. We did not go inside the museum.

Beautiful building in a good area for exploring. The Buda Castle is one of the iconic Budapest buildings and a must see. Not only is is great to see at a distance but getting up close and exploring the surrounding area is a great deal of fun. I highly recommend it!
Buda Castle. It's gorgeous. The impressive buildings with the spacious squares and the breathtaking view offer a really romantic atmosphere.
Nice view. i didn't take the carriage but just walked. 'the view was nice and you can see most of Pest from there. Nice place to start the trip with. Didn't go into the gallery tho/.

Such a nice walk!. Buda Castle was the very first place we visited on reaching Budapest. Needless to say, it was the perfect beginning to this lovely city. Though our stay was too short (4 days) to really get to know the city very well. The Buda Castle, was enchanting. The architecture is really stunning.
Amazing views!. Interesting architecture and a lovely environment. Amazing views out over the river and onto the Pest side. Definitely worth a visit. (August 2014)

Lovely Castle. This is another building well worth a visit. You can see it the same time you visit the Fisherman's Basillica. It's a long climb, but you can take the finicular right up there and see the amazing views. I did not go inside the castle, but I believe you can.

Beautiful castle and amazing views. We decided we would walk up to the castle and it was so worth the effort. The baroque castle is beautiful and the views are quite spectacular. Walk around, take in the aura of this place and imagine life as it was here. We did not go inside so am only commenting on the outside.The lovely part was we saw this up close during the day and then we saw it from a night time river cruise all lit up. Really quite and experience.
Ancient Palace. It is a huge Palace with lots of amazing statues, which could tell hundreds of years` history of Budapest. Lovely city, lovely castle

It makes the view of Castle Hill Magical, up close...well.... Buda Castle is a fixture on the Castle Hill. The size and grandeur, especially when lit up at night, are unforgettable. It is definitely worth a visit when in Budapest. Just be prepared for a slightly different reaction when you get up close...this is a post WWII re-build, and it lacks soul. Still, it is awesome from afar, and it will always remain a wonderful memory after your visit to Budapest.
Fair. It is a nice place with a nice view from the city. The only point it that the castle is a kind of art museum so there is no original castle furniture to see.

Very nice but I prefer the fishermans bastion. Very nice place to visit and walk around, the view is beautiful, we enjoyed the walk there very much, we came in a cold day so we used the funicular, a little bit expensive but worth it if it's cold.
Lovely old sight. A lovely sight within a lovely city. The building is in the Castle district and is quite hilly. Worth visiting. Also on the tourist hop on hop off bus route
Lots to see. The 200 room palace and grounds with lovely statues require time to admire. Amazing during the day and extremely beautiful while lit up at night, it is a must see.

Beautiful really famous statues, big art museum, and even changing of guard. Came here on the day the art museum was closed, I believe it was an odd day, (Monday perhaps?) So highly recommend you check when they open if the primary reason going to Buda Castle is for the gigantic art museum. People here outside (locals) were nice to us tourists when we asked questions in english.Good thing about coming here on the wrong day (early ish, 10 in the morning) was that none of the other tourist groups were there yet so perfect time to take solo pics with the Matthias fountain (majestic and so antique), the courtyard lion statues two of them roaring two of them not roaring (there's a backstory to that I believe), the terrified horse statue (sorry, it has a real name, just can't recall)...etc Just loads of history. Don't miss the giant bird statue (it's on the cliff side, hard to get a good angle) if you look closely it looks a bit like a vulture. Apparently it's a "Turul" or some mythical bird of death in Hungarian culture. Very cool.Also, most museums in budapest charge you extra for a photo permit, to allow you to take pics inside. Some of the folks inside can be very nasty about it. (Not saying it's this one obviously since I went there when they weren't open) but basically each time you walk into a room holding a camera/smartphone they'll ask for the permit. And even when you have the permit, if they don't see if on you they will walk in front of you right when you're taking a picture and try to snatch your phone away. Some museums were more chill about it. Just a warning..

Beautiful architecture. I like this building, beautiful architecture. Near large buildings you feel yourself a very small man. It's worth to walk around. It is a pity that today people do not build so beautifully and we are surrounded only by the rectangular giants called houses.

Good for views but not much else. The castle is beautiful and so are its views. Very accessible with escalators and lifts. Beware that the toilets cost money and only take 50ft or higher (it caught me out). However, there were no maps that made much sense and it was all quite difficult to walk around.

Stunning but somewhat underwhelming. Firstly let me start by saying the castle itself is spectacular and is a place anyone visiting Budapest should visit. My only problem was that we visited the museum in the castle which was not the most interesting museum we visited during the week. By no means bad but seemed very dry for want of a better word. There is also the national gallery and library in the castle for those interested in those areas.
Royal palace. Steeped in history , beautiful gardens and statues fountains again history if castle was very interesting
Beautiful views & surroundings. Well worth walking up to the Castle, just to experience the old cobbled streets & wonderful architecture. Fabulous views over the city.
impressive. Impressive in it location and size. Nice informative museum but would have liked to have seen more of the accommodation.
Pay a visit here. This was a good experience, lots to see and museum very interesting. Very photogenic! Once again we did not allow enough time to see much. Went up in the furnicular

A modern castle but with lots of history related to the site. An intersting history for this castle site which has gone through many destructions.The artifacts inside are a little limited but still worth a visit on a rainy day

Not to be missed!. Get there easily by Hop on Hop off bus. Buda Castle sits at a height where you can stroll to take in amazing views of the sorrounding city as well as the beautiful architecture. Great spot for getting the camera out.

Beautiful example of Central European architecture. If you are in Budapest you can't miss this. Such an amazing experience. Architecture stunning, and make sure you visit the National Gallery as it will not disappoint you. Some amazing art works there. You could spend hours in there. Make sure you get an audio guide as well. They usually ask you for an ID of some sort when getting it. We had none as everything was in the hotel safe, but our hotel key was enough. If you really don't have anything they will ask you to fill in a little form before handing you your audio guide. Staff are very helpful. Also, the views you get from this location are amazing. You can see the entire Pest, so if you want to get some amazing photographs this is the place.
Worth a walk around. Lovely castle on the hill so great views of the Pest side of the city. amazing place, well worth taking a bit of time to explore and have a walk around.

From the outside it was very imposing. The castle holds a commanding view over the Danube from the Buda side and can be seen from any site along the great river. It is on the route of most of the city bus tours, as is the Citadel

Grand building housing comprehensive museum of Budapest. You can take the funicular up to the top of the hill though it's an underwhelming way to access what turns into a fantastic view over the Danube and Pest. The Castle District houses the national art gallery which is really worth a visit. You can also see the official residence of the president (from the outside, not open to the public) and walk around the battlements and admire the view. We paid to enter the castle museum in the basement which began as an interesting exploration of the cellars and archaeological finds from the area and ascended through grand staircases at the centre of the castle to find several more floors giving a detailed history of the building and the life of Budapest. The central floor houses a beautiful atrium and there was a fantastic exhibition on St. Matthias' church. On the top floor exhibits track the political and social life of the city through out the twentieth century. All interesting stuff.There is also a quirky cafe selling canned beer and filled rolls

Stunning. There is not a lot I can add to the reviews.This is a stunning place with fantastic views across to Pest, a must visit on your trip, allow a good half a day to visit this area as plenty to see and places to eat, walking boots advisable.

Its on anyone's list. See it. Enjoy the history and the architecture that reflects the culture of Budapest so very, very well. The nearby associated church and battlements give a real feel for another era and a proud civilization.

Museum disappointing but castle amazing. After you visit other castles in Europe and you see how perfectly maintained they are from the inside you would expect to see sooo much in this castle as it is magnificent from the outside.. Sadly, everything in the castle is lost and the museum doesn't have much to see except for the full history of Budapest which was extremely well traced!

Well worth a visit. Lots to see and do at this attraction and the views are spectacular. Also as you walk around the architecture is beautiful. nice little shops and cafes too. Don't miss out on a trip.
Just lovely. This is very grand and imposing, beautifully kept building and lots to see, we managed to do archery in the gardens and walk round the lovely grounds

Not Just a Castle but a Museum and Gallery. Whilst doing the Buda Hill precinct not only is the Castle outstanding from its exterior it also houses a museum and a gallery. A wander through the museum which has a very modest entry fee is well worth the time.

Buda looking over Pest. You can't not go up here. We went up on hop on hop off bus, but you can walk, take the funicular railway. Views from top over pest are amazing. But then so is the castle complex. Did not go in however. Lots of people all just hanging about enjoying themselves.

castle. How I love Budapest!
This is the second time my husband and I have been here and the Buda side is my favourite and the castle is very beautiful a must do when you are staying in Budapest!
The Buda Castle. Fantastic history was unravelled in front of our eyes. Well maintained. The souvenier shops were excellent
Must see. Quite simply, you can't come to Budapest without spending some time up at the castle. Even if you don't go in (which most don't), the views are great.

SPECTACULAR STRUCTURE !!!. Buda Castle is so gorgeous, particularly at night when all lit up! A wonderful view of the castle is from Pest, across the Danube. This Baroque castle's oldest part of the present day palace was constructed in the 1410s, We visited Castle Hill on a day when Buda Castle was closed so I can't comment on its interior. We did, however, see a changing of the guard and we were able to walk around the compound enjoying the fountains, statues, courtyard and the beauty of the castle's architecture. Be sure to take your camera as you'll see beautiful panaramic views of Pest from this vantage point. The castle houses the Hungarian National Gallery, Hungarian Museum and Hungarian Library. There is a funicular that connects Castle Hill with the Chain Bridge.
Amazing. The walk up the hill was strenuous, but beautiful. There was a lot to see and there were activities, such as archery and spear throwing. It is a must see.
Outstanding architecture. Spend some time up here, on the Buda side, also excellent views back into Pest. Make sure if your visiting during the colder months you have plenty of layers on....

Interesting and pitoresque. The palace is grand and dominates the Budapest skyline. Getting up is easy, just walk across the Chain Bridge and either take the furnicular or walk a short distance up the hill. The furnicular is an interesting contraption, but the ride is short and the queue can be long. The Castle itself gives fantastic views of Budapest and it is nice to walk about the courtyard and drink forralt bor, the local version of glühwein. At the far end are the medieval remains, and these bring you back to an age with princesses and dragons and are a good way to start in the museum. Pay the 2000 HUF admission ticket and work your way up. To see it all you will need a couple of hours. Many interesting things to see, but sadly not all the plaques and descriptions are translated into English.
Interesting building. We spend more than our going around the building. We did not like that condition of the building is not perfect, some place should be repaired.

A must when in Budapest . The castle was located a couple of minutes from our hotel.Great place to visit, plenty of restaurants ,museums and interesting things to walk round and see.It is vast and worth a full days visit.My favourite was the changing of the guard and well worth waiting for.
Gorgeous. I did not go in the building. I stayed next to the gorgeous facility and we did enjoy the great feast of the lit building at night.

this is a liitle village. this is a charming little self contained village. try to catch the changing of the guard. do go and have a drink and cake in the cafe above the little supermarket (go into the supermarket and the stairs are at the rear of the shop)

Buda Castle a good day trip. We spent about 4 hours at Buda Castle which was a educational and positive tourist experience. Great opportunity to see what life was like living in a Castle. Buying the correct ticket was a little confusing but we were successful. Traveled by local tram to get there and enjoyed that experience as well. a Fun Day.

Magnificent!. The castle is huge - be prepared to walk a bit. I like the upper terrace because you can see the Parliament building and the Danube river.
There were two entry - from the river side and at the back of the castle. I took the back door because there was aerial show and the front road was closed.

Lovely building with multiple museums. We were there on the Remembrance day which mean the museums were open for free to all. The castle is impressive and there is a lot to see and walk around on the outside. It holds several museums including the history museum which is well worth a visit. It covers multiple levels and areas and has something for everyone. I particularly liked the lower levels with the oldest, medieval finds.

So much to see. With so many incredible buildings housed within the castle grounds this is a must do whilst visiting Budapest, Starting at either side!The funicular will take you up and down, being able to visit the castle, the original castle walls, the art gallery within the castle grounds, Mathias church and the Fishermans Bastion you would be a fool to miss this side of Budapest.
Marvel Architecture. It is a gist of architecture. Extremely beautiful at night. Happily roam around galleries and museums here and appreciate live music on the street.

Well worth a visit. We visited the castle history museum and found it very interesting although hard to navigate, it doesn't flow well but it is worth going into all the side areas because they often contained really interesting artefacts.

Worth a visit if you are in the area. I came here just after a visit to the parliament house, it's a short walk of around 30 minutes from the parliament building via the bridge to the top and it's well worth it. The view from the top is amazing and great for photo taking if visibility is good.
A treat for photographers. I wasn't able to visit inside but the outside architecture is beautiful enough to admire and photograph.
So cool. I love living Europe for the very reason that these places exist. Beautiful building and architecture in a really cool city.

Gorgeous Castle. Visited Budapest a few years ago. Buda Castle is a beautiful castle and a must see when visiting Budapest. You can take the funicular up to the castle, small fee. Lovely views over looking the River Danube and the Parliament Buildings. Lots of ground to cover so enjoy;-)

Worth getting there... eventually. This may sound like a very dumb review given that, every time I've been to Budapest, me and my friends have failed to make it to Buda Castle before closing time. And yet, maybe because of that, we have very personal and fond memories. We've had the still open outer grounds all to ourselves.This place is absolutely stunning at night by lamplight. You can roam around and take hopefully very good photos (if your camera and freezing hands allow), or run into an arts and crafts fair where you can taste the best potatoes with paprika you will ever find. You can also see Pest from the top of Buda hill and beautiful Széchenyi Chain Bridge (which, at night, looks like an elongated Christmas tree).

Sheer architectural Magnificence. an imposing structure from the outside and am sure equally awe inspiring from the inside. Consists of multiple galleries and museums and a cute funicular cable car system that takes one up from the road below to the castle. One sore point was that there are multiple areas around the castle that are being being strengthened or re-constructed due to wear and tear, without proper notice boards and signages that led to our getting nearly lost and having to retrace our step. The view from the top of the ramparts is AMAZING to say the least.

I was try to find the castle but is an art museam. I do not know what ia going on with budapest.buda castle i was thought that you can visit inside but they have seperate in 3 different museams with paintingJust go for a lwak ans take photos of course is veryyy nice
Walking in the "History". Great and beautiful buildings, where you can still feel the spirit of the History. It has a fantastic view to the Pest side of the city.

A temporary exhibition near Nat. Gallery. The long-forgotten, ruined building near the presidential palace and the national gallery has now been pressed into service: it hosts a temporary exhibition of the great Hungarian painter Tivadar Csontvary-Kosztka. Csontvary was active in the early 20th century, and painted several huge canvasses in a pseudo-naive style and using extremely bold colours - somewhere between the post-impressionists and the Fauves. The building is obviously not an exhibition hall, the connecting corridors are positively claustrophobic, and many rooms are too small for the paintings that are on display, but most of them can breath. An artist of cult status in Hungary, virtually unknown abroad - it is well worth visiting this comprehensive exhibition of his works, collected from several museums and private collections. As often is the case, the explanations have numerous statements that are testament to the hubris of the curators, nothing else. The show is on until the end of December, so hurry.

Not your typical castle.. This is really a complex of buildings rather than aa King Arthur's castle. It is fascinating, though. The Palace was closed the day we were there, but the two churches are huge contrasts in architecture and decoration and give you a lot to look at.

One of the best city views in Europe. The castle and palace are vast so I have posed some pictures serve as a description. The climb to the top could be challenging if you are not fit, but you can take the Funicular Car or the small bus. At the very top is a fairy tail castle tower with a cafe within allowing you to view the Danube and Budapest, worth the climb just for the view. The old town beyond this is part of the stunning UNESCO world heritage site that is a subject in it's own right. Spend a whole day up here.

Pity about the windows!. A magnificent baroque palace, dominating the Danube crossing. This is very well worth a visit, and there is not space here to describe it. What a shame the former communist government replaced so many original windows with anodised aluminium double-glazing
Castle Visit. There is so much to see with the museums, galleries, church, castle and shops you can easily spend the whole day there. You might even have to go back again as there is a lot to see

Stunning Castle. The castle is simply stunning and breathtaking. It is so majestic and enthralling. The architecture is gob smacking. Buda Castle is at the right side of Castle Hill. When I visited Castle Hill the first time, I missed Buda Castle as I was too enthralled by the views from Castle Hill. The good thing about Buda Castle is that there is no admission fee to walk around the compound. If possible, come visit Buda Castle and Castle Hill in the night (it is not closed) when the whole place is lighted up. The whole area looked golden and the view across the Danube is surreal (read my posting on Buda Hill). Not to be missed if you are in Budapest.
Lovely day to visit. great castle on the exterior but disappointed with interior which does not retain much of its original features. Basically converted into a national art gallery.

Lovely building well worth a visit. The statues and architecture are stunning. Visited the museum inside which stretched over 3 floors and was very interesting and informative. Admission to the castle grounds is free but there is an admission charge for the museum.

Buda Castle. There is a funicular at the bottom of Castle hill that carts tourists to Buda castle which is built on the Southern tip of Castle hill.Buda castle was first completed in 1265 and over the Centuries was sacked, destroyed and rebuilt a few times.Its last total destruction was during World War II when on 16th October 1944 a German Commando unit led by the famed Otto Skorzeny of "Benito.Mussolini Escape " fame occupied the Royal Palace and forced the regent to abdicate.During the siege of Budapest by the advancing Soviet Union between 29th December 1944 and 13th February 1945 the "Axis Powers" were routed and Buda castle totally destroyed..After the war the castle was excavated from its ruins and after thorough palace research and archaeological excavations.partly rebuilt over the following years with final completion in 1966.Today the Buda castle building complex has been converted into a museum consisting of 1) Budapest history museum 2) Hungarian National gallery and 3) National Szechenyi library which is the National library of Hungary

Breathtaking Views, the Best in Budapest. We took the Siklo (funicular) railway, built in 1870, up to the castle. This provides the best view on the way up (since you can not walk down the same route). From the top, at the Castle, you can enjoy amazing views of the River Danube, The Parliament, and the Chain Bridge below. The Royal Palace complex has been heavily restored and rebuilt six times over the past 7 centuries. It sustained a lot of damage during WWII, which has still not been completely restored. You can visit the museums--National Gallery and Budapest History Museum (with a pass or entrance fee), the National Library, the National Theater, and an abundance of statues and monuments.

the best place to see all the great Hungarian painters. since the museum of fine arts at Hero Square is closed for 2 years for renovation they put a small number of items here from there but otherwise it's 2-3 floor of Hungarian arts,included the most famous Hungarian painters and most of their works,not crowded either which is a bonus after being in the Prado or at the Uffizi

Beautiful venue in a beautiful city. Worth the trip by bus or tram to the top of the hill on the Buda side of the Danube. If you get to the castle, you also have easy access to the art museum located there as well as the Fisherman's Bastion and the Matthias Church-all with unbelievable views of the Pest side of the Danube.

Only the outside remains intact.. From the river the castle is very impressive. Outside at street level you realize it has been damaged and partially restored. WWII was not good for the castle. All its stained glass windows were destroyed along with much of the roof and all of the grand salons as well as most of the interior. As such the tour did not include the inside. From the photos it did not seem there was not much but paneling covering the interior walls. However the views of Budapest along with the history of the castle( provided by the tour guide) made the visit worthwhile.

Interesting. The castle is now an Art Museum (entrance fee). We walked the exterior and took some amazing photos of the Pest side. The Castle Hill District is a fun area to explore. We took a walking tour through the Big Bus. Lots of interesting sites. It is not an easy walk due to the hills and cobblestones but well worth the effort.
A Must See. On the Buda side of the city, a healthy but easy walking assent that is rewarded with Magnificent virpews of the Danube, bridges and Pest side of city.

Majestic castle of the mighty Magyars. Once the seat of Hungarian kings ruling central and eastern Europe, the castle sits on top of a hill on Buda side of Budapest. It overlooks river Danube and Pest side. It looks impressive from any of the beautiful bridges of the metropolis but once you arrive under its walls, you start to comprehend its size. The walls are huge and tall, massive and strong. Walk around the building, walk in and out of its outer arches and plazas. It is a huge maze of buildings and side buildings, gates and roads. Impressive! Inside is even more impressive, the staircases, ceilings, gates and doors, etc. Amazing! It hosts exhibitions and museums, so to see everything, set aside many hours. Also, the castle offers magical views of the Hungarian imperial metropolis!

Extremely beautiful . It is good to walk up the castle hill instead of taking the expensive funicular. It is not a long walk and you can enjoy the scenery along the way. Alternatively, there is free escalator on the left hand side of the castle.
What a view. You look across the Danube from the hillside top and can see all of Pest. Sign up for the tour it is worth the walk.

Great castle. Visited as a part of city tour. Although did not get time to go inside but the outside beauty is amazing. The views of pest side are great. This side of town is only for sightseeing and this castle figures on top of that list.

Portaits on holiday. There were very long queues at the entrance with some desks unmanned. It took a long time to get in and some of the staff were not well informed about the gallery. The most famous picture - Lady with Birdcage - was on holiday in Milan..so disappointed. Café quite good!

Buda hill. Visited on a river cruise. First had coach tour of Pest side of river then short stay on the Buda Hill. Not much time to have good look but we mainly used this as fact finding. We have wanted to have something like a 4 day visit for a long time but could not work out which side of river to get hotel. This is now resolved. Best hotels on Pest side and Buda side is for site seeing only. There is a large church on the Buda Hill that looks very good from outside so will have to go back to see the inside.
Don't miss the excavated portion. The most interesting part were the lower levels that were the excavated portions of the original castle.

Breath taking spot. A very beautiful place, the buildings are really nice and the best views of the Pest side and the Danube river, see it at night and its really enchanting. Be prepared to walk alot on cobbles and uneven brick floors ! well worth the walk !
Buda Castle. A must see place of Budapest. You may take public transport to reach at the foothill and then the furnicular, or climb the stairs to the top. Great view of the entire pest region.

Big Palace. I was slightly disappointed after going to see this, I thought there would be a lot more to see. There is just the museum and national gallery. It's interesting to go see it, but I though there would be a bit more than walking around the grounds. Don't get my wrong it was stunning at night and well worth the river cruise to see this. There are a lot of tourist attractions around and nice places to eat a small bite.
Very good indeed. This is one of the places you should not miss out on when in Budapest, by all means a must do. Well worth it and preferably have your walking shoes on and enjoy. Highly recommended.
Impressive !!. We had a long walk up but that was by choice you don't need to but well worth the effort large and impressive building.
Elegant. Located with many other high tourist points the Castle is perfectly placed. Worth making a day of it.
A must. Great restoration work, bringing back to view from rubble the medieval castle, nice exhibitions, unique views over the city.

Too much to see. We spent most of a morning both around and in the Castle. The castle is now a Hungarian Art Museum. My wife and I were pleasantly surprised at the quality and accessibility of the museum and its art and we both suggest a full day to see all of the works.

Great walk in a beautiful area.. Buda Castle/Palace is the dominant monument in Budapest. It is a beautiful area for a walk and is easily accessible by the very good public transport system in Budapest. One can also view the palace from the Pest side - best at sunset from the banks of the Danube.

Good views, but traditional Palace/Castle. Really lovely views (especially at dusk!) but it's not a traditional palace or castle with state rooms etc. There are grounds, National Museums & facilities but no actual 'palace' rooms. We had a great time, you just have to adjust your expectations.

Make sure to make time for this on your visit.. We unfortunately only had a couple of hours to spend at this amazing exhibit. You will have the opportunity to see not only history of the monarchy but you will also see lots of information about the history of Budapest. This was an extremely informative And interactive exhibit. Like many other things this attraction gave not only insight into the cultures and the people who live in this area but also the political history that makes this such a unique and complex society. Make sure to take time and see not only the exhibit floors but also the basement where you were actually in the foundations of the castle itself. Just amazing and well worth a very modest fee to get in.

Very nice and huge complex on the cliff overlooking the Danube on the Buda side. Awsome. This huge complex requires many hours to be visited. Beautiful monuments outside (Mathias Fountain, Eugene de Savoy, Mythical Bird..). Better take more time to visit.

Amazing view. I love this castle. The building very beautiful. and the view amazing. We saw changing guard when were there. and also TV cameramen was the to take photo someone important person come from America.
Go inside!!. So worth it!! You can walk through there for days there's so much to see!! Totally worth the price of admission!!
Great view. If you are in Budapest go and visit the Buda Castle. The view of the city Buda and also of the Danube river it is amazing. So dont miss it.

A very calm, serene, and beautiful place. The view of the city from the palace yard is absolutely wonderful, the lights go off after a certain time in the evening, so make sure to check the timing before you get there.
Buda castle. First place on our trip we visited. The castle, grounds and surrounding area are lovely. The views are probably the best part.
Beautiful. Beautiful place but check before you visit as it closes every other Monday, which we only found out when there in the rain
An amazing castle.. The Hungarian Monarchy lived here in a beautiful castle with an amazing view of the city. The castle is very big and great to see.

Excellent Views. Use the funnicular to reach the Castle. Its not very high but makes a great change from hiking up. Once at the top of the Castle, the views are breath taking. And lots of statues from the past empires. The falcon which was the Maygars emblem was also interesting. One cannot enter the castle but it really was not necessary. There were 2 guards at one entrance but am not sure what entrance they were guarding.
very historic. Very interesting attraction, very historic. If you can take a tour to really understand its significance. There are lots of interesting stories and facts.
AMAZING CASTLE. An amazing castle on a hillock which has been partially converted into an art gallery. Picture perfect location on the Buda side. Truly worth visiting.
A Landmark on the Buda Side. This majestic building anchors the Buda side of the city and is very historic. Makes sure you take a tour to really understand its significance.

Intriguing . Very interesting attraction. There are lots of interesting stories and facts about the building and its many inhabitants over thr centuries. Well worth a visit and is near several other attractions in and around Buda.
Hungarian Art Gallery. Like all art galleries this one was well laid out. Huge rooms, lots of people 'guarding' the exhibits. Largely Hungarian artists but at least one Monet.
It's a castle. What can I say. It is opulent, very 17th century, and grand. We were on a Viking tour, had an excellent guide, and learned a lot about Hungarian history. Very medieval.

Lovely Views. Great castle with amazing views over the Danube and over all of Budapest.
There's an escalator that will take you up if you don't want to pay for the funicular railway - but that seems to be a little secret!
A must see. This is a wonderful architectural landmark on the Buda side of the Danube. The contents were just OK but the views across the river of Pest are a must.
Feast your eyes. A 13th century marvle and former Royal palace in the hills by the people of Buda. It is neo baroque. Clearly seen everywhere with that green dome. Near or far it is wonderful.
Nice views of the city. I didn't visit any museums here but the area has nice views of the city and it was a pleasant stroll up there. Go on a sunny day.
Great views from the terrace. Enjoyed great views over the city from up here on the terrace. The Art Gallery has some interesting exhibits and quite a good gift shop.

Worth the walk. Buda castle is an lovely place to walk around, a beautiful part of the city not to be missed, we walked up from the bridge but they do have a cable car which had quite a long queue but could also have been another part of the experience of Budapest.

Wonderfull. I'm from Lisbon, Portugal. Travelled with a group of 50 people.
Never thought that this city would be so wonderfull. Loved it!

Best seen from a distance. Buda Castle is not attractive to those of us who love seeing how the royals lived. The Hapsburg family never lived here (and I'm told only visiting a few times). However, it does contain an excellent art museum which is worth a visit. We saw a Chagall exhibit that was astounding. But as a castle, it is best viewed from across the river where its setting on top of a hill is picturesque.

Spectacular.. This amazing palace complex has amazing architecture and is a feast for the eyes.Unfortunately, there a very few descriptions, panels or information on what you are looking at, which makes it less enjoyable...so either hire a guide, or (unlike me) come prepared with a guidebook.

Beautiful but.... As you would expect from a great city with an amazing history, this is a beautiful building. But really just from the outside. For us, it seemed to lack something. The views are fantastic. The place is worth a look but we never felt a "wow" moment.

A must see!. Buda castle is amazing! A must see! Beautiful view of the Parliament, Chain Bridge and all of city along the Danube. The castle houses a large gallery of paintings from Medieval to modern day in a massive beautiful building. We made lot of great photos! Easy to get there.

for art lovers, a great collection of hungaran paintings. Apart from the stunning view over the Danube and Budapest, you will be able to admire a complete collection of hungarian paintings, retracing the artistic history of the country.

Architectural Beauty Great for Photographers. Being a Photographer hobbyist, visiting such beauty made me feel overwhelmed at what and how to best capture such architectural beauty. even on a bad dull and cloudy day I managed to take some good Photos. Even though this castle didn't feel like a typical castle. However the views are spectacular.

Grand palace on the top of the hill. This palace is grand and beautiful to look from the outside. The way to this palace can be reached by funicular or by bus. The view at night is more amazing when the whole building is luminous.

Ok but the Fisherman's Bastion was better. We went on a Monday and the funicular was closed. There was a street on the left of the funicular office box to walk up which took us up one side of Castle Hill (we came down the stairs located (on the right of the tunnel). It was an easy walk up and took about 10 minutes even with us stopping to take pictures and look at things along the way. The castle was pretty but some of the statues were a bit odd (a turkey vulture in front, a hunting scene in back). The iron gate in back had a raven. It appears they were a bit eccentric.After walking through the castle, we followed signs to the Fisherman's Bastion. You walk through a cute little street which has cafes and stores. You also pass Matthias Church because it is next to it.

Spectacular!. This castle is simply spectacular. I particularly enjoyed the fact that this attraction doesn't close down at sunset. I arrived late but was able to roam around the grounds for hours in the dark. The place is well lit and the shadows created from the lighting really accentuates the architecture. I wasn't able to enter the interior (this part closes after dark), but just the exterior is fantastic. It appear to the a great place for couples to tuck away with a bottle of wine and enjoy the grounds. I highly recommend visiting this attraction. Arrive earlier to enjoy the interior.

Relaxing. We didn’t get to see this on our organised tour, so went back under our own steam. We didn’t enter the building and its museums. We loved the views from the terrace around the building, enjoyed the changing of the guard and the informality of the guards once the officer had left the area!! And the gardens at the base of the hill next to the river. Altogether relaxing.
Interesting. It is huge and take a good walk up there, but for those whom likes Museums, well worth, so just get on feet and get there!

Beautiful . The castle is very beautiful, you can walk up the hill by foot or take an Funicular. The view from there is beautiful and the garden is pretty, there are a lot of restaurants and shops up there

Strange experience.. It is just one big museum, if you like museums. I don't mean to b a pain but this one of those buildings that looks better on the outside! To see inside you must pay money to visit the various museums. I have to say wonderful views but not my best experience of Budapest.

Difficult to fond your way around this area and we found a lot closed. Beautiful and expansive from the Pest side but when you get over here--go on the funicular--it is hard even with a guidebook to fin entrances and much of it seemed closed. We did particularly appreciate the St. Matthias church and th terrace coffee after getting off funicular.

Castle with museums. Now, I did not visit the museums myself, but I did walk all the way around the castle on the outside, which is also a very good idea. It is easy to forget I think, the rear side was very quiet with few people, but it is worth looking at the whole area rather than only going inside.

Huge Royal Palace high on the Hill.. Walk up from the river side through the gardens and using the lift system, funicular railway or take a tour bus up to the Buda Castle. The gardens are lovely and free, it's a huge building you can wander right around the outside, look over the battlements, over the river and across to Pest. Numerous coffee shops and stalls, the presidential residence and various statues and monuments. It is beautiful.
Walk up to the castle. You can either take the funicular up or walk. The line was too long so I walked. And I was glad I did.
Fantastic. It's a place that you must go, but reserve a time to visit, at least 3 hours. The view of the city and the Danubio is fantastic.

Beautiful Gardens, Interesting Art Museum. We spent time going through the Art Museum which was very informative. Also the gardens are nice to walk through, and of course being on the Buda side you have wonderful views of the Pest side across the Danube.
Breathtaking view . As a solo traveler. I recommend to take bus or tram to Dózsa György ter and take elevator up there. Elevator costs only 200 HUF. Funnicular may not worth it.

Bit disappointed. Grounds amazing, old town great, views fantastic, but castle not what we expected. Lovely to walk around, although food overpriced because it's so tourist-y. Castle itself is now a museum/art gallery and costs to get in. We were expecting a traditional castle exhibition so this was quite disappointing.
Hospital in the Rock brilliant - go.
Amazing. The local is amazing, with a beautiful view of the city and the river. Love that place. The city around the castle still a medieval buildings. It's really really amazing.

Lots of Ingress portals :D. Desidet to visit there while walking nearby. Nice place and quite lot to see and the museum of Hungary was nice. Spend three hours without even noticing the time. Dont miss it if you are near!

Palce Complex of Hungarian Kings. Buda Castle is the historical castle and palace complex of the Hungarian kings in Budapest, it is a gigantic Castle with great views from the top of this hill overlooking the Danube River. Castle is well appointed and takes a couple of hours to see. I highly recommend this place because of it's museums and location:)

Outstanding1. We were lucky enough to be here when they were hosting a food and wine festival. It was crowded but we had a great time. The grounds of the castle are superb and the views are breathtaking. It has to be on your to do list when in Budapest. Just lovely and I would highly recommend.

Execceded expectations and well worth a look. As a keen traveller, it's not every day you stumble across something you'd not heard of before and which exceeds your expectations. The Labyrinth of Buda Castle is one such.It won't change your life, but it's worth the money and worth spending an hour. Be sure to go through the totally black area, and be sure to remind yourself Dracula was a real person and he was locked down here for 10 years. Vibes aplenty.
Nice palace. Very nice to see bit we didn't go inside.The surroundings are impressive and so are the views..They do sell coffee at little shops around the palace.Also a few museums are there.
Amazing Castle! . Use the to go to the castle! I recommend to visit it during both day and night! The view of the city from Buda castle is simply breathtaking !!

amazing. i love this place. huge and gigantic. the view is stunning from here. it looks stunning at night from the river. u may spend hours here. have a lot of things to see near these. must try it once u r in Budapest.
Buda Castle. We went to Palinka Sausage Festival at Buda Castle, it is a beautiful building and the surrounding grounds, a fair walk uphill though, or you can get the uphill tram.

Do it on a nice day for the views. Not a traditional castle but there is lots to see and do here. The old town is a must to wander around and the views from here across the Danube are stunning. Take the lift from the bottom of the esplanade and then the escalator and then its only a short walk to the top.

Beautiful building, gardens and views. Go here!. Simply delightful. This is a lovely spot to look across the Danube and into Pest, and it is so pleasant just walking around the grounds and gardens. There is a Hungarian museum on site which I didn't have time to go around, but looks interesting, but I just wandered around the site for free, taking everything in. There is no real need to get the funicular because there are no extra views from doing so, and the steps and paths aren't too onerous to manage.
Inside boring, views great. An ok visit, we didn't go inside as art is not an interest of ours. However the views over Pest were great!

Less crowded than other spots-great for taking pics!. Recommend if you want to take pics, not nearly as crowded as some of the other scenic stops and there's a food stand that makes a sugar and cinnamon coated baked bread that is amazing! A must try!We took an uber to the spot and walked down-worked perfect!

Impressive exterior . Passed by the castle during the free walking tour guided by Monica. The exterior is very impressive and you can see the castle far from another side of the river! There is a festival during this weekend, so drop by and see!

Beautiful castle with a beautiful view!!!. Really worth to go there. Many times they are making markets, gastronomy weekends and festivals there. The castle and the area are both huge it takes like 2 hours to walk around it.
nice views!. Large Castle with great views from the top of this hill overlooking the Rhine River. Castle is well appointed and takes a couple of hours to see.

An obsene amount of photo opportunities. What a great place to go and enjoy the sights and take photos.Buda Castle was built on the southern tip of Castle Hill, bounded on the north by what is known as the Castle District. It overlooks the Danube and the beautiful bridges crossing it and offers views of the Buda side too.You could walk around up there for hours taking in the sights of the city, the castle itself and the surrounding district. Although there are usually loads of tourists you never really feel like it gets too crowded.I highly recommend going there, as well as taking the time to walk around and explore the surrounding area as well.
A day well spent. We stayed in Budapest for three days (Sepember 2014) and this was one of our most enjoyable days. You can spend a minimum of half a day enjoying the views and grounds.

Not to miss to understand Hungary's history. Excellent visit to know more about Hungary's history and its people. You have to remember that the castle is not a organised as a museum, it is full of rooms and is almost like an ever ending maze rich with objects and architecture. Be prepare to walk for a long time. We were there over two hours and if we would have taken more time we could have been there maybe four hours.

Amazing. Enchanting place, it is recommended greatly for people to visit.It has a wonderful panoramic view for Budapest & Danube.the day I went it was the turn to change the guards it was a very interesting experience, plus the other day I went, it was Saturday & it was full of people, no place to stand with a lot of different activities & music, it was a very attractive atmosphere with different kinds of food & sweets.Recommend it for all.

Beautiful castle (free). Not the most spectacular castle in Europe by far, the lots to do in the nearby area. Museum grounds are all free to walk around. Free entrance to the gallery and museum of you have a Budapest card.Getting there: get the Funicular up the hill if you are already on Buda side. If you are near Pest side, get the bus number 16 from just near Deal Ferenc metro station. It drops you off outside the castle. Nearby: only a 5/10 min walk to Matthias Church, Fisherman's Bastion and Hospital in the Rock Museum. Gallery and Museum are on the grounds. Tip: visit at night for beautiful views lit up by lights.
Must Visit. After a long day sightseeing in the wonderful city of Budapest you come across Buda Castle, an ideal way to finish your day, do not miss it out.
Great museums. I went there trying to scape the bad weateher but I end up enjoying very much the National History museum.

Absolutely stunning architecture, history, art galleries and museum. Great area to see views of the Danube and the Pest side of the river. Many cultural activities and strolling areas. We arrived in Budapest on the Hungarian National Holiday and this area was packed with food stands, music and big crowds but what a great first day in Hungary! With the the fireworks and the excitement of the crowds it was truly a memorable experience.

Huge grounds. Beautiful but tiring to walk. Buda castle and her grounds are on the Buda side. Don't let anyone talk you into doing a walking tour as it will just kill you. Yes it may only be 30 mins walk to the castle but they fail to tell you that there's more walking around the grounds. We hired a bicycle and covered so much ground without tiring our legs. This is the way to see Budapest. The battlements wind up and around through the cobble stone paths and we saw so many older folks walking uphill through the winding paths feeling sorry for themselves. We just wiz pass them on the bikes.Don't pay for a 2 way funicular ticket as you will walk to matthias church and probably walk down from there instead of walking back to the funicular as this walk will take you to the bridge near the Parliament which is on the other end of the castle and battlements.
Amazing Architecture. Another spectacular building in Budapest. Grand facades - great views of the Danube and Pest from the site too!
Gorgeous views!. Gorgeous views of the whole city. W visited during the annual wine festival. Fantastic location. Visit just before dusk, to see the city come to life at night!

Grand. Spacious castle, has a museum (closed on Friday I think , just check), nice tour, please book slots from internet else you might need to wait long.The castle guided tour is good but once can also take the audio tour, my personal preference is always a guided tour as I like the interactions , audio tours would be much more informative and one can move at own pace I prefer guided tours.

Nice trip up to the Castle, great views over the city.. We visited here in Sept 2015. There is an admission fee to gain access to the Art Gallery and Museum, however the Museum Gift Shop is free to look around. We didn't go into the main Gallery/Museum but a walk around the grounds was just as nice with some spectacular views over the city.
Well worth a visit. We spent a good half day here but you could spend longer, the castle area is like a small quaint town and it is lovely to walk around, plenty to see and good views
Good views. This was really good. You get lots of really good views over the city and it easy to reach by the furuncular from chain bridge.
Buda Castle. This is good site to view on a morning or afternoon. It is not a castle but you can view the building and walk around the grounds.

So many more authentic things in Pest, but the funicular is a classic.. A mere fantasy reconstruction with tourist crowds and the only over-priced restaurants in Budapest, all of which my instinct tells me to avoid. Yet if, like me, you have an extra day, go ahead. At least, unlike Orlando, real events did happen here since Roman times, just not in these buildings. But, stay in Pest for the real beauties and shops and food. And don't miss the spectacular National Museum collection for this silliness.

Beautiful castle, art gallery inside, and ruins around the castle's gardens and fountains . I enjoyed walking the steep hill until arriving at the castle (because the funicular was not working the day I visited the palace). The castle itself is truly magnificent, and you can also enjoy the lovely view of the river, the Chain Bridge and ,any of the sights on the Pest bank from the palace's terraces. Around the palace there are a few beautiful fountains, lovely gardens and ruins of the old town. Definitely worth a visit. I recommend mixing the visit of this place with a short walk to the Fisherman's Bastion and the Matthias Church, and visiting both of these sights as well.

Such a nice and huge castle in Budapest. Our trip to Budapest was full of amazing places like this one. It takes time to go around and see it all, but visiting this castle is worth it for sure. It is big and very interesting. We were lucky, cos at that time we went there wasnt that many people, so we made beautiful photos...
Amazing views. Loved the castle area and the hike, walk, escalator or funicular ride up to the top. Great views of Parliament, Chain Bridge and all of city along the Danube.

Meh. You will not miss much if you just look at it from the other side of the river. For stunning views of the city go up the Gellert Hill, and for sheer beauty visit Matthias church and Fisherman's Bastion.

Sure spend half a day there. It's worth the time and the effort. The walk up is steep and don't carried away by the guide books on this. Better to take a ride on the bus, or a taxi which is not too expensive if you chose to take it from the foot of one of the bridges on the Danube. The castle and cathedrals inside are awesome and what I liked most was the ART gallery which is a short walk from the castle. Nice cafés , and coffee shops all,over. The architecture here is so unique a blend of the west and the east with string Roman influence.
Was closed to visitors. Due to a festival we could not get into the grounds, let alone inside. It looks fantastic and I would still recommend a visit. But check the schedule in advance!

Beautiful Views. The view over the Danube from the castle grounds is spectacular and not to be missed. While we were there a emergency meeting of the government was taking place which limited our ability to enter buildings. Didn't matter as that view made up for it.By chance, we were also treated to a military ceremony that day which was quite colorful and interesting. Buda Castle is a main attaction in Budapest.

Castle, art gallery and old ruins. All in one location too. A must see. When accessing you can take the funicular for a fee or go left about 100 meters to a large stone archway, go in, take the elevator then the escalator for no cost then a sort walk to the Musseum Castle access. Lot's to see around the castle.

Well worth a visit, an amazing adventure. is was really my highlight of Budapest, exploring this enormous complex was really a treat! I would like to visit this a second time no doubt there were monuments and sites I did not discover!

Well worth the time and a great value for your money. The Hungarian National Art Museum is beautifully done. The restoration of both the building and the art is first rate. We had to tear ourselves away.

Castle with a difference.. Really, it's just another set of buildings and we visited it during the Budapest Wine Festival. However, the museum alone is worth the visit and the grounds around afford some great views of the city.

Great views over Budapest and the Danube.. The castle houses a large gallery of paintings from Medieval to modern day in a beautiful building set on the top of a hill next to the Fisherman's Bastion. Get the vanicular railway to the top, it's easier than walking. Try to see the changing of the guards at the palace next door as it is amusing, with goose stepping soldiers in sunglasses trying their best to look serious with their antique rifles.

The views from the grounds are great but the castle not so much. You cannot go into this building except for the National Gallery. You can walk around it and it is an impressive building. The views of Budapest make this a worthwhile visit. You can walk easily to St Mathias Church from here.
Touristy but great. If you are visiting the Castle district (and what tourist WON'T be ??)then a visit to Buda Castle is a must. Houses the national gallery for those folk who have the time to spare

Excellent area and viewing point. We had an evening meal up in the castle are. The night time views were fabulous. We came back and did the Big Bus walking tour and that was excellent as well. Lovely area with commanding views over the City

Budapest in a nutshell. Massive building, grand architecture, fascinating history Buda Castle is worth the visit. Better have guide for the visit. These buildings make Budapest as one of the most beautiful cities in Europe.

Must see. Can get to see many of the attractions along from the castle unfortunately on the day we visited there was a big wine festival taking place so getting from Fisherman's Bastion to the castle was closed but we managed it by walking down the hill and along the road and then back again. That is when we discovered the escalator and lift that will take you up to castle and the museums

Amazing architecture and stunning views. Situated in the castle district of Buda, this is a site not to be missed. You can freely walk around the grounds and stop for refreshments in the terrace cafe/restaurant. The views are fantastic, looking out over the Danube and across to Pest (pronounced Pescht).
Great views. Lovely architecture and pleasant walks round the castle is complemented with great views over the Danube and the rest of the city. Don't miss out on this.

Great views in iconic location.. We visited on a Monday, so all the museums and galleries were closed. Even the funicular railway was closed for maintanence. However, it was a very pleasant climb up the hill on a gorgeous sunny day, and the views from the castle ramparts are spectacular, even with all the selfie photographers . Being there at 12 noon for the changing of the Palace Guard , with their very complicated ceremonial performance was a very fortunate opportunity. Certainly, a visit to the castle and the views it provides over Pest is a must see.

The Palace. Great tip if you are going to the Palace on the left hand side there is a entrance with two statues on top you can go in and find a lift to the next floor were you can then go up the escalator that is in front of you. You will now be in the palace grounds free of charge. Walk round and be amazed at the size a butiful buildings around you. Plus you will get the best views of Budapest anywhere.
Impressive castle. Another must see if you are in the city. The ground surrounding the castle make for a nice walk. The views of the city are impressive.Worth a visit.

A must-visit. What you see inside exceeds your best expectations. It looks beautiful when you see it from the other side of the Danube especially when illuminated at night, but you still find more beautiful when you explore it.

Beautiful building and views. I just love the architecture of this place. The views across the river are spectacular, and you could probably spend a whole day here.Fortunately for me, I was dropped off by a bus tour and did not have to climb up the hill to this place.
Stunning views. There are great views from Buda Castle but also make sure you see it light up at night. It is magnificent.
Great place to wonder. Great place for a relaxed amble. Every street and square is decorated with eye pleasing architecture full with many beautiful nooks and crannies.

Nice view and worth a visit. We walked up there this afternoon. The view was amazing, and you are guaranteed to have beautiful shots, even if you are an amateur photographer. The castle itself is beautiful. The hike up isn;t as bad as I thought it was. Make sure to take water with you before you get up there. The food and the water is a bit pricey as expected.

Nice stroll around the castle grounds and a magnificent view of Budapest. My friend and I spent hours just roaming around the castle grounds and into their quirky little village behind the castle. There's so much to see! We really enjoyed the view of Budapest while standing by the castle hill. We loved the little shops and church in the village and the archery activity in the castle gardens. Will definitely visit again!

The labyrinth at Buda. It is an interesting series of underground caves linked by corridors that for centuries have been used as places of refuge. Currently, in the various rooms there are a series of tableaux, mainly depicting scenes from Verdi's The Masked Ball (accompanied by piped music of the opera). There is also a section (which I enjoyed but at which my wife demurred) where you walk for about thirty minutes in pitch dark, with only a cable fixed to the wall to guide you. There is also a considerable focus on the fifteenth-century Vlad the Impaler (aka Dracula) and references to his life, his marriage, and his (alleged) imprisonment in the Labyrinth. How much of this is historically accurate is highly debatable (and mostly unsupported by historical evidence). In addition, the Labyrinth has been subject to considerable conflict itself, with police raids in 2008 (allegedly for not having a tourist visa) and 2011 (for alleged environmental misdemeanours). During the latter, staff and tourists were forcibly removed by police (an account of which, written by the Labrynth's previous operators, can be found on the web). It would seem the attraction under their management had been altogether focused on more serious, reflexive issues, the role of labyrinth's in history, and on European cultural icons. As one reviewer noted, the present 'exhibition' is more 'cheesy.' I think I'd have preferred to visit in the former period. then, too, it had a restaurant!

Worth the walk ... Even on a hot day. We had missed walking around the castle when we came to Castle Hill earlier today...and took a long walk there today, not realising the sweet things festival was on...which meant we had to pay to wander areas normally open to the public. It was chocolate, so we did anyway, and enjoyed sweet and savoury treats from local suppliers while wandering around the courts and gardens of the castle. It was probably pretty close to what it might have been like in festival days of old. The Mathias fountain was pretty, the views impressive and the statuary interesting to behold. We meandered home down the stairs and along the Danube promenade, having enjoyed our day.
That view OMG!. Beautiful place with a marvellous view and nice museums. A whole afternoon is better to plan for that especially in summertime when the place is crowded.
Adventure Budapest. This is such a beautiful landmark of this gorgeous city. You feel very safe walking in any direction. Everywhere we go the people are friendly. English has not been a problem.

Nice castle. Nice castle on the hill, we got there and back by mini funicular for 1600 Ft per person. Most fascinating thing is that funicular is towed by metal rope, which is anchored by wooden nut only.From Buda's castle courtyard is possibility to see view of Budapest downtown and Parliament.
Impressive building. We walked this area on our last day and were pretty tired from walking by then. It's a very impressive area with plenty of restaurants and bars close by to sit and watch.

What a stunning view, and the budapest history museum inside. We accidentally stumbled upon a wine festival there and we got tickets both for the wine festival and the budapest history museum for 3000 Huf . The views are great, you can get up there either by fonicular from clark adam ter bus 16 station or just go by foot up the hill from the clark adam ter bus station to the left of the fonicular entrance
Buda Castle. We did not go in this but it was across the river from our hotel and offered an impressive view during the day and at night when it was lit up.
History buffs. We did the National Hungarian History Museum that has a wonderful Buda Castle exhibit. It was well worth the trip up the Buda mountain. And the views are magnificent.

Great place and views. Didn't visit the museum, but just to walk around this place is stunning and has great views across the river / Pest to match.
Lively, charming streets run off it full of bars, cafes and quaint shops.

Impressive castle. This is quite an imposing castle that looks down on the city and the Danube. We have walked around it both durying the day and night and it always impresses me. It sits on castle hill and has many restaraunts around it to visit while there.

A little underwhelming. Compared to other castles, this one is just average in terms of the architecture and details, in my opinion. Nevertheless, there will be too many excellent views of the surrounding areas while you're here, so climbing to the top is not really totally worthless.

Nicely Maintained Castle. We only had a view of the outside of the Castle. By castle standards this is pretty dull - definitely a latter day castle where more emphasis was on the inside rather than protection from invaders from the outside

Great views from the walk to the Castle.. We were only able to visit the Courtyard during a Palenka Festival. Appealing architecture. Doesn't operate as a Castle now but an Art Gallery instead..Great views of Budapest.

Nice building and gardens. Buda Castle sits proudly on the hill, overlooking the city. The architecture is beautiful, and the gardens were very nice and immaculately maintained. We did not go into the National Gallery (housed within the Castle), due to lack of time.
Great views. This place is stunning, head over in the late afternoon and sit on the battlements to enjoy the sunset looking over the river and Pest.

The castle itself it's nice, but avoid the History Museum there.. We were visiting the Castle's grounds, which were nice, when we decided to visit the History Museum: there wer not audioguide or tours, and the place was awfully organized, skipping from different times without any logic and without any boards explaining what was shown.An avoidable experience.The best thing we saw there were the pictures of the castle right after the Germans torched it and before it was rebuilt. What a disaster.
Amazing in the daylight or the dark. Go here during the day for majestic views of the city or see it lit up at night for fairy tale like pictures.

National Gallery. When we were making our way to the Castle, we fully expected to find the interior of the building somewhat preserved, with antiques etc. In fact, it now contains the National Gallery, which contains a vast number of spectacular pieces, including altar pieces. One can easily spend at least three to four hours browsing the gallery. On the particular day we visited the Castle, we were fortunate enough to find the Wine Festival in full swing on the grounds of the Castle. This is not something which is present year round but it was highly enjoyable!
nice don't miss the gardens. Very nice and some museums but walking around it and down to the bazar and yards is something you shouldn't miss
Sightseeing. Worth visiting. We were especially lucky to witness the yearly Wine Festival. Especially beautiful to visit after sundown as the place is fantastically lit up.

One of the best view of the city. Does not matter how many days you will spend in the city, take a time to visit the castle, there you will find a nice view of the city. It's important point out that has a small village near the castle that is a good option to visit too.

Budapest Wine Festival Buda Castle "This entrance fee and tasting fee!". September 9, I visited this a party. The first negative surprise - need to pay an entrance fee of 3000 HUF! Not only is - then you must purchase a card 5000 HUF! People were very few, sellers of wine had more than visitors. This disappointment. This is not a holiday, but a commercial enterprise. Wine lovers better go to the store, than to go again. A recent festival in Budafoki white and sparkling wines was much more fun. (September 5 and 6)There was free entry and an opportunity to watch wine cellars underground. That was awesome.

A must-see whilst u r in. Budapest. Great tour with Akinga. She was very relaxed and patient with our questions about the castle district. Lots of things to see and views to admire. I recommend the guided tour esp of st Matthias Church since Akinga was able to point out areas we would have missed. The walk over to the palace was lovely with great views of the city. Highly recommend.

Stunning castle, and great views of the city and Danube. The Buda Castle is an architectural beauty. It is a large complex, with a variety of buildings to tour. Walking up to the castle is an interesting fountain of hunters and dogs. The castle wall is imposing, and in one spot we found a canon ball embedded in the wall, which the kids thought was cool. Great spots for great pictures at the castle and overlooking the Danube.
Worth a visit!. Beautiful castle in idyllic surroundings. The architecture is truly amazing, we would highly recommend a visit due to it being one of Budapest's landmarks.
Stunning views of Pest. Lots to see at the castle and the surrounding area. views say it quite expensive this side of Budapest but we found it very reusable to eat and drink.

Castle that's NOT a Castle.. It WAS a castle, now it's a huge MUSEUM. It's huge, covering a whole range of Hungarian History.
Well worth the price of admission.

Magical. I gotta tell that night after visiting the castle I dreamed with it, it will be not forgotten!!!Amazing endless admiration of it. You have to surround it, walk all over as much as you can because it is amazing in front and back every single side of it is magical. I loved this building and I can't wait to visit Budapest again, in part because if this castle.
Must See. We visited as part of a cruise down the Danube. A must see on the Buda side of Budapest. Budapest itself is a very friendly and interesting place to visitl

Buda Castle. Visit to Buda castle is really important if you visiting Budapest.Visit to this castle becomes more important at night to see the lights in the Pest region from Buda. The parliament looks amazing at night.

Grand building. I honestly think the castle looked more like the Parliament building and vice versa. For a castle, it wasn't as 'disney' as you'd imagine, but rather hard line structured, something that would have been ideal for the Parliament! That said, the building is still grand and majestic, being on top of the hill on the side of Buda, there were amazing views of Pest here.

Must visit if you're in Budapest. There's lots to see in Buda Castle, which is a sprawling complex of buildings and a palace museum. What makes it fascinating about this place is it was totally destroyed during WW2 and everything you see is more or less totally rebuilt to original spec, quite an achievement considering very little was restored during the communist years.

you have to spend a hole day there. Buda Castle is for tourists but it’s a must do in the city. After the destruction of Second World War all the castle district was rebuilt. An awesome task that took years. Its impossible to see Budapest without spending a hole day in the castle. Also explore the restaurants near by the Hilton.

Great views and great history. Buda and Pest are twin cities on the Danube, known as Budapest. The Buda castle is on Buda hill with excellent views over the combined city. The castle is massive and contains several sights within as well as a nice terrace looking over the Danube. You can take a funicular railway up from the river.
Great!. Stop by at noon for the changing of the guards which our daughter just loved! Great to go with a tour guide to learn some history as well!
Don't waste your time here. Nothing great, quite boring. Do not waste money on an Audio guide, they just read out what's written anyway and give no extra information.
Drive to Buda. The bus tour around Buda & Pest is worth the cost. It's an amazing feeling driving around the Buda castle and the sites around it.

Great Views. Visited here on a weekend, so large crowds, it was also a hot day, so were pleased we took a bus to the top rather than walking. There was a large, mainly food market on too offering an array of hot & cold takeway & local food. An enjoyable visit with excellent views over to the 'pest' side of the Danube

Beautiful architecture and breathtaking views from Pest. One of the most beautiful buildings seen from the Pest side. Perfect location uphill. You can get there by funicular or by walk (around 200 stairs). Up there, the view from the Pest side and the Danube is perfect. The architecture of the building is very romantic. It was all reconstructed in the XIX century, so there's little left from the Medieval Castle.

worth the visit. Amazing castle but oh what a hike to get there.Amazing rooms, decor, sculptures, paintings.Spectacular view of the city from the castle. Lots of fairs and exhibits present when we visited, so quite hectic.
Lovely. Beautiful, lovely grounds to look around and great views over the city. There was a food fair when we visited which was just great and a bonus show casing Hungarian food

The castle. A must visit. Catch the funicular up the mountain to arrive at the castle. A market of fabulous deli foods await you. Walk around the castle. Interior has been converted to a gallery for those interested in the arts

Gret views and art gallery. We could see this castle from the Sofitel Chain bridge. Took the funnicular up the first time to buda hill but walked the rest of the time. Really enjoyed a couple of hours in the National Museum. Great art and includes highlights of the collection from Museum of Fine Arts which is being renovated.
Great area, and nice views. Beautiful building, recommend the National Gallery Museum inside Buda Castle. However, the area around the castle and the views is worth a trip on its own.
beautiful. beautiful even when it is rainy, great to see some of the classic architecure. Highly recommended. Not a great selection of food nearby
Glorious castle. We get an excellant view of the Castle from the danube river bank exspecially it is good to photograph it in the morning

Great views. Stunning Castle, we really enjoyed the views from here and the big statues. The fountain with the hunt scene was brilliant. We weren't convinced about the H & S of the archery range and it was pointed towards where you walk but I'm sure they know what they are doing.

very nice and pretty. we spent there a few hours in the ares, worth the ride in a bus.
i really recommend! the view is gorgeous!

Do not miss the National Hungarian Gallery. The National Hungarian Gallery (which is within the Castle) is worth a visit, especially since it helds an exposition of the only masterpieces of the Museum of Fine Arts (and it's not only about Hungarian Art as you can see on their website) you can actually see before 2018.

Buda Castle.. It's worth visiting the castle just for the views if nothing else. It is a pleasant area just to wander round and has plenty to see. You can take the funicular up the hill to save walking. We walked back down via Fisherman's Bastion.
its a palace, not a castle. It's a great palace, but a castle it's not... no turrets / battlements, no historic battles. IMHO, it therefore didn't do what it says on the tin. ;)

Impressive Castle With Lovely Views. You climb the Castle Hill named after this Buda Castle & go around this heritage sight which has seen many change of rulers occupying it from the Magyars,Hapsburgs,Turks & back to the Hungarians.Take the audio guide on payment which will give you all the interesting information.The Buda Castle also houses the National Gallery of art & the National History museum.There are lovely views to see from here of the Chain Bridge,Danube river & the Pest town.

Top of the Wall. The walk up is well worth the view over the city, which the castle wall offers. Beneath spreads the whole of Budapest and the Danube which flows through it. To get there by public transport we took bus No.16 from Deak Ferenc Ter (accents missing) and got off once the bus crossed the bridge, right before the tunnel there is a bus stop. From there we walked up. I Have been told there is a bus that takes you directly up. Worth looking into if you are not a big fan of walking or have little time at your disposal. I assure that the view from the top will not disappoint.

Very impressive. Need plenty of time to explore tBuda castle and let it have it, it deserves it. From the impressive size and sheer beauty surrounding it all you will be pleased with your visit and the fantastic views of the city.
Great architecture; excellent views!. This is a must visit attraction in Budapest right atop the Chain Bridge offering great views of the Danube and Budapest town.
excellent. it was one of the best places we visited. very big museum and it allows you to travel back in time. .

Massive and Impressive, especially by night!. The palace of Budapest sits on top of the Buda hill and covers a large part of it. It is, in my opinion, less beautiful from up close than from far awya, but seeing how large it is you won't be able to miss it if you're in Budapest! My advice go have a look at it from the Pest side of the city at night, you won't forget it!
