I really like view you see in this picture actually. The view of Pest is also fantastic from the other side.. What can I say. This the Castle that Queen Elizabeth (Sissy) of Austria spent a lot of her time. If you know the Remy Schneider movies from the 50's and 60's in Europe, then you have to see it. It is beautiful and has typical Hungarian architectural features. Completely different from Prague with the Gothic spires, it is beautiful in its own way. A must see if you come to Budapest.

Amazing place. We visited Buda Castle twice. It houses the National Gallery and the National History Museum. Firstly, we went at the National Gallery, which is stunning. It has amazing paintings from all around the Europe mainly. Then, we went again to visit the National History Museum that houses the history of Hungary in one place. It's interesting if you like history! You can get useful information!

Wow - beautiful during the day and night!. Huge. Can't miss it! Day or night. We visited during the Festival of Folk Arts and really enjoyed seeing the local arts and crafts being demonstrated in an historical context. Be prepared for walking up and downhill on cobblestones, although there is an escalator up and a funicular near the chain bridge area. Great views from the top - a perfect place to take panorama photos. Lots to do in the Buda village - don't miss walking through for the shops and cafes. Lots of people still live in the Buda Castle area in restored apartments.
the best point to see the city. it was really goodfood was fantastictake your time to explore it. Much worseA good spot to have a great view of the city

Must see while in Budapest. Plan on minimally spending a half day at the castle and pack a light jacket as it can be much cooler than in the city. Stunning sights that allow photography and amazing views from several areas of the castle that overlook the city. We purchase the self guided tour and was very happy with the quality of the audio and the information provided. Outside the castle is a small area that several vendor are set up selling local cuisine and beverages. You simply can’t go to Budapest and not see the castle!
Nice landmark to see. Very impressive landmark with many interesting historical tidbits. Hugely beautiful and ancient castle .Definitely should be on the list of Budapest visitors.

Mainly for the view. The view from the castle is stunning, and we visited mainly for that reason. You get a full beautiful panoramic view of the entire city. There are some museums in the castle, but we didn't visited them. Try to catch the soldiers while they're switching positions.
Another 'MUST SEE' in Budapest!!!!. The castle and castle area is a MUST SEE in Budapest!!! The architecture is gorgeous and the decor/detail is very interesting.

Disappointing and poorly maintained. I was sad to see that this building, once a castle has not been maintained as a castle, especially since the hapsburgs (the royal family in this part of the world) we're one of the most amazing dynasties in the world! The building has been so poorly maintained and for a castle that is the heart of the Buda side of Budapest it is incredibly disappointing to hear its been turned into an art gallery.The views however from the top of the hill looking over the city are well worth the trek up!

Best part of it is to watch changing guards. One can find the place by its unique Green top from far away. There are many statues around the building. If you are facing the building the building, you can go through the gate on your right and waiting to see changing guards. I love the eagle on the gate which I am attaching a picture of it.

Beautiful sight by night. Visited Buda Castle during the afternoon and night. The buildings were all lit up beautifully and it was great wandering around.
One downside was that one of the older staff at the gallery was very rude and unhelpful, which marred the experience a little.
Nevertheless, it was an enjoyable experience.
Art Festival 2015 . Fun from bottom to the top with literally thousands of booths selling interesting local art works and local foods, and of course beverages.
Trip July 2015. Not exactly an amazing museum, but quite a few paintings, a beautiful interior, and an amazing view from the cupola that allows access outside.

Visit the outside but not sure about going in. Outside Buda Castle is where you arrive after ascending Castle Hill. The area surrounding the Castle is great to walk around and appreciate the views but we didn't bother going in to see the galleries inside due to time constraints.
best views of the city. Buda Castle has amazing history with even better views of Budapest. Take your time up here and enjoy the views. Appreciate the history in this historical castle.

March 15th. We were fortunate to be there on March 15 Independence Day. All of the citizens were out sporting rosette pins in their national colors All of the buildings and museums were open with many historic demonstrations and parades.
Must see if you are in Budapest!. Your guidebook will tell you the background and history behind this very historic Castle. Don't buy any souvenirs around the area; they are grossly overpriced...

Only good view!. The Castle Hill is a great Budapest attraction overall. With the Fisherman's Bastion, Church, Sandor Palace etc. but the Castle itself is not worth a visit. It is now a museum with too much restoration. It is only good for the view that can be had from it and the way it adorns the castle hill panorama. The climb up is very exhausting and the alternative funicular is pretty expensive and scary.

Best combined with other attractions.. Buda Castle is beatifully located on top of a hill, and the view of Pest is stunning from here. It is not the most fascinating castle we have seen, but it is not the least either. We recommend you visit it but mostly for the view, Fishermen's Bastion and Matthias Church

Lovely place to wander around. This is a lovely place to wander around at your own leisure. We took the cable car up to the top and walked back down to save time and energy because it's a large hill!It's even more beautiful at night (I saw it on a night boat cruise) but even in the day it is a stunning place and offers beautiful views of the city.

Marvelous museum .the castle a museum itself. Tells you the story of Hungary displayed in various floors.We stayed many many hours there...so much to appreciate.Chose watch ever your interest and concentrate in it.The exhibition of the restoration history of San Matias churchIs exceptional for those interested in details .The visit to the underground construction will amaze everyone.The archaeological exhibition will interest many visitors.A must must in Budapest if you stay more than 2 or 3 days

self guided tour. Lovely photo opportunities and views over Buda and Pest. We were fortunate to have a stunning day and enjoyed lingering at landmarks and eating ice cream. The changing of the guards at the palace was fun to watch.
Nice view. expensive fees, staff not great, museum without a lot of interest and most of the explanation are only in hungarian or german
Nice views. Beautiful on the hill, à lot to see but not inside. Its not a palace or something for visitors so we walked around the outside. Also the rest of the town on the hill is very nice.
Beautiful from outside. The Buda Castle was very beautiful . We only viewed it from outside. Our tour did not include a visit indoors.

Go at night!. If you don't get a chance to visit this stunning place during the day, go at night! The castle's courtyards are open 24/7 (it was, when I visited in August 2015). It is absolutely magical at night -- cooling, not so crowded and surreal.

Don't miss a visit to the Castle. What an impressive construction! I enjoyed during the day and when it gets illuminated at night. The Funicular Railway would make your trip faster but if you have comfortable shoes, it is no needed.
View is the best part. Doesn't really compare to other castles in Europe but offers great views of Pest. At night it makes for great photo ops. There are a number of nice restaurants in the area.

Beautiful Building, Not to be missed. Best way to get there is by the Funicular Railway. Allow at least one hour for your visit. Have good footwear. Beautiful architecture. Fabulous view of Budapest as it is on the Buda side. Must see attraction.

A delight.. We strolled around the castle for half a day and every aspect was compelling. About 300 photos later and a visit to the cafe overlooking the river and city we walked back to Vaci Ucta. Nothing is too far to walk to in Budapest.
Buda castle. Another piece of super architecture as nearly every other statue look very clean and polished. Buds castle is certainly worth a look
well worth visiting. The streets and the ancient building were well worth visiting, I don;t know if we would have found many of the small places without having a local guide,
Enchanting castle.. A lovely day was had exploring the castle district in Buda. Castle looked in mint condition. Some lovely places to seat and then eat. Almost as if in France.

Spend Equal Time Inside and Out. The view and setting are unique in the world as the castle sits right on the large cliffs of the City of Buda right in the heart of the town. This makes it wonderful because it has amazing views both inside and out. By spending more time outside and watching the city you get a much better feel for the flow and pulse of the city and also the majesty of the buildings and the amazing Danube.
worth the visit. a very nicely built castle with some nice views too. a must see while visiting Budapest. worth the trip

An iconic site along the Danube. The two buildings I think about when I think about Budapest are the Parliament building and the Buda Castle. This building is beautiful and can visited at all hours of the day (as seen by attached photos). I went here late at night to enjoy the views, I went here during the day to tour around the building and the fortifications. I also attended an art show at the Castle. There are so many things to do in and around here, but if you wanted to just look at it and have a coffee or dessert in the area, that will suffice as well.

Beautiful at night.. Apart from the amazing castle there is so much to do in this area. You can go in the labyrinths, enjoy quality crafts shopping and eat delicious traditional Hungarian food. Plenty of local buses to it.

A must stay place. If you go to Budapest try staying in the Castle District. This comprises a controlled compound comprising the castle, the National Gallery, several restaurants, museums, statues, cafes, hotels and a cathedral. Plenty of shops too. A safe nice quiet and clean place where you can endlessly explore some of the most prominent historic treasures of Budapest.
Full of History. Well worth a visit, stunning architecture and home to various museums, lots of areas to sit and relax in, absorbing the history.
Guided tour visit. Only went there on a guided tour which did not allow entrance time to castle. Great views from there though, you can see Buda and Pest seperated by Danube

A must see while in Budapest. Definitely a must see while you are in Budapest. Imagine the horse carriages with the royals in the court yard and the ladies in there regal gowns strolling there. you can loose yourself in time .

Europe's guardian palace. Simply amazing, and such an honour to walk around this place knowing it gave so much during hostile moments to protect the so called western countries from the armadas trying to conquer Europe! Still standing tall and the most mighty of all castles! A must see and do!
World Heritage site. The Buda Castle and the complete Castle area is so much beautiful that you have to walk there couple of hours if you are in Budapest!
Great sightseeing!!!. This is a wonderful place to go...feels like a magic place once you start going up the hill. amazing sightseeing and coffee shops to chill a bit.

Reproduction with a Wonderful View and Worthwhile.. The Buda Castle has a wonderful location and is visible from many locations on the Danube in Budapest. As a someone who relishes the real deal rather than reproductions, it was sad to learn the earlier manifestation of this castle was destroyed in WWII. There have been so many battles in Budapest and this hill was usually a strategic location that it is no surprise that many old structures on it are lost. Still, there are some interesting parts of the building and a tomb underneath worth seeing.

Great Views of Pest. We visited The Buda Castle and the district surrounding it. This is a nice walk around to see the exterior and grounds. As far as we understand, there aren't preserved/restored rooms as in other palaces/castles we have visited recently. There are various museums, however we did not visit them. There is construction going on in one section, so there isn't a great way to walk it in a loop. The castle provides many great photo opportunities, especially for sights on the Pest side, such as Parliament. The streets around are interesting to walk down and there are a number of monuments and points of interest.
Part of the city history. Looks better from a distance at night. Worth going to walk through the streets on the Buda side which offers great views

Very beautiful. . A very beautiful place that is worth a visit. From the top of the hill you can see the whole city and it specify it's beautiful at night time when all the lights are up decorating the beautiful city. Walking through the streets in the warm summer night gives you a very romantic feeling and makes you think about that hundreds of years a go there were kings walking through and now you are.
grand. so much to see and so grand - also enjoyed what seemed like the changing of the gaurds. everything was so well looked after.

Superb area- come when dark too for nice photos. We were in Budapest during 2015 Easter period and on the second day we planned to visit this after seeing Chain bridge and then zero point. We took Bus no 16 from the zero point, just crossing the chain bridge towards Buda side. However the bus originates from Deák Ferenc tér near the yellow line metro station and going to Donáti utca.There is a funicular service available from that point for going to top of the castle hill area, however that appeared too costly for us as the fare was 1400HUK for return where as the bus fare was 300HUK(as we took a block of 10 tickets)It took 15 mins to reach the top of the hill, stoppage named Dish Ter. This is one of the top choices in Castle hill area.  This area has a palace, beautiful entrance gates. This was built in 13-16 century. We heard that original castle was destroyed and replaced by a smaller one. Now this is the home for Hungarian National Gallery, History Museum and National library. We didn’t go inside and enjoyed it from outside only. There are entry fee for all these Museums.There was a beautiful Easter market operated at that time in the Castle area, which also had an entry fee of 5 euro. However we went into the market and enjoyed some hot foods with local wines. Special mention was Chimney cake and honeycomb cake.We came back here again in the evening when it was dark. That was the time when we really enjoyed the place- it was almost deserted except some people with camera stand taking nice pictures of the Chain Bridge, Parliament and the Pest side. We also took lots of photos of beautiful illuminated snaps of Chain bridge with the reflection shimmering in the moonlight and went back at 9-30pm by bus no 216 tofrom Deák Ferenc tér .
nice old place. iti is very nice, old place... great for walk, especialy at evening... small restaurants can be find in every street, plus it is not very crowded... very nice part of Budapest!

Imposing from a distance, culturally important up close. Having only strolled around the front gardens and lengthy courtyard, I can't really say I've visited the castle proper. However, it's an impressive set of buildings that were designated a World Heritage Site in 1987. With a history dating back to the mid-13th century, what is seen today is really a reflection of the improvements and modernisation implemented in the last 150 or so years. There are two entrances but most visitors will probably enter via the ornamental gate located near the funicular station. A statue of the turul, a mythical bird and the symbol of the Hungarian nation, stands perched at one end of the gate and is unmistakable. The grounds are decorated intermittently with fountains and statues. Look out for the Matthias fountain, the playful fountain entitled Fishing Children, as well as the grand equestrian statue of Prinz Eugen of Savoy that faces the Pest side of the city.The castle is more long than deep in its design but six of the interconnected buildings have been converted into the National Gallery, Budapest History Museum, and the National Library. However, like much of castle hill, the views from the castle's terraces are magnificent and picture postcard-like.

Very grand. It's a very beautiful castle with a lot to look at. You can take a funicular up to the castle which is good fun or walk depending on how fit you're feeling. The grounds are lovely and there are lots of statues and things to look at. We didn't go inside...but I would definitely do so if I went back to Budapest.
Must go!. One of the great places situated in Budapest. One must go here and you can have a great view of the Danube together with the castle and palace.

nice exterior - good views of Danube. Interior is mainly a Hungarian museum, but worth the hike to get there due to the river views and exterior architecture. I stayed in the lobby while travel-buddy zipped through the museum. Bring coins to use the ladies room - nothing is free in Buda!

Very nice ancient castle with excellent panorama to the city. A good program is to walk around here, see the Fishermans' Bastion and the Matthew Church. Do not enter by car, you can use the public transportation. Otherwise, do not buy anything here, terribly expensive even when compared to other popular tourist locations. Try to arrange your toilet elsewhere.

Another Budapest 'WOW'. We seemed to be saying "wow" a lot as we walked or rode around Budapest. The castle is no exception. It looks stunning from Pest or a boat on the Danube when it's lit up at night.

Birds eye view of Budapest. Arrived at it via the funicular ride but walked down. Views from the palace courtyard are awesome. The museum shop inside has good things as souvenirs at reasonable prices.
Impressive!. Great to view at night from a riverside cafe and also impressive up close.It also leads onto the medieval town which is also a must see.

Must do in Buda!. No visit would be complete without stopping here. Need a full day to see the whole Castle District. Hop on Hop Off Bus is a great way to get there or the Funicular if you like waiting in line a bit. Changing of the guard every 2 hours....don't miss it.

Begin with history in Buda at the Buda Castle, and see Pest over the river: Romance, history, wonderful food nearby!. all of the sights of Hungary are beautiful, romantic, and historic. You need at least 3 days in Budapest! The food, the sites, the stature, it's amazing!
Top 10 places to visit. Did not go inside, but from the outside it was beautiful and imposing. Different from other castles.

a good way to spend the afternoon. We weren't able to go inside but the grounds outside were enjoyable to walk around. As with all of Budapest, the architecture, statues, fountains were beautiful. Stroll The Hill as much as possible as there are stores, restaurants and hotels to see as well.

Impressive castle on the Pest side of Budapest. The Buda castle is an imposing historical building on the Buda side of Budapest. It is best viewed from the Pest side. We especially enjoyed viewing it after dark when it was lit.

Labyrinth is open and a must see . We had a bit of trouble finding info on the labyrinth under the buda castle, as it's previously been closed under mysterious circumstances. It's definately open at the moment and was incredible, I think it's a must see in budapest. To find it, it's marked as number 15 on the buda castle site map. We found this more reliable than the locations marked via google maps etc. The door is marked "Labrinthus". It cost about 1000fnt to get in (about $5aud). There's about 1km of naturally formed cave/tunnel that has been used at different times by the castle for storage, cellars, and at one point a prison (where Dracula was held!). Some areas are in complete darkness so may be a bit scary for kids - take a light or a phone!

very good - reminded me of palace area in monaco. Fisherman's bastion - very beautiful and impressive with st Matthias church etc the palace area however seemed to have been mainly taken over by libraries and museums

Nice outing at the Buda castle.. I came in the back entrance, closer to the Danube. I found the preservation of the castle remains well done and contained in a good space. The summary information available was good, if limited. Individual items are only labelled in Hungarian. I suspect if you came in the front and got an audio guide, it would have been better. But it had some disjointed transitions.

Serene and Quiet Place. We stopped by Buda Castle but we never made it inside. We visited in wintertime when there are few visitors and the grounds are quiet and serene. You can take some great shots of the Danube and city from this spot. In the wintertime they sell mulled wine here ... a great way to start a tour of the grounds.
Beautiful view. This is a must see in Budapest.It is huge you can have a bit of a walk around, the view is stunning, especially when the lights come on in the evening. You can take stunning photos.

Can't go inside the castle........ Nice walk around it, nice views of Pest from Buda, compound is nice and touristy, Couple ofhours is all you need.
Besides views, not much going on

Top 1 attraction!. If you haven't yet, put down Buda Castle as the top 1 attraction on your list of things to see in Budapest. Located right alongside the Danube river (on Buda side of course), it is a beautiful building, that you can walk up to, and even inside! I strongly recommend you spend sometime there and explore the palace!

Amazing!. After visiting Matthias church we walk parallel of Danube and we passed outside of Hungarian president house before we arrive to the historical castle and palace complex. Castle hill is the best way to have a romantic walk.The architecture and panorama are impressive, view from Buda side to Danube and Pest side is incredible especially at night.We also used the cable car for leaving from castle and our son was very happy with that. Worth to visit place and spend your time.
worth a visit. We did this on a guided tour. Very lovely building but better with a tour guide. Great views across the city.

Buda Castle. Very interesting to see the decor remains of Soviet Bloc at the Buda Castle. We were here March, 2013. There was a musical competition for teens from around the world. They performing throughout Buda Castle. It was lovely. c
Spectacular and romantic. This is where you want to go for a romantic walk, with great sights including panorama, and a marvelous architecture being consistently kept in a slight decay.

Rich with History, Spectacular View. After crossing the suspension bridge from pest to buda (offering tremendous views of both) and a 10 minute walk up a winding stair to the castle, museums and office of the Hungarian president, the view of the Danube and Pest side of Budapest is amazing. The architecture, statues and building facades along the way and at the destination are tremendous. Enjoy!!!
Gorgeous..need I say more?. Beautiful architecture with outstanding views of Budapest. The Museum is also there...fantastic place to walk and take beautiful photos. A must in Budapest.

The things fairytales are made of. Loved this castle. I thought I was in fairytale land. There were many great photo ops and I couldn't get enough of it. The history was interesting and the architecture was unbelievable.

Everyone should visit. I loved the castle and the history attached to it. I did not like the fact that buses are not extended her. The taxi we got after missing the coach time table was quite cheap. so enjoyed the experience.

Magnificent building that towers above Buda!. On a recent visit to Budapest I had the opportunity to spend a bit more time on Castle Hill and get to really enjoy this grand "palace" of the Austro-Hungarian Empire. Almost too big to really appreciate up close, similar to the Parliament in scale the castle dominates one side of castle hill and provides breathtaking views of the Danube, lower Buda and Pest in the distance. If you have the time, visit the castle early in the morning or later in the evening when there are no crowds. The quiet and the scale are very humbling.
Just....Beautiful!. The Buda castle is one of the most stunning castles in Europe. It is very big with a lot of museums. You can also try your self in archery.

Not s castle but worth a visit. No castle but definitely worth a visit. The views are lovely from up there and St Matthias Church makes it even more worth it. Take the funicular saves on the legs, didn't think it was expensive as all saying but we did pay for return and would of been nice the walk down.

A Grand Castle. The castle, very much like the Viennese Palaces' of the Hapsburgs, demonstrated more than adequately the rich history of the Austro-Hungarian Empire. Perched high above the rest of the city, the view of the Danube, the Parliament and Pest side of the city were beyond beautiful. Quite grand and providing wonderful insight into Austro-Hungarian history.

The hike isn't worth it . A very mehhh museum experience...I found the whole experience pretty dry. It feels as though the museum curators just threw some paintings on the wall. This was not done with "soul" or even really with a clear purpose. The interior was just unimpressive.
Mix of Roman and Russian Architecture. One of the best place to see Mix of Roman and Russian Architecture in Buda, worth to visit in Summer time
Worrth a visit. The view is fantastic - we went up to the castle both during the day and in the evening. The castle itself is less than spectacular since it is not the original.

A must see place in Budapest: history, attractions and tastes. All you need is good weather to have a walk in the Buda Castle neighborhood, but even when it's too cold or raining you can have even a public bus to take a tour, because it worth it. The whole area is full of historical places, so I suggest to have a guide, at least from internet, because you can spend a whole week there if you want to see and understand everything.It's full of churches, museums, memorial places, restaurants, view, and always changing activities - I definitely recommend for everyone!
Overrated. We thought it will be a true castle but it was some remnants and a building that you cannot visit. They had some nice views from there and a restaurant.

Castle on the hill. Hike to the top or take the old, funky funicular. Either way, you've got to go see this awesome old castle. Most of it houses the Hungarian history museum (go see it!), but the grounds are being excavated thoroughly as an old Roman encampment has recently been found. Lots to see and do at the top of the hill!
definitely visit. Definitely visit the castle and the environment around the castle. Quite beautiful and a nice walking tour. Lots of people watching with live music to keep you in the mood.

A piece of history. The Buda Castle is on a hill overlooking the city of Budapest. It includes the palace and various other buildings. You can feel the history while you are there, and enjoy the view of the river and the city below. While there, we saw the changing of the guards with all its pomp and circumstance. A must-see during your trip to Hungary.
Smaller than expected. It looks very big and impressive, but once you are there, it's none of these things. It was a little dissapointing, but still nice to see.

Disappointing. This was a disappointment although the views from the terrace were spectacular. We didn't go inside as wanted to do other things with our time and the external view was not inspiring. Best viewed from the Pest side of the river

Beautiful views. Beautiful views as always. I didn't find much to interest me indoors but the views alone are worth the trek up the hill. We walked as the funicular railway was very busy, but the short walk wasn't too taxing.
one of the most fantastic castles. one of the most fantastic castles i have overseen,the magyar tribe were well advanced for thier ,time,must see

Unique. This castle is unique in its architecture. We walked up to the castle from the river side. The style is more Italian Renaissance. As we past through the side gates, towards the right, we eventually come to a castle wall that exhibits more Middle Eastern influence. As we went on a Monday when everything was closed, we did not get any guided tour to explain the background of the castle. However, the architecture and the view were superb. Definitely worth a visit.
Best sites in Budapest. Enormous -very well maintained, loads to see - including museum and national art gallery. Fountains, statues and more

Spectacular. What an amazing Castle - June in Budapest has many Festivals and we were lucky enough to visit one in the grounds of this Castle. It had it all music, great traditional food, crowds of tourists enjoying the sun and ambience of this great Festival. As day turned to night, The Castle became alight with charm - I felt that someone was going to come out and tell me to 'go home' - that I shouldn't be in this beautiful place with a beer and a sausage. Good on them for allowing Festivals in the Castle grounds - those of us without these beautiful Castles in our homeland, are grateful to have an opportunity to visit.

Night View---Just Waoooohhh. The Night view of the castle when it is lighted is just an experience intself....During the day you get the whole city view which just makes you feel there so much to budapest...The Setting of the Danube River coupled with the traditional Buildings in the backdroop is something which i will always remember and cherish....Happy Budapesting
historical icon. If you visit Budapest you must visit the Bud Castle. it is full of historical interest . it is crowded but magnificent

Go early in the day. Good for a wander early in the day when it's quieter. Great views of the city. Don't expect to see a castle - Buda Castle is the site on the hill containing lots of places to see including the Royal Palace, Matthias Church, Fishermans Bastion, Museums and much more. You could easily spend a day here especially if you go in the museums and there are a number of places to eat.
Good place to visit. The buda castle is on the buda hill and also very close the citadella - Nice set of museums and can be added as part of the mathias church and fisherman bastion touring route

Lovely precinct but doesn't compare with Prague Castle. If you haven't previously seen Prague Castle, then this would look quite special. It is certainly worth the visit, but it does not compare with Prague. Everything seems much younger, even Mattias Church, beautiful as it is, was only built around the turn of the twentieth century. At the South and quieter end is a poignant ruined church, with a poster display of the devastation caused by the battle for Budapest in 1945. Past the Matthias Church and approaching the enormous and visually impressive Royal Palace is a very large area of old building foundations (one of a church demolished in the eighteenth century) and a large area that looks something between a bomb site and an abandoned archaeological dig - at the moment it does not add anything to the overall impression of the area.
IMPRESSIVE. The view from the castle looking down the Danube and over Pest is worth the visit alone. The castle and surrounding area is busy with tourists but there is plenty of space for all.

Fantastic Views. The views of the city and Danube were incredible. Take the bus (16) to avoid the steep walk up Castle Hill. Then make sure you find the steps to St. Matthias church for more fantastic views of the city.

Grand views. The Castle complex offers another fantastic view of the Pest. We were not able to enter the galleries now housed there as we got there late in the evening. The grounds and views are stunning.
Excellent and vivid castle. Excellent, magnificent, stupendous castle and very colourful. A must visit if in Budapest. And you can view the Danube flowing thru from there too.
One of the many highlights........ A must see - by foot or by Venacular; the best view of the Parliament House from the Buda side. Changing of the Guard every hour by th ehour

No Visit Complete without Walking up to the Castle. It is a structure you will see from all over town, but it really is the views from up there that will blow you away. Walk across the Chain Bridge, and then up the hill...take a camera as there are incredible things to take pictures of the whole way. There's also some nice shopping up on the hill on the way to Matthias church...I found some better prices on souvenirs than down in the town. All in all, this is a must-do while in the City.
National Gallery. I strongly recommend to visit National Gallery. Hungarian masterpieces are worth to be seen. Entrance fee is not very expencive

Very large and impressive. I learned that when you are talking about a castle it is not just one building, but a group of buildings. Hence, don't expect to see Buda Castle in one day. It is not possible. It is an impressive series of structures and be prepared to walk on cobblestones.

Imposing Buda Castle on the Buda Side of Budapest. Right after we checked into the Budapest Marriott Hotel, we were impressed by the imposing view of the Buda Castle on the Buda Side of Budapest. Built along the western side of the Danube, one could not help but be impressed by the view of the Royal Palaces across the Danube. No royalties reside in the Buda Castle at the presebt time, but it is now home to the Budapest History Museum, the Hungarian National Gallery, and the National Szechenyi Library. Both during the day and at night, the sight of the Buda castle is awesome.You won't miss it when you're in Budapest. Enjoy the view.

Marvelous, especially the water facing side. Very interesting palace with quite diverse sides. Most interesting for me - the one facing Habsburgs road and also the side facing the river with prince Eugene and Turul statues. Nice place to walk around.

Beautiful. Was lucky 2 b here n Spring so to speak. Perfect weather excellent company and great wine and food made this visit unforgettable :)Njy ur visit here a must see. Lovely bars pubs and restaurants around.
Wonderful view. Great experience!The Buda castle is magic and especially the panorama.Without any doubts is one of the place to visit in Budapest.10+
Awesome view of the city . It's one of the must see places in Budapest it's a great view looking down and over the river to the pest side of the city

Day out in Buda. Catch the funicular near the end of Chain bridge to access the Buda Castle area. Convenient mode of transport which offers spectacular views over the Danube. Buda Castle and surrounding area are architectural gems.
Interesting. Another beautiful building in Buda. Lots of cobbles around the castle, so make sure you wear comfy shoes.
Views. We only took a quick tour of the castle - the views are good and this is the point where you can book the cable car to the bottom of the hill.
Quiet and relaxing. We went for a nice wonder round and it was nice to look at all the architecture but it would have been better if we'd had a map so that we knew what to look out for!

Nice to see. Everything is close by in Budapest. Had a lot of fun enjoying this city with my family. Seen it almost 20 years ago and came back- the city is doing a really nice job to keep the history updated and in good shape.

Beer Festival. I was here for a beer festival. I had never been to a festival which was hosted in the castle. This place has lot of things to see around the corner so dont miss it. The trolley will take you right at the top. Check the price of the trolley on internet
So many things to see at the top. After the hike up you will be rewarded, to avoid the lines we bought our tickets in advance. So many views of the pest side. It is lit up at night go see it.

Nice atmosphere, old buildings. If you like old buildings and tourist, this is the place to go. We had a lovely time in the old scene and ofcourse, people watching. If you are lucky, you can see the guards change. That is a nice show.
Beautiful. Central to the castle district, this structure is an important part. Take your time to wonder the ground and the surrounding area, there is much to do.

Beautiful historic building and gardens. Breathtaking photos await. Best time to visit is early morning when there are fewer crowds. Summer the area is alive with festivals and venders. Bring comfortable shoes and water along with your camera.

beautiful vastle. Buda Castle – A place you should definitely see in Budapest. It is the historical castle and palace complex located on cost of river Danube. The view is magnificent and I recommend to go in night, it’s even more beautiful.

WOW. Hike up all the way and do not forget to explore each and every corner of it , mind you it is HUGEEE . so you will need a lot of time but don't worry they got some nice restaurants as well if you feel tired ;) but do not stop to explore.
Be prepared to walk!. We thoroughly enjoyed exploring the grounds all around the castle. There were many walkways and levels to explore as we took pictures.

Amazing staff. I got there and tried to buy ticket.total was 2800.I tried to pay 3000 bill plus 300 coin to get rid of my coins and got 500 paper bill back.I had 250,front desk said no worries and she pai me 500 without getting the rest of 300 coin.Whole staff in museum were really polite and helpful. Paintings were good but not many written explainstion. you should get headphone for that

Funicular and Buda castle . Incredible! Close at 6 but you still can hang out in the evening on the outside. It's one of the things you cannot miss, the view to the Pest side is amazing. Don't forget your camera.

Beautiful views, easily accessible, middle of Baroque, Ottoman and 19th Century splendor. In the middle of 19th Century houses, churches, and public buildings, visiting Buda Castle is like stepping back into ancient times. Walk across the cobblestone square, observe the views from your vantage point, walk through the castle gardens and walkways. While commercialism has arrived, it is still possible to enjoy the historic importance of the site and its beauty. Easily accessible via public transportation or the Red Bus.
Worth a visit. The architecture was attractive and the views great. A nice cafe at the top too.Nothing to dislike. The walk here wasn't as tough as we thought it would be.
Beautiful castle. Amazing castle to walk around, lots of things happening and the change of the guard is always fun. Did not go inside.

great views. well worth a walk or funicular ride up to castle as views are great.theres a great little bar in one of the castle turrets that do nice coffees and beers and offers magnificent views over the city

Interesting place, a bit to modernized exterior.. Intresting place, sadly a bit to modernized. I myself work in City Planning, planning permissions and am very historically interested as well. Therefore it bothers me a bit that for excample windows has been replaced with modern large glass, and also other aspects of this castle has been replaced with modern type instead of keeping with it's history. Still worth a visit, definetly, but would had liked it to be more like it originally was meant to be.
Architecture, fine details. Big area to go around. Very nice architecture and lots of history into this building. A must see for travellers!

Buda View. What a monument and so well maintained. Lot of history at this place. Beautiful architecture and nicely carved sculptures. An excellent view of Budapest from the top. A great photo opportunity for all. Natural surroundings and green environment also maintained.

Underwhelmed. I think my expectations were far too high for the castle and I was really underwhelmed when I got there, there's so many beautiful castles in Europe that I assumed this one would be the same but it's really nothing special at all and I certainly wouldn't recommend coming here if you're trying to fit in all the best bits of Buda in a small period of time, there's lots of far better places to see. The views are good but there's definitely other places in Budapest to get a far better view.

Amazing place, like in the disney film. By the cableway is really easy arriving on the top of the hill.
Once you arrive there you understand how marvellous can be budapest.
The monuments are unbelievable, a stunning panorama and the parliament on the other side of the river <3
I really loved it.

Beautiful. This is a beautiful castle., with large grounds. Interesting history. We did not take a tour inside as it was a Sunday (not sure if they have interior tours). There are many events, on the castle grounds, there was a beer festival there when we visited.Interesting, when combined with a tour of the rest of the area.

Definitely worth a visit. Buda Castle is also known as the Royal Palace, and it certainly looks more like a palace than a castle. It is easily recognisable across the city, perched up in the hills over looking the Danube. The best views are from along the waterfront in Pest and the best way to reach it from Pest is to take the old fashioned funicular train up the hill which stops just outside the walls to the castle.This impressive looking building is enormous close up and is now divided into the Hungarian National Gallery and the Budapest History Museum, which I visited and is worth going in to learn more about the history of the building.It doesn't cost anything to stroll through the grounds and visit the Matthias Fountain or just admire the fabulous views. There are also a couple of coffee shops and restaurants although I didn't visit them so cannot comment. Definitely worth a visit on a trip to Buda.

Not worth it!. I think my expectations were just too high. When I saw the castle silhouette on the horizon, from the other side of the Danube, I said that we definitely had to go visit it. I was disappointed, as I expected to see something like Sissi's Palace in Vienna, or something like that. NOT A CHANCE!This one is only a waste of time.There are many beautiful places in Budapest, but this is not one of them, as the Palace is not even the real-deal.As it was mostly destroyed in WW2, they reconstructed and renovated it. This is no restoration, This is just a new building (in my opinion Restoration is a completely different thing than renovation).Too many buses, too many tourists, too much of everything. NOPE!

Beautiful place and stunning view. We went with my partner to see Buda Castle during the day and in the evening as well. Was absolutely stunning in both cases and definitely worth to walk around! There even were army musician, who made a nice atmosphere for visitors. It's really a place to walk, relax and enjoy a great day! A must see in Budapest!
Beautiful. Amazing sight. Budapest is a beautiful city. So much to see, so little time. The city was much bigger than we thought. Architecture at its best.

Iconic Site in Budapest. The Buda Castle is very large and can be seen from anywhere on the bridges connecting Buda and Pest, the river, or waterfront. The castle is on the hilltop of the Buda side of the river. The castle grounds are massive. I took a scooter to the top of the hill, but you can take the funicular. The walk up from the river is very steep. The castle is beautiful during the day, but it is stunning at night when it is all lit up. Make sure you have your camera and enjoy the walk around the castle grounds.

Grand Castle. We walked around the Castle but never went inside. This is a huge complex that speaks of Hungarian power in the past. Just walking around takes a good hour. The views of the City are as good as from the Hasalzblastya. The ruins next to the Castle are worth a visit. When visiting the Castle District do your homework as one building after the other has special significance and if you are unprepared or without a tourist guide, you quickly loose track of priorities and significance of different building as they are cluttred together in the walled area. I suggest you enter the walled area from the Funicular and make the Castle your first stop. If you enter from opposite side, you are dead tired by the time you reach the Castle. Too much to see, so best to come prepared and do some homework.
Beautiful from afar but uninspiring close up.. Part of a walking tour. If you wanted to walk the ramparts you have to pay. Great view of the city form the top of the hill though.

Iconic place to visit. One of the iconic places to visit, while in Budapest make it part of your walk from one side of the river to another and back. Great views, brilliant places to see and you get some exercise. Just hope for great weather like we had :-)

Great castle. Fabulous views over the Danube river. This can be easily reached via the Funicular or you can walk from a nearby metro station. Visit the history museum to see inside the old castle that the Royal Palace was built on. This includes some unique rooms.

Massive Impressive. Buda Castle is massive as it looms over the Danube and the Pest side of the city. Remodeled in the neo-classical style in the 19th century, it is even more impressive when lit up at night. Didn't actually get to go inside since our guide said it was difficult to gain entrance.

Lovely views over the Danube. Very nice castle which can be reached by funicular railway and where you can enjoy the views of Budapest and the river Danube. We did find that the coffee and tea prices has increased significantly since last year. We preferred to use the coffee house outside the castle grounds where the prices were a little lower.

Buda castle -it's closed on Mondays. Buda castle -it's closed on Mondays. That's what the different hop on hop off companies will never tell you. It's a waste going there on Mondays. Else it's a nice place to go for the ones who like such places.

Stately old lady.. If you really would like to see the grandeur of Buda Castle, first have look from Pest side of the city, across the Duna (Danube) River. The Castle is proudly perching on the top of a hill.The construction of Buda Castle began in 1243. During the more than 770 years of its existence, it has repeatedly besieged, captured, recaptured, damaged, and then has been restored.During the Second World War major part the Royal Palace and Castle District was destroyed. In the 1960s they were rebuilt and restored to their current condition. This is what we can marvel at now.You have several possibilities to get there. Walking is one of them. If you prefer some kind of transport, catch the No 16, 16A, or 116 buses, and I would advise to get off at Bécsi kapu square and stroll through the Castle District .It you want to get closer to the castle , stay on the bus till Dísz square. Currently it is a bit difficult to find the bus stop what originally was at Széll Kálmán square, but now I would rather call this part already Széna square. There is the bus stop at the front of the Burger King, at the corner where Ostrom Street turns into Széna square. These problems are temporary extended because of the rebuilding of Széll Kálmán square.Since the 22nd of May the above promenade accessible from to different places. From near Bécsi kapu, you can get up to Anjou promenade and from the Szentháromság street line onto Tóth Árpád promenade by elevator. The third new elevator operates on the other side. From under the Hilton hotel it goes to Iskola Street. All the three elevators are carrying wheelchairs. Of course first you still have to get somehow to the base of the Castle walls.The forth is an express lift. You have to go to Dózsa György square and from there to Palota Street. The lift starts from there and takes you up to the Széchényi National Library, what is part of the Buda Castle. There is a fee, 200.- HUF one way (less than USD 1.-), while the previous three are free of charges.Now, when you’re finally there, look around and enjoy the inimitable atmosphere of the castle. There is usually some kind of event, if you want some other entertainments as well.The Royal Castle contains the above mentioned Széchényi National Library, the Hungarian National Gallery, the Budapest History Museum, etc. There are plenty of things to see, so you can spend the whole day there easily.On the 5th of July a Csontváry exhibition will open, and it can be visited till the 31st of December. For me it is a must see thing, since Csontváry one of my favourite painters.Next to the Castle is the Sándor Palace, where the current President of Hungary always resides ,and where the Castle Hill Funicular arrives from the Buda bridgehead of Széchényi Chain Bridge. So this is another way to get up there. The funicular cost HUF 1200.- for one way, and HUF 1800.- for return.If you still looking for some entertainments go to the Castle Theatre, where the National Dance Theatre performs now.You can also try your skills in archery, or crossbow, or spear and shuriken throws. It depends what you prefer. Or just stroll around, and admire the many sculptures, the colourful flowerbeds, have a coffee, or a lunch, or buy a traditional Transylvanian funnel cake (what is not only good, but fun to eat as well), look at the wonderful panoramic view of the Duna River, the bridges, the Parliament House and the St Stephan Basilica from the walls of the Castle, the choices are endless.The Buda Castle will provide you with a nice experience and wonderful memories later on.
Pretty. Lovely!! We walked up as the funicular has ridiculous queues and it isn't a hard climb at all! Wonderful views of Budapest! The beer festival was there when we went which was amazing too!

A must-see on your Budapest trip. Definitely visit the Buda Castle complex atop the city of Budapest. It has a great history museum and you can still see some of the original medieval castle, underneath the repaired version.
Interesting. Interesting visit on the top of Buda hill. Good position to hawe a great wiew on Budapest. one of the best place to see in Budapest
Buda Castle. When in Budapest it is a must see location. Take your time to take in all it offers. Amazing architecture.
Wonderful with the lights on. Buda Castle can be seen very widthly all over Budapest. It looks nice with the lights on, but the area is huge if you go over there. Be ready to walk a lot.

A big Surprise. I expected to go and see a castle building. Instead the Buda Castle is a walled city...people actually live there. There are shops, schools, restaurants and a fabulous view. What a great surprise.

Go in late afternoon. There are big crowds in the morning but when we returned in the afternoon, not many people were around. It's a beautiful vantage point to look out on the Danube and Buda. I'm sure the night view when everything is lit up would be spectacular.

Good views of Pest. The walk up to the castle is nice, as are the views of Pest. The castle itself is not amazing. I would say that the Parliament building is a much nicer piece of architecture than the castle. But I guess the castle does have more history.
Nice. Budapest alltogether is a very nice city, with incredible architecture, well worth its place among the European capitals.
Gorgeous. One of the kind castle to see, we even seen that movies are filmed there, so must be pretty authentic. Some of the things I have not seen before.

A Wonderful View and Good Art Gallery but...... The castle is on the tourist trail and is expensive and commercial. Having said that you can not but admire the fabulous views along the Danube and over Pest. The castle has some wonderful art on display - don't miss some of the modern pieces. Worth a visit but go in the early morning, don't eat there and expect to pay to go to the loo!

Impressive, and as you descend inside, it keeps on going!. Visited with the Budapest card, so included. Entered from the back, so went through all the deepest parts first. Impressive, and littered with all sorts of treasures collected during excavations. They tell you all about those as well. Some lovely paintings as well. You do need a fair amount of time to do this place justice.
Worth a visit. The castle is very well maintained and gives a good sense of how things were when it was in full use. Lots of shopping in the small streets around the castle
Interesting. Watched the changing of the guards which was very impressive! Lots of good photo opportunities and more to see than expected.

Interesting and historical. A few hundred meters away from Fisherman's Bastion, the place is massive and is a must to visit when you're in Castle Hill. A lot of areas where you can take a lot of pictures of detailed statues and architecture of that era. The area houses the Fountain of Fishing Children, National Széchényi Library, Budapest History Museum, Mace Tower among other sights.
The Castle. This is amazing history. Hungary lost two wars and 80% of the city's was rebuilt. Most of it is not as old as it looks. The Castle was rebuilt starting in the 1950s

Beautiful old castle. It is a must visit place when you are in Budapest. Either take the Hop on and off bus or the local bus No 16 or the funicular train near the chain bridge. This part is the Buda section and from the top you get a spectacular view of the city and at night you get a breathtaking views of the parliament and the vigado hall. In the morning they have a ceremony for changing of guards (not sure if daily, visited on sunday).Nice architecture and if you intend to buy souvenirs from Budapest get it from here and not from the town. You get exactly the same thing and is cheap, get ready to bargain and if possible change to the local currency. Though they still accept euros.

Go at night for amazing views. Best views of chain bridge, the icon of budapest. Fantastic views at night, especially when the city is lighted up, and the bridge is simply stunning. Safe to do so as alot of tourists and locals alike go there to enjoy the views or for a drink. There is a funicular to the top if you are lazy to climb, but the view is worth the climb

Introduces you to a completely new city of Buda just on the other side of Danube.. By just crossing the Danube river and climbing (or riding) uphill introduces you to the hill town of Buda, a completely refreshing exerience of a booming hill town will excellent views of the Pest side.

Poetry city. It was on the hill . YOu can go by bus or by walk , but walking can be confuse :)Museum was expensive we walked around in palace. If you go in summer there is a festival in here. You can see Traditional staff and foods. not so cheap. ıt ıs the place that you sen see panaromic Budapest. Especially on the evening.. Many lights and unbelivable Budapest.. Waits you... go soon
Buda Castle. Beautiful views of the city! Be sure to arrive around noon to see the changing of the guard at the President's residence. Quite impressive!

Beautiful views. The area around the castle have great outdoor cafes very picturesque. The church is beautiful too. Walking down to the town lots of little markets with great gift - make sure to buy some Paprika!

I Thought I had seen them all ........ As I said,, I thought I had seen them all .... This one ranks near the top.. for beauty, religious experience etc.. you have to visit this church.. It sure stands tall in relationship to Budapest... A MUST see when you are in BUDA and the BASTION area.... TAKE THE TIME !!!!!!
Lots to see. There are so many things and places to visit around here, lots of museums and old statues and some lovely places to eat.
Avoid the crowds. We walked around the place at night and were surprised at how easy that was and also how quiet. Beuatifully lit up and peacefull .

castle. what a splendid castle stands out on the buda hills and theres everything for the sightseer and so much to look at we went around the wall s had a go at the archery and entered the art gallery with in the castle and on learning the history of this great castle was amazed at the amount it had , me being a novice on Hungarian i like to think now i have been educated a bit more still not a pro yet but will going back

Magnificent Grandeur Overlooking the Danube. Buda Castle dominates the hillside on the Buda side of the Danube. The massive and elegant structure is impressive when viewed from the Pest side of the city. You can reach the site by climbing the steps (about 100) or taking the Funicular. Once at the castle you can watch the changing of the guard, explore the walls and monuments, marvel at the glorious Matthias Church, and visit the Fishermens Bastion.

You won't regret. This has to be a part of your visit in Budapest. There are many things to see there, it takes a lot of time, but you'll enjoy. It's marvelous. :) You'll most certainly have to walk a lot.

Panoramic views, little market, free to walk around. You could easily spend a few hours wandering around this area - you can take the lift up the side of the hill to get there - much more relaxing and enjoyable! There was a small market whilst we were there - the stalls looked semi permanent with handmade souvenirs, snacks and hot drinks. At the top of the hill lift and along the side of the Castle and Royal Palace are views across the Danube and the city - great for photos. The cobbled streets and gardens are free to walk around however we did not pay to enter the building itself.

Really nice place. Perfect view on the city, castle is really nice place. This place is "have to see" in Budapest and I enjoyed it there. You can walk up to the castle or use small train, but it is easy hike.

Must visit. Ok I admit we did not pay entrance fee for any of the sights on the hill and we did not enter into any of them. BUT we did have a lovely time walking around, enjoying the ambience, view and history. Easy few hours of walking around.
Interesting. Get an audio guide if it's available. Things definitely become more interesting when you hear the stories behind each room, painting, etc. A really nice place.
Worth the climb. When we visited it seemed very quiet, however it is impressive because of its size. It houses the historical museum of Budapest. Once again the views are good.

Do visit the caves beneath the castle. The caves beneath the castles are just amazing. The one which I visited was free of charge. But be prepared that it would be cold underneath. Apart from the caves do take pictures of the awesome Buda castle as it has a magnificient architecture.

Not a great piece of architecture, but the art gallery is fine. The castle was reconstructed after getting bombed. However, we lucked into a free concert, and the acoustics are wonderful. We also enjoyed walking through the art galleries.

Very nice to see Budapest beneath you. It is nice since you get to ride on the cable car and get a view of Budapest beneath you .. However we went there beginning of January 15 and it was freezing !!!

GREAT VIEW POINT. The castle and surrounding areas are like a beautiful small village. We walked over Chain Bridge and took the funicular up to the Buda Castle and all within the same grounds are The Mathias Church and Fishermans Bastilon. There are some great views of the city from here. You can also walk up or down Castle Hill if you don't want to take the funicular.
Delightful. Give yourself lots of time to wander around the area as there is lots to see. Don't miss the ruins at the Hilton that have been turned into a bar- delightful.

Buda Castle is a must see!. Buda castle offers extensive views over the Danube and Pest. It is a huge, architecturally beautiful building with lovely gardens and the size of it means you don't notice the crowds too much. We spent a long time just gazing at the stunning views. You have to pay for entrance, but the views are free.

Must see, beautiful and historical site. I did not actually go into the castle because I felt that taking it in from the outside was amazing as it was. The hike up to the castle was one of my favorite parts of my trip to Budapest, but for those not wanting to do the trek there is a funicular up the hill. The view from the top is beautiful. More signage around the castle would be helpful, definitely read up on it or bring a guidebook with you if you are not with a tour guide.

Beautiful Pest+Danube Views. Castle is a must see to enjoy the beautiful city and Danube views. What I really like about the castle is its spaciousness and allowing to look at the city with its long and accessible front walls. Also if you decide to walk, there is a nice elevator at mid-point that takes you to the Castle level, it made our live a lot easier.

Outside vs Inside. Very beautiful from the outsider with lovely gardened surroundings and astonishing views of the Danube! But just don't buy na entrance to check out the inside: too expensive and boring!
I recommend!. If you go to Budapest you have to go to Buda Castle! Mainly because the castle is really huge and beautiful! And you will be delighted with the view from there!
Great View. It has a great view of the city and river. It is very pretty at night when all the gas lights are on.

Iconic view of the city. Love this view.... Go there every time I visit Budapest. Great place to relax and have a drink. I also went back for some nighttime photography, which turned out spectacularly. Night is great - the crowds are gone, but you feel safe and can easily still get a city bus.

Very touristic place. The castle itself is almost not worth the visit.
The view is magnificent and the village and other attractions near the castle make the trip worth while.
The Funicular trip cost 6EUR(06/2015) and has a cue of about an hour and the bus ride takes 5 minutes and cost 2EUR (Round Trip) but is less touristic.

Spectacular. Took us half hour in the queue to ride the Funicular up to the castle. While standing in line we were hassled constantly by hawkers trying to sell hop on hop of bus tours as well as restaurants and concerts. It was fun going up in the funicular. We walked around the outside of the castle- no charge and it is magnificent. Restaurants there. Also they charge fl 280 to use the WC, so be sure to take coins.Definitely worth the visit

Grand building on top. this castle is visible from most parts of Budapest coz of its location high up on the hill. You can walk up or take the bus or reach up by the funicular . The castle for most part is a museum , a library of important books etc. As such we didn't see or find an entry to a castle setup . But the fountain ,the exterior all have gone through major renovations & look grandiose . Photo Opp galore , the river the pest side all visible & wow moments a plenty .

The Buda side is on one side and the Pest is on the other and the Buda Castle was connected to our hotel. It was great.. I think going off season is the key to getting good rooms and people are kind and will help you with directions.

Good views of area and lots to see up here.. Castle complex is worth the visit. There is much to see and this was a big part of the Hungarian past. Budapest was a co-capital of the Austrian Hungarian Empire, and this Castle was the center of that former glory.

Beer Festival ! Every June. There is nothing better than visiting the Buda Caste and drinking beer on its historic grounds, drinking a variety of regional beers, eating local foods and enjoying music until apparently wee hours of the night.... Great way to spend the evening! or afternoon....I would build my trip around timing with this festival...Oh yes... The castle and its surrounding area are beautiful and a must see when in town...

Nice to see. We could not find any entrance to the castle except to the gallery. Perhaps there is none? The grounds and the views of the Danube are very nice. We were lucky to hear a quartet of girls busking and singing religious music a cappella.

Nice if unspectacular . we travelled on a beautiful day as part of a guided tour. There are some interesting stories about the castle and some good views as well including the impressive Mathias fountain. Change of the guard at 4 is a nice quirk. However there are far more spectacular versions of similar in Europe and the castle is perhaps not helped the fact it's been rebuilt so often hence lacks a little identity. In summary, nice, interesting but not spectacular

Wonderfull. Everything about this place is nice. Beautiful surrounding and nice atmosphere. what else can I say. I don't think anyone will be disappointed visiting this nice castle. I will recommend to anyone.
Beautiful castle and stunning views. The castle is beautiful, just like a fairy tale castle with the most amazing views. It is well worth the trek up the hill to reach it.

European History. a little more then two centuries ago the cities Buda and Pest have been two places hither and tither the danube river, connected by a bridge. As the city grew to one area connecting the two areas the castle became a central place for both sides to negotiate future perspective of the city and the entire country overlooking both parts and the river. Today it is a well kept sight and symbol of a growing area in the european monarchies

Brilliant views and interesting local stuff to see. Walking up was good cardio (not for the faint hearted) and there's heaps of interesting buildings, castle ramparts and churches here - but the views over the Danube and of the ridges and Parliament are the best bits.

Don't miss this!. Don't miss this! The views are magnificent! A visit here provides an instant understanding of the reasons why this was the perfect location for an ancient fortified city! Access is easy, by cliff-lift or bus, otherwise climb the hill yourself for the best impression!
Night is best!!!. Great city views. Beautiful spot to meander around. However best photos of Buda castle are from the bridges or opposite riverside and a must see at night for pics ;-) .

Looks better from Pest. We walked up to the Castle which was a nice short walk - it's not as high up as it seems so it's a very easy walk. But when we got up there the museum was closed (because it was a Monday) so don't go on a Monday if you want to go inside. The castle itself didn't look that amazing close up but the view of Pest from there is beautiful though so definitely worth a trip.
Beer Festival. This was a spectacular venue for the beer festival and a lot of fun. Few tourists and even fewer stag parties. Really fun. Amazing views

City centre break. Spent 2 days in Budapest as a city break with wife and daughter. The Buda castle is one of the best places to visit to see a fantastic view of the city and also gain some historic understanding of the city.
A Highlite of visiting Budapest Hungery. On of the best series of grand exhibits in all of Hungary. A not to be missed site when visiting Budapest! Great view from Castle grounds.
Dont miss this!. A place You should not miss.Great views and great architecture. This really history.You just have to take the time to visit this place

Historical ! Amazingly beautiful ! A must-visit !. Each time I visit Budapest I make it a point to spend time at the Buda Castle(also known as the Royal Palace) and adjacent area as it is bursting with life and gives a great view of the Danube river with the Chain Bridge and the Pest city. The area is also home to lovely museums ! Castle Hill, a World Heritage Site, showcases wonderful Gothic arches, very old Baroque houses, cobblestone streets along with lovely cafes and souvenir shops.Some houses were built in the 14th and 15th century AD. I took a taxi to reach the Hill but the entire sightseeing was done on foot and that meant a great deal of walking around and it is absolutely a delight to walk around in the Castle hill area. It goes without saying that if you are visiting Budapest then visiting Buda castle and spending time at the castle hill is a must !

Only got an exterior view, worth the walk.. Ran out of time, and was just closing as i arrived so i was only able to view the exterior but well worth it, and another amazing Baroque building as Budapest is known for. I spent an hour rushing around the outside, and still didn't get it all. Inside is a museum largely devoted to the Habsburg rule of Budapest & Hungary, will leave to others to comment. Not only is the building amazingly beautiful with a huge archway entrance but their are numerous sculptures on the tops of the building to view and plenty Habsburg heraldric shields of varying types - both personal & family ones. As you walk in there is Matthias's fountain, built in the 1600's that is a momument in itself. I stupidly allowed only one day for the Buda Castle/Hill complex - DON'T make the same mistake. You need 2 days at least, 3 if you actually know and appreciate the history.A must see.NB most attractions in this part of the world are closed Mondays. Take into account.

Beautiful views to Danube. Buda castle is a wide area, inside the old walls of Buda. You can walk among the walls, you can find cafes and restaurants inside and definitely take several photos of river Danube from up there. Don't forget to visit Hungarian National Gallery. It is worth experience.

Well worth the walk up. Its possible to ascend to the castle by a funicular but queues can be long earlier in the day or just after lunch we found quieter.However the walk up is interesting and not as daunting as first considered there are new lifts to take visitors up too. Apart from the architecture and history of the Castle there are the most amazing views from the castle of Pest and the Danube.

old wine. I regularly visit Buda Castle whenever I am in Budapest. The place is just getting better with time. There is always something new to discover. Even my favourite spots offer something I haven't noticed.

On the hill with all the great monuments. Buda Castle is a museum now, had not enough time to go in with all the other great monuments to look at on the hill. If you go on a cruise, give yourself at least 5 days ahead or after if its a round trip.
Fabulous views. The castle overlooks the Danube and really both sides of the city including the gorgeous Parliament House on the Pest side. This is a wonderful way to get your bearings.
Impressive castle and views. Historical and magnificent. A must visit to Budapest. make sure your there at midday for changing of the guard. They are excellent and one of the best I've seen.

High on the Hill. The Buda Castle is on the Buda side of the Danube located on a high hill overlooking the Pest side. It's an easy walk to the base of the hill - then a funicular ride up the hill - or if you prefer - bus #16 travels from central Pest to the top of the hill. The castle area and grounds offer great views of the river and the city.

Just Classic!. Another not to be missed place to visit! Buda Castle is in the 1st district and can be accessed by joining a tour. According to our guide, this area has witnessed many wars and conquests dating back from the 13th century! It has been destroyed a few times but as you can see it has been rebuilt to what it was before or in a similar style. From here you can walk to other nearby attractions.
Must see. Truly an amazing structure, historic and locations gives an excellent panoramic view of the city and area.

Grandiose. I love this place particularly in summer during the Festival of Crafts, there are a lot of creative crafts and that feeling, hmm. Don't miss it when you're in Budapest in August. But not just this time, it's a great place for a walk and you have a great view to the city, the Danube, wonderful - especially at night. You will love it too.
The beautiful and gorgeous. This palace is a mus if you visit budapest.. A great european architecture with fantastic view of the city

An iconic building of Budapest. The Castle of Buda, was strongly damaged during WWII, and only its exterior has been restored. It is illuminated by night and really looks good. The chateau complex regroups now an Hungarish art museum, and the Museum of Budapest history. Do not expect any historical interior, as it can be shocking to be in an old looking building with a modern interior structure. Hungarian art Museum is ok for art lovers, but not a must see.
Very old and quant.. A nice quiet place to visit after the hustle of Pest. Buses are regular and the hop-on hop-off buses stop outside.
Amazing. After a hefty walk to the top of the castle, the views and atmosphere make it all worth while. I would consider staying closer to here on my next visit.
Get early in the day for,the best experience. A large variety of views, buildings and stops. It gets real hot and packed so get there well,before noon.

Great building, view and surroundings. It's the whole package. The building itself is gorgeous, but you can also enjoy equally the surroundings and the astounding view of the city beyond the Danube. Set aside a couple of hours at least to explore all there is to see.
Fantastic. The castle is no longer in use for royalty, but houses an art gallery, and has cafes overlooking the danube and the Pest side of the city. Definitely a can't miss attraction.
Budapest. Took the tour bus up and spent the morning walking and enjoying the magnificent views. Some shopping but bought very little. Beautiful buildings including Fisherman's Wharf.
Must book in advance.. Selected days for guided tour. I missed it.. Coz i didnt pay attention that there are only 3 days out of whole week for guided tour... I will go again just for buda castle..

The most charming spot in Budapest, Hungary.. All of Budapest is charming, quaint, and historical but you cannot miss this gem. I could spend weeks walking the streets of this eastern European city which used to mark the end of the Roman civilization--the other side of the Danube was Magyar, and the Romans seldom ventured east.

Buda Castle. This is well worth the walk over the chain bridge. Beautiful building and we visited the Budapest history museum.. Fre of charge if you are a EU citizen and over 70 in age. Avoid Taxis the prices are ridiculous.

Fantastic older part of the city. Easy to get to using the funicular railway next to the chain bridge. Easy to forget that you are wandering around part of the city that people live and work in. It feels as though it has been established just for the tourist. Many buildings to see, including the National Gallery and library, presidents palace and underground hospital. Also many lovely shops and places to eat to suit all tastes

Beautiful. Had a quick look yesterday and now going on a tour - the whole area is wonderful and want to see the artisan stores. The views are terrific (although Gellert Hill can't be beat) but lovely cafes, and medieval village alongside - changing if the Gards every hour but Noon is the most spectacular
Definitely a highlight. Anyone visiting Budapest would have to see Buda Castle. A landmark, on a mountain above the city, with a magnificant view of the Danube and Pest....must see.
Amazing.. The walk is really worth it!!Definitely, one of the must do in Budapest (Buda side).Once you arrive to the top, you'll get an spectacular view of Pest.
super duper. you should go, for real. walk around, explore a bit and let your eyes take in the sights. amazing view of the city
Castle experience. Really lovely place. Views amazing. Cobbles everywhere so make sure you wear flats.The castle grounds are vast. Would definitely recommend a visit.

Not so much a castle anymore. This is a cool building which dominates the view from the Pest side of the river. However, it's not really a castle anymore, mostly being made up of a gallery and museums. The building is nice and there is a beautiful fountain there. Good to see, but nothing special/
So cool!. Went for the market, great finds. Views were amazing! A fun place to explore. Area around the castle,is really nice too.

Amazing view of the entire city. Now a museum and no longer really a castle but the views from the Buda Castle are magnificent of the Pest side. You can take pretty good pictures of the Parliament building and the walk up the castle is sure to get rid of any cellulite you may have.

Gorgeous Fountain. Really nice changing of the guard we caught that was a bonus. Nothing to flash inside again another castle the was ravaged during the war. Architecture was amazing there is lots of little things you would walk by so I advise a tour guide or research before arriving.

The best place to see the pest side !. Well this place is amazing. you can reach if just after the chain bridge. there are two ways to climb it.you have a small rail car( you should pay and lot of people are waiting at the queue) and i preferred to climb it by foot. it took 10-15 mins. but the beautiful sceneries will remove your tired. cheers

A lovely area. This is an amazing area before going I thought it was just the Castle but it's a whole area I think my favourite part of Budapest could easily spend a day there restuarants etc great atmosphere just loved it
Landmark!. A must visit in Budapest! Simply brilliant architecture and certainly a great landmark!!! Was spellbound by the beauty of it!

Thumbs up for the museum. This Baroque - Medievalist/Austro/Hungarian architectural folly is positively dripping with history, which induces blurred vision, weakening of the loins and general tourist lassitude after more than an hour of heavy pavement pounding. However, it's highly recommended if just for the museum, which is a valuable introduction into the artistic and cultural heritage of Hungary. You can also go into the dome to get an expansive view of Buda and Pest bisected by the serpentine majesty of the Danube. Tip: if you want to take photos within the museum, then you MUST buy a "photo ticket" at the ticket counter. You will be stopped and ASKED for this ticket if you are seen photographing in the museum. If you are CAUGHT without a ticket, then adopt a "I'm so sorry I didn't know about such a thing and will quickly rectify my mistake" attitude. Where some museums might ban photography (or allow it for free), the museum has adopted the grubbing capitalist approach presumably after shedding the collectivist coils of its post-Communist hangover.

Walking the Castle. Be ready for a walking and sightseeing extravaganza. Take money for gift buying. The garnet jewelry is beautiful, and you'll want to take some home for friends. Also, be sure your camera is will charged.
Nice view. Nice place to enjoy the sunset and the night, from there you will the parliament, the Liberty Statue and the Basilica, and the bridges!

Beautiful from the outside, quite beautiful to view from the Danube!. We were on a walking tour and visited the outside of this castle which was quite large on a hill overlooking the Danube.
