We drove by the outside part when on the bus tour o the old town of Buda, you can tour inside but apparently not all the old artifacts are there.
Its grand.... Its fine for something to do. Is it special, well I can only compare it to my other experiences like Prague castle and it has nothing on Prague. But it's fine for a gander
Gallery. Inside there is a fantastic gallery. Paintings and statues. Outside great architecture and view of Budapest.

The view! The view! The view.. It looks stunning from across the Danube and is worth a visit. The castle looks like it is just out from some fairytale, but the view from the top of the castle is just exceptional. Beauty! Stunning!I wish it had been preserved without creating modern structures inside.But a must visit for the panoramic view it offers. The view is better than the view from Budapest eye.It requires a lot of climbing and walking and atleast 2-3 hrs.
beautiful castle. It is the most prettiest castle i have ever seen in my life. It gives a great City view with Danube river and all nice architecture of the city.must visit,
Incredible place. The sight from here is amazing (day and night). Expensive for food, but lots of monuments to see around it.
Buda Castle. A very interesting place to visit. Covers a lot of area and needed a half day to take it all in. A definite place to explore
Budapest's castle. It seems amazing when you see it from down, from Pest side, but when you actually get near to it seems that it is not renovated and it seems untidy.

Museums. Very interesting presentations about the history of Buda, Obuda and Pest. Dating from 10,000 BC. Not only were artifacts presented but different periods were presented by the art of the times.

What a View. I skipped the line to ride to the top and ran up. It took 6 minutes. It was a beautiful day after several days of rain, so everything was nice and it was great for picture taking. Come early, catch Tram 19 at the Gellert if you can get here before 9 you will have the place pretty much to yourself. Easy walk to the Fisherman's Bastion, then catch a bus or just walk down to Szell- Kellman Ter and your back in the city. The WC facilities cost 200 HUF
Pure nature. The whole area of the castle offers a great view to the visitor and many places to hace a walk. Many sights and spots of interest.

Well worth the visit for the views of the Danube and Pest. The Buda Castle was almost completely destroyed during WWII. It's completely rebuilt so it resembles the original castle. The facade of the Castle is not the original stone due to the cost. The tour inside is not worth taking but definitely go for the views of the Danube River, the Chain Bridge, Parliament and much of Pest. Over by Fishermans Bastion the views of the River are somewhat obstructed by trees but the view at the castle is completely open, no trees interfering with your pictures. If your there around noon or 3 in the afternoon there's a neat ceremony for the changing of the guard. Go there for the great photos you can take outside.

Another great piece of history to enjoy. WE had a nice walk around and enjoyed the photo opportunities... A great place to visit. There is some amazing tile work in the arches on the front of the castle.

The views are worth it. Just the views from this castle are amazing and so picturesque that it's worth the visit. There is a army drill that happens every 15-20 min which is great fun for the kids to watch. They commence with an authentic drum roll which then leads to a little March ceremony. My children aged 7 & 10 throughly enjoyed this. The castle is stunning. Very different from the usual Parisian or English castle architecture. Very enjoyable indeed. Just a tip- Budapest was considerably cheaper than Paris so we took the hop on hop off bus tour and throughly enjoyed the visits. I would recommend eating at the many outlets at the castle considering they are not that pricey. Many people opted not to go inside the castle, which is fine too as the exterior is beautiful. The surrounding views of Budapest are worth a million. We throughly enjoyed it!
Unbelievably Picturesque!. I couldn't take enough photos of the stunning view and the beautiful architecture. You cannot take a bad photo here from any angle.

Check out the free galleries!. Using Rick Steves, you can visit or bypass the paid for portion of this Palace and find a hallway filled with much info and artifacts about the palace and its inhabitants. There is a WC in the cafe which costs some small change, as well as sweeping views of Pest and of course great people watching. Get her in the afternoon to avoid much of the crowd who tends to get here first thing in the morning. Many places to sit and take it all in.

THE VIEWS FROM THE RAMPARTS OVERLOOKING THE DANUBE ARE MAGNIFICENT. I've seen so many castles in my lifetime that this one did not impress me. If you want castles, go see those built by Mad Ludwig or travel the Loire Valley or the great country houses of England. . .but the view from this castle's ramparts, gazing across the Danube towards the ornate and altogether unique Parliament building is one of the most spectacular in all Europe. Don't miss it!
Beautiful!. Beautiful city in a beautiful city! it is a must! placed in a high hill, you can see all the Pest side!!

Breath taking place!. We liked everythng specially the view, also it is very well preserved, it also has souvenir shops and restaurants, but you need to reserve way in advance, since is one of the most desirable places for lunch or dinning..

This is a must do !. Very agreable to stroll in this area... don't miss the beautiful Matthias church ( mátyás templon ). You need to buy a ticket but for sure you will not regret it. Also visit the beautifull terrace café with wonderfull view of Pest. There is a gypsy orchestra with nice music. We had a gulash soup and a nice glass of white wine. I didn't had the feeling it was expensive. 5 euro for a nice soup with fresh bread !
Great views. Great photo position for all of Pest. Liked the views. No dislikes. Good coffee lounges. Plenty of museums and a great church to visit.

Breath-taking views. Budapest us a very beautiful city. The views from the Buda Castle are just stunning! We spent the afternoon at the museum, and visiting the basilica. Very few vehicles are allowed there, so strolling the street was quite enjoyable. The area surrounding the castle is very historical and there street was lined with booths of vendors selling snacks and souvenirs. I highly recommend visiting Budapest!!

Pure history with amazing views. This is a must see place in Budapest, lhe place is diferent from everything i have ever seen, an excelent surpise like the city of Budapest itself. The view from the castle and also the view from the Danube river at night is breath taking.

Just for the views. The castle looks so amazing at night. It almost look ethereal with all the lights lite up. Upon visiting it for real though, we were dissappointed that it is only good for an expansive view of Pest. You are fine as long as u dont expect to find a castle that u can roam about.

Great views. You can either walk up to the castle, use the trolly car pulled up the side of the hill by cable, or use the hop on - hop off bus tours that stop near the top. The views of the rest of the city are excellent. You must visit here during the day time to see the city, but visit Pest during the night to see the castle lit up. (Katy Perry also filmed some of here video Fireworks here)

Magnificent views. It is well worth the effort to get to the Castle as the views are amazing. The gardens are beautiful also and there are lots of things to see. Inside the castle is an excellent gift shop and various galleries. As a 70+ entry for me was free, as was all public transport.
The views. More stunning views are to be had from Buda Castle. The castle itself is good but the views over the beautiful city of Budapest are outstanding.
Stand proud above the city. See the city and the Buda hills from the grounds of the castle. We did not venture inside the castle but did see the changing of the guard (at 11am).

Large complex. This is a large complex, free to walk around. There are fees for some areas. If you like to take pictures, you can get amazing views of the city. Close enough after to walk across the bridge to Old Town.

Another amazing sight in Hungary. Turets, old fascinating doors, beautiful old buildings. Everywhere you look there is another wonderful thing to see. We walked from Castle Hill and it was just lovely.

The views are better than the castle itself.. The actual castle was, to be honest, a little disappointing, however the surrounding area and views are fantastic. There is so much more to discover and the views are just superb. It's quite a trek up, but a must to do with so much waiting for you at the top. Looks o impressive at night time with some super lighting.
A must!. We caught the big red bus up to Buda castle to save us walking and it was defiantly one of our highlights of the trip, great view over the city and a nice afternoon spent.

Classic Grandeur. Although a part of it was destroyed during WWII, the building still manages to impress. I only walked around the outside but it's very easy to imagine horse-drawn carriages, grand dukes and their elegant debutants dancing around the place.
In winter the place was deserted at night, which allowed us to dance in one of the courtyards.

nice walk - nice view. it is a nice walk up the hill - there is also a tram but it is not far to walk.we were lucky and there was some Kind of Food fair around the Castle when we got up, which livened it up a lot too. it is a nice place to just sit on a wall and look down as you have the whole of Budapest in front of you.
Beautiful View. In this country of castles this is one that is a must see. Most beautiful view ever! Amazing to look at both at close and at a distance.

More to it than just a castle. Spent some time looking around the grounds of the castle. Didn't go inside except to have a coffee & bun (good price) and use the toilets (had to pay....). Changing of the guards was a good but brief show. The church was beautiful. Stunning view across to Pest. Well worth the visit.

Grand Castle. I approached the castle from the front gates accessible from my walk through Castle Hill first. The gates announced you were at the castle and are beautiful. I walked all around the castle and even though there were a lot of people outside the gate it didn't feel crowded during my walk. As everyone has said the views are spectacular. There is a museum you can enjoy and many stops around that provide with a spot to sit. Turrets and old doors remind you of the past and add a touch of spice to your visit. The history this provides will help make your stay in Budapest even more interesting.

Budapest - Beautiful views of Pest from hills of Buda. While the Buda castle itself is huge, the architecture is not historically correct, and many parts have not been built correctly. BUT, the views over the Danube to all the rooftops are incomparable! A total must see, and the best at night.The remainder of Buda is interesting and beautiful, and there is a museum in the castle if you choose to view it's contents.
Immense. Enormous but not so particular, inside there some museum but It is not possible to visit the ball saloon at the and only the exterior part. Good the view from the terrace of all Pest

Towering over Budapest in all its Glory. Take the tram up or be challenged by the endless stairs lol the views from here are amazing! lots to see and do. I didnt make it inside the castle due to time but wandering the grounds was an experience all in of itself.
Worth a visit. Although we did not manage to go due to time restrictions, we heard very good comments about it from other visitors

The most visited attraction in Budapest.. You should use the Lift to get up to Castle Hill, it provides with spectacular views. Afterwards, look around and get some pictures. It's probably one of the best views in the city. The entrance, though, to see the art exhibit inside the Castle, I would have skipped it completely. It's an exposition about Hungarian painters, although nice, not worth the money or time.

Great view of the city but preferred the Bastion more. I liked the castle hill area a lot but I much preferred the Fisherman's Bastion and the church. The castle hill provides great views over the city including the bridge and the Parliament and you could grab a coffee or lunch there but I did not stick around that long. Still a must see.
A bit of a ruin.. But the Palace next door is a grand structure. Towering over the Danube. This area suffered no damage in 1000 years of floods unlike the town on the other side of the Danube,Pest.
Best view of Budapest. Quite a tiring way up, but once you reach up there and see the view, you'll get one of the best views of the city.

Beautiful Area. Buda Castle was beautiful. It was very busy, especially for April. The views were amazing! We really enjoyed Fisherman's Bastion. There was a nice quiet cafe that offered a nice break from the masses.

Stunning!. This is a must see for anyone that goes to Budapest hands down. The view is amazing and there is a bunch of things to see and cafes to try up on top and some nice museums as well. But all in all definitely a must see I cannot say that enough.

Expected more. Somehow I expected the Castle to have, at least a large portion, something worth seeing. It seems the vast majority has been given over to functional office space. Interesting exterior. Not much inside.

Beautiful architecture, stunning views. The Castle is a great place to walk around and see beautiful architecture and wonderful views of Budapest. We were they in late April and the crowds weren't too bad, so we were able to get good pictures.
Beautiful restored compound. Clean, well restored. Interesting history around the various buildings..a must see...also the best strudel ( comparing, Asutria, Czech Republic and Hungary)

Great. It was on my list to see, gave fabulous views of the city with some historic info but I felt it was more about tourists than history, therefore add it to you list but don't expect much more than views and great photo opportunities.

Spectaular. Not only is the castle spectacular but so are the majestic views of Budapest
A city rich in History showing its glory of the past
Up Hill. But so worth the walk. From a distance it is regal, but walk up to it and discover some of the intricate architecture.

You have to see it, very nice!. Beautiful view of Buda, Parliament and the Danube from the top of the hill. The castle is well preserved, there are shops and restaurants as well. You have public transportation or hop on/off bus. Check out the Lanc hid(chain bridge) and the Gellert furdo (thermal baths). Great city to visit.

A must visit, you need to get to the top. Historical castle and palace complex of the Hungarian kings in Budapest. Seen across the Danube in the morning and at night you immediately know you have to visit the Buda Castle. At the top you get the best panoramic views. The museum has so much to show and the statues are beautiful (got me staring for a long time). There is a medieval wing where I was able to get the feel of using some medieval weapons(after you pay).

Stunning. Every one should visit the castle, the ruin and the one they built last, another stunning sight changing of the guard, and the beautiful church and superb buildings and houses and shops all worth the visit
Very nice. The whole castle district is lovely. We spent approx 1 1/2 hours walking around enjoying the sights and taking photos.

Another Beautiful Building. A beautiful building and grounds on an elevated position on the Buda side of the Danube, If your lucky enough to see the changing of the guards at 12-00 they do a brilliant display! Leave yourself plenty of time to take in the views

world master traveller in central europe. a magnificent fortress of a castle, i came to it after walking along the Buda side of the Danube, to be met by what looked like the entrance to a Roman villa, with grand archways and pillars by the score and stone lions everywhere, seeing how far up the main castle was from the riverside my heart sank at the beating it was going to receive for the next half hour or so, but theres esculators and lifts everywhere, bloody marvelous, at the shake of a lambs tail, i was near enough to the top to get out and walk the final bit,( can`t be too lazy!) and yes the views were superb, this city really does itself proud with such a great city scape as far as the eye can see, 20 miles? on such a pretty, godless blue sky day it was beautiful, gobsmacking MMmm? the various buildings atop the castle were all very grand, with plenty of monuments of chaps astride mighty steeds and even real toy soldiers parading for show, one of the highlights of the afternoon was walking the less visited side of the walled city, were the cherry trees were all in blossom, given a pink hue to the promenade of a Km or so, ever so pretty, that and even more vistas across to the other hills of Budapest really made the already great day even more special.

Perfect view.... Τhe castle area is very large but very nice...Inside the castle there is the National Gallery which you can visit and the view is fantastic..Also there is a guy up there who gives you a crossbow to throw arrows in a target which makes you think that you really in the season...Absolutely must...

One of the only things to do besides getting drunk. I highly recommend wandering around Buda Castle, it a beautiful view of everything and extremely picturesque. It's super touristy but that's expected.
Fantastic. Plan to spend a few hours exploring the castle grounds. If you can get there before noon, you can see the changing of the guards.
Feeling of Middle Ages. Incredible! The Eagle, the knights, the view, the style of the buildings, everything is admirable. Even that hot spicy wine. :)

A must for sightseeing.. You can't miss this, if you don't want to take the funicular or walk, you can take the 16\16A public bus from the stop in front of the funicular, or from across the bridge, in Pest, the bus will take you up the hill in no time.There are a couple of museums, the best wiew ever on Pest and the Danube, shops and restaurants, the Fishermen's Bastion, and plenty other things to do, try to be there in time to see the guard change, it's cool.

A most beautiful castle. It's amazing that this castle was almost completely destroyed during WWII and now it looks like this. The view over the Danube is stunning. If you like old castles (like I do), this is one of the best in Europe.

Loved walking around the castle, church and Dracula's Chamber!. I personally enjoyed spending time walking around the castle, visiting the Matthias Church, and was very excited to walk through 'Dracula's Chamber' - a labyrinthe of tunnels which are a part of the Buda Castle.You will also find a lot of coffee shops, restaurants and souvenir shops in that area. Overall, it was a nice experience and I would recommend a visit for sure.

Looks better at a distance than close up. The walk up the hill to the castle and National Gallery is not onerous although it does look steep at first sight. The week we were in Budapest the funicular up the castle slope was under major repair so we had to walk (although the ubiquitous hop-on hop-off bus tours naturally find their way to the top too). In my view the castle and the adjacent buildings look better from afar ie from across the river than close up. However, there are the museums and the gallery to explore and several walkways that offer great views back to Pest and the Danube. The adjacent Sandor Palace is the Office of the President of the Republic of Hungary and I believe there is a guard changing display regularly ?? on the hour with a band on certain days.
Worth a visit. It is a very nice place with a wonderful view of the other side. Definitely worth the visit. There are around a lot of places to sit and have a coffee or lunch
Great castle. You cannot visit Budapest without going to the castle. It was excellent and you get brilliant views over Budapest.

Must See In Buda, Across from Pest!. Fortunately, we were on a bus tour so we were driven to the very top of the hill. From there it was an easy walk to St Matthias Church and Fisherman's Bastion. Beautiful views of the city and the Danube. See it if you can!

A Must to Climb to. A huge resort of historical castle, not so splendid and styleful like Prague castle and unfortunately looking like as if there was not much life in, but still impressive and offering great views on the city and Danube
From a walking perspective, little to see outside.. The National Gallery and official, soldier graded parts make the lay out frustrating.Obviously good views and plenty of refreshments are available.
Fabulous. Good Food and Ambiance. Good Coffee too. Although very crowded in the evening, may be because of tourist season.
Very nice!. The Buda Castle is on Castle Hill. I didn't go inside, but I saw the guard exchange and it was a very lovely moment, I enjoyed it very much!

Must see in Budapest. Love the Castle very much, it's one of the a must seen tourist places in Budapest. You can see them from the river side as it's on the hill. Very easier to get there by walk, cable car, or bus. Sunset look out from the Castle is the best. Don't miss the restaurant inside the Castle! It's a bit prissy but worth for money in terms of services, food, the view and the atmosphere.

Take the time to walk. We walked up the ramps to the castle - don't take the shortcuts, make sure you take the time to walk and explore. Once you have reached the castle, we popped through the museum, and out and along to the Mattias church and along the ridge. Such a lovely walk and the view is spectacular.

best place to see in budapest. the castle from Buda var is the most important historical heritage in Budapest. you must see it when visiting Budapest. the castle reminds of the greatness of the Austrian Empire.beautiful streets, architecture, great view of the city.

Among the best in Europe. The Buda Castle is large and includes a Palace, shops, restaurants, etc. All beautifully kept. We found other castles in Germany that had new buildings inside the castle walls or ruins. The Buda castle is beautifully kept and exactly what you would hope to see in a historic castle. Budapest as a city is so beautiful and well worth the trip -it should be a "must" on everyone's list.
Lovely views. There was guard changing when we came here so caught the act of guard changing was great. The views overlooking the city is amazing.

Fisherman Bastion - Buda Castle walking tour.. Buda Castle, a "must see attarction" to visit during any Budapest visit, is a continuation of the Fisherman Bastion which is only 7-10 minutes walking. To the Bastion it is only two bus stops (Bus 16) )from near the Parliament.A very good point to have a panoramic picture of the City. You should take your time, never rush and try to enjoy your viewings. On the way back from the Castle a good alternative might be to take a river tram and go in any direction - it is just 5 minutes walking down the steps to the river tram stop, you can easily see it when enjoying magnificent views. When combining Fisherman Bastion with Buda Castle and river tram you have perfect combination of watching the city from the hills and then from within the river - you also see both sides of embankment and details of all the bridges and Parliament bulding. You can stop and visit Shoes on Danube on the way and proceed to Margit Island if the weather allows. Strongly recommended to buy day tickets (I bought 72 hours right in the airport - you just say from which time you want it activated) and it was definetely worth it as you are very mobile, transport system excelent and tram trips are also covered by these tickets. Also would recommend downloading Trip Avisor's BUDAPEST which is a valuable things as it allows you planning or changing your itinerary, gives all the details of public transportaion and schedules.
Take the tour... Do take a tour when at the castle. Budapest has an amazing story to tell and what better palace to hear it all...
Easter Fun. Were the for Easter - there was an Easter market with dancing and singing, was definitely a great experiance
lovely. even if youre not going for the museums, walking around the castle is great fun and the views are lovely from the top. worth the trip
wonderful views. You can walk up to the castle from the bridge over the Danube but its much easier to hop off the bus. Its worth the effort just for the wonderful views of the Pest side.

Amazing. Amazing views up here of all Budapest!We also went into national history museum on the grounds and it had three floors, for each of the different historical periods in Budapest. The grounds are beautiful and you can walk around the palace and then to St. Mattais church beside.

Fantastic building. I loved this castle. This massive romantic structure on the Pest shore for the Danube river. Was so interesting to walk around it and go in to the art museum inside. If the weather had been better my girlfriend and me would have stayed outside and just enjoyed the view of Budapest for a longer time. If you pay to go into the museum, I would recommend you to take a trip up in the dome of the castle. This castle is a must for everyone visiting Budapest!
Lovely. I'd recommend this lovely places. Great pics great area to have food. Lovely astounding views. Busy wit tourists but not so that you can't enjoy this.

A trip to the past. The Castle and surrounding area is awesome, we had a chance to visit the museum with a exhibition "1000 years of history". Everything is so clean and well cared for, close attention to details.

Castle over city. Buda Castle is a must see. You can't ignore it since is in the top of the city. But not so high you couldn't access it by foot. There is a funicular also to take you up, but we preferred walking beacause of the long line to the funicular. There is several museums in the castle and of course a nice view over the city.

Night Out in Capital. We went there in the night. Whole town was nicely floodlit and many cafes were open, so if you are feeling like eating/drinking or just find a shelter you can do it there, after seeing this magnificent town panorama. It has climate of an old town (like in Krakow) with less street performers. Pretty good for a night escapade.
great city views. We watched the changing of the goose stepping changing of the guard and then enjoyed the views from the heights overlooking Pest.
So pretty!. It's free to walk around the castle and the views from the top are incredible. We spent hours on it, it's worth a visit!

just like a fairytale. This is the prettiest castle I have ever seen. I expected to see Cinderella. It is just soooo pretty and is kept in perfect condition. Amazing and that it survived so many wars and bloody battles is unbelievable. Don't go to Budapest without going to see this.

Don't let the Raven on the gate scare you away .... you'll be transported back to another time and hear carriage wheels on the cobblestones (wear sensible shoes). Go to all the museums that are now housed in the castle and see the views and the archaeological digs. This is a must-see.

Amazing views of the whole of Budapest!. It is free to walk around the castle ground and I was able to capture some beautiful photos of Budapest, especially of Parliament which is directly opposite on the other side of the Danube. We also visited a lovely cafe which was built in to one of the castle walls and the views from it were stunning.

The Castle and Palace Complex. Lots to see around this area, including wonderful views across the Danube to Parliament. The area includes the National Gallery which is excellent and well worth visiting

Lovely Area to Walk and Explore. The Castle and National Art Gallery are here.
Lovely gardens to relax in, and enjoy people watching. There are fountains depicting important historical events, and stunning architecture.

Great Views, Great Scenery. This is a must to walk around and venture the area. The castle offers a great viewpoint over the center of Budapest and Parliament. The monuments are beautiful and antique. The guards are interesting to watch and take photos with.

Expansive and beautiful. The castle is so big, and has such a cool history! There is a lot of walking up and down stairs, so be prepared. Also, it costs about an extra 3€ to be allowed to take pictures, even with a cell phone. The good side of that is that you will spend time actually looking at the artifacts, and not just taking pictures of them. Lots of weaponry and clothing to see. No backpacks allowed in, although you can check them in at the coat-check for free. Also, make sure to get the "Transylvanian funnel cakes" at the little kiosk outside. Delicious!

Going back in time. This place just take you away from reality. Is quite nice, just walk around, and across the building, very beautiful, and the view is quite nice. I went on a cold day, the coldest place you can be at too, just be ready for the weather, but visit it.
SO MUCH HISTORY. It was great visit and beautiful views of Budapest all around the Castle! There is also I place inside and outside that sells really good Hot Wine!

Must Visit. Must visit / but do spend time there...there are many local restaurants and sud have lunch or dinner there. Also in the complex there is a branch of the famous Szamos Marzipan cake shop...so do eat there also.

Хорошо побродить вдоль стены. Там есть лифт с левой стороны, на самый верх-низ (т.е. нет необходимости пользоваться вагончиками наверх). There's an elevator all th way to the top and back which is free and is located to the left near the National gallery so there's no need to use the train to the top which is I think 900 forints worth one way.

stunning building. This is the pearl of Budapest's sight's and monuments, an unbelievably beautiful castle, set in the hills overlooking the Danube. This castle has gone under various titles, THE ROYAL PALACE, ROYAL CASTLE, but now everyone knows it as BUDA CASTLE. Viewed in daytime ,unbelievably beautiful, if your lucky enough to catch the ceremony of the changing of the guard your in for a treat. Viewed at night the illuminated castle is breathtaking. Very easy to get to,bus 16 brings you to the castle as does the VARBUSZ from MOSZKVA TER. You can also get the FUNICULAR TRAIN up the hill but in my opinion unless you want to ride this train as something that was on your tick list of things to do in this wonderful city, i would stick with public transport. The views from the castle are magnificent, you can see CHAIN BRIDGE and the DANUBE in all their glory,so a trip up here is well worth a couple of hour's out of your day.

Creepy atmosphere, could be creepier!. Now this sounded interesting, a series of caves under the hill. A former torture chamber and prison, this could be brilliant. The first part of this place was a little odd. Here you have a former prison and for some reason the early areas of the labyrinth are devoted to mannequins dressed in opera costumes and wigs with opera music playing. Bit strange as it doesn't really match the surroundings. Anyway, it gets better with lots of creepy areas and information about Dracula. This is a fairly large attraction and you may feel that you'll never get out, but you will. Worth a visit especially if you want to feel a dark oppressive atmosphere. I think it should focus more on horror and torture and fear and less on Opera, it could be a very frighting experience. One area of the labyrinth is devoted to being in total darkness and finding your way through a short corridor in absolute darkness, as somebody who sometimes goes caving I am used to this and is very enjoyable to be immersed in total darkness and relying on your other senses (for a short time), but this part of the labyrinth was ruined by people using the torches on their mobile phones. Why enter the dark chamber if your going to use a torch? It's not a compulsory area to visit. If your afraid of the dark, don't go in that bit, you'll only ruin it for others! Maybe it needs a member of staff in there to enforce the darkness?

BUILD IT, I DON'T WANT IT, NUNS IN,= NUNS OUT, UNI. IN = UNI. OUT; FIRE,- NAZIS, RUSSIANS !!!!!. In 1764 Austrian- Hungarian Empress Maria Theresa donated money for the completion of the building. But she did not want to live there, so some nuns moved in. But they found it unsuitable, so the University moved in. But again they also found it not to their liking so the local Austrian 'Viceroy' shifted in because Hungary was of course part of the Habsburg Empire. Then like most castles, palaces and cathedrals the wax candles cause the building to burn down.In 1856 good old Franz-Joseph caused it to be rebuilt, just finishing in 1912 ready for the First World War!!In 1944 the now German-Austrian army moved in, causing the Russians to blast them out; leaving very little left of Buda Castle - plus scores of Hungarian soldiers dead in the streets. And that was the end of the Habsburg Rule when King Charles the Sixth abdicated.IN 1966 rebuilding recommenced and still continues today. However, they started to build a 500 space underground car-park, but the last I heard it was unfinished.So much for a bit of the building's history. Check out the other TripAdvisor comments on their visit. I think you will find they are mostly very positive.Brian, from Perth. W. Australia.

Worth visiting. Went past on the tour bus and then decided to go back and visit, so pleased we did there is so much to see, small market, some nice shops and plenty of cafés and restaurants,easily spend couple of hours here.

Stunning Views!. An intricate building that houses the National Hungarian Gallery in the middle section of the castle as well as the Budapest Historical Museum.The castle seems even more impressive during the night. There are many sculptures and monuments around that worth to be seen while a bit further at Disz Ter.At parade square you can watch the military change of guards. Address: District INo cars are allowed to enter.Directions: On the top of Castle Hill (Varhegy). Funicular from Clark Adam ter (Buda bridgehead of the Chain Bridge).Bus #16 from Deak F. ter, bus VAR from Moszkva ter.

Unique, Beautiful. We went to the castle having toured around Europe already for a while, this castle is really unlike any other, walking around all the different areas and even getting hot wine and pretzels in the courtyard was very nice! There was a free walking tour that we were able to hear a few tidbits about the castle so that was also cool! We chose to take the trolly up and then find ourselves walking down the other side! So worth it, worth the view and the experience, you can also spend as little or as much time as you want up here as it is not so busy and crowded that you fell pushed through. Best of all to walk along the castle is free! There are parts that cost but we did not do them this time! We had a great enough time without the museum!

Nice Evening in the night lights!. The Castle District area is freshly renovated!!! If you are in Budapest do not miss it!!! Come up to here after getting dark and take a walk in the whole castle area. Starting from the "citizen" district to check the cobblestone streets then go up to the Fishermen's Bastion and the area of Matthias Church. To contiue your walk to the Royal district and enjoy the view of the city from the Savoy Balcony!

Best Attraction in Budapest?. The Buda Castle was by far the most intricate building we visited during our stay. From the stand-offish outer walls to the quaint farmstyle courtyard, this place had it all! The main building houses a museum, which isn't the best in all honesty - more picture than anything else but cheap enough to be worth a look anyway. There is a cafe as you enter the museum, which was reasonably priced as ever in Budapest. At the back of the museum there was a set up offering the opportunity to try medieval weapons - spears etc. Great fun, and cheap as ever!

Breathtaking views over the Danube - especially at sunset. We went up the hill to the castle for dinner and sightseeing during a few spare hours while on assignment in Budapest.It was well worth it! The views over the river (of the parliament in particular) are to die for, and it is very pleasant to stroll around the top of the hill looking at the newly renovated old buildings. I think they are doing a great job of sprucing the place up.We also had dinner - which was excellent - but the prices are most definitely "tourist prices." If you prefer local prices... you should eat somewhere else.
Nothing great.. Compared to other castle in Europe (Krakow, Prague etc), this one is a let down. Views are definitely great from the castle though.

Hungarian National Gallery. Budapest is very attractive, and it's hard to decide what to see when you're there. Buda Castle complex is very interesting, though. Medieval art section in Hungarian National Gallery is my favourite.
visit. I just cannot believe the building in Budapest they are amazing and this building is amazing and over looks the city worth a visit

great time. we had a great time here the place was swarming with police and guards, unbeknown to us they were waiting Putin arriving which added to the visit. Again everything was clean no litter or gum stuck to the paving stones and the views over the river were just out of this world I don think that we were lucky when we were there as the sky was clear blue and the sun shone every day.

Great views. We went up by funicular - get in first carriage if you can- which gave wonderful views back over the Danube and Pest.The area is interesting to walk around and gives great photo opportunities but we found it a bit 'touristy' . We were amused to see the guards in their dark glasses on sentry-duty doing their high-stepping march as they swopped over posts.St Mathias church has beautiful roof tiling (like the Dijon Hospice).We went inside but its wow factor was more on the outside!

Stunning view. This is a historical place with its own grandeur. The view from the top is also stunning. The place records a very compact history of the Hungarian Kingdom. The best time is to visit in the afternoon when sun is on your back.

Not to missed. We saw this on the hop on/hop off bus & returned the following day. We were staying on the Pest side & thought Buda the nicer but quieter side. The castle has a "fairytale" appearance & gives wonderful views of the city. Allow plenty of time to do it justice.
A must. This was a great trip ( there is a chairlift up to it ) we were so lucky to have been there too when they were changing the guards very exciting
Amazing views!!!!. Well worth going there, walk about, beautiful sights, nice cafes and restaurants. The best option maybe is to get a tour bus, hop off, spend some time and hop on the next bus.

fantastic. WE were lucky enough to spend a few hours in the grounds and as it was a national holiday,there were lots of stalls with delicious local foods and music and local people dressed up in traditional costumes.

Buda Castle district. We were really lucky as we arrived morning of 15th March which is a state holiday so there was a lot going on at the castle with loads on stalls selling local street food as well as drinks and souvenirs. We tried Palinka which is local form of brandy but clear and boy was it strong. There is a bar in the castle wall overlooking the Danube which is a great place to have a drink. I was disappointed with my Irish coffee as they put whipped cream from a can on top but my wife loved her baileys coffee. Price was reasonable.

Buda Castle Labyrinth. The Labyrinth should be an attraction by itself if you ask me! It was amazing!It could be a bit tricky to find as there isn't much info about it online. It's part of the Buda Castle complex, so go there and find one of those maps sticking out of the ground and search for "Labyrinth." It's towards the Fisherman's Bastion, in that general direction, on the left. There is a small sign hanging from one of the buildings.Anyhow, you go down some steep steps and buy a ticket. I found it really creepy and I was jumpy the whole time but it was amazing! :)There are random opera scenes with explanations printed next to them. Some torture chambers, tombs, graves, heads on spikes, hooded figures in the dark, etc.I was afraid the whole time that someone might jump out and scare us (as part of the tour) but this never happened - thank God!There is are differents sections of the Labyrinth that play different music and that look different. Some are covered in heavy fog and "monk" music while others have no music and are in complete dark.Speaking of which, there is a section which has no lighting and there is a rope on the wall that you use as a guideline. You hold the rope and follow it through the passage. Rule - no lights. :) Go with someone, it's super fun and really scary as the sounds from other parts of the labyrinth bounce around. There are water droplets that add to the spooky atmosphere as well.The air can get heavy at times because of the smoke machine and the high humidity, so be prepared. You will not suffocate but it's no spring breeze either. :)Tip - if you arrive around sunset they will turn off most of the lights and give you an oil lantern to find your way around. Lanterns can be found at the CASA (ticket booth where you bought the tickets). We went in March and around 17:30 they turned off the lights.This attraction is for everyone looking for some adventure tourism, kids are welcome too. They even organize birthday parties! :)
Cool views. I went here some years ago. The view over the city is fantastic! Get the Finicular up to the castle.
Fantastic Castle Views. Our free walking tour for the day had to include a trip to Buda castle. Once you get there, the views are magnificent. Hard to ignore and worth the visit. A must see!
many museums to visit inside the castle. There is a nice view of Pest from there. It is very large and many museum scan be visited inside. It is possible to go there by funicular as well.

Misleading. It's not your typical Castle, I would describe it more as a former palace come museum/gallery.It was lovely to walk around but the exhibitions that were on within the buildings did not appeal to us. There were no information boards explaining either what could be seen from that point or what events had occurred.There was what looked like a lovely water feature within the complex, but no water :( (as with much of Budapest)

A must when visiting Budapest. As part of the free walking tour of Budapest you visit the castle area. It would be a sin to visit Budapest and not visit the castle and the surrounding area with its shops/cafes. The views from the castle across the Danube towards Pest are outstanding.
Amazing. Enjoyed the leisurely walked around the buildings and take in the views. I liked the view across the Danube looking across to Pest.

Wonderful Tram and Incredible Views!. Definitely take the tram up to the top of the hill for the incredible views! While you are up here walk around Castle Hill and visit the shops, galleries, an open-air bar or restaurant. The views are to die for.
A surprise!. It's a must. Over the river it has one of the most spetacular views to Budapest and the inside exhibition it's also a "Must".

Amazing location. The castle is on top of the hill and has some amazing views of the city. The castle itself is grand exteriors. The sculptures are good, but not much inside . There is a museum inside which is open on certain times. I liked the main entrance area which is massive and leads to the other parts of the hill, this walk is fun

Stunning view and a historic art gallery. One would usually visit the castle for the stunning view over the city, but it isn't functioning as a castle any more: there is the great Hungarian (historic) art gallery in the building. Well, if you are a foreign tourist you might not know anything about Hungarian arts. I never thought to enter there with foreigners, because I thought that it would be boring for them. Then two Italian friends of mine -one an art student from Torino University and an other one an IT professional took it as basic that we have to see the exhibition -they visited on separate occasions. Both times I could hardly drag them out of the place after hours of wandering around in the building. Hungarian artists have historically had strong bonds and connections with Italians so I guess it's easy for them to relate to everything on show there and the gallery managers really have collected the best pieces of art from the history of Hungary. Entrance fee is 1400 huf (5 Euros) for an adult. So, I would recommend the gallery for everyone coming from Europe and having some interest in arts. If you are the standard "art equals Mona Lisa" type of person and you couldn't care less for the so called "hidden treasures", then just enjoy the view! It's free and beautiful.

Best visiting the National Gallery and History Museum. Another highlight in Budapest, not just for the panoramic views of the Danube river, the Parliament and Pest but also for its museums: the National Gallery and even better, the Museum of History.
Lovely castle. Lovely castle and grounds... Worth a visit and little shops beside.. one of the things to see whilst here

Great view of the beautiful architecture of Budapest!. Took the hop-on & hop-off bus to get to Buda Castle. Took the funicular up and was mesmerized by the breathtaking view of the city.Did not go into the gallery - but the outside view on its own was enough. Arrived just in time to see uniformed soldiers do a small ceremonial march and warmed ourselves up in the bitter cold with a hot cup of wine while enjoying the delightful view. A must-see for sure!

Nothing much to see. Took a few photos from outside and walked around the castle. It was a bit disappointing as there is just a museum inside and the grounds are nothing special either. I think it is best to take a photo from across the river on the Pest side rather than waste time walking around the actual castle.
City views. Amazing trip up funicular railway. Castle and buildings are beautiful and the village like atmosphere is enticing. Terrific views over the city.

Expectations are too high. Except for the great view from its territory, the castle itself is a little bit of a disappointment. It looks great, and the look from it is great, but the castle itself is closed for the most part, and the museum inside is rather boring.

Research before you go ☺️. We did a lot of research before going. We read about the fountains and history which made this an even better visit. Everything was awesome. We had hot cocoa before heading back down which tasted like it was made with straight up cream and a chocolate bar. Worth every calorie. Lovely trip and lovely walk up too. I think the "ride" up would deprive you of a lot of fun photo stops. However, it would keep your legs reasy for more sites in the day. Would recommend going earlier rather than later as there were hardly any people there around 9:45 am but by 12:30 crowds were starting. Definitely a good stop!
Great. I really liked the place itself, but the fact that there are million of tourists at the same time there, is not something that I would twice...

Beautiful building on first glance. Buda Castle definitely stands proud looking out from the bank of Buda but when you read up on the history it is quite sad that it has not been restored to its former glory. Was hoping for a real castle experience but got an art gallery instead - still very nice but not what we expected. Perhaps we missed parts of itt? Reasonably priced entry.
beautiful place. The palace looks really nice from the outside, has beautiful gardens. We couldn't visit the inside of the palace I don't know if it is closed all the time or only in the winter.

Great for pics, lovely to walk around....Great view!!. We took the Hopp on Hopp of bus and one stop is the castle. Lovely to walk around, have some hot chocolate and enjoy the view and all the different people from all over the world walking around and talking in different languages. If you have time, walk around a while.....lots to see. Great for taking pictures.

Beautiful day and night. nice to see and walk around it!the view is amazing from the castle.you can go up to the hill on foot or by teleferic.i think walking is better,you can take pic while you walk,enjoy the view etc.

more for the views from the hill and the architecture of the building. We resided in the sofitel with a view on the chain bridge and castle and walked to the castle. The view on it is very nice. When we were at the palace they were playing classical music which was heavenly in such a location. The entry fee was confusing but that may have been the cassier to confuse you with ticket prices. The works they have in there were not all that impressive to us. Maybe we have been spoiled on other locations. So i'd say go there in the evening for the views of the outside and for impressive art go to the cathedral in town.

Wonderful views day and night. The view of the city from the castle is absolutely breathtaking, definitely worth the walk. Alternately, you can wait in a line to take the funicular up the hill. I ended up stopping here twice, once early in the morning and once in the evening during a walking tour and both times of day are really incredible. On the walking tour, we managed to time it so we were able to see the changing of the guard next to the presidents quarter. Going inside, the National Gallery has an interesting collection of mainly Hungarian artists and a lovely group of medieval church art. The price of admission is relatively inexpensive, accurate prices are on their website. One thing to note is that if you want to take any pictures in the museum, you need a special ticket. Buda Castle is really a must see while in Budapest

Epitome of History and Beauty. You have to go here when in Budapest. If you don't go here, don't bother going to Budapest. Millions visit each year and are in awe of the sights. Visit the Castle and enjoy a great Authentic Hungarian lunch or dinner within walking distance. You only live once.

Very nice . Very nice area, with very nice view of the city ( Pest ) .The surrounding area shows little neglect , something that you don't expect to see in such a monument.The museum inside is very interesting, and amazingly it's cheaper than the lift which takes you up the hill....I guess they need more to preserve a bloody lift than the museum itself...
Awesome view. Nice to walk up by stairs and same time see beautiful city in better and better. In the night you can see Budapest lights and it's like a dream, so lovely!

Best views. It is a great walk providing with the best views. You won't regret taking the tour! It feels like being in a medieval caste with tiny little houses that you would not believe people lives there! really romantic!
Great trip. Budapest is a wonderful place to visit. The locals are friendly, the food is great, and the drink better yet. The castle was remarkable.

Buda Castle. Go via the Fisherman's Wharf and walk to the top. The castle area is very nice and there are some good cafes at the top to relax in. The buskers are rather annoying - they do little to add to the experience and don't really fit into the theme. Again, a good location to get some quality photographs.
Worth The Walk. Buda Castle/Palace is must visit .The view is breathtaking. The walk along the hill is something that one will cherish forever.

Make this one of your 'must see' locations. This area is well worth the climb! It is at the top of a very steep hill but the pathway from the end of Chain Bridge climbs gently and is suitable for most to use. However, there is also access via the funicular railway (although the queues for this were very long when we visited). Once at the top of the hill, the views over Budapest are nothing short of spectacular and there is so much to see in the area that a day is very easy to fill. The Old Town & Castle Hill are so full of history and interest (taking a good travel guide with you is highly recommended) that it is hard to know where to start but it certainly doesn't disappoint. If you get hungry during the day, I recommend that you head for the Cafe Miro in the Old Town near to the Matyas Church - cheap and fantastic local food in a relaxed and interesting 'arty' cafe. This area is nothing short of spectacular and should definitely be at the top of your Budapest sightseeing list.

Exhibition. A wonderful building in a fantastic location which we visited specifically to see the exhibition of paintings by Jozsef Rippl-Ronai and Aristide Maillol which was brilliant. We also sampled the cafeteria which was very clean and fast. The whole building was beautiful and very well maintained.

Great at Night. We walked around the castle during the afternoon but didn't visit the gallery inside. The case provides great views across the Danube of Pest. Great to visit in the evening as well for night time pictures! Funicular railway up to the Castle is and interesting way to get up the hill but it also doesn't take long to walk.

Totally worth it. The national gallery was worth visiting. Unfortunately, the dome was closed so we could not enjoy the views. We visited both the permanent and the temporary exhibitions, and the price of the ticket was just 1200 HUF with the ID under 26.

Shell of a castle. When I think of a castle, I picture opulence: splendor, magnificence. Unfortunately Buda Castle was robbed of all of that, what remain are the walls, yes, with some pictures and such. If you are only interested in history, then you may like it. If you want to see the trimmings of richness, you will be disappointed.

Amazing views. If you are visiting Budapest you must venture to Buda Castle/Palace. The walk up is steady & the views across 'pest' are breathtaking.The whole area is worth a stroll & the changing of the guards is also good.

Great ensemble, great views of the city and nice show with the changing of the guards. A "must see" landmark if you are in Budapest, at least to admire the royal castle and palace from the outside. A lot of monumental statues, fountains and wonderful views of the city. It was turned into ruins in World War Two and rebuilt later. A great stop with a lot of photo opportunities.Another attraction beside the museum and the view of Budapest is the changing of the guards (from hour to hour). In special days (every last Saturday of the month, at 12 o'clock, this ritual is accompanied by music).

Not as anticipated, but lovely. There isn't really a castle anymore, aside from some ruins. However Castle Hill is essentially called Buda Castle these days which encompasses a number of beautiful sights to see, such as St Matthias Church, the Fisherman's Bastion and other beautiful buildings like the National Archives building - make sure you check out the beautiful roof!

Walk back in trime. We climbed the hill to the castle to see huge Ravens, watching out over the city and kind of keeping guard.In winter one can have nice hot wine which is strong and full of flavour.One must just lose themselves in the district and let their feet lead them a long the many little streets, to teh back of teh city and the Buda side of the city and the little hills surrounding the city to the Fisherman's Bastion - a little piece of magic.Watch the city change before your eyes if there in daylight as the dusk descends and the city lights make the city look more magical.Head away from the castle towards teh Gilbert hill and the true feeling of it being a castle shows as you walk by the battlements and the many inner walls there was built.

Not quite what it once was. Buda castle was obviously once a beautiful place, but unfortunately under communism it was not restored as it should have been. The exterior whilst looking authentic from afar is in fact moulded concrete and the interior has not been restored at all and looks like the inside of a shopping centre car park. The statues outside however are beautiful, especially the hunting scene to the rear of the castle- our guide advised us that this was because they were dismantled and buried during the war. They have also just started excavating the old foundations of the original castle which stood there, however work has stopped due to Europe's poor economy- it will be very exciting to see what is uncovered of the castle's Imperial past mixed with it's more modern troubled history!
views. a must to go and see not just for castle but the view of the danube and pest side are fabulous .easy to get up to castle by bus or vernicular.

Impressive, great views.. Catch the 'changing of the Guard' amazing how close you can get to these guys! The Castle itself is a fine place to wander around and the views across to Pest are pleasant, 'tho not as good as from Gellert Hill. From the castle you are a short walk to the Fishermans Bastion, tourist central of Buda!The view of the castle at night from Pest is memorable.

Royal feel. Obviously, built for royalty, the design and feel of this castle is quite magnificent. However, if you have seen more magnificent ones in Vienna or Paris, you might be disappointed. Nonetheless, Buda Castle can be one of the stops on your walking trip in Budapest. The castle is closed many a times and you will only be able to see the exterior. So make sure you contact your local tour guide or hotel concierge to check if you are making the effort only to see the insides. Nightime views are better.
In love. Walking back in time to the good old days. Beautiful place to visit without any disappointment this is a very romantic spot . Anytime and anyplace :00

Spectacular!. Must go! Go during the day and spend the whole morning walking around, get a drink and hang on looking at the spectacular view! Don't forget to return at night! Difficult to say what time is more beautiful!
Beautiful place to wander. The area surrounding the castle is beautiful as is the castle itself. You can get wonderful views of the Pest side of the city from up there.

Stunning. We spent around 2 hours exploring the castle area and it was lovely! Not many people around and lots to see and do - museums and galleries and the views are amazing! Definitely worth a visit.
What a view. It's one hell of a climb but the views of the city from Buda Castle and many places on the top of the hill are fantastic. A must do

Beautiful Royal palace and old town. The Castle houses a few museums and the old town around it has many more, as well as good restaurants and the funicular from the base of the hill. We spent most of a day here looking at different things.
big and being rebuilt. Lovely building having been destroyed several times during wars and occupation. Now houses museum. It is beautiful and can be seen from pest
Mostly closes. It was interesting to see, but mainly the castle was closed and you were only able to see the exterior of the castle. However, the view towards the city is great.
Beautiful. Amazing views across the city, having a drink as the sun goes down over Pest, beautiful! The castle is amazing

Best views. Go up to the castle of queen Elizabeth best views of Budapest and the architecture is beautiful. Lots of famous monuments and the church is just stunning you have to pay to go in but it's worth it if your into a bit of sightseeing.
Great place to wonder. A great place to wonder for a few hours, with great views across the city from the walls, worth a few hours of your time

A must to visit. The views across to Pest from here are wonderful and the area around Castle is well worth taking time to explore. St Stephens Basilica is also worth popping in to although there are some restoration works currently underway.

Lovely walk and amazing views of the city. My boyfriend and i visited at xmas and weren't dissapppinted, it was a lovely walk through the old ruins with a winding path up to the top. When you get to the top youl reach a square which has a refreshment stand (were pleased to be warmed up with a hot chocolate!)
beautiful castle and city. mysterious in its own way... Buda castle is located in the top of the hill with views buda and pest, it is not only offering the castle but it's kind of complex

Best Views in Budapest. The castle itself is not quite as grand as you may expect. Regardless of this, the views you get from the surrounding area are breath-taking and the building is still architecturally stunning.
Beautiful architecture. One of the tradional must-sees in Budapest. Just great to wander around and get some nice pictures. Beautiful statues and architecture.

No place to rest. Make no mistake, the Buda Castle is huge! We walked the outside and then paid the fee to view the History of Budapest exhibition, which a is really worth it. My only complaint is that the coffee shop has closed down which makes for a dry visit - especially if you plan on spending a few hours there.
Nice. We ran out of time when we went there... we only managed to see the gallery and the enjoy the view from the castle of the Parliament and The chain bridge. Basically the Pest side.

Fascinating area. Only saw the outside of this building as it's got a couple of museums inside which we didn't have time for on this trip. But the area and the building itself are beautiful. Will definitely be returning to explore this area when I'm next in the city.

Spectacular views. You can easily get here by walking across Chain Bridge. The views of the city are sensational. Make sure to walk across the entire castle, as there are some interesting statues: particularly one of a mother holding a baby. In this spot you can take some awesome photos.

35th wedding anniversary week in Budapest. What a beautiful setting. This is a very definite for any visitor to Budapest. Steeped in history and the views are stunning. We were there on a very clear cold day so the overall experience was very rewarding.
Wow!. Stunning views across the city and at night the best place to see the lights! reasonably priced and easily accessible by bus or on foot.

Interesting district on Castle Hill. Nice area to visit and walk around. Funicular railway goes to the top from bridge area. Lots of interesting structures, cafe's, restaurants and great views. Palace building is huge and interesting. Castle only ground level ruin.

Great Architecture. A very good place to see the city from and to admire the architecture . Whats missing is the ability to enjoy the interior of the buildings except for the art galleries. It would be a better area if the interior was open to a tour to look at how life was lived in the times it was occupied by the Hapsburg dynasty.

Wonderful Museum, views, building. The views from Buda Castle are terrific. The cultural art museum inside is also exquisite. Worth visiting the museum, and definitely worth walking and exploring the area around the castle if time doesn't permit a longer visit!

Fantastic views of the city!. Plan to spend some time walking around the castle. Take the tram up and walk down if you are able. The hop on off bus has a stop on front so plan to visit with plenty of time before the bus stops running. There is a museum on top so go early and stay late!

Super views and architecture. The castle district is certainly worth a visit if only for the views across Budapest. Most postcards that give panoramic views of Budapest are taken from here. The area below the castle on the river side is up and coming and has some very high class restaurants while on the other side of the castle is more traditional and laid back.

my fave castle. if you are lazy to 'climb' the hill, take funicular ,forgot how much it cost sorryyou can see pest area across danube from here, you can find small gift shop in the backside of buda castle,worth to visit

Splendid View. Well worth the visit. The view of the Danube and of Pest is breathtaking. The architecture is beautiful. The artwork and exhibits are very impressive, especially if you are a collector of types of porcelain that is displayed.

Iconic building in Budapest. This is iconic building of Budapest.You cannot be in Budapest before being here.Exterior of the castle is quite impressive, but the interior for me is just "so-so".The best way to see this castle is in evening from the Chain Bridge area.The lightning on the castle is at the best on that time.

The Buda Castle. It is a beautiful place with a great view on Danube and Pest. The Budapest History Museum on the history of the city and castle is not so interesting for my children, but I liked it very much because the exhibition tells about objects, buildings and people. You can find the photos of archaeologists who worked on the site!
Amazing View.. Walked to the Castle without spending much time there as it was our last day. Great views and a great place to get photos of the whole Budapest area.

If you only go one place in Budapest, this is it.. Breathtaking architecture and a great view of the city. Go early and give yourself a few hours to really see this place. It has some classic castle pires and plenty of secret nooks and crannies. I went on a snowy day in late December and it was still pretty crowded.
Large. We got up late afternoon and then took us down after dark. Incredibly how big it was. Seeing all lit from the bottom afterwards was an incredible experience. Very beautiful!

Very impressive architecture. This place is massive. You can definitely see it on the Pest side of the Danube and it is palacial. I highly recommend taking the lift up the hill and walking down the stairs to come back - it's a few stairs with some flat ground and then more stairs so it's nice and spread out and you're not winded coming down.

A very nice place if you want a plastic setting.. I stared out of my hotel looking at the tourists swarming over the area, I commanded a prime hotel suite in this area.What the Hungarians failed to tell you was how it had been modified for tourist reasons and is definitely not genuine or original.You would be better off in Disneyland because you know it is not real.

Beautiful!. I had no idea how huge the Buda Castle complex was before I arrived but wow! We went in one gate and headed up further to the top of the castle. There you'll find the most incredible views out over Budapest. There's a lot to see at the top, so much to explore and of course you have the National Gallery at the top too. As you walk along the castle you'll find shops, cafes and a small market then if course there is the beautiful church of which you can walk to the top for even more spectacular views. There's a lovely bar/restaurant by the church and there are plenty of different vantage points for photos. We spent a few hours up there but easily could've spent many more. I highly recommend a trip to the castle

Castle grounds are amazing but. I thought it was one pure old castle that I'd get to tour. But inside it is not old. It is split into 2 parts, one being the art museum and the other the history museum. I didn't have enough time, nor interest in the history museum but saw the art museum and it was all new inside, nothing remaining of the old castle. But, it could have been destroyed in world War 2 like part of Parliament, or just not proper for the art work. But set aside at least 1 to walk the grounds. I'm not a big fan of art so I sped through that museum in about 1.5 hours but the average person could spend 3 hours inside that alone. Cost for the art museum is 1400 Hungarian for the permanent exhibit or 2400 for that plus the artist (usually famous) exhibited at that time. Beware you pay 500 Hungarian to be able to take pics
Incredible!. A person could spend all day wandering this castle complex. The Hilton is built directly into part of the ruin and it is an amazing site. LOVED IT!
Amazing place. Very amazing and beautiful place. Buda castle is on the top of mountain close to Fisherman Bastion. From the top a wonderful view to all Budapest. Very historical place.

Perfect. It was a great time in Buda Castle.I think it could be the first choice to go while visiting Budapest. There are lots of different places with great views over there which you could spend whole day there.

Great History & Culture. We visited here in December 2013 and had a great visit around the historic castle which has a varied history through many trials & tribulations.I would recommend a visit here if you gave the time when in Budapest if you would like to absorb some of the Local History.Again it is not an extortionate price for admission to the castle so go on, give it a go.Enjoy.

Outstanding, BUT, plan your restroom stops!. A truly outstanding attraction on an epic scale. The castle dominates the Buda side of the Danube, spectacular at night when lit up and viewed from the river, from one of the bridges or from the Pest side.BUT, at rhe moment, there is contruction in progress limiting the number of restrooms available to the general public.Access can be via the funicular at the Clark Adams square next to the Chain Bridge or a Hop-On-Hop-Off tour bus, which is a great way to orient yourself in Budapest, or any city on your first day.

Majestic. The palace itself looks fabulous from most places in Budapest and is very inviting to the visitor. Decided to walk all the way along the chain bridge. Though there is a funicular to go up and down, if you have the time I would recommend a leisurely walk through the chain bridge. The view from the top is spectacular and you can keep clicking away till the batteries run out ! I could not see any interiors as I was a late visitor in the evening. There are plenty of visitors and both the walk up to the palace and the return is exhilarating.

AMAZING!. The beautiful Castle on the hill, with its view and the Gallery and the National Museum...take your time to see everything. We were stupid cause we thought you can see everything in a few hours but it's not like that, I think the visit should last at least half a day.Visit the castle during the day but even by night, cause the view is breathtaking!
Buda Castle. Excellent view on Budapest. It is great castle. I recommend to visit and see this beauty. I will come again..

Nice buildings, great view. Nice set of buildings with great views of Budapest. A nice area to visit and discover, we didn't do a tour but maybe worth it to get a insight into the buildings. We took the funicular up which was ok, I would've preferred to walk up though and it's not difficult. Would suggest about 3-4 hours and a visit to one of the many cafés here and just walk and look around. Even the houses around the are are nice to see

Stunning views. Buda castle is very beautiful and a stunning district. I took the leisurely stroll across the bridge that has 1 large lion statues either side of the entrance. It is a great view waking across the bridge, great for taking photos. Take the funicular lift up the mountain, it will save your legs and is a quirky way up. The castle grounds are stunning and the architecture is fabulous. There is souvenir stalls up there as well as food stalls and a cafe. As I went in summer it was very hot so you will need water and sunscreen. You can drive up there and take a bus but I recommend walking from the other side of the river and getting the funicular.

Fantastic architecture.. Buda Castle is amazingly beautiful. It reminds me of visits to Prague for it's building structure and style. There is a statue at the entrance with intricate detail . The statue of a Hungarian hero on horseback even gas detail on the blanket nnderneath the rider. I did not realise that this was carved but yes it was and fascinating. The view from the Castle is stunnung as is the ramparts and Castle walls.

Most beautiful view from Budapest. Up to the Buda hills to have a unique view from Budapest. Use the "funiculare" the easier way to get there. Out from "funiculare" you will be in front of Buda Castle (thats not exactly a castle but a palace). Walk to explore this area a few steps ahead you will see the Fisherman Bastion, Saint Mathias Church and others.If you go by the end of the day you will enjoy the sunset and quite night view of the city.

Worth a trip. This is worth a trip for the views and it's an impressive castle (more of a palace I would suggest though).You can't actually see anything of the inside as it's been destroyed so many times but the museums give an idea.

Gorgeous place to visit and take some great photos. The walk around the castle and surrounding area was so gorgeous. We took some great photos and got excellent views of the city. Thoroughly enjoyed coming here,definitely a must see when you come to this beautiful city

Beautiful. We walked over the bridge and went up the Funicular lift to the top and around the Castle area it was beautiful very clean and quiet. next time I will stay in this area. It is a must for all to see.

best experience in Budapest. i was lucky last year to see the palace in action while there was a spanish delegation going on so the place was filled with parading soldiers and horses the courts of the castle are really nice the whole area has a nice vibe to it and the cable cart gives it a nice touch

Take the funicular. Take the funicular for a view on the way up.. So spacious and a lovely collection of wings housing different interests, vast grounds to walk around, and views down to the city spectacular if no fog.

Beautiful structure. Walk across the Chain Bridge to the funicular and take it to the top. The structure is so beautiful with amazing views and museums. It's great to walk around and spend time admiring the architecture of the building. It's not yo be missed.

Worth a look. My partner and I decided to head up to the castle on our last day in Budapest. It is great as you can wander around the grounds and take in the views without having to pay to get in. The only point at which you have to pay is on entry to the museum - we didn't have time to visit but it would have been nice to learn a bit of the history surrounding it. Can't miss if visiting Budapest.
whole day visit. there are alot of attractions within the area of the castle , we started i think around 9 am and we were done by the 5 pm , nice view for the ( pest side ) and the Danube

Must see!. The Castle Hill area is a must see when you are in Budapest.In addition to Buda Castle, there is Fisherman's Bastion, Matthias Church and the funicular railway to visit too all within a short walk of each other on the hill top.We visited just before 12 noon and saw the changing of the palace guards complete with rifle spinning, rifle swapping and all guards in their dark shades :-)If you have more time to spend there is a museum to explore detailing the history of the Castle too.
Beautiful. We never went inside this structure, but walked around it and were able to view it both up close and even from across the Danube. It's a beautiful building.

Amazing Budapest Castle. Cannot say anything on here about this amazing structure than what others have already stated. This is a pleasure to walk around and has lots of hidden mazes and idiosyncratic areas. Definitely a must see when visiting Budapest.
beautiful. With the great hop on and off service this is so easy to see as well as all the other sites must be visited and more as well

Beautiful Palace, wonderful panoramic view of Budapest. Beautiful gardens, beautiful architecture, beautiful view...what's not to like about the Buda Castle? Very romantic place, especially by night, when all the city lights get lit.

A Wonderful Maze of Paths with a Surprise Around Every Corner . Lots for culture vultures here. Museums, galleries, great views, sculptures and statues around every corner. Great starting point for your visit with tons of stuff to see all in one place

Great place!. Nice view, low prices, museum, and a Nice little restaurant outside the Palace, on top of Buda.
You HAVE to visit the Castle when you are in town.

Don't miss this if you're in Budapest. Make sure you take your time to walk around the entire castle, including the museum. It is so interesting and the view from the castle hill is superb.My advice: 1. set aside an entire day for this place if you can and don't forget to visit the cellars and the museum2. have a cold lemonade in the little cafe just on the top of the castle wall, it is a wonderful little gem3. take coins with you, because you need to pay for the toilet (which is, unfortunately, not very clean)
Buda Castle. I like to look at the Castle at night from Pest side when the lighting was on . The architecture of the building is so splendid
Must visit. Worth the walk up top(funicular was closed for repair) amazing views from the top and plenty to see. Not just castle but streets are all open all day

Nice castle, excellent view of Budapest. The views of Budapest, from this castle are just overwhelming. Totally recommend this place. Look at the entrance for a post were you can try to throw arrows, shurikens and spears!.

Buda Castle labyrinth. it's a shame that there is nothing much to explore inside the cave despite some tombs, opera scenes （out of tune) and scattered stones without much explanation/information. there is no traces of human living history displayed within the cave. But it can be a good experience if u wana feel the darkness, and 'haunted' ambiance, join the night tour at 6pm then.
beautiful castle. amazing castle well worth a visit. full of history and fantastic architecture. beautiful landmark dominates sky line

History of Budapest. There are some great opportunities for photos in this area. We went to the museum inside which was very interesting to learn some of the history of Budapest. The architecture in Budapest in general is wonderful, i loved it but on this side of the river there's are some particularly great views and buildings. On the Buda side things are a bit quiter but it's nice to see the contrast. We had a lovely chilled day.

Historic and Picturesque. One of the best views of budapest. it is an amazing sight overlooking the danube. the area itself has beautiful castle towers you can walk along and they are very much like a fairy tale of how you would imagine eastern europe
Buda Castle. I've asked my wife to merry me at this place. The view of the city it's very nice, especially by night. It's a place that you have to visit during the day and night.

Romantic place!. For me this place is very romantic because my husband ask me to marry him here, in the top of the hill while I was mesmerized by the amazing view of the city by night. I simply love Budapest by night. It is fabulous!

Great place at Pest Side!. This historical place of Pest you must have seen, It's really beautifull! You have also one terrific vieuw on Boeda from this hill! The buildings are very beautifull just like the places it has! You must give it a vieuw and maybe continue your walk trough the Old City of Pest wich is just near the Palace!

so much to see.
