Buda castle is an interesting living castle.There are obvious places to see but also there are hidden gems.One is the labirenth or the under rock hospital.Some parts are open to public but most of it is closed at the moment.Also there is a grave which is very important in history but neglected.Its the grave of Abdurrahman Abdi Pasha who was the latest commanded of the castle.He was an Ottoman pasha and he was 70 when he fall fighting with the sword in his hand.Hungarians burried him where he died ,between the Vienna entry and military museum on the city walls.In his grave stone it says,He was a brave enemy,should rest in peace.This is the only Ottoman thing left in the castle.

Beautiful Building & Stunning Views. One of several beautiful buildings in Budapest. Lovely place to walk around although parts of it were closed off on the day we visited due to an American film crew shooting scenes of a new sci-fi movie. Stunning views over the city.

Great place. The castle is a nice structure and the area is very nice to walk around and explore. The main reason to come here however for me was the scenery not the castle itself. If you are a history buff, then perhaps you would be interested in the castle itself.
Stunning!. Gorgeous castle, magnificent worth while going to see it, we went at night and as it is on the Buda side of Budapest it was hilly and the view was amazing!!

Nice place. If you're a scenery lover, getting up to the castle is worth the climb. The scenery from atop the castle is beautiful. The castle is very huge and long with many unique buildings filled with Turkish influence. If you ever made your way there, do not ever miss out on the Hungarian Sponge Cake which is the local dessert. Overall, it is a nice place to spend half a day just to visit and enjoy a slow walk.

A must see area of Budapest. Budapest is well served by a number of splendid buildings and amongst this number is Buda Castle and the whole of the Castle District. Having taken the funicular railway to the top we walked around the Castle and inside the Museum which was very interesting. The turbulent history of the Castle and the growth and final merging of Buda and Pest is explained and although there are no ornate state rooms available to visit it was still a very enjoyable visit. A short walk away is the statue of St Stephen and Matthias Church with its fabulous spire and ornate roof tiles. Well worth a trip.

Labyrinth of Buda Castle - By Lantern Scary. There doesn't seem to be an option to write about the Labyrinth of Buda Castle as a separate attraction which it is. I had read about it online and it seems to be a little hidden gem as when we asked for directions from our Hotel Reception and also at one of the help desks in the Castle area no one seemed to know about the Labyrinth by Lantern Night Tour but it did exist. There were mini cards that you can pick up in the Tourist Information Centre and by doing this my partner and I got 200HUF each off the attraction which was 2000HUF each. It was worth the money and one of the best attractions. Although, it was very scary by Lanterns. We went at 18.00 thinking it would be a group of people with a tour guide and lanterns. We got there around 5.45 and seemed to be the only ones there and he told us to take a lantern and go through as you do it on your own. All the lights are turned off in the Labyrinth and you are on your own which is very scary. If I had known about that in advance I might have done it in the day when it wasn't as scary. We were in there for about 15 minutes before we saw other people going through which was a relief then I felt more courageous to go back to certain parts we had missed before by tagging on behind to other people! Very scary by Lantern and worth a visit. I was scared I might get lost in there and get locked in overnight but on exiting I could see we had been on CCTV so if I had known that before I entered I might have been a bit braver when in there! Well worth the money but do it at night when all the lights are off and they have opera music playing which adds to the thrill factor.

Lots to see without needing to pay to go in. We were blessed with a warm sunny autumn day but we saw the changing of the guard after a ride in the funicular, tried archery, had great views of the city and Danube plus a pleasant stroll all the way to the bottom again. Lovely!
Exterior. More interesting from outside than from the inside. But it is sure the place you have to visit when you are in Budapest.

Spectacular view. The castle stands majestically above the city on the Buda side giving wonderful views of the parliament and Pest.We were not able to see the inside of the building but the outside is spectacular. Sadly the many windows look as though they were fitted by a double glazing company. I am sure at an earlier point in its history the windows were more ornate.

Excellent Architecture and Awesome view. The Castle is well made ... the view from the castle on both the side is amazing ... there was a small cafe overlooking the pest side of the city ... one can sit there enjoy the place ...
Wonderful area. To be honest, never quite figured out exactly which part of the complex was the castle it's self, but the Castle Hill area is wonderful to walk around.

Do not miss out!. The Castle Hill is beautiful on its own, but the Buda Castle has a certain charm that cannot be overlooked. It's massive, with straight sharp lines to define it, that have been toned done by the sculptures that decorate it. You might think that it's not impressive enough, but it will leave a mark for sure.

A must-see if you go to Budapest!. A pretty beautiful old building which you must visit if you are in Budapest. Great location to take pictures and perhaps the second building you should visit besides the Parliament.

Buda Palace. Another one of Budapests great buildings, the grounds are open to wander round, cafe /restaurant available (but stops serving food about 7pm). You may be mesmerised by the stunning views over The Danube so don't forget to wander round the back of the Palace for views away from the river. There was some building work going on when we visited. National Gallery and archery in the gardens.

Nice view. I had been to buda castle before, about 10 years ago and sadly I could not remember it. I visited it again in September and we took the waking tour that is free with the transport ticket.The walking tour was really good and the guide was very funny.They appear to have renovated a lot of the area, and made some other improvements since I was last there.Very touristy spot, but worth the city views. What is interesting that u don't see often these days is no skyscrapers as they have a rule that no buildings can beep taller than the church and parliament.
Amazing castle. Lovely walk up through the castle grounds and rewarding cafés/restaurants at the top, beautiful views overlooking the river and parliment.

More Great Views!!. So the Funicular brought us up here and WOW are the views mighty fine!! We had great weather so it was perfect to get a few good snaps. It is easy to see why the Castle, and the Citadell, were built on this side of the river as I'm sure those inhabiting them enjoyed looking down on the poorer people below!! A very nice castle with nice relaxing grounds to stroll around and a few market stalls to to help you spend your Forint!! The castle was home to an art exhibition while we were there but other than that I am not sure how much of the inside of the castle is open to the public. Another must see.
Our day out. Great history and views you need to visit here this is were everyone goes get on the hop on and of big red bus great day out worth visiting
Stunning. Need to go both in daytime and at night to appreciate stunning views and architecture? Only disappointment was no bar open to toast the view at night never mind!

Too Late For Enchanted, but a real charmer. OK, I am a romantic. The Buda Castle and the entire area was a delight for this Jersey Boy. The weather was so supportive of a 10 experience. You need, as we did, to spend hours here. After all the city, in my opinion is less than friendly, attractive, romantic and safe. I have never been more solicited or offended in a European city in my life. My Hungarian grandmother would have complained. Do the underground tour and eat while your at the castle. You will always remember it. I will.

Amazing views and architecture. This seems to be where all the 'classic' views of Budapest are taken from - over the Danube to the Chain Bridge and the Parliament building beyond. Great view, certainly. There's not a huge amount to see of the Castle itself it seemed to us, but there were market stalls around and the Matthias Fountain within the Castle area is well worth seeing.

Great area. The area of the castle is beautiful and has a few museums - the national gallery and the castle museum. It's worth visiting and walking around as the views across the city are spectacular.

Funicular. An expensive option to get to the castle. You can walk and the road is not that steep and there are very few stairs to negotiate. The view is superb. There was the Palinka Festival on when were there which was an added extra for us. There are small stores selling the 'secret box' and other bits and pieces to buy. Buda Castle is a must visit.
Very nice by the night!. It was so beautiful by the night with all of those lights making it like it was made from real gold!

Its good but not great. Well part of it is in forms of ruins and other parts under renovation so I m not sure as to taking out a massive space out of your itinerary is wise. Anyways the exteriors strike a very elegant pose and perfect for photographs also the view is good as well.

Beautiful Castle and best views of the city. The castle atop the hill is quite beautiful and worth exploring. A major part of the castle was destroyed during the second world war and we could still see large parts of it still undergoing renovation. One can easily walk it up to the Castle or otherwise take the funicular or buses to the top. The walk around the castle hill is quite amazing and fun as well. The Castle itself is imposing - has a majestic fountain in the courtyard to the back - there is also a hungarian art museum attached to the castle. The eatery next to the castle offers amazing views of the city and a wonderful place to sit and enjoy a sip of wine.The castle hill in general affords the best views of the town from both the sides - on the front the Danube and on the back overlooking the other hill (don't remember its name now).
Great place. It's one of the most important buildings of Budapest. You can't avoid noticing it from different directions.

Better from a distance. Buda Castle is so beautifully lit at night that you feel it must be visited during your stay. At night from a distance is the best way to see it. We did a tour of the Castle District as part of our Big Bus tour and that was great. There really is no interior to explore - the castle was decimated (for about the 4th time) during WW II and most of it is now like movie set. However, many statues have great stories behind them as does St Mattias church. Ruins and a part of the oldCastle still visible are interesting as well. Just don't plan for a day at the Castle!

Hapsburg's castle dominates Buda with amazing galleries inside. The views across the Danube are stunning. The huge complex of palaces are nowadays some really good museums and art galleries. The special exhibitions are always good, and the range of Hungarian art is unique, showing the skills and workmanship of the people of this land. There is a history museum about the city of Budapest, a gallery devoted to tryptychs and altarpieces, and floors of 19th and 20th century paintings. It is well organised and well worth a visit. It is one of my favourite art galleries in the World
Beautiful Views. A must see when visiting Budapest. We took the funicular which also has amazing views. The Castle is interesting to walk around and the views of the city just cannot be beat

Buda Castle labyrinth. I had not heard of this prior to arriving in Budapest but worth a look if your up visiting the castle. It's sold as the tomb of Dracula and was approximately £5. You descend some steep steps and walk round a strange mix of tunnels and rooms with interesting and strange displays. The tunnels are well lit to give of an Erie feel. You guide yourself round by use of arrows on the walls. There is one section that I loved, it was completely dark and you guided yourself round by use of ropes on the wall. You don't have to do that section but it is worth it. You eventually descend into what is supposed to be draculas resting place, it's lit really well like the rest of the tour. There are some odd opera displays and a small strange cinema to look at to. Worth a fiver I thought.
Amazing view to the city. A must see place in Budapest. The view from the dome of the Hungarian National Gallery is really stunning.

Beautiful Castle you must see. This place should be on your must see list. Situated in a wonderful setting the castle from much older days brings us back several hundred years. The structure has been maintained well and there are always numerous visitors here. It is on all of the tour stops but you should see go and see it. A very phot positive stop in the city.

Beautiful. Buda Castle is easily included in any time spent on the Buda side. While we were there the wine festival was going on so it took away from the beauty of the castle and we couldn't walk in to see it without paying admission. A must see
Beautiful Palace. This building is architecturally stunning. It is a beautiful building in the Old part of the city on the 'Pest' side of BUDA-PEST. It is worth a visit.

Visit it, just for the view :). The Castle is located on the top of a hill. The view from the top is great.One can see the opposite bank of the Danube. The President's residence is located here, Funicular, several museums.When I visited the Buda Castle, there was a wine festival, plus some construction works. Plenty of people, difficult to get closer to the panorama. But we did it!There are many souvenirs' shops, stops, where tourist hop on and hop off buses stop (so you can plan to get a ride there and away :). I also noticed few bistros, with local food :)Please mind, that most museums have a fee for entrance.

Super place to visit. Excellent view of budapest, very old building , but very well maintained & attractive . Must see place in Budapest. Most city can be view from above looking overall beautiful city

Great views of the river, average museums. The palace is a grand building, lit at night and visible from the Pest side as the crowning glory of the Buda Hill. You can wander around the palace courtyards and fountains for free. The palace building is now host to two museums, this is the only way to see the insides. Both charge admission, of around 1400HUF-1800HUF, with extra charges for photography.The palace inner courtyard looked a bit neglected, one corner was devoted to keeping rubbing wheelie bins, hardly the kind of colour you need in your holiday snaps.

A must see!. This is a must see in Budapest, it has a view off all the major objectives and it's definitely worth a while. It's still under renovation but almost done so we were able to walk all through it and we were fascinated by the views. This walk will take 2-3 hours if your time but you won't have any complaint about it :)
Good experience. Took the funicular up, the area around the castle was under construction, and walked down. We walked around the grounds - a beautiful view of the city.

The most impressive view in Europe. Many points of interest atop this castle wall perrched above Buda and Pest. Great views of the Danube and all of the major sights of Budapest including the Parliament building across the river. This is a must-see in Budapest and plan to spend a day atop the hill in the cafes, churches and museum. Take the Siklo back down the hill to the foot of the Chain Bridge.

castle. its a whole complex with church museums the palace, there are a lot of things to do and also bistro and coffee shops, as souvenir shops,thereis a ticket for the most of the things up there you can go walking through a park or by the funicilum, thereis a queue,or even by taxi and bus, during the festivities of saint stephen, there was a lot of events
MUST SEE ATTRACTION.. Excellent and not to be missed attraction.Beautifull glimpse of royal hungarian architecture.A must see

One of the romantic places in Budapest. One of the must see places in Budapest. You can spend time from some hours to one day here (specially when you are interested about museums and exhibitions). Castle is really nice from Pest side. You can walk across the Chain Bride and walk up to Castle. The landscape is nice day and night time too. You can see Buda and Pest side from here. The castle is wonderful. There are a lot of café, romantic streets between buildings built in previous centuries. We were here several times.

Lovely Vantage Point. Although it is wonderful to view the Castle from across the river... especially at night... the relaxing walk across the Bridge of Chains, and either the ride up the funicular or short walk up the mild graded path, is certainly worth the time. Spectacular views of the river and landscape. The fountain and architecture of the Castle buildings is exquisite. Just ran out of time to see the Hungarian art collection in side (went to the fine arts museum instead) but would add that if I could.

Fabulous. The castle looks great from across the Danube day or night so it was lovely to actually go in and see it. We were staying right by it and it is lovely. Very impressive facade - great inside - it has a section that is an art gallery. We went up into the Dome - the photos would have been fantastic if I had remembered to charge my phone! Very highly recommend a visit.

A lot of history. You can easily spend an afternoon in and around Buda Castle. This is were Hungarian monarchs lived from the 13th C onwards. Today there are two museums in the castle; The History Museum and The National Gallery. The History Museum costs 2000ft and has info about the Ottoman occupation and parts of the medieval royal palace in the basement. It is free to enter if you have a Budapest Card. The National Gallery costs just 1400ft. Both these are open 10am-6pm daily and are closed on Mondays. The extensive grounds are free to explore anytime. You can start your exploration by catching the funicular railway at the foot of the hill. As you enter the castle grounds, look for the black crow on the gateway. This is the symbol of Matthias Corvinus, one of Hungary's most loved Kings. Just beyond the gate is the magnificent Matthias Fountain.

Now an art museum with a great view. Buda castle is now not a castle but houses the Hungarian art gallery. Admission to the permanent portion of the art gallery is free with the Budapest card.The Hungarian art gallery was quite good but the icing on the cake is the visit to the dome and the view from the balconies. The view of the Danube and Pest from this spot is stunning. Use the card for just these views.

Buda - the quiet half. After the hustle and bustle of Pest, Budapest is a quiet viewpoint over the Danube and Pest not to mention the oft overlooked rest of the city to the West. Start off up the funicular - fun quaint and saves those legs. Take a one hour tour on a Segway from the Tourist Office by St Mattius church. They use off-road X2s which smooth out the cobbles a treat. Come back down on the 16 bus and have a drink at The Sailors inn
Beautiful. Beautiful place. A must go for tourist. Great place for some nice views and to look at some really beautiful architectures.
Good Castle. Buda Castle is a place well worth seeing. The design is attractive and it's sits perched on a hill with good views of the city.

Visit the castle with the Hop On Hop Off bus. A good way to see the castle would be to take the Hop On Hop Off bus tour (starting point at Erzsebet Ter). The bus passes many historical land marks, where you can decide if you would like to alight, view the attraction and get on the next bus. We did not stop at any of the earlier stops but made the 1st stop at the castle. Beautiful castle with nice photo opportunities. From the castle you are able to see the beautiful city of Budapest, with the Danube River, Chain Bridge and the Parliament Building. Spent at least 2 hours there, including the wait for the next bus, as the place was packed with tourist who came to visit the castle.

Beautiful sightseeing, but nothing else. The building is very beautiful, impressive architecture and the view from the hill is mesmerizing. yet there is nothing else to it. Inside the building there is an art museum. yet I find it disappointing that there was nothing about the history of the place.
beautiful.... it is very great very green you can do a nice walk over there....on the back is a man with old weapons for play just for fun and take picture as a king and queen :P he was very good...

Beautiful up close but better from afar at night. The Buda castle is certainly beautiful and I'm happy we saw it but to be honest I enjoyed it much more from Pest city center across the Chain Bridge at night. It is lit so very favorably that it's a delight to gaze at.

Buda Castle. Definitely worth visiting the grounds and if time and interests permit the various museums on the property. Check out the free concert schedule during the summer. An imposing and massive structure unlike any other. A definite must if visiting Budapest.

Ancient castle....well kept and .... ...so awesomely historic. This is even a statue of the ruler that protected the city from thousands of Muslim invaders. Nice to spend the afternoon taking in all the splendor.A guided tour is best btw.

Breathtaking. Budapest awes you with its grandeur due to due to its extensive history and a mix of cultures that influenced all of the creations around the city. As it was first built in the late 1200’s and ruined and reconstructed quite a few times since then, it really IS a place where you simple come to admire the might and nobility of the building. You can get inside for a fee, but not sure if it is worth it. To my opinion, the castle is a piece of art by itself from outside as well as the view to Budapest at your feet is simply breathtaking.

Wonderful views and how to get there. To start with, I will say that you can not leave the city without visiting Buda Castle. In my opinion, the best way to proceed, will depend much on your own taste. In my case, I love history, so I decided myself for a guided tour (I have also writen a review about it). First of all, is quite easy to get up to the castle. The bus 16 leaves from Deak Ter, nearby Vaci utca, and it brings you all the way up to the Castle.You can also take the funicular from the square in front of the Szecheny bridge. Also the bus nr. 16 stops there. Once up, the funicular will stop in front of St. Mathias Basilica. Also the bus nr. 16 has different stops around the Castle neighborhood (more like a small village).I will recommend also on this review, to buy the Budapest Card. It costs around 8500 HUF, depending if you buy it on the net (cheaper), or on a sale point (you will also fin done at Deak Ter, at the start of Vaci utca). With this Budapest Card, you have 2 free guided tours, free entrance to 8 Museus (we did not visit all of them, free entrance to Lucazs Baths and ilimited use of public transport).Up at the Buda Castle, you will be able to walk around and have stunning views of the city. If you are not taking a guided tour, I really recommend to og a bit late in the afternoon, so it will not be so warm as it is almost impossible to find a shadow. To take a walk around the village is interesting and you will also find the Fisherman’s Bastion just getting out of the funicular.Everything depends on how many days you are visiting the city. This time, we spend four and a half days and we had time to visit everything which would be considered as a must.*If you have with you the Budapest Card when you visit Castle neighborhood, you can also enter to the Hungarian National Gallery (Only the permanent exposition, the seasonal are paid a part) and the Budapest History Museum. Remember, in Hungary, all museums are closed on Mondays. So a visit to the Buda Castle, could really keep you busy for a few hours if you have a complete overview of the area.

Huge castle with great views. Overall, the castle is exceptional. Though its post-war rebuild may have reduced its exterior appearance, the sheer size of the place, along with the richness of the museums inside and the views of the city that it offers. Downsides are the cost of each admission to the museums, and lack of content in some of them (though the gallery is excellent).

Castle from the Past. Beautiful restored castle with lovely grounds. Lots to see in the area. Historical statues, paintings, furniture inside. Lots of details and old things to look at and read about.
Flawless place. Must see destination for travellers. Great views, lots of incredible history, amazing architecture. I loved changing guards on front of Presidential Palace

Wonderful plce to visit. A back drop for lots of photos and its obvious when there why the place is popular. Marvellous views from around the castle. Church is lovely , admission fee applies. Plenty of eating places and reasonable priced too. Shops are fairly similar and quite pricey.
So huge!. An incredibly huge castle, symbol of the old times of Budapest. Not my favourite spot in this amazing city, but definetely worth to see!

A beautiful view of the river and Pest in addition to the building itself.. We saw an exhibition at the National Gallery, but the building itself, the Buda Castle, is worth the visit even if you don't see the museum. The terrace in front of the castle overlooks the Danube and Pest, including an area that juts out further and provides a great view of Margaret Island as well. The fountain with Matthias in his hunting attire and with his dogs, advisor and mistress is quite unique. Be sure to take the time to see this part of Castle Hill when you are there.
Gorgeous views . We lost about 4-5 hours in the castle district. Such a gorgeous place to visit, the views were stunning! Highly recommend it!
Incredible view. I would recommend this castle even to people who have visited way too many castles in their lives primarily because the view of Budapest is magnificent.
beuatiful place. Gorgeous, the most beautiful city I've been visited, the castle brings a spell and enchants the city!!

Delightful. We came and it was a lovely day! We walked from the bottom to the top which was a climb but worth it! The castle is beautiful, with a lot of ground to cover, it's surrounded by a little village almost with a beautiful church, labyrinths, parliament, etc.. And the views are sublime! There is admirable history to this place and the castle! Highly recommend
Great views. Beautiful castle! The views from the top are amazing. Great panorama of Pest. Quite the hike up though, so be prepared.
Great afternoon. The weather was wonderful the afternoon we toured the area. The tour was great and our guide was wonderful. Another must

The Royal Palace. The castle has been restored from its damage sustained in World War II. Built in the 13th century - sits on top of a hill and is a beautiful site to see A Gothic palace has been renewed in renaissance style. It was destroyed,, and was rebuilt after WWII. It's a town from the Middle Ages, little streets, old houses, and narrow buildings. You'll love the feel of the place.
Beautiful views,inside and out. Buda Castle is worth adding to any Budapest itin. The views both inside and outside the castle are grand.
Beautiful!!. Beautiful and HUGE place. If you are a student, you can get an entrance discount. Afterwall, it really worths the walk.
Castle. The Castle and view are spectacular. It is a popular place to visit so allow time for the crowds.This is a must
Lovely views of the city. I'm not really into visiting buildings etc in cities but you must visit here if you are looking for good views of the city!
Castle with Style. This lovely castle is full of surprises. It is possible to go up the hill where the castle stands with a sort of mountain train. The location is supee in thw middle of Budapest!

Definitely go and visit - directions explained. The views are very good from the castle, there are several monuments and picture points so it is worth going to see. the cathedral is another must see which is only 5mins walk away. One route is to go via 16 or 16a bus from town, other is the Red tram route from Pest side and the 16 16a bus. All transport cheap efficient and generally you will always find someone who speaks English to ask incase you are unsure, friendly locals. Tip - do not use the orange exchange money places the rates are a rip off, there are a couple of other smaller ones close by which are far better (next to the cafe opposite the large cathedral).

Nice view. Its a nice place to walk around but we didn't bothered to go inside the castle, the views from here are beautiful and instead we visited beautiful building of fisherman's bastion that was amazing

Very Beautiful Historic Location with a Magnificent View. We were not able for time limitation to go into the National Art Gallery; a tour in the area was more than enough to enjoy this historic place starting with the Administrative Building where the bullet holes still apparent, watching the change of guards ceremony, and ending with exploring the Castle Building and its beautiful Gardens.If you didn't visit the Castle Hill; you didn't miss much as you can still enjoy the superior Panoramic views of the main attractions of Budapest, the Danube and its magnificent Bridges especially the Chain Bridge, the Parliament, St Stephen’s Basilica and many other beautiful locations.It is a must visit to all photographers and scenery lovers.

Nice views and museums. Great place for some nice views over Budapest and also for visiting some museums. Even got some nice places for lunch and drink (outside). Walk down the hill btw towards the Danube and bridges

Buda Castle is amazing. Its must see place. After all it’s a city castle. But don’t expect defense structures. It’s more of a palace. With museums and galleries inside. The view form here is just amazing

A great Empire. Buda Castle tells the very impressive story of the Austro-Hungarian Empire. Visiting is a must for travellers interested in the city's past (which still reverberates nowadays, of course)
A definite must. Well worth a visit, take the funicular to the top, take a wonder, have lunch, walk back down, again good views, also old ruins and history worth seeing.
best view ever. Amazing cable car drove up to the castle. Gorgeous view from the castle. A real treat. In place souvenir stalls, museum, restaurant, coffee shop and more

Amazing views. Went with friends, it was so chilled up there to wander around and to take beautiful photos of the city. We didn't go inside instead we spent about a hour of so just admiring the views and soaking in the atmosphere. There were some stalls up there as well as restaurant and cafe.Please let me know if this is useful information and I will write some more.
beautiful view. the view from up there is just magnificient.if you go to Budapest, just ensure you allow a few hours to go up there.

Romantic in the night . Without going inside, take some time to go there close to the sunset time. You will see great colours and then all the lights getting turned on, the castle will then appear incredibly romantic

An interesting art gallery. The main Castle building houses the National Gallery. The gallery is well worth a visit and has some fantastic paintings and a spectacular collection of altar pieces and screens. Two problems one is that the gallery is massive and it lacks seating in galleries to rext or to take time to view works. The second problem is that the lighting of some pictures is really poor !Despite these comments it is well worth a visit

wow. we didnt go inside bit there was enough going on outside to worry about it, it is extremely busy and they had a German market on whether this is every day or not i dont know but it added to the charm, lovely photo opportunitys and you can see everywhere from here, Fab!

The Hungarian art gallery. There's more to the castle than the gallery, but that is what we visited.The gallery houses what is the National Gallery for Hungary and what a fascinating journey through the history on art it was. Exclusively Hungarian, it was very interesting to see the world through Hungarian eyes, what genres were favoured and how artists responded to the various art movements happening in the world. Very well worth a visit.
Looks impressive from a distance. When close up this building was very disappointing. Huge site, no obvious entrance - not sure the point of it for foreign visitors

Must go! wether it's nice or bad weather:). Of course all of the outside places are much better to visit and see when it is shiny and warm. But on this side of the river you can first of all see a beautiful castle and secondly admire the view where you can see an amazing panorama of Budapest
Just okay. It is very beautiful and provides great views of Pest. I don't see any reason to do anything but walk around the outside. Also, the walk up isn't too bad either.

Walk around outside, no need to go in.... This is a great building to walk around, check out the castle grounds, but inside is not much to look at. There are plenty of statues and other decorations to look at on the outside.

Beautiful complex. Lovely place to walk around and fantastic panoramas of Pest. Plenty of photo opportunities. The whole castle area is great to walk around. We managed to catch the changing of the guards which was good to watch. On the walk down there are many touristy stalls and you could even have a go at archery (paid). Simply wonderful.

Review of Buda Castle museum. Portions were closed to the public but they did not inform us when we purchased our tickets. They did not give my teenager a student rate with her ID. We were unsure of the layout and began viewing art and were literally yelled at and then laughed at by museum staff/monitors. It was weird. It was bad enough we almost left. We aren't all that clueless we just don't read Hungarian. For the rest of the museum we were either followed like criminals or ignored when we were seeking help. Just skip this nightmare.

Great Buildings and Views. The building and the history of Buda Castle are really interesting. The glass in the windows seem to be hand made or crystal glass as there are waves through it. As Buda is on a hill and Pest is flat the panoramic views up and down the Danube on a really sunny day are ideal for photography. The view of the castle from the opposite side of the Danube at night went is fully lit up are breathtaking. Oh Yeah, to walk around the castle area grounds is free.

Amazing. The building in itself is huge and amazing and offers a great view of Danube and the bridges and I was lucky enough to spot the place in night and found the views breathtaking. The place easily takes up couple of hours so be prepared for that as well. The place is great for some photo ops and makes for a great holiday memory.

A great building.. This is a lovely building on the hillside of Buda overlooking the River Danube and over to Pest.From here you get views which is great opportunities for photographers. There are wonderful sculptures too.

Amazing Pest views. A big area to walk and best to go at night for the outside views of the castle and the Pest part of the city when everything is lit up. The bridges can be seen from here and parliament also.From here there is easy access to the Buda part of the city, with the cobble streets and Mathias Church. There is also further views from the Fishermans Bastion.

Amazing night view of Budapest. I believe that it has a better night view overlooking the Danube than the Fisherman's Bastion. You have to walk till the very end of the passageway (in the direction of the Citadell) in front of the Buda Castle where you will find an amazing view of the 4 bridges, from the Parliament to the Liberty Bridge. I nearly missed out this spot - so don't forget to walk a few extra steps!

Great place to visit. Go up to see the castle in the funicular. Great photo opportunity. Fantastic views. Loved this part of the trip. Buildings have beautiful architecture. You must visit. Gifts shops and nice places to eat. Cheaper on this side of Budapest

huge, beautiful and with a great view of the city. I'll start from how you get there...if you love walking it's a nice walking distace from pest and then to go up you can take the carts which are a bit pricy (like evey tourist attraction), we took it only one way and when we went down the stairs we discovered how small of a distance it is, so it is possible to go up the stairs easily, there's also public transport just ask at your residance's reception and they will tell you what to take. For the castle itself you can go inside there are museums/exhibitions which I didn't go to so can't review, but you can go around the castle itself, there are beautiful statues and gardens and different constructions.

Gorgeous Castle Exterior. One of the more beautiful castles I have visited in Europe. Such beautiful architecture. I wish we had a guide to give us more history as we toured it on our own with limited guidebook input. Rather disappointed that you couldn't visit the interior. The entire castle district is well worth a visit.
Lots to see. The whole area in and around the castle is great to wander and it seems that around every corner there is something to be found.

Well worth visiting!. Buda Castle is actually part of a large site on the hill overlooking the Danube. It has been through many changes and rebuilt from ruins after the Second World War. Now it is a major cultural centre with the Budapest History Museum and Hungarian National Gallery among its attractions. It is well with doing a guided walking tour around the area as it helps to put everything into historical context. There are also great views back to the Pest side of the river and these are especially spectacular at night. The cafes and restaurants do charge a premium for the location but it is possible to find cheaper and just as good alternatives in the side streets. Well worth a trip just for the views alone and certainly allow a good day to visit all the attractions this area has to offer!

Stunning!. This is such a great building in many ways, it is huge, and the gate leading to it is just beautiful! You are treated with a nice view over the city as well.
We walked up to the hill and then walked around to see all the sites up here, and then took the bus down again.

Worth seeing!!. Worth a trip there but do not take the expensive lift (more than 1000 each way each person) to come there if your own foot are 2 wasted pieces. Just a short climbing will get you there free of charge.

Buda Castle - One of many things to see/do in Castle District. Buda Castle, also known as the Royal Palace, is included in the Budapest UNESCO World Heritage Site. It is one of the most important historical attractions in the city and can be easily found perched atop Castle Hill on the Buda side of the Danube River. This is the site of of castles and palaces which have served as the seat of power over the region since at least the 13th century. King Béla IV built a medieval castle here between 1247 and 1265. By the end of the 15th century, King Matthias had made it into a large-scale and lavishing building, which was then overrun by the Turks during the occupation period. Destroyed during the liberation of Budapest in 1686, a Baroque style palace was erected in the early 18th century as Hungary fell under Hapsburg rule. Under the direction of Empress Maria Theresa the Palace was vastly expanded and experienced a glorious period which lasted until WWII, when it was more or less destroyed. Today the Royal Palace is as it was after reconstructions shortly after the war. Within Buda Castle you can visit the very good Hungarian National Gallery, which showcases historic artworks by Hungarian artists. There is also the Budapest History Museum, found within the Royal Palace grounds, which contains many artefacts from the city and castle. The castle exterior is architecturally attractive, as are the fountains and equestrian statue of Prince Eugene of Savoy found directly in front of the entrance to the Hungarian National Gallery. However, most impressive and memorable are the fantastic panorama views of the city below Buda Castle. This is probably what we enjoyed most about our visit to the the castle.

Great views. Of all the sites that we seen during our day in Castle Hill we found the Palace to be underwhelming in comparison. Definitely worth seeing and the views from the lookout are fantastic but do not expect too much.
Great place. Öné of the best place in Budapest , my group liked it , our uncle Ben stayed in the district for 3 hours and decided tó prolong his Budapest trip due tothis
Amazing Views. The castle is beautiful and the location offers great views of the city. You can see views from both sides of the castle looking towards both the river and the inner part of Buda.

Another tourist attraction. There is a funicular railway here although it is quite expensive when there are steps either side to walk up and a bus that will take you to the top in mins..This walk was easier than the Gellert hill one
very beautiful place. on the top of the city with great view. very nice place to walk. museum inside (we didnt go). classical architecture is amazing.

Amazing views. We took a hop on hop off tour of the city and stopped at the castle, it is simply stunning. We got a hotdog and hot chocolate (both really fairly priced and yummy) on a fresh March morning and just took in the view. You cannot visit Budapest without coming here

Another Castle -- But While You in Buda..... Perhaps I and my wife have travelled too much but we are "castled out." That said, the entire Castle Hill area of Buda is an absolute must when in Budapest it gives you a sense of what the Hungarians thought about themselves during the Dual Monarchy. The castle and the surrounding area is vert large, very enjoyable even though it rained while we there, take your time, there are several other museums in the area plus the Hospital in the Rock, plan for an entire day on that side of the river and start with the castle. And if you like castles, of course this is more than a three star experience.

Great architecture, impressive buildings, not much else to see or do. Currently under re-construction, but other than some very large and imposing buildings, there is not much to do here. The Art Museum is in part of the huge building, but you cannot get into any of the rest of the structures. On our tour of Budapest the guide said that the Communists gutted the ornate interiors and whitewashed all the rooms!! Too bad, perhaps it will be better once they finish re-construction.

worth a look. nice area for a wander around. doesn't seem to be a massive amount to do there - especially on a monday when everything is shut. nice area around the castle a lot cleaner than the pest side.

Impressive palace. If you visit Budapest you have to visit this palace. Inside you can visit National gallery have a look at some treasures of the Hungarian nation. Reserve 1 - 2 hours for visiting the whole complex.Great view from the castle on Danube and the city.
Excellent. Definitely worth walking around and learning about this castle! I would definitely recommend this to anyone visiting Budapest!!!

Gotta go. So, you ser ot sitting across the Danube from the Pest side. Regal, intriguing. You see the funicular, hiding jewels above. It 's just a short walk over the chain bridge. If you don 't do it , you 'll regret it forever.
Nice. When You think that somthing like that whas bild before electrification and engines , You only can say "BRAVO"

Really nice walk. Me and my partner visited here today. Was a really nice walk around a very impressive building. We rode the funicular up to the castle which, dubious as I was, I felt very safe. The castle grounds itself is filled with great statues and stunning views across the city. A definate must if your in budapest.

You MUST see the Noon Changing of the Guard. When in Budapest, one of my top picks is seeing the Changing of the Guard at the presidential residence, which is in the Buda Castle, (right next to the Castle Hill Funicular). The guards change every hour, (and they have the last changing of the guard at 4:30pm, when the last guards go off duty). The best show happens at noon. The changing takes approximately five minutes, (the guards complete multiple precision drills with their rifles and march around the presidential residence). A camera and video recorder are recommended. The other changing of the guards are impressive, but the best and longest is at noon. Afterwards, there are many buildings to view and you can see the old foundations that they are unearthing that are several centuries old. There are also some gift shops that sell great souvenirs. If you want extra enjoyment take the Castle Hill Funicular from the castle for about $7.50 (round-trip).
Views from Buda Castle. The best time to visit the Buda Castle is at the sunset and you will see the whole city in lights, wonderful views from the top.

Decent attraction. The castle complex has a very nice peaceful feel to it. We arrived just in time for the changing of the guard on the Funicular railway which was worth the experience in itself. Great views over the river and we got some good photos too! The castle is interesting to look at, but we didn't go inside.
Nice place. A must-see, although we didn't enter the museums. The view from the castle is wonderful and the building itself is wonderful.

Incredibly Impressive!. Whilst I'm sure it's possible, we didn't do a tour of inside the castle, and that's the onky reason it's getting 4stars! From the outside, this simply massive beauty gets you the best views of Pest, the Danube, but also from the back the hills of Buda too! We strolled around for about an hour admiring the architecture and the art works of the palace.... very impressive! You must also see the palace from Pest as well! Well worth it!

Nice castle, museums and views. This building was severely damaged during WW II, however it has been reconstructed in a very nice way. The castle complex holds a few museums that we didn't visit. The views of Pest from the castle are really nice and you can shoot beautiful pics from the castle. The town of Buda is really beautiful with medieval houses and little shops.

Really the best part of Budapest. This area is so lovely with the little shops and streets. the area is very touristy but the views and history make up for it. We hired a taxi driver who could enter the castle walls and could speak good English. I think this was better than the tour buses Taxis are very reasonable.
go at night. We went at night and was it worth it as all the statues were lit ,also the added views of parliament,and the traffic on the Dina.went during the day and just as goog

Should be beautiful, but under reconstruction for too long time now.. Nice, must be visited, but only by foot. The streets are always under work, which is not helping a lot. Enjoy the nice views from the Fishermen's Bastion towards Pest (Eastern part of the city), or visit the Royal palace (the king never lived here). Some other attractions also available, but you can find the same almost everywhere. Try the underground hospital. Avoid being hungry from Mathias church to the Royal Palace... restaurants are especially for tourists!

Fantastic architecture. The views from Castle Hill and the architecture of the Buda Castle are amazing. The interiors, unfortunately, didn't survive the World War II, which left the palace in ruins. They were rebuit in an austere and modern fashion, very unnecessary to visit in my opinion. One of the buildings holds the Hungarian National Gallery, which I didn't find very interesting. So just take your time walking around it and enjoying the view!
Nicest castle ever. I immediately visited Buda Castle when I came Budapest, because my friends recommended me to check it first. It has great view to Duna and Pest side, especially during sunset.

A fantastic view. One of the most beautiful city-panoramas in the world, mirroring in the waters of the Danube. The silhouette of the Mathias Church and the Duda Hills in the background are completing this fantastic view.
Fascinating. fascinating with a long history and magnificent buildings, start from the castle old stairways ,...then walking to the other part

Funicular. The main reason we decided to go up in the first place was because we saw the funicular. Once we were up there, though, we realised that there was plenty to see, and got right to it. Plenty of different city views to enjoy too. We spent the morning learning about the castle, then sat at one of the cafes there to have some coffee and just enjoy the view. A pleasant place to go if you enjoy history and nice architecture.

A nice way to spend a few hours. We visited the castle on our last day in Budapest. We caught the tram to the bottom of the hill and then travelled to the top using the funicular. Once at the top, the views are lovely and you can see right out across buda and pest.We spent an hour or so walking around, which was pleasant. Our only criticism would be that nothing is sign posted. We weren't sure what anything was or what there was to see. There were fantastic statues with no name or commentary. This was a shame.Overall, it was worth it for the views.
Buda Castle. Beautiful architecture in a lovely party of the city. A wonderful place to walk and enjoy the views and the surrounding area.

Main attraction. You will want to spend a day visiting Castle Hill and the castle district. Taking the funicular at the foot of the Chain Bridge is fun. We were able to walk from Leo Panzio to the river, down to the bridge and across to the funicular. Once up the hill, walking around the castle is fun and views are great. Visit the museums if you want, then head over to the castle district and spend the rest of the day exploring.
Another part of the Hungarian history. A walk around the Castle area is very interesting and historical. Just the idea that this is really old is awesome.

Make Buda Castle and the Castle district a whole day. The exterior of the castle is beautiful, and they are in the process of renovating the entrance at the bottom of castle hill which was in deacy, so in a year it should all look fabulous. The interior of the castle is an art museum, with white washed walls. No, it's not the Hermitage, or Peterhof, but there is one of the best collections of carved wooden alter pices I have ever seen. Buy a ticket, walk left of the ticket counter and enter, and there are some steps up to the second floor. You won't be sorry. There is a good coection of Hungarian impressionist artists. I am always impressed at the quality, though they are not Renoir. Which reminds me, they have awesome exibits that are on disply. This year van Gogh, Renoir, Matisse, show going on. I have never seen any of these artists paintings before, but now I see why people rave about them, and I'm not an art fanatic. Sandor Palace is next door, at 12:00 they have a changing of the guard, nice to catch. Then head to Matthias Church taht was just renovated and is awesome. many other sights to see in the Buda are, a whole day. Some people say the castle is a waste of time. Try Yellowstone next year.

It's worth a visit only by the cable. It's one of the must see in Budapest. I suggest going up by the funicular and then take the walk down to danube. You shoulg have those great little walks into the castle.Also you should see all the great views from there.

Could be better.... The Buda castle seems to be like the only major attraction in Budapest. However, it certainly did not live up to my expectations and I felt the whole place could have done more. The views of Budapest is nice but definitely not breathtaking. Just nothing special in my opinion overall. I suggest to arrive the Buda castle by crossing the chain bridge, arrive at the foot of the hill, travel up the hill by the funicular.

The view justifies climbing. Eventually Buda is there mainly for Pest…The citadel is nothing special but the magnificent famous view of pest indeed justifys the climb to the mountain. Take tram 14 and then change to 27 (transportation frequency not very good but nice drive in the little local bus)

I could and have spent all day here.... I love Budapest and have spent quite a bit of time there. One of the best attractions in this beautiful city is Buda Castle. It is quite a large area so make sure you wear sensible shoes. There are many sculptures and fountains, buildings and breathtaking views of Budapest. Another essential item is of course your camera, there are myriad photo opportunities to make you look like a pro.I have captured a lot of this castle area in 3D which you can see on my iPad app 3D City Explorer. My favourite part of the castle is that it sits high above the rest of the old city and you can really get a feel for what it must have been like in the old days when there were Kings and Queens. You couldn't get a better location to build a castle here, and Hungary is a fascinating place. In summer there are free concerts within the castle open court area, and a nearby walk to the Fisherman's Bastion will take you to restaurants and cafes, with more amazing views. You can easily spend a beautiful day out up here.Regards, Ken.3dcityexplorer.com

beautiful. Try to get here using the funicular, it will be a very pleasant ride. The atmosphere is nice and it reminds of the old days of glory of the Habsburg family. The view over Danube and Parliament (this building is incredible, completely incredible) is breathtaking.
Very good views. Use the furnicular to go to the top and you get a very good view of the city from up there .there are some nice places to eat the local cuisine around the entrance

panaramic view. have stayed in budepest a few times.always seem to be drawn to the castle.you can either use the fanicular or it is accessable by road.the views are stunning.the band playing near the church are brilliant.lots to see.well worth a visit

Nice View. Ride the funicular to the top of the hill then spend hours roaming the castle grounds. Did visit some of the museum artifacts and walked the stone pathways and drank in the great view of the river below and the town of Pest on the other side. Plenty of history here, and not only centuries past. There was fighting in this area during World War II with stiff Nazi resistance to Allied army (Russian). I believe some of the dead enders resisted in the castle itself.I don't understand why I can't put in actual date of visit, which was late Spring 2005. System only had limited date choices. ????

Very nice place and great view. Even if you don't go inside, you should at least go around, there is a great fountain and nice gardens. It's hard to believe the place was destroyed since it is so majestuous now. Hosts many festivals.The insides are occupied by either the national gallery or the history museum. Both will give you great views and if you are lucky, when it's hot, they open the windows and you can take great photos of the parliament.The easiest way to go is the bus 105 to Clark Adam (just past the bridge) then take the stairs or the funicular.
Impressive. Walked over the chain bridge then up the funicular to the castle. Amazing views. Shops and restaurants near by. Look fantastic lit up at night. Worth a visit.
Wonderful.. Beautiful place, & great view over pest.We didnt take the Funicular. If you are infront of the Funicular at Adam ter go to your left, and youll see a path up (a bit of stairs).

Always a must to visit. Set on the high side of Budapest you look over the river to the parliament, which is a beautiful building, shame there is always work going on around it ..... so you get cranes etc in your shoot.But here in the Castle on a blue sky days, just wonderful on the weekends you get some guys dressed up in old costumes with big birds of prey. A wonderful couple of hours to spend up there.

Lovely Place. We strolled up in the mini escalator towards the castle. It was such a nice place to walk around and live the old age. Very impressive and strategic view over the Danube and you can see the Parliament and the whole city from there, and the world war artifacts they have there are very nice. We had lunch in Buda caffe which is of average quality but it was our only option since we were far from the other Pest side of Budapest where all the restaurants are.

I live very close to Buda Castle! :-). Buda Castle gives you a breathtaking view to the river Danube, its bridges and the Parliament, you can take beautiful photos here. You shouldn't visit this place in case of fog cause you won't be able to see anything along the river. The Hungarian National Gallery operates in the palace, you should check it because the paintings are amazing there! I think Budapest History Museum is only for foreigners who are especially interested in archaeology. You can find it in the palace, too.

No Castle But What A View. The Castle district is an absolute must see place on your Budapest visit either for the daytime views looking down over the Danube and across the Pest skyline or even better at night when lit up. You can get bus numbers 16 or 16a from Pest ( by the Chain Bridge ) and within a few minutes you will be in this Romantic spot ( make sure you visit the Fountain in the main Courtyard, it's quite Beautiful ).
simple one of the most panoramic places on earth. excellent views - surely worth a visit. Took Hop on-Hop off from Pest side. Very cheap price and definitely worth-it

BUDA CASTLE - mostly an art Museum. The Buda Castle of Kings and Emperors for centuries, was converted into a museum during the communist era, and was not open to the public for many years. Now it is a place to enjoy centuries of art, take in the views of the Danube, and enjoy the sights to behold.
Beautiful. The Castle complex overlooks the city. Fine buildings & excellent views. We got to see the changing of the guard as well.

Buda Cadtle. Beautiful view from the top. We happened to arrive in Budapest during the Palinka and Sausage Festival. Enjoyed the ambiance, Palinka and the Hungarian Rock Folk music ( if such a genre).
Buda Castle. A great castle, lots of aritcuture and well preserved bastions.Lots of ex-soviet armoury, not my kind of things, reminds one of the bad old days of the Russian oppresion/

Very pretty and romantic by night!. I went in the evening when it was dark - the castle was beautifully lit and it very relaxing walking around the castle! Only disadvantage is that photos don't come so good. I would suggest going a bit before it gets dark so that one can experience the castle in light and when it gets dark.
Beautiful building. One of the greatest building I have ever seen. There is an art gallery and a library inside. Lot of tourists are crowded sometimes all around the place but it is a fantastic site
Changing of guards!. Grand changing of guard ceromony during midday is a must for the visit in budapest! It is amazing. The best changing of guard ceromomy that i ever watched.

buda castle. It was nice, but other places seemed better! It was a windy day, but we still loved it. The castle was lit up very beautifully at night, and the view from the river cruise was exhilerating. Did not dislike anything.

wonderful. we happened to get there at the afternoon & spend the time until supper time. what a great things to do than you can see how beautiful it is on the day time & even prettier in the night when all the lights are start... just wonderful..!!;))

Great views of Pest. We loved the view of Pest from Castle Hill. you get a birds eye view of the Chain bridge, Danube, Pest city, and the Parliament buildings. There is a lot of reconstruction of the roads up there when we were there and can get a little crowded on whats left to walk on. The views by the cathedral are the best.
wonderful place. be it day or night this place has a charm in itself. the entire complex is great to visit. the views of Pest, the Chain bridge or the parliament is quite fascinating.

Lovely view from up in the castle and great fun at the Wine Festival!. Me and my partner stumbled across the Buda castle as we crossed chain bridge. We paid to get the lift up to the top and back because it was just quicker! You can walk up there if you dont want to pay for the lift. Once we got up there, there was a wine festival going on, so we paid to go in there too and it was a great experience! Lots of wine, cheese and food and live music. It really was a great atmostphere and great experience. The view of budapest from up in the castle was a beautiful sight, and was even prettier at night! Got abit chilly though!
Walking tour. Lots to do and see around the Castle Area. Various sites - mostly expensive due to it being very 'touristy'.
Nice Castle cool story. Visit it with a guide so u can hear the tales about king Matias. He is so famous that Hungarian mothers and fathers tell his stories as bedtime stories for their kids
Nice to Walk Around. The castle grounds are lovely. From the gardens, there are beautiful views of the city, especially at night.
Nice to look at. I enjoyed the walk up to the castle but it was closed for the day, lows about going in off season, but it was a lovely garden. Good range of sites to see in the area.
Impressive!. Was a bit windy when we climbed the hill to see the Castle, but it was totally worth! Wonderful architecture, and a much greater view from the city. Highly recommended!
from outside nothing extraordinary. from outside itlooked like nothing extraordinary, we were not inside (tired). Anyway perfect looks from terraces.

Good museum collection, great views. The current special Impressionist exhibit is definitely the highlight of the museum. The castle itself is only impressive from the outside the interior is completely redone as a museum. Several times a day performers will entertain you on the grounds.
The small selection of craft shops just beyond the residence has good selections and prices.

A nice Castle... The Castle is wonderful to see from outside. But the Castle is now function as a museum. the castle was destroyed during the world war and they rebuilt and restored it. Inside the castle you can see a various of good painting and sculptures.
Stunning views. The view from the top of the castle is just stunning. you can see most of the Pest side, and a lot of the Buda site. Bring a camera and some binoculars

Mustsee. It is an amazing place, both when you watch it from the opposite bank of the river, and when you are inside it. I advise to visit the museum in the castle, it is not big, so it is not tiring. When we visited this place, there was festival of arts and it was possible to watch people making unbelievable things of different materials. For those who like handmade things, it was a paradise!
A fleeting glance!. Didnt spend too much time time here, but it looked beautiful! The Buda Castle is worth a visit and will need time to have a proper visit!

Attractive buildings. The castle complex has been well preserved and well maintained.It's easy to wander around and enjoy the views from the hill, but also be impressed by the buildings and the many statues in the grounds. Do allow several hours for a visit, more if you intend to visit any of the museums and galleries.
Visit the budapest castle. Beautiful art collection, nice view over the city. There was a lot going on inside the walls. The mountain trainride is nice.
Interesting. Incredible views and the staff are friendly and helpful. Worth visiting and seeing. There are many stairs but even avoiding them worth seeing.

Dont Miss Changing of the Guard. We took the Funicular top the top. This is definatly the best attraction in Budapest. You MUST see changing of the guard full ceremony at 12 noon. It feels like a scene from World War I pomp and circumstance.The music and uniforms were greatSpend the rest of the day just walking around the district. Derfiantly the highlght of Budapest

A beautiful historical walk with great city views. It's well worth the visit just to walk around the castle grounds and soak in the scenery. Probably the best way to get to the castle would be to take a bus to Clark Adam ter (square) and hop on to the funicular railway car that will take you up to Castle Hill. The best view of the Chain Bridge can be seen once you reach the top of the hill. It's a nice leisurely walk through the castle grounds with plenty of places to sit and relax. The smell of the food coming from the vendors near the castle was very inviting. They were setting up for a food & wine festival that day so we didn't get to stay around that area for too long. We didn't have enough time to go inside the castle since we were only in Budapest for the day. Wish we could have stayed longer. We liked it so much that we're already planning another trip to Budapest. This time it will be a longer stay.

ATTEN....TION!. Visited the palace this week. Great views once you reach the top. We took the Rail car up the steep hill.Don't mess with the guards. One girl tried and almost started an international incident. The soldiers here in Budapest take their jobs VERY seriously. Show them the respect they deserve. Lots to see both at the front and the rear of the building. Lots of gift stalls too.

budapest 2013. we stayed in pest and managed to do buda in one day. the castle/palace was deffo worth a visit and even better if you are on a bus tour as you dont have to find you way to the top. however if you do plan on going to the museums at the top check opening hours as one or two were shut!

Lovely building, but only pay to enter if you're an art fan. Most people just come in to walk around the outside and admire the palace building and views and take a picture of the horseman statue, kids with fish fountain and the gate and big bird sculpture. I am into art, so I paid to go into the palace which is a lovely building although has very little left from yesteryear. The Baroque and pre-baroque art is excellent. Although I am into modern art, I didn't rate anything in their collection from that era. Except maybe the giant painting called something along the lines of Pilgrimage to the Cedars in Lebanon... Most of the art is religious but well executed. The red marble staircase is pretty cool and has some fossils in the stone. (Red marble is a Hungarian thing). Was crowded outside, but not inside. Probably because tickets are at least 1000HUF for an adult. (Can't remember exact price)
Operetta above the Danube.. Attended a magnificent performance of the Budapest Operetta Theater in the courtyard of the palace. It was a beautiful summer evening in a glorious setting.

An Interesting Area.. Possibly the best way to get to Buda Castle is to the Hop on Hop off bus. A 1 day pass (+ next day free ) cost 5000 HUF each. From the bus stop on top of the hill, it is a long but easy walk to the Place and Museum. There are great views from the castle area.

Views of Buda (& Pest). Worth the climb to have superb views over both Buda & Pest. A little disneyfied as far as the castle and other buildings go ... great to hang out around sunset to sit and enjoy the views of the city.

Busy but fascinating. We took the Hop On Hop Off Bus to the stop and walked up the hill and steps to the Budapest Castle complex. There are many paid things to see and do with families up there. The Spy Museum was 5000 Ft for us and took an hour underground in the caves. Lots of curiosities from spying equipment and a well versed guide. The Military History Museum is vast and complicated but has many items in English and is cheap. It would be great for military and history buffs. There are good views from both sides of the castle hill.

Great view.. I did not go in the castle but the view from the Fisherman's Bastion is fantastic. Get lost in the grotto under the castle for a thrill, especially if you go by yourself. Dark and endless tunnels.
memorable. This was the best place to visit in Budapest. Wonderful building, historic area, nice museums. We chose a hotel nerby, so we could enjoy it during our stay.
Best of buda. The buda castle area is beautiful, with plenty of nice buildings. The atmosphere is absolutly historic. You will fell yourself like a king or queen :-)

Budapest must see and do list. Everyone who visits Budapest sees the castle at least from a distance. It is worth the time and effort to take the funicular up the mountain and walk around the Amstel complex. Because we enjoy art museums we paid the entrance fee and toured the national gallery. The museum focuses on Hungarian artist. It was very interesting and with the audio guide very informative.

green grass. What is nice is the green lawn near the entrance where you can seat and listen to the guitar music played by some nice young people. I did not go to the palace inside but the buildings look reallu nice.

High side. The Budapest side of Budapest. Take the funicular for an easy access, walk around the castle, then over to the recently restored Cathedral by the famous fisherman s Bastion. Coffee and marzipan at the marzipan museum and you get to use another toilet for free.

Great walking tour. I was here during a national holiday.. Great walking tour in Buda. Lot's of local artist and foods. The castle has a great museum and a lot of places to rest and relax. I walked throughout on their National Holiday, Aug 20th. Great views of the Danube and the opposite Pest side of the city. Have fun.
Like a dream. This place gorgeous. It's a great place if you want to see fairy tale like castles. The view of the town from this place is great too.

You have to go!!. Beautiful castle!! Went there during summer time and spent an entire afternoon there. It is a very impressive construction on top of a hill. You can just go and get lost there. I just regret it that I didn't visit at night, but the view at night is breath taking.

Definitely worth your time and money. I loved walking around the outside of the building and looking out at the city and up at the castle. I also loved looking around inside the building. It is now an art gallery, which is not ussually my thing but there were a few undeniably amazing paintings that were worth seeing. Additionally, knowing that it is a palace you are walking around also allows you to enjoy the archetecture and history of the place independant of the art. I would put this high on my list of things to do in Budapest.

Go at night. Impressive. Go at night to see the city lights from the castle, really nice. Bring a date and take the cable car up to the top for an easy ride. But you can easily hike the steps to work off all the goulash and good local wine you had for dinner.The castle itself is pretty nice. Not amazing, but very big and it really dominates the city skyline so is something you need to check out. The best part about it is the view out over the Danube.

The castle is gorgeous. The panorama of the chateau on the hill was absolutely magnificent. The castle is gorgeous. A little more information in English would have been helpful. is gorgeous. Impressive architectural work on top of a hill over viewing the town below.
Imperial Palace. Must visit this. Th number 7 bus from Pest takes you right there. This is a MUST. THe palace, the church and the views from the Fisherman's Bastion will enthrall you.

Incredible. This is a wonderful city best seen from up on this hill. Amazing history. So much history. We got to this via the Red bus Hop On Hop Off tour which was brilliant. Do note the time it finishes and don't just sit on it. Plan and get off to really see the sights.Do walk to both ends of the Citadel.. You need at least four days to see the city.

It should be better preserved. It's a beautiful place,but is not as impressive as it could have been. There are many parts outside of the building which are really dirty. I understand that many parts of the building have been destroyed by the fire during the Second World War and it's oustanding the hungarian people desire to get back on its feet, but the trouble is the state of conservation of some parts. The view is breathtaking. Yes there are places where you will feel like inside and old castle, but inside the building there are regular museums and the looking was pretty modern for my taste. I was there with my wife and my 6 years old daughter. One warning: Stay away from the restaurant that stays in the terrace. It has a beautiful sight but the service is awful...
Great View of the city. Great view from the Castle but over priced restaurants around here. Can easily avoid the museum inside.

Confusing tour even with audio guide, and long!. Interesting, but the tour is way too long, confusing, and very repetitive. In the end it was a relief to find the exit. The interiors are restored to a municipal standard, as opposed to a royal standard. I don't think the Hapsburgs would be impressed. However, it was very damaged during WW2, so it's remarkable it is still standing (many adjacent buildings were pulled down). Whoever wrote the script for the audio guide should (and maybe did) use it as a dissertation for a Masters degree - too long, too detailed.

Buda Castle. The Buda Castle is a must-see in Budapest. From the outside it presents an astonishing view at night. From the inside it is a pleasant visit. The Buda Castle hosts the International Wine Festival in September where you can find the best local wines.

For Museum Lovers. Once a royal home, today a complex of museums. An impressive building dominating the landscape over Budapest - nice view of the Palace from the Danube bank on the Pest side. The easiest and most spectacular access is if you walk through Chain Bridge and take the cable car to the top. It is a short ride and takes you right to the Royal Palace. There are several museums inside including the presentation of former royal chambers as well as Hungary's National Gallery. Devote several hours for the visit as coming out you can enjoy the viw of the river and the city from the top called Castle Hill..
Tour of the grounds and the scenic viewpoints was great. Beautiful sight lines to the city of Pest, the Danube, and many of the great architectural buildings and bridges of Budapest.

One of Europe's Most Famous. The Buda Castle houses the National Gallery of Art, among other things. It is well worth going and spending several hours. Actually, there is more than you can take in in a single day. The entire castle area is worth seeing and of course the views from there are spectacular. Don't miss this as it is one of the key places in Budapest. Nearby, all within walking distance are Roman era ruins and many shops and restaurants, the Matthias Church and other sights.
Gorgeous!. Absolutely wonderful. So gorgeous and amazing views. Unfortunately you had to pay a little more than I would have wanted to view the insides, which was a let down.

boring!!!!!!!!!!. i see some review said the castle fee is expansive and boring when i want to go inside my father is really expansive! but the only thing is good is the out side. is so beautiful! i think you just don't go inside! and there is really so little English information.

Amazing Views. The views from the Castle are amazing and should not be missed on any trip to Budapest.We visited there in the afternoon and took the funicular up as we didn't fancy the climb in the sun and the views were amazing. We spent a good hour wandering round the outside taking in the architecture and impressive statues but did not go into any of the museums. Bus no. 16 and 16A take you up the hill and drop you right in front of the Church / Castle.

Budapest Castle. Must have a guide!!!. Well. I'm not an experienced tourist. For me this place would REQUIRE a guide. Otherwise you will be looking at a lot of beautiful statues without knowing what or who they are all about. There is a LOT of walking on cobblestones and climbing stairs. And it is BIG. So just meandering around is not the way to go. After I had been there I read a lot on the Internet about this place. So having someone knowledgable about its history would be so much better to go with you. We went by "Hop On Hop Off " bus that has recorded tours that are informational in all languages BUT the go by fast. So I we'd suggest you go on the round trip once (2 hrs) ,determine where u want to get off the next time around, do some research on a guide and then go around again. This bus tour is inexpensive and it is for two days and also has access to the boats on the river.

on the way to become tacky. The Castle building is a large and cold monstrum, now half empty, half housing the National Gallery and possibly still the National Library. The surroundings are very tacky: low-quality and smelly cafe/restaurant at the base of the entrance to the National Gallery, rows of low-quality, "hungaricum"-peddling wooden huts facing the residence of the president of the republic, difficult-to-walk pavements and a splendid view over Buda on one side and Pest on the other. Overall, a rather tacky medley of things, but overall of a cheap touristy kind. the Nationla Gallery has exceleltn exhibitions - but is a bit pricey.
Picturesque. We saw the Royal Palace as part of a walking tour, so we only saw the outside. It was very pretty, and there was good views over Pest.
Rebuilt. This is a nice walking area but really touristy. Make sure to eat before you go! The views are great but most of the buildings have been rebuilt.

Disappointing. Not really royal and not really a palace. If you like museums, you'll enjoy it. If you're looking for the beautiful mosaics, ornate furniture, ceiling paintings, and lurid royal behavior, you won't find it here. Good looking building from Pest and good for pictures.

The views are amazing. The Buda Castle is located in top of the Castle Hill with close proximity to the Fisherman's Bastion and Matthias Church. The views from the Castle are amazing and should not be missed on any trip to Budapest.We visited there in the evening and then the Museum exhibits were already closed, so I cannot comment on that.Bus no. 16 and 16A take you up the hill and drop you right in front of the Church / Castle.

Stunning view over the city.. Enjoy this fantastic surrounding of the Buda castle, a stunning atmosphere walking between the Fisherman's Bastions and the surrounding area, the panoramic view is outstanding and even more during the day but at night the view of the Danube and Pest is something unforgettable.

Time for Buda.
