I got the impression that visitors stay mainly on the Pest side, where there is lots to see, and spend probably a day on the Buda side as it appears to be more suburban/residential, and it's hillier too, so not that easy to tramp around unless you enjoy hiking up and down hills.However, if you are spending time in Budapest you do need to visit both sides of the river, and a day for Buda should be enough. We did not go into any of the buildings, some are not accessible anyway as they are offices, and some are being renovated, but we enjoyed walking around (there's a walk up unless you use some form of transport) and looking at the various attractions as we meandered around. There are plenty of places to eat, and there are stalls with food and drink and souvenirs, so you won't go hungry or get bored.Great views of Pest and the river from this side as well.
Must see. Great place to visit, lots of spots to take pictures. It gives a beautiful view of the pest side of the city across the river.

Buda Castle. Buda Castle is a number of things today. 1. Hungarian National Gallery - honestly I was a little disappointed - there wasn't that much to see as most of the 2nd floor & above was cordoned off as a function was being prepared in the space - about 40 mins! 2. Budapest History Museum - This was the exact opposite - at least 2 hours and that was a quick review of the multiple floors - it was interesting and well presented and there were even interactive displays that I didn't get to try. 3. The Budapest / Hungarian State Library - one needed to be a member to use the lifts or there was a 200Forint (about 201 forint to an AUD) charge to use the lift.
Amazing. Loved the history, old stone, location, stone streets. Had a fabulous guide take us through which was so helpful.

Great view from the castle. Enjoyed the castle but the district around is the best aspect. Felt sorry for the trained, chained eagle. It tryed to escape while we were there. Its a bit like the dancing bears. Smacks of cruelty.

A Must-Do, Must-See in Budapest. The Buda Castle/Royal Palace is easily found on the Buda side of the Danube. It is a beautiful palace that will leave you feeling like you've truly seen a piece of history. You can ride an lift to get to the top of the castle, but I recommend walking. It is quite a hike, but definitely worth it. Not only that but you get to see great shots of the city as you do and there are many wonderful photo opportunities. When you reach the top and explore the castle, there are little shops and places to eat and drink.

Nothing impressive. If you will go to the Royal Palace you would expect a palace like Vienna, Italian or another countries palaces.- This one is only a waste of time.- As you can see I'll never go back to Hungary.-

old town-castle - palace. got there on the on-off bus and then walked down the hill back to accommodation on the buda side. lovely well restored old town, cafes, castle, magnificent views. well worth a visit to get an overview of this wonderful city of budapest

Very pretty and great view. The Royal palace and the Buda Castle itself is stunning. You could be there for hours taking in the view and sitting in the courtyards. You can get up by walking or taking the tram. Both are relatively easy and not to much of an effort. We took the tram up and walked down which was easier( and much cheaper if you on a budget). Remember to bring water along, water at the bottom of the tram and at buda castle is really over priced)

Beautiful architecture. Stunning palace. Breathtakingly beautiful and definitely need to be of things to see whilst you are in Budapest. It is more of a courtyard than a castle however and you can't see around the building. The views over the city are absolutely fantastic.

Must see!. This castle is one of the reasons, why Budapest is such a beautiful city. You can easily spend whole day in Buda Castle area. Amazing views overlooking Danube. Fun way to get up the Castle Hill is funicular, near Chain Bridge

Royal Palace, Budapest. Buda Castle or Royal Palece was built on the southern tip of Castle Hill, bounded on the north by what is known as the Castle District (Várnegyed), famous for its Medieval, Baroque, and 19th-century houses, churches, and public buildings. It is linked to Clark Ádám Square and the Széchenyi Chain Bridge by the Castle Hill Funicular.

#1 un Budapest.. This is *the* place you must not miss. I don't know if there's another way up, but take the funicular, which is a nice trip up and not too expensive, to my recollection.
The castle is massive and you'll not only profit from its marvellous architecture but also from the views of the city.
First place to visit in Budapest!. It's the best place for those who are interested in museums, and history. The fees were a bit expensive, but it worth it!

Great views. Number one place to visit in town is royal palace. Just before the sun sets down, walk over the chain bridge and take the funicular up to the palace. You will be amazed by the views, especially during the lighting of the bridge and all the monuments. It is a sample of the beauty of the city. You can enjoy a drink or dinner on the restaurant located at the place. Just remember. The funicular closes at 22:00 (during summer), so don't be late.

More courtyard than castle, but well worth visiting. There isn't much to see of the former castle/palace other than the exteriors and a few museums (all of which were closed on my visit), but the architecture of the buildings is worth a look from the outside in itself, and perhaps the biggest attraction here is that it has one of the best views of Pest.

Game of Thrones territory. Check out the guy with the huge falcon skulking in the ramparts! Terrific views and lovely precinct. Self- service restaurant back from castle across little park is very good value - nice salad bar, a blessed relief in 39 degree heat.

Worth the visit. Well worth the walk up into the castle, area crowded with shops, bars and restaurants, full of life and activity. By the side of the castle there's also a wine celler that does excellent wine tastings of the local grape in a shaded garden - fab for a summer afternoon

Nice architecture. Great building witha really unusual hunting scene fountain, strange statute of what appears to be a buzzard or vulture clasping a sword....Use the Cliff Lift it is a great way to view the city going down.
More of an area than a castle.. Not what I think of when the term castle is used but a collection of museums, buildings including the cathedral and fisherman's bastion. Surely high on the visit list.
Great castle. A Castle with many levels and different exhibitions. Worth a try if you are interested in the history.

Could spend all day. this was part of a walking tour we took of Budapest. There is so much history it helps to have a knowledgeable duide to help. The statue in the castle gardens are magnificent especiall the hunters fountain.

beautiful place. You can take the funicular up or by foot. I choosed the funicular. I do not remember to well the price, I think arround 400 HUF. At the castle you will find many shops and more than enough museums. I did not visit any of the museum becouse they are a little expensive, starting with 1000 HUF, and I am not into art. Bu the view it's great, the pictures will be beautiful. Take your time, walk arround and then go in the center, grab something to eat (after you exist the grounds of the castle, you will walk along a bridge with many flags and you will enter the city, at a crossroud there you can find a restaurant where you can serve yourself and pay at the cashere up front, they are not very cheap but the food it's amazing). Neat the restaurant you can find a local postal office, maybe send a cart at home.

Good way to pass a few hours. Travel up to Castle Hill via the Funicular for great views, particularly from a table on the cafe balcony near the Castle building. There's some excavation work to look at, information on the Castle, a changing of the army guard, great views and nice areas to sit and relax. Can also buy a few small souvenirs here.
Palace. Really great architecture. Fantastic views. Recommend that you walk the whole area. Great place to view the Parliament and the Danube.

Highly recommend. Take one-half day to visit this Palace. This is worth the time. Make sure to see the inside and go around the front, we almost missed it. There is a nice cafe in the front for lunch that is very casual and offers a great view of the City Pest.

Pretty Cool!. Since we came later in the day, The museum was closed and we didnt get to go inside, but we did get to walk around. The outside was just as nice and it was really pretty from that far up! The ride up the moutain was pretty cool as well! Would love to go back and really spend some time inside though!

Beautiful view over the whole city. What a spectacular view. Lots of tourists. Best to bring your own lunch as the only place s to eat are very touristy & pricey places. Handy: there's a small public bus that goes directly from that area back to "Derek Ter" in the city centre. Costs are around one euro and you can even buy tickets in the post office next to the palace/castle. Make sure you visit the church nearby as well! Worth it.

Spectacular views from the top of the hill. Especially in the evening, the lit up bridges across the Danube and the skyline of Pest is breathtaking. The whole Buda Caste complex is vast and sprawling - allow for at least a half day to take in the sights alone.

Spectacular views. Views are amazing. We didn't realise still after that it was here Katy Perry filmed her firework video. It's a long walk but accessible by the vernacular train. We brought a lunch and sat out the back on the benches taking in the Buda side of the city. There's a lot to read up there. It goes through the entire history from every rise and fall. A great day out for everyone. Very romantic in the evening.
Wonderful. Loved it. The castle was amazing so much history. Views were awesome. A must see on anyones list. Loved walking the town as well

Nice view, lots of turists. Watch out for pickpockets here, I guess this place with full of tourists would be ideal! Expensive restaurants, cheapest coffee was in the bottom of Hilton hotel (next fo fisherman bastion) where they are selling the marzipane.

What a view!. You did probably get your best view of the city from the Castle District! There is also a nice cafe right on top of this where you can sit and enjoy the view sipping on a cuppa...the view of the city from here is phenomenal.

Nice!. I visited the castle in winter, it's so amazing to arrive by walking and admire the exhibition into it. There is also a little cafè where we rewarmed ourselves from the outside temperature with a palinka and hot chocolate!

many wings...a little confusing.... the front side wing e...is the history museum, many galleries on wings abc...go too tourist info or read a timeout,lp,roughguide for what you want too see...within wing E...is the royal chapel,cellars basement...worthy of a visit...for the mediveal feel of the palace...much of the other floors,the history of the palace in budapest...with temp exibitions everywhere...devote the min of 1.5 hours here...also with a reasonably priced cafeteria...
interesting. Should be viewed with a guide so as to get the historiucal facts. There is a lot of history to Hungary. Its facinatingl I wish I could come back aain and visit all the sites

Beautiful outside!. Not what we were expecting. It's really just another amazing place to look at from outside.Very Austrian feel about the place.Not castle as we know it.The kids loved the trip up in the funicular and the views again are outstanding. The new palace is built on old Medieval parts which can be seen,the gardens and fountains are beautiful and as the weather was gorgeous,we didnt try to venture inside.There was a man offering a chance to try cross-bow,archeryand some spear and sharp thing chucking which my son and hubby loved! We even used up some old euros to pay him!He then sat them on a throne in Medieval garb for a photo.Being teenagers they did this reluctantly while us parents laughed!If you walk through an archway you go to the area with fountains and shops straight ahead up the street past the stalls is a lovely cafe. it looks expensive as it has flowers and umrellas outside,it isnt .Go and have a baguette and ice cream there its fab!But if you have ice cream in a cone you cannot eat it at the table???We got some and left. Free to use the loo if eating there. Waiters a bit miserable though haha you cant have everything!

Changin of the Guard. Fantastic views over the whole city, magnificent architecture and wonderful feeling of the golden age of the Austria-Hungary Empire. Changing of the Guard at noon - not quite the pristine precision of Buckingham Palace but 10/10 for dedication and enthusiasm

More interesting on the outside than what you find inside. Walking around the castle complex turned out to be better than castle itself that houses a museum but does not really function or is set up as a former residence.

Buda Castle and views. Highly recommended for the views across the Danube and towards parliament. It can be reached by tour bus, via a venicular carriage or on foot. The castle is lovely and there are some local stalls and shops to visit followed by a nice walk through the old streets and back down to the Danube.
Coach tour visit.. Lovely place to spend a sunny afternoon, although the shops were very expensive. Very interesting historically.

Unremarkable interior but pleasant surrounding. We enjoyed walking around the outside area. The interior is pleasant enough but none too memorable. Our visit to the interior was problematic. Our visit coincided with a school group of rude teenagers. We happened to go into the restroom at the same time as these school girls. 2 or 3 of them were ahead of us in line, but the rest of them were behind us as we went in. Once inside, the girls behind us quickly ran into the stalls, cutting the line very aggressively. We didn't feel comfortable "competing" with young girls, having no past experiences of bullying the young, so we let a few of them go first. I wonder how such rude behaviors can be so commonplace as to afflict a whole group of school girls. Unsure if this is a "common teenager thing" in Hungary.

Go hang out. A great spot with super views.Lovely to wander around.When I was there they had a massive market going with food and geegaws for sale.They do good sausage.Knocks Berlin sausage into a cocked hat.Check out pres palace,take the funicular or stroll down via a great cafe whose name I forget where I got a great latte and salad...

Take the funicular up to the castle. Great views on the way up to the castle and also of the castle. We caught the changing of the guard vey spectacular and smartly dressed guards with dark sunglasses on!
Lovely castle. Lovely castle set in the historic, walled town originally called Buda, so much history associated with it, very pretty. Fantastic views over the Danube.

A village of its own. What a place! Felt like I was in a different city altogether (a city within a city). Ended up spending a big chunk of the day up here. There was a food festival if some sort happening, with traditional entertainment which proved to be great fun. There are some great restaurants, shops and magnificent views up here. Don't leave without a visit.

Castle Area. The whole area around the castle is quite beautiful and well worth the walk. We travelled up to the castle via the funicular which saved our legs from quite a steep hike, We had a snack in the cafe there and found the food good and inexpensive!

Not a palace anymore.. The views from the palace are amazing, the funicular ride is short but fun, the changing of the guard is interesting but the rest is all museums. The palace is no longer a palace but a complex of museums. There is a library, an art museum and some history museums. The art museum was nice. It featured mostly Hungarian artists so that was interesting as they are not usually well-known. As it was a hot day and there is no air conditioning, the building was warm so we opted not to see any more museums.

Loved this Palace. Although this is not a big palace like others in EU,but we pretty much love this palace. It's very nice architecture, and it's not too crowded which is advantage for taking photos without people in background. One hour would be enough to walk thru the whole area. There's also changing guard on the side entrance of this castle.
Great palace, fantastic view. We used the stairs to climb up the hill and it was an easy hike. The view above the danube and Buda is breath-taking.The museum is also extraordinary.
Buda Castle. Strolling around Buda Castle takes you back to another time. The grounds and architecture are beautiful and the views of the city are alone worth the visit.

DON'T go there hungry!!!. Beautiful place to go and see, can get here on any of the hop on hop off buses.We arrived feeling hungry and bought some peanut brittle and a slice of cherry and cheese strudel and this cost us £14!!!!we bought a larger slice of strudel the next day in town for under £1Stupidly didnt ask the price when we asked for it and should have realised it would be a ridiculous price somewhere like that, who would have thought we were seasoned travellers!!

Stunning views - loved the funicular railway up to the top!. Stunning views - really photogenic - loved it!!!
Bit of a tourist trap but worth it!!! Got choice of shops & restaurants, too.

Nice View. Stunning View, good restaurant, not much significant history.
The vendors were more expensive than those in the square or city markets.

Nice views, well worth visiting. Good views from this hill, Buda Castle is right next door to the Office of the President of Hungary where you can see the changing of the guard, plus up there was also a food festive which was nice.

A must in Budapest. This is definitely worth the hike up to the top. There is a cable car that can carry you up, but unless you have a legitimate medical issue, there's no reason you shouldn't be able to make it on foot. The cable car is like $15 or so round-trip. We walked both up and down.The whole area at the top is great. We went on a Saturday afternoon and there were a ton of things going on: archery lessons, a band playing, a souvenir market, food.You can also watch the changing of the guard and go into the National Gallery of Hungary if you so choose.The views are incredible and the whole area is just fun. You could easily kill a couple of hours just walking around.
Brilliant!!. Absolutely Beautiful place!! Well worth a visit and with stunning scenery overlooking the Danube and Budapest,Brilliant!!
Great view and nice castle. A must see in Budapest! Great view of the pest side and a nice caste to see. You can also find museums and restaurant

great. the palace it self was a fasinating building but it was the whole area, especially at night that blew me away, it was like looking at a picture in a childs fairy tale book. I dont have the words to say how lovely it was, just that it was the first time my friend and I were stunned into awe inspired silence the whole trip.

Well worth the trip - amazing!. I was shocked to find a small village within the castle grounds - shops, restaurants, and an open market. We took the "hop on hop off" bus and thought it would be a quick stopover but ended up spending several hours just wandering around, drinking a beer, and enjoying the spectacular vistas. This is a must see on any trip to Budapest!
Great view. Best place to see Budapest from higher ground, and when you are there don't miss best strudels in Budapest at Retesvar Cukrazdsa in small hall way just before Mathias church.

Free with Budapest's card. interesting, more the medieval floor.then the Hungarian history is very interesting, but please get the audioguide: it's impossible without it. then prepare yourself, because it's a very long visit!

Royal Castle, Beautiful surrounding district.. The Castle itself is beautiful, but it isn't the nicest building in the city, many monuments have more impressive architecture than it, however the view from the hill overlooking the danube from one side and the hills from the other, along with the quarter surrounding it which is wonderful to walk through, makes it definitely a wonderful experience.

Amazing castle - historical parade. We just wanted to see the castle, we had low expectations we have been surprised. On this hill you can see a lot of cultural interesting houses not just the castle and we found there the historical parade regarding city foundation. The visit has really improved since we found a guide to follow. We paid him there and he shared with us some information not only regarding buildings but also trying to let us learn how hungarian inner spirit is. I really appreciated it. This part of the city is BUDA do not miss it.
nice. The Matyas fountain is beautiful. The Hungarian national gallery was a disappointment, because it was so small inside. We liked the Budapest history museum very much.

Amazing views. Take a full day to visit the castle area and you'll not want to leave. There is so much to see.....the Fishermans Bastion, the Palace grounds. Have a meal, sit awhile with a drink soak up the village atmosphere. And....the views are brilliant.

not very interesting. unless you are religious and like looking at very unhappy looking baby jesus and mother paintings then this is not going to be of much interest to you the inside of the castle is modern mostly and the permanant art exhibition was as described there are better museums to be visited nearby so I found it was a waste of my time and money

Impressive architecture & history. Buda Castle stands impressively above the Danube, this is the perfect photo opportunity, fantastic architecture and history to match, take time out to wander and explore, have a drink at the Cafe which overlooks the Danube and views that stretch for miles. Places like this, some kind of guide or guide book is essential.Access via the funicular railway 1700 HUF return (adult) or walk up the meandering pathAgain toilet facilities are not free, charge was 1 Euro

great views from the castle a must see in Budapest. The castle is beautiful and a great place to enjoy the views. There are a lot of cafes and restaurants on the hill, just enjoy at a relaxed pace, take a camera and get lots of pictures, especially panorama pictures :)

Buda Castle. Wherever you are along the Danube the Castle stands out prominently offering fanatastic photo opportuinities both day and night. We walked up the hill approaching it from Chain Bridge and decided not to the take the funicular because the views from each level are different and well worth doing. When at the top you can visit the museum (we didn't) but then you can walk around the palace and see fabulous views of of Buda and Pest from many different locations. After the castle then only a short walk to Fisherman's Bastion.
What a castle !!!. Great place to take shots and take in the beauty of the castle and its surroundings. The views of Budapest from here is breathtaking to say the least.

Great place to see Scenic Budapest.. Museum is awesome. Its very central Europe oriented. Lot of old church and royal art collection. You could spend easily 4-6 hours walking around learn about central european history.

Palace of Plenty. The grounds offer a hald day of various activities. Take the funicular to get to the top! That starts off the day with great fun. Inside one of the areas in the palace is a National Museum and I enjoyed the art in this museum as much as I did Museum D'Orsay! Lovely collection. Also on the castle grounds they had a little test archery set up and I shot my very first arrow! Lots on the ground to do - a must see.

Buda Hill Castle and the Castle District. The Buda Castle area of Budapest is found at the top of the Buda Hill, on the west side of the Danube. To get there very easily, take the Budvari Siklo [Buda Hill Funicular] near the Chain Bridge. The large, imposing building at the top is known as the Royal Palace, and is the home for a number of important Hungarian cultural institutions. You’ll find the Budapest History Museum here, which covers the history of Budapest. The National Art Gallery is also here, as is the National Library of Hungary, the National Széchényi Library. At the top of the funicular ride, and separated from the Royal Palace, is the President’s House. Just as in London, England, have your picture taken with the soldiers stationed at the guard houses!Castle Hill is a Unesco World Heritage Site, and it is an impressive sight from the shores of Pest, towering over the cliffs on the Buda side. However, don’t expect the over-the-top glitter and glitz at this World Heritage site that you would expect at other palaces or castle in Europe. The reconstruction of the building after WWII was more for symbolic reasons, as no monarch had lived in the palace or on the grounds since 1541. However, the halls of the Ballroom, St. Sigismund’s Chapel, the Palatinal Crypt, the Great Ballroom, the Main Staircase, and the Habsburg Room are all still elegant examples of refined architecture. The palace building consists of a several wings (lettered A to F), which are situated around the Lion Courtyard. There are sculptures located throughout the grounds and on the buildings, there are beautiful fountains to see, and there is a phenomenal view of the Danube and of Pest. The flower gardens are also very lovely in the warmer months. When you get off of the Siklo and walk along the Danube overlook, check out the bronze statue of a large bird that is perched on top of a tall pedestal. This is the mythical Turul bird, a powerful symbol of the Kingdom of Hungary. After touring around the Royal Palace museums, stroll towards St. Matthias Church and the Castle District, and check out the craft stalls along the way. Some reasonably-priced fridge magnets and small souvenirs can be found there. Be sure to look carefully at the fantastic buildings along the way to the church…the famous POSTA building is a mellow yellow color, another has a famous ceramic statue created by the beloved artist Margit Kovács perched in an alcove above the first floor, and other buildings are painted in bright colors.Put aside at least a whole day, if not more, for exploring Buda Castle, the Castle District, St. Matthias Church, the Fisherman’s Bastion and other famous sites. There are many museum, gardens, shops, and churches to see and discover.

Superb area and atmosphere. Take the ventricular train up to the top for 1000 fts, (£3) and then take your time to stroll around the streets and the castle area. many snack bars and restaurants which are good prices. Well worth planning to spend most of a day in this area of Budapest.

Tourist trap. Judging by the queue for the railway, it would have been quicker to walk, but was worn out at the end of the day. Then I saw the cost of the tickets would have bought dinner for one of us, decided to give it a miss, view or no view. Too much still to see without wasting time being taken for a ride (in both senses of the term).
Nice place to stay. Poor light inside the hotel, lot's of red and black colors, but i suppose this is the concept ( see Paris )

Steeped in history. Well worth a visit Historic buildings in magnificent condition Be prepared it may cost you to take photo's inside some of the buildings. My tip would be to switch you're flash off.

Buda Castle in Budapest, Hungary. Went to the castle by walking from Parliament building. Crossing over the Danube via the Chain Bridge. One can reach the castle via tour bus, or can walk up all the way up. I choose to walk as its not difficult to do so, plus the weather on that day is very nice except a bit gloomy. The view from Buda Castle is simply amazing! Worth to visit. And one of the must-go for those who have limited time in hands to do city tour.

castle?. expected more of a castle but was more of a collection of buildings, worth the trip for view, changing of guard etc. We walked up rather than taking tour bus, this was not difficult and plenty of stopping points on way up hill

Shame about the restoration. Well worth a visit during your time in the city but more because it is the main thing you will see from the Pest side.The building is not particularly impressive close up due to the shoddy restoration that has been done but it does allow some great views of Pest and the surrounding attractions make the visit more than worth it.

Awesome View!. You can reach to top by funicular or you can simply walk as well. There are no words to describe the view!! You can see the parliament, Gresham palace, chain bridge and St Stephen's Basilica in one frame!!! One the 'must be done's in Budapest

Not much up there but the views are impressive. Take the funicular railway up the hillside to the palace. There isn't much to do at the top other than looking at the site where the old palace was destroyed by German invasions. However, look out on any side and you will have breathtaking views out over Budapest.

A lot going on. There was a festival on in and around the palace over the Easter weekend with a ticket combining access to all the shows, stands, exhibitions etc. The weather was not good the day we were there, but it cleared up the following day. The castle has undergone so many transformations, being rebuilt time and time again.

too many tourists, too little to see.... sorry, but there are many places in Buda and Pest that are much more sexy than this one. Too many busses, too many tourists, too much monkey business and too many rip offs.

Lovely area to walk around. The whole castle area is lovely to walk around, and incomplete without walking down to the Royal Palace. We were there in the snow and the views all around were sensational.

The President Turned Up!. Yes, honestly! We arrived just as th troops were forming up and the President duly arrived in his huge Audi. What a bonus! However, as this will hardly happen every time, tke the opportunity to have a good walk round. There is some amazing statuary and the views across the city are fabulous. Ignore the souvenir sellers who are touting over-priced stuff which can be bought cheaper in town. Take care on the uneven cobbles - flat shoes are best for walking about up here and also through the old town. Take your time and enjoy this unique part of the city. It's well worth it.

royal. Another large piece of architecture in Buda.When we visited there was filming going on at the Royal palace and fishermans bastion.You could easily imagine the courtyard with horse drawn carridges.Well worth a visit
Budda town. Beautiful surroundings, great castle, good coffee. It's a Disneylike place.Easiest way to get there is to drive
Lovely walks. Well worth a visit. It's quite old-fashioned but that's what we were looking for. The Laberynth is worth a visit as is St Mathias church.
Another landmark. This whole area is worth a morning or afternoon of your time. Great views of both Buda and Pest from here!

Superb spectacle by day or night. From our room in the Intercontinental, the Royal Palace was a striking sight by day and night. Stunningly beautiful. We walked over to take a closer look, and whilst the views from the palace towards Pest were with the trip, the palace and castle itself are best viewed from a distance.

Beautiful views and splendid buildings.. This is a spectacular building and there are awe-inspiring views. For me, this was one of my favourite places. The area surrounding the castle is a must do. To get here, cross the Chain Bridge and get the funicular railway to the top. The whole area up here is wonderful.
Lovely castle. I went there one sunday when there was an exhibition of chocolate brands. Full of people, crowded and we have to pay to enter into the castle because of the exhibition.

Beautiful castle with panoramic view from top. Amazing architecture of the castle.You can have a panoramic view of Danube,Chain bridge,Gellert hill etc.Walk up the hill or take a fernicular ride.Apart from the castle,there are other places also in the same area-Fisherman's Bastion,Matthias church, Labyrinth.You can spend atleast 2hours here.There was snowfall when we were in Budapest but still we enjoyed the beauty of the place and took many pictures. Do not miss the view at night.

Great. The arrival of 2013 caught me strolling about this beautiful place and I enjoyed a great view of the entire celebration, despite the fog and the cold. It really is an impressive structure, even by night because it is well lit and a must-see place in Budapest.

Beautiful, historic palace. My favourite part of my trip to Budapest was visiting Buda castle. A perfect place for spend a summer's day and a great place for photography enthusiasts to take great picture looking over the Danube.
Awesome in the March Weather. Its been a good day break with my wife for a long walk in the initial summer!!!Its like we had traveled a 200 years ago in the fairy tale story...
royal palace. very nice architecture up here we spent an hour or so just walking on the outside of these buildings

Budapest castle worth a visit but give the museum situated inside a miss.. You have to be fit to visit this attraction as it is situated on a steep hill. Alternately use the red hopper bus. Architecture in this city is amazing and the castle is still being restored after suffering 2nd world war damage, but the work already done is brilliant. Disappointed with the museum. Equivelent to £8 each admission and frankly although large not worth the cost.
Amazing views on a clear day. Really great just to walk around. Feels very fairytale yet entirely free. I would avoid getting dinner up here though as its quite expensive...

Nice walk around the palace. We didn't actually go inside the palace but it's nice enough to just walk around outside, lovely views of the Danube/Pest and the grounds are pretty and well kept. There were guards standing at various points which do a ceremonious changing of the guards - excellent photo opportunity!

Stunning views. Walking steeply upwards for about half an hour, we didn't know what to expect - but it was well worth it when we got to the top! (Luckily it was a cool day, it would be tough doing that walk in the Summer heat!). The views alone were spectacular - you can see the entire city - perfect for a few photos.The architecture of the castle and surroundings is stunning with lots of history. Well worth a visit.

fantastic art. Not normally great museum-goers but the paintings in this gallery are superb - particularly good if you like conventional depictions not 'modern art'. The school of 'social realism' is well represented.

nice to see. We took the funicular up to the top to save the walk. Very lovely buildings and the view was great. Went into the National gallery and enjoyed looking around but would have liked more information to be on hand and didn't appreciate the staff lady who stood watching me in the bathroom changing my son's nappy weird!!!

Soloing Eastern Europe: Summer 2012. Taking the steep climb up a hill to see this spectaculous piece of hunagrian architecture and the amazing view of the capital city of Hungary is well worth taking the heat on a June afternoon.It was nice and quiet when I explored the Castle with a friend I had made in the hostel I was residing in.The statues of and fountains dotted around would make you stand and stare and take in the beautiful sculpture talent and I was lucky enough to see the changing of the guard.Take the cable car down from the hill to see a growing view of the city and take a walk across the chain bridge.
Beautiful views. although it needs further renovation it is full of history. A small museum inside. Do not miss the underground caves

Day or Night Great to Vist. Beautifully restored building offering wonderful views across the river of Pest.Marvelous to stroll around be it in the day or when it is lit up at night.Also many festivals take place up on the grounds during the summer (Wine, Palinka to name a few) so if you are in town when one is going on even better to enjoy it while so many people are too.Definitely one of your must do items while you are in Budapest

astonishing. The Castle is Huge! You can see it from anywhere close to the river! It offers some nice panoramic views from Peste and at night it looks amazing. I guess i have never seen such a beautiful city at night such as Budapest!

Try to catch the changing of the guard. This is a beautiful area full of history. If you can get onto one of the walking tours I highly recommend it. The changing of the guard on the hour is definitely something to try to see if you can!
views. the views from the top of the castle are breathetaking. Lovely cobbledstone area, with a few shops and stalls. Would love to go back in the spring.

Amazing Buda Castle !!!. I have been to Budapest on summer 2012 for 4 month... I have been sightseeing all attractions and was amazed by the grandour of Old Palace of Buda and the surrounding Gellert Hill area. Worth visiting...
Impressive.. Elevated views across river after ride up funicular(very crabby kiosk lady who ripped our banknote with her machine!) Impressive building on a lovely sunny day.
Fascinating place. Wonderful place to visit...we spent most of the day in this area. The Hospital n the Rock was the highlight of our visit...a must for anyone visiting the Castle Hill area.
treat to look at. Gorgeous architecture-saw at night and day. Love how they light it up. Right on the river so a big part of the skyline view

castle in the snow. Very atmospheric in the snow although unfortunately the view across the Danube was understandably not great. People were all very helpful and snow was being cleared all the time. The old town was lovely and the Matthias church was being renovated
Buda. Make this part of you time in buda. Museum of history is ok but only if you have plenty of time. Changing of the guards was good. Lovely to walk round and take in the architecture.

Top sight in Budapest, day and night.. For me, the hill with the Buda castle on it, is the top sight of the whole city. After climbing the hill, you are presented with an impressive and big castle/palace. You can walk for an hour of two in front of the castle, offering very scenic views to the city below. When we visited it had snowed, but it's really nice to walk thereInside the castle grounds there is also an interesting and huge National Galery Museum when you want to escape from the freezing cold during winter if you feel so.Beautifully lit at night till around midnight, it's the evening sight when you are on the other side of the river.Make sure you don't miss this one, even if your stay is short.

Beautiful building, extraordinary wievs!. Buda Castle - it's a beautiful building, it give home for exhibitions, our National Gallery as well. You can walk around, wonder about its beauty, the little details... I personally recommended to come up by foot, because, especially in the Spring or Summer (when it's not too hot), well worth come up by foot under the trees.And the wievs of the city when you finally climbed up, it's your gift after came up, it's really extraordinary!

Our walk to the Castle. We walked and used the funicula - so much to see and so much history in this area - unfortunately we had done no preparation, had very little knowledge of Hungarian history. A return visit with more information would be a very good idea.

Great view, and fun to visit.. Take the funicular -- and don't be put off by the queue and the attendant with her old Communist attitude. There is plenty to see when you get to the castle, now a museum of Art and History, after its restoration from the previous decades wars.

a must to visit!. went there with a friend, walking from the across the river, and then climb up to the palace complex. tired but all worth it! beautiful beautiful view and buildings. can't picture it with words. if you come to Budapest, this is a place to go first and foremost! amazing view of the river and the city. Went there during the night and spend a lot of time taking pictures then walk back to our hotel. We end up not sleeping and enjoying the trip too much!!!!
unbelievable view. This is a must you can look over the whole city and great views of the Danube, a great chance to take photos.
Breathtaking. Breathtaking - especially on a clear day at sunset! Beautiful stroll around the grounds and wonderful architecture to look at. Could have spent hours just walking around.
Great views. Visiting the Castle and Palace offer a great chance for indoor and outdoor tourist eventing as you can happily wile a day away with the views of the City

A Castle is a Castle - right. Buda Castle serves to remind us of times gone by and we learn how the castle functioned throughout the years gone by and served the city - the views from the upper terraces are excellent on a clear day and the detailed information on the caslte is past and present day use allows the visitor to wonder and explore the many hidden areas, some less interesting then others - visitors need to decide for themselves what they expect from a monument such as Buda Castle.

Buda Castle. The castle was well worth the trip, we went into the museum, glad we did although not as much to see as we expected. We saw the changing of the guards when we arrived that was interesting as we see it so many times in London, great to see traditions are still in place elsewhere.

lovely views. The Royal Palace offers lovely views. Many tourists think that the Buda Castle is infact a castle, it is not. As far as I understood from locals the whole area which includes Fishermens Bations and the Royal Palace is named Buda Castle area. The building itself is the Hungarian National Gallery of art, situated on 4 floors. At the entrance you pay arounf £5 per person and this gives you access to all floors. Good value for money, really considering the place is massive. The will also store your coat for free, giving you a keyfob with a number on it so you can redeem your coat after your visit. The collection of art is interesting and quite astonishing. No photos are allowed unless you pay a little extra at the entrance. Outside the views are amazing and there are plentiful of statues to admire.
Nice views. Nice views from the castle, except it was freezing when we went during winter! Shame that all they had inside was an art gallery.

restored and quite plain. The outside of this easily-reached building is large but rather plain. The National Gallery which is housed in wings of the building is limited and some of the lighting was quite poor.
lovely crown on a hill.... This castle is lovely as it rises on the hills of the buda side of the river....we enjoyed viewing it from the river the best!
Good place to go. Castle area looked very nice . It was snowing and enjoyed the walk from top to the road down . Some nice coffes shops near by .
VIEWS. This was my favorite thing in Budapest. The view from the castle is gorgeous and changes everyday with the light and weather.

A lot to see. Just wonderful. Make sure you have plenty of time to walk through the whole district. There are too many great things to see and you won't regret. I'd advise you to go in daylight and stay there until the night.

Impressive View. I personally thought the dramatic setting and view was more impressive than the actual building. I am a bit jaded as this was the last stop on a Prague, Vienna and Budapest trip. After a long trip through Europe, incredible buildings and statues begin to not stand out from some of the others. If this structure was in my city, it would be the centerpoint of the city.

where the stones and the cold speaks history. we've been in Budapest on Christmas 2012, we visited many sights across that splendid city. Buda Castle in enormously great, it is a huge castle. we went there by night and it was a snowy day. you can see the entire city with those charming lights ... the Danube river and the two bridges could be seen from a special angle. we took many pictures there :Dit was enjoyable!

Powerful, historic and artistic too. The Castle contributes to Budapest romantic nature and it’s beautiful, especially at night when its outline is illuminated. You can feel the historic power of the castle; its statues are speaking of some past ages. From the castle view of the Chain-link Bridge, the Presidential and Gresham palaces and the Danube River is so romantic., we used the elevator to climb up and walked the pathway heading back.
Fantastic Culture. Visit for great views across the river and looking over the Buda side of the city. Make sure to see the changing of the guards.

Nice to walk round. The castle was beautiful and it was nice just to walk around the grounds and the views of buda and pest were amazing.The changing of the guard was something else and we enjoyed it throughout.

Great complex. Royal palace and whole area are beautiful. Here you can see everything: ancient ruins, defensive walls, towers, parks, monuments... Try to explore every part of it and than go back to Fishermans Bastion. Nice and cheep souveneers are selld in wooden houses, also food and vine.
Busy, but worth it. We went in October and it was still very busy but it has some amazing views and great photo opportunities

SO MUCH TO SEE AND DO. Buda Castle area has so much to offer. Much of it you can do for free. It is so romantic by night although the views are better in daylight. Lots of nice cafes to rest in. the mosaic stykle tiles on the outer roof of the buildings are beautiful. this whole area is great place to be. You could spend a whole day and evening and still not see it all.
Majestic. This place is amazing. To take a wander around and see the attention to detail and splendor of this place is a great opportunity. It's a fantastically beautiful place and well worth a look.

Buda Castle. What can one say about a city that has so many wonderful buildings that are, in most cases older than my country. Buda Castle occupies a prominent position on Buda hill which is impossible to ignore, drawing you up to it where no disappointment awaits.

Lots to see here. There are a number of attractions to see in the castle district. You can spend all day here so make sure you determine what you want to see before you go. The other sights in the area are Fishermen's Bastion and Matyas Church. Make sure you take the funicular up but walk down. You will also see the CItadel and if you head in the right direction, you will see the Gellert Hotel.
Room with a view. We were lucky to have booked the Hilton in the Buda castle. Amazing building, history and architecture. Stunning for someone that has been to Budapest for the first time.

Stunning at night. My partner and I took a trip to the castle the first day we were in Budapest, its well worth spending some time up there very quiet and peaceful, lots of cobbled streets with loads of detail on the buildings and the view from the castle across the river into Pest is spectacular especially on a clear day, for a quick way up to the castle we took the funicular which was a fun way up and down. We also went to the castle at night when it was all lit up which is worth doing if you have some time, the lights cast some interesting shadows and shapes on the buildings.

Very imposing building. The Palace in Busa is really a palace and not a castle... it is nice to visit and explore the area including the Fisherman's bastions, however we have been informed that it is not worth entering the Palace, particularly at the moment, since you have to pay an entrance fee but the palace is currently being restored and thus all the interior is covered and you can really see nothing inside.
Christmas in Budapest. We have never seen anything like it. It was all wonderful. Our local guide provided a lot of history.
Enjoy the view. From this, the old part, of the city you can see the view of Budapest which is part of the UN World heritage (yup, the view, not the buildings is what it is certified ;)

Nice but not extraordinary castle but.... The castle's location and its surrounding amenities added to its charm. There's a Hilton nearby too. Changing of guards and their fanciful parade, though short, is a welcoming scene in cold winter that warms the heart. My boy enjoys it.

Essential. We approached this on an evening after walking along the Var area and it truly is amazing....almost jaw dropping in size and beauty. How many superlatives can I use .....we did not go into the art gallery as we ran out of time so much to see and so little time.....

Castle. The building is lovely and they even have the changing of the guards which was great to watch. There is a ski lift that takes you up to the tops but costs £5 but you can walk up it if you have the time to spare. We saw a Segway tour of the palace and it also holds inside the palace a museum.
Impressive. Only saw this from the outside but what an impressive building. Its one of those places you have to find time to visit when in this lovely city.
Better from a distance. If you look at it sitting on its hill, it looks great. From close by just another palace and not the nicest one to visit.
Just plain impressive. A city that so rich with culture and history has allowed the visitor to appreciate that these place have weathered the test of time.
Like stepping into a Fairytale. Everything, but positively made by the fact it had snowed the previous evening & with a blue, blue sky it was almost unreal.
Buda castle in the dark evenings. Top tip go at night as there is nobody about,very romantic and no queues for the cable cars. Great views of the bridges and the entire city
Huge and impressive castle. Another sight symbol of the city. Possible to reach it by feet or using the little train after the Chain bridge.
No different from any other castle. The view is great and it's a lovely walk up. The castle is pretty, like most castles. If you're in Budapest you may as well do it.
Great architecture. I enjoyed visiting this place because of it's brilliant architecture. And obviously the whole place is very historic and worth seeing.
Very beautiful. One of the most beautiful places in Budapest. A lot of history in it. Beautiful view of Pest. It's so high standind.
Wonderful Place. Budapest is a very, very wonderfuk city! I'will be back next Spring. Buda Castle is one of the most beautiful views I've ever seen.

Great Castle. We found this a nice place to walk around and there are some cafes/resturants in the vicinity. The museum in the castle is also worth a visit. You can also see the changing of the guard.We walked around with a guide and there was lots of information which complimented the walk and quite a lot of specific stuff you might not find out without a guide.

Lovely Day. Take you time and enjoy it all. There is so much to see and do so don't rush. Parts are reconstructed but it does not take away from the views or your day. Fun to shop up and down the streets as you go from spot to spot.
Interesting but not exceptional. Well worth seeing but not a "must see" in our experience. Much of the castle is still ruins following the Russian blockade.
fantastic. lots of stone steps to climb but definately worth it. The views of Budapest are outstanding. All the buildings at the castle are worth some time to look at
Enjoyed Entertainment Outside of Castle. We didn't get a chance to visit inside the Buda Castle however, we walked around and enjoyed the vendors, entertainment, and the beautiful view.

Only walked around outside!. Beautiful views but we only had 2 days and the now museum was closed the day we planned to go. Please check opening hours so you don't get stuck outside like we did! Oh and it's an easy walk up the hill. Save your money and don't take the tram. The lines were way to long anyways!

Great at night. Sorry to say I haven't visited it 9don't know if it's possible), but it looks magnificent at night, fully covered in rays of light. Completing perfect the nightly landscape of the Danube river with the bridges.
Stands guard over Buda. Quite an imposing building but it is modern and is more impressive because of it's position on the hill rather than it's achitectural qualities
Good but rainy.... Very impressive, great views! Just a shame about the weather... Lots of shops and restaurants and the castle itself is really nice.

Okay but not impressive. Castle and old town is nice but nothing special. Try to visit the museum, especially the basement. There you can find Kings Cellar and Chapel. The museum above is small but worth of visiting. Nearby you can find art museum too.

Great views and an atmospheric walk. I would recommend talking the funicular up. It's only 900forint oneway but the walk is a bit of a hike.At the top you hve great views across to Pest and the bridge.This is particularly spectacular at night when the Basilica and bridge are all lit up.Walk to the right for 5 mins and there is the spa and baths and some good views along there.To the left you walk towards Matthias Church and Fishermans bastion.Over this way are loads of restaurants, cafes and shops. Tourist prices but you can stop for a nice coffee and cake (Cafe Pierot does a great hot chocolate)From Fishermans Bastian you get some more great views of the city.We walked down from there and it is about 5mins to the river.You can walk along and take picture postcard photos of parliament from there (again, at night with the reflection on the water is is amazing!)We didn't do the labyrinths as they seemed a bit touristy and overpriced but you could easily spend half a day up there.Visit the Hungarian house of wines as well for wine tasting.
Budiful Budapest. The entire Royal Palace area is a must-visit for any trip to Budapest. Don't neglect the Hospital in the Rock and the Church in the Rock.

Fantastic views.. The Buda Castle was on our "Free walk" itinerary and we learned from our guide that it was never inhabited by Royals and isn't even a castle. That said, there are three museums housed within the "castle" walls and the views over the Danube alone make a visit worth it. The walk up is a bit steep, otherwise take the funicular railway.

Amazing Castle Area. We were fortunate to be in Budapest during the wine festival held at the castle. We had to pay the festival entrance fee to get into the castle grounds, but it included entrance to both the castle and art museum. The festival was fabulous, lots of food and amazing entertainment.
Must See. Visiting the castle is worth it. Makes you think how aweome it must have been to be a Royal back in those times. The palace is huge and the views of the city are magnificient!
Great castle. Didnt get the chance to look around inside although we walked all around it. Very awe inspiring despite it being a relatively new castle.
Scenic. This has to be seen at night looking down on the the lights from that area in the city. Is quite high up on a zig zag road. Cars can go a certain distance.

You have to see this. The royal palace is beautifull situated and you you have a good view over the city. Beautifull buildings and grounds. You can go up by an old cable car and walk down. Changing of the guards at 12.00 is something worth watching. On it grounds are reasonabe souvenir stalls I would recommend buying there.

You Must Go. If you are in Budapest, you have to go see the castle. The area is quite large, the buildings are beautiful and the views are amazing. Take a guided tour to get the most out of it. The castle grounds are free, but you have to pay to see the National Gallery and the church. From Pest, the best way to get their is take transport to Deak Square and then board the #16 bus to the castle.

Big Gallery. One comes here for the National Gallery, and indeed there is a vast collection of Hungarian art, mainly from about 200 years ago, but to my eye all rather much the same, and not of international standing. The best bit was the current temporary display of satirical drawings from around 1900, some of which related to paintings now on the walls of the main gallery.
Big palace on Buda-hill. On the Buda-hill, for the best result take a guided tour, there you will receive a great history about the Buda Castle. There is amazing view to the Pest side.
Stunning views. Clean buildings, steeped in history and stunning views across Peste. Lovely to walk round the surrounding area - medieval and baroque buildings

Great views. I went up to Budapest Castle and walked around the grounds taking in the amazing views of pest and buda aswell - it's a shame it's no longer a castle because I would have loved to have wondered around the hungarian royal rooms
Beautiful View of Pest. Revive the "Royal" past of Budapest and see the Buildings were also Princess Sissy spent part of her life. Enjoy the amazing view of the side of Pest from the Belvedere
Stunning building and art gallery. Loved the works of art both inside and outside the palace, with artists and architects/sculptures satisfying everyone's desire to be seduced.

Wow. Take the short ride up in the funicular for the most wonderful views all over Budapest. You would need a good few hours up there in order to see everything. The long walk down could be tiring for the less able but it sure is a 'must see' sight.

another must go spot. make sure to walk along the Toth Arpad after visiting the Military History museum then to the Buda Castle. Don't just walk along the main street. Its another kind of discovering when viewing the nice view of Buda city from Toth Arpad setany. Try and you will know.

Amazing Views. We went to this location as part of the hop on hop off bus. Take the funicular. We were fortunate to arrive in time for the changing of the guard. The views over the city and The Danube are amazing.The history museum is worth a visit. Admission charge applies.
Worth visiting. Very interesting but don't both with the Budapest History museum very expensive and most of the exhibits were missing

Overlooking the City. The castle looks down over the city. It is lit up at night and looks superb. There is a magnificent waterfall with huntsmen and dogs at the entrance. Bronze, I think. You should see this if you visit Budapest. Take the vernicular railway to the top.

Enjoyable. It was very enjoyable exploring the grounds around the Castle. But as far as castles go, I thought it was pretty average (I do live in Vienna mind you). Views from the top of the hill are great though and a must do.

Beautiful at night. . This place is amazing and we recommend going in the evening. It is lit up and quiet perfect for a romantic stroll around the vast castle grounds. However during the day you do get to go into the museum. My gf would like to share that it has a squashed penny machine so take 2 x 100 coin and 1 x 5 coin.

Wonderful views. It is well worth taking the cable car up to Buda Castle and Royal Palace area. Stunning views. I recommend you go late afternoon so you can be there for when the daylight goes and the city lights up. It was a wonderful sight and great for photos ... take your tripod!
more beautiful from a distance. as u can see from close up its actually more modern than the design makes it appear, but lovely nonetheless, this side of buda is worth seeing at nightime...stunning

History in hand. View from the fortress extends to infinity. The stone walls of the fortress to be well preserved with its monumental dominates over the Danube and Budapest. One huge historical monument for which you have to separate the day to be able to visit around. Be sure to engage a local guide
Pretty. We didn't go inside, but the outside of the Castle was very pretty. My son had a great time shooting arrows outside the Castle on the lawn.
Nice building, but not really a castle. It was impressive, especially perched on the hill overlooking Pest. Didn't compare to other castles in Europe. Maybe the museum we skipped was better.

Nice area. It's a great place to see. There are some impressive buildings there reminding us of the Austro-Hungarian empire. It's also worth visiting some of the museums in the area and the National Gallery.
Great Views. Great Views from the top. there is an old World War bunker at the top that you can go into. Very interesting and well worth a trip
Very nice to walk around. we walked around this area which was very nice and caught the hill train up the hill. Very pretty area and lots of different museums and styles of building

Great Day out. Interesting area. dint realise there was so much to see. there were beautiful birds of prey with handlers next to the Church. We had photos taken with them. Amazing. the old buildings and ruins are interesting, everything is explained well and its easy to find your way around. There si a cable car taking you up to the castle, well worth the small fee. The people are so friendly and helpful. Loved it all

very cool. of Buden or Buda i want see this castle.Absolutely fabulous castle ,Nice place for a walk especialy on sunny weather,The entire Castle Hill area is nice to see- Beautiful view. Nice statues. i did not visit the exhibit inside the palace since i did not read great reviews or was of interest to me. thisplace near Funicular .it worth 1.00-1.30 hours,Enjoyed walking round the castle with its stunning statues. Well worth a visit. Wish the fountain had been working on the day of my visit .he view to Budapest is amazing and gives you great photo opportunities.
Buda castle. Of course one must go here. But it sits atop a big hill on the Danube so also has a bird's eye view of the city.
Absolutely fabulous. At 12 midday there was a performance put on by the arm which was amazing. Beautiful buildings and spotlessly clean.

Nice place for a walk especialy on sunny weather. The entire Castle Hill area is nice to see- Beautiful view.; Nice statues. We did not visit the exhibit inside the palace since we did not read great reviews or was of interest to us.

Dream Castle. A great view on the beautiful Danube. Can see you whole Chain Bridge and some other bridges, together with the Pest City. A nice scene seen from the outlook at the night. Recommended for the photographers to have DSLR shots from the Castle.

Very interesting!. Great for the historian in you. Definitely take a tour if you want to understand anything - We did as part of the hop on/hop off bus. Cute cafes to eat around the area. Nice photo taking spot.

Baroque Extravaganza. We went there on the day after the National holiday and strangely most of the places were closed except the history and archeology museum. There was a cafe open there with a very reluctant woman serving

Changing of the guard. We went up the Funicular for a fee and came up right next to the Palace. We saw the guards guarding the Palace at first which was sobering. We then saw the view of Pest, and it was so beautiful. At around the hour, we saw the changing of the guard, and that was an experience in itself. Just so great to see. We also walked around the ruins nearby that was just amazing to think about what was here 1000 years ago, and then the view of Pest and the rolling hills. Just a wonderful experience.
Interesting. Well worth a visit for the views and photo oppurtunities. Also stalls and cafes to enjoy, flat and confortable shoes a must.
Lovely place to visit. Enjoyed walking round the castle with its stunning statues. Well worth a visit. Wish the fountain had been working on the day of our visit
A true Palace. The view to Budapest is amazing and gives you great photo opportunities.................................
Changing of the guard. Very busy with lots of organised trips. Visit early in the morning for a bit more space. Saw the changing of the guard which was nice.
breathtaking from the outside. loved the diffrent parts that streched around the castle but not much to see inside also the view was great of the whole city and the danube

stunning building. we walked to Buda Castle but lots of bus tours are available. it sits in an elevated position and has great views of the Danube over to Pest. Its worth going down to the Pest side of the Danube at night to see the Castle, it is even more spectacular
Amazing. We walked up to the castle instead of taking the cart up the hill. The views are lovely and there's plenty of places to stop up there for a drink

Relaxing Buda, as opposed to a heavy Peste :). Buda Royal CastleThe huge building on the south end of the hill fortress was a royal palace, with different styles and looks in the historical period, starting from the XIV. century. Rebuilt 400 years later, while the largest reconstruction works be carried out after the Second World War. In the day and age there are Historical Museum of Budapest, the Hungarian National Gallery and the National Széchenyi Library (Széchenyi Könyvtár).Buda is perfect "antidote" to speed through the crowd and Pest. Hilly Buda can be seen as sigh of fresh air, especially during the hot summer months. Take advantage of the time to get you to admire the luxurious residential villas, walk trails, rent a bike and take in the view that you can enjoy, explore caves stalagmites or just enjoy your meal in a restaurant surrounded by green nature

Beautiful, and so different from Pest!. This place is really something and the views are to match! In fact the whole of the Buda Hills Area is just something a little special.It's much more quaint that Pest and although it's got a lot of tourists there it has a nice feel to it.
Very Nice!. Really nice. Lovely view. Clean, safe But the day that we visit the Buda castle was Monday and we couldn't go in the Royal Palace. Anyway we only admire it from outside

Great view over Danube. The castle buildings are very beautiful and with great views over the city. Changing of the guard takes place on the hour and it is a sight to behold absolutely fantastic. The grounds are beautiful and obviously really old. The views are spectacular and the architecture amazing. Worth to be recognized as a World Heritage site. It's not imposing just magnificent. The statues were artistic as well. Go back into history, walk the cobble stoned streets, enjoy the medieval street scape, have a coffee or beer and enjoy the great view over Danube.

Palinka and Sausage Fest. Went for the fest and also to view the castle buildings at night. very beautiful and with great views over the city. Easy to get and an excellent venue for concerts and fests.

Fantastic. Changing of the guard takes place on the hour and it is a sight to behold. absolutely fantastic. The grounds are beautiful and obviously really old. in the lower grounds of the palace/castle proper are lots and lots of fantastic stalls selling hot food and drink and music playing. Very Germanic and great great fun to just sit with a cold beer and people watch.

Make sure you go at 8am or after 8pm!. I cannot recommend the Castle enough. The views are spectacular and the architecture amazing but it has to be seen at the right time. I was in Budapest for 8 days so visited the Castle first thing in the morning, midday and at night. In there morning there are very few tourists and the light at that time really compliments the building. At night it is all wonderfully lit and I saw perhaps 5 other people. But during the day it is just another tourist nightmare. Hundreds visiting which really takes something away from the place

Amazing historical building. Worth to be recognised as a World Heritage site. It's not imposing just magnificent. The statues were artistic as well. You wish you were Hungary's President so you can work in the office there and admire (enjoy) the sights everyday.
Great fun. We went during the wine festival. Such a great atmosphere lovely food nice buildings and great fun. Much easier if you take the old fashioned style lift up !

Nice place to walk in the evening. Castele itself is just a castle but the part of the city arounf is very nice especially in the evening. Photographers can have a good shots of the parliaments and a river on the sunset and night.
You must see it.. Go back into history, walk the cobble stoned streets, enjoy the medieval street scape, have a coffee or beer and take a grand view of Budapest.

Pretty but not sold to it's full potential. This is a lovely sight and is really grand looking but unlike tourist sites in other cities there are no signs or explanations anywhere about what each area was in the past and the significance of the area. Bit disappointing really.

beuatiful by day, beautiful by night. liked everything, except the cobblestones. Those are the original ones, but are hard to walk on. Palace is a marvel,the Art Gallery's collection is comprehensive, and view is breathtaking, no matter which direction you turn.

Not much to see. This castle was largely destroyed in WWII and only the exterior has been restored. Visitors cannot go inside. The grounds were bustling and we enjoyed people watching and combing through the food and trinket stands. We watched the changing of the guards at the presidents' office building.

A must visit!. An amazing place, you have to visit this place. It is quite a hard walk up, butyou can either get the number 16 bus to the top or takethe funicular (costs 1000 huf). The views are great and the history is amazing.
Take the funicular. Very nice lunch at the top and excellent views. Also historical and could be hiked but the funicular is a unique and old remnant from the past.

Nice view, that's all. There is a nice view but you can find the same in many other locations. In the castle there is a boring history museum, a galley but nothing related to the royal castle. Visit only if you have the time.

Excellent September Wine Festive. While visiting in September there was a wine festival taking part in the castle grounds. There was over 200 stand of local wines and a great atmosphere with music and dancing going on in the stage area. We paid around £10 to visit the wine festival which also gave us access to both the art gallery and history museum, both of which werent the best we had been on, with little descriptions in English in both.
Beautiful Views. The Castle District is very lovely. Beautiful views. Easiest way to get there (and darn cheap too) is the hop on/hop off bus. A must to do in Budapest!

My favourite place in Budapest. I didn't attend the gallery, but enjoyed walking around. And even returned once again during my 2.5 days trip. One time at sunset, one time in the morning.Splendid views from both sides of the hill, beutiful monuments and architecture. I enjoyed the atmosphere very much. Attention to details is rewarded:)

Soaking it up. If you like a bit of a walk and want stunning views of Budapest then this is a must, there was even a beer festival when I went which had a top atmosphere and great people happy to have a chat and share a beer
Hop On/Hop Off bus got you there. A must see while in Budapest. The hop on/ hop off bus was the easy way to get there and an inexpensive way to see all the sites in Budapest.

Enjoyed the Beer Fest outside but didn't go inside. The Castle grounds were great to walk around and the views were wonderful. I liked the statues and waterfall statue of the hunters the best. We stumbled upon a beer Fest around the Castle grounds and never made it inside.
Fit for a king. This is a wonderful place to visit. I liked all the beautiful examples of archicture. It gets a little crowed during lunch time. Arrive early and enjoy all the sights.
loved the guards outside. once again the position of this palace is superb as the views over the city are breathtaking. the guards outside the main enterance are very impressive in theyre uniforms.
A Must See venue. A lovely part of the old city that is a must for any visitor. Take a trip up the fenicular railway and be sure to do the carriage ride around the castle district.
amazing. wow what a building and what a view it really is one place you must see when you go to budapest.also easy to get to transport system great.

MUST SEE. Out of all the sights in Budapest this was one I would have never traded. The palace is so vast that it streches over most of the Buda hill. But do not let that deter you. Walk up to the top, if you are able, and you will be rewarded with the best views and 2 amazing Hungarian museums (the National Gallery and the Museum of History).
Do not miss it. The castle, museum, cathedral, streets, Fishermen Bastion, all are beautiful places to visit. Take at least half day to visit them. Go inside the cathedral.

Beautiful from the outside.. Not quite sure on the inside, it looks more of a gallery than an actual castle. Although when you get to the basement it gets more interesting with secret passages & a pretty little view from the windows.
Amazing castle....royal in every way... Tour guide was informative and friendly... we enjoyed this wonderful castle and its grounds. The view from here is amazing. worth the time and effort.
Exebition of Royal Palace. Inside exebition is wonderful.Very beautiful view from the Royal Palace is beautiful .Budapest is a wonderful capitol.

Worth a nice stroll around!. The "Buda Castle" is worth a nice stroll around especially on a beautiful day. The buildings and architectures, as well as the surrounding compound and of cos the view, are altogether quite lovely.
More of a palace than a castle. Could see buda Castle from our room at the Marriot hotel. It was even more beautiful when lit up at night. The red bus took us up to the quaint cobbled square

Very nice. We did not av enough time to go inside the castle due to lack of time but from outside the castle look spectacular, especially in the night when lights were reflected on the castle building
Worth going to.... But you only need an hour or two here. It's a bit depressing. The museums look run down. And True, it's not a castle.

High hopes but overly touristy.. We were really looking forward to visiting the castle district, so much so that we booked a seperate hotel in Buda for the night. I cannot stress enough how important it is to follow the advice in the guidebooks and GET THERE EARLY. There were loads of tour groups there and massive craft market on which you had to pay a ridiculous amount (around £6) to get into. It was necessary to pay in order to pass from one side of the area to the other, which was quite annoying. The area itself is beautiful though... particularly the old town right at the top.

Beautiful royal palace. I never stop wondering, how an earth they could have built so tremendous buildings at that time without all the tools we have today. Howcome all the most outtstandig buildings are all oldones.

Outside tells you the history, but inside is rather modern!. The impression from outside, encourage you to see a perfect castle when you visit inside. Even though, museums are very interesting to visit, but unfortunately, inside of the castle has been turned to host the museums which was a bit disappointing!
Go the the National Art Museum instead.. The art collection is not nearly so fine as the National Art Museum's. Architecture is interesting but not inspired.

Top five site in Budapest!. When in Budapest the castle and royal palace are a must see!about two or three hours is enough but a good stroll through is recommended. The Museum in the Royal Palace is high recommended since it has the 60 foot Muncacsi Mihaly! Beautiful! So much beautiful National art treasures in the gallery!
great views, nice area. take bus 16 to go up instead off the cabletrain (waiting forever). and bring a biog memorycard for your camera!

The Identity of Budapest. If not for a picture with the iconic budapest castle the journey up the hill is worth it for the panaramic view of the city. We found the climb not as bad as expected and we did it in the summer heat! Definitely worth the effort and there is a lift to help. Highly recommended.

Another good place to get a wonderful view of the Chain bridge!. Another good place to get a wonderful view of the Chain bridge and the city... incl. river Danube.
The majestic eagle is very beautiful!
Better to walk up instead of using the cable car.

Beautiful architectural area. Some great and beatiful architectur located in this area. You can also see the best view of Budapest and Danube from here. Some restaurants and souvenir shops also in this area.

Underground Hospital. Enjoyed seeing the underground hospital on the Budda side that was utilized during WWII and the revolution. It is somewhat difficult to find but worth the effort. It has not been open to tourist very long so I think the directions will improve with time.

Buda Castle Area and a very special Gift Shop. I have just returned from a 7 week trip around Europe , UK and Ireland. Whilst in Budapest we had the good fortune to visit the Buda Castle Area which is very interesting and not at all what I expected. Budapest was a very pleasant surprise and this area if you ever visit is a must not miss experience. On our travel we found a quaint little Gift Shop called Yulla Creatives in an area know locally as Fortuna Passage and they were selling genuine hand crafted Hungarian Ceramic products that were not only beautifully hand painted but of a very high quality. Some of the Christmas decorations were exceptional and it made me feel very sad that Australians are so limited to cheap overseas reproductions when for the same money and in many cases less it was possible to buy absolutely beautiful items originally made and handcrafted. Why do we accept rubbish over quality ? The gentleman who runs this shop is called "Marko" and he is funny , witty and entertaining and if you actually bother to spend time in his shop you will find he knows an awful about the area as well. There is also an exceptional restaurant and bookstore adjacent to the Gift Shop. Just beware the area does have cobblestones so come well prepared with good walking shoes. The views from this area are spectacular and musicians play instruments I have never seen before (a piano like instrument played with sticks ) so it certainly opens up your senses and broadens the mind about what exists on the other side of the world. For all the Australians contemplating a river cruise from Amsterdam to Budapest or vice versa make sure you visit this area and be sure to drop in and see "Marko" and don't just walk in and walk out - that's very rude and a bit ignorant - have a chat to him and ask questions about his products and the area in general and I will be astonished if you do not walk out with at least one item. I rate this part of our trip right at the top and we brought back some beautiful hand painted plates and a couple of Christmas Tree decorations and in all our travels we have seen nothing else like it.Anyway Budapest is special. If you can also get to see their Parliament - its truly magnificent.

A rich & poor divide. Everything about this place was about the rich and the prileged at time of need by the ordinary people. I was on a tour with a guide and had each room explained. The people that occupied these digs would have no understand of the regular public. The artwork and hanging carpets were outstanding. The ceilings unbelievable with the stories they told. A must see.

Former Royal Palace,. now housing an art museum. Origionally built in the 13th Century. Rebuilt in neo-Baroque style in the 19th century.
