Rebuilt again in the 1950's from it's damage sustained during WWII. Walking the halls of this amazing Palace one can only imagine the Pomp & Circumstance that happened here. To take some amazing pictures of The Var (Castle) it is worth the climb up Gellert Hill (or take the bus from Moricz Zsigmond, Kor Ter) you will not be disappointed. Also make sure to see the matthias Fountain adjacent to the wall of the Castle. The sculputre represents King Matthias with his royal falcon on a hunt while in the company of Helen the Beautiful.
Beautiful. The Buda Castle stands imposing upon the Danube River and the Pest side of Budapest. The courtyards are very impressive.

Beautiful. Stunning views and great experience. You can take the cable car or walk. We took the cable car on the way up but walked down. You can enjoy a drink once you are on the top of the hill and enjoy the views over the Danube and Chain Bridge, with the whol of Budapest under your feet. Stunning!
Magical. Loved visiting the castle 2 decades ago and it still is magnificent. You learn SO much about Hungarian history and art, it's amazing.
Excellent. Beautiful well preserved castle which houses the National Gallery showcasing historical paintings. Great views to the Pest side.

Spoiled by the monstrous Hilton hotel. The Castle is worth a visit (going up the cable car is fun) but it somehow feels a little fake - not like so many of the old historic castles of Europe. The views are good though and wandering about at the top is pleasant on a good day, despite all the tourist tat on sale.
thought provoking. we visited the castle which is now a gallery showing Hungarian art which we found to be rather dark.

Not really a castle - more a museum.. The Buda Castle isn't really a castle - it's been restored numerous times since WWII and now hosts an art museum. That said if you're interested you should take a wonder through the gardens to checkout the fountains, as well as the museum inside. TIP: If you're interested in attending, approach the castle from infamous cable bridge. You then have the choice of either the Funicular up the hill or walking. If you approach from the other side (the korut street side) of the castle there is also a lift, however this costs 100 ft each.

the best view of Pest. a must the museums are great - the views are the best - simply a must - don't pay for the fenicular get the 16 bus from either end of the Chain bridge is cheaper, the views aren't so good but you are lucky to get a view from fenicular and it will not matter when you see the views from the fishermans bastion!

Stunning.. An absolute must-see whilst your in Budapest. The Museum is amazing and the grounds are fantastic. Watch out for the wonderful fountains in the gardens which unfortunatley attract a large number of tourists making it difficult to grab a photo opportunity.

Very nice palace. Very nice palace up on the other side of the river. Easy to walk to if you're up to it, or it is a very short bus ride over to the other side of town. The palace itself is nice, but nothing spectacular. I would recommend that you go see it with a tour group so they can explain the history behind the architecture and exhibits.

Amazing - Breath taking!. If you visit Budapest you must take the walk (or taxi) up to the Palace... there is also a museam up there and lots to see and do - not to mention the panoramic views over the city and the Danube!

Not The Kind of Palace to Live In. The Buda Castle has been destroyed and rebuilt so many times that after WWII it was not restored to any particular period, it was turned into a Art Museum. Our guide took a pass on it because he thought our time could be better spent elsewhere.
Fantastic. Really enjoyed this part of the trip we used the two day hop on hop off bus we even stopped to have lunch in a lovely little cafe nearby.

Awesome. One of the places in Budapest that one must visit if you are in the city. The Buda Castle typifies the grandeur of Budapest and the richness of its royal past. You need at least an hour to really enjoy the place. You will have great views of the Pest side from the castle. The castle is at its full grandeur at night. You better join the evening cruise along the Danube to witness this castle turns into a big firefly at night. :)
Worth a visit. Interesting mix of architecture both stunning old and not so stunning new...why ? The square is very pleasant to have a beer and chill. Great views of the city.

magnificent. It is fascinating when you see it at the top of the hill. When you get there (long and hard walk better go by bus - hop on hop off)and see all that beauty.I asked myself : Is it real? The view is incredible, the buildings phenomenal. It is a live postcard.

Not really a castle but area still worth a visit. This is an attractive part of the city but signposting could be improved, as we wandered around for a while, Good views over the bridges and river Danube. This area contains a little separate district good for sightseeing. We explored the Labyrinths underground which were interesting. We caught the hop on-off bus as this area was quite a walk from the Pest area of the city.
a romantic castle. very interesting place to visit, not to mention the gorgeous guards that should us their prowess during the changing of guards. What a lovely sight!

Worth the views!. A great place to visit during the day and night. I recommend visiting at both times as you get a different view of Budapest - particularly seeing the Chain Bridge lit up at night. There are also small shops selling various crafts and some museums to visit. You may also get the chance to see the changing of the guard outside the Presidential Palace. Try taking the funicular if you don't wish to climb the hill!
A Nice Place to Go. Nice place to visit while in Budapest. Many tourists where there but that is what we expected. We spent about one hour in this area.
Great history. A very nice walk around these historic buildings gives you a sense of Hungarian national pride and importance.

Really worth the walk. From up there the scenery on Pest (on Pest side) or one the hills of Buda (on the other side), is just breathtaking. Even though the day we went was mighty hot, we loved it. Both the castle and the streets surrounding it give you the impression of a different city altogether given the age of the different houses surrounding it. It is definitely one of the sites to go to

Democracy in action!. Saw the equivalent of the changing of the guard, twice whilst we were there. Quite how they stand so perfectly in such temperatures still amazes me! Great to look around and take in the history and views! More photo opportunities!
Worth the climb. High on the hill although if you should climb it you will not be disappointed. Great architecture and view point. If you don't want to climb then I recommend the funicular

Lovely views!. Loved this, we took the funicular up to the Castle and wondered around the outside, taking in the views over Pest then wandered through the back to view Buda side of the city. Do it, if only for the views!
A must-see. amazing view from up there. Take the lift on the way up, on the way down you can walk to enjoy the rest of it. Dont miss the fountains and the mini guard-show. very beautiful!
"A real fairytale castle". The view are magnificent. We really did not have enough time to see eveything. The statues are awsome. Got some fabulous pictures.

Buda Castle, Royal Palace, Budapest. Buda Castle was built on the southern tip of Castle Hill, bounded on the north by what is known as the Castle District (Várnegyed), famous for its Medieval, Baroque, and 19th-century houses, churches, and public buildings. It is linked to Clark Ádám Square and the Széchenyi Chain Bridge by the Castle Hill Funicular.The castle is part of the Budapest World Heritage Site, declared in 1987.[ It is beautiful both in the day and night. Must to take a night cruise

A 'must visit'. Not to be missed area to visit, for the buildings themselves, fountain, the views, and the changing of the guard at noon. Look for videos on youtube such as this one http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=01LB_C7_gnQ
History. Rich very rich History of this Central European Culture . The Panoramic view is excellent. Take some pictures.
Just beautiful. Wonderful large rooms with ornate decorations. On a good day you can get right up into the central dome giving you superb views across the Danube into Pest.

A jewel in the mountains. The castle and the view from the outside are truly beautiful. You have a great view of Pest. We were not interested in going indoors, since the weather was phenomenal, but the exterior is a work of art.

Nice walk in the castle. The Cathedral and the castle looks good on the outside. Nice panoramic view points on each attraction. Many statues and nice fountains, the squire and the guard shift give a nice show.Take a tour guide or a guide tour since just hanging around will not give any pleasant experience.Try the Ruszwurm (http://www.ruszwurm.hu/) cafe it has divine cakes and chocolate.WATCH OUT: The Change has very unattractive rates, so bring the local money in advance. The shops and the restaurants has even worse change rates.

Nice place. This is good place to visit if you have extra time. It is few mins walk from church Matthias, which is a must-see place. It would be better if you go across the chain bridge and see the castle at night time.
Beautiful Building. So interesting to tour a castle so well preserved, yet almost destroyed in the war. The grounds are beautiful. Be sure to see the changing of the guards.

What a view!. It's a beautiful castle, with fabulous views and gorgeous rooms. in the musuem to appreciate the art and history in. Lots of walking and great views to take in - to avoid the masses of people, try waiting for a weekday or going early on weekends.
Advice: Go to the bathroom when you see one (there are not many available)
Buda Castl.e. This is the best view of thne Parlement Buillding. The housingg area iss lovel.y and quiet

Looks great from a distance, less attractive from near. The Buda castle looks magnificent when seen from Pest side and especially at night. I could not wait to go and see the castle from inside. The inside is not that impressive. It was bus ride and a walk in the hot sun only to be disappointed. The highlight of though was the views from the Buda Castle. They were breathtaking.
Gorgeous!. Wondering around Buda this is a must do. The building, views and sculptures around the castle are beautiful. Well worth it.

Great views, beautiful spot. Do visit the castle even if you are only walking around the grounds as I did. You have fantastic views from the top over the Danube river and Chain Bridge. You can also see the parliament building very well. My top tip would be to take the old furnicular up to the top and walk back down through the grounds. Don't miss the waterfall around the back of the castle.

Royal Palace - the best views in Budapest. The Budapest guide book didn't really point out what stunning views there are from here so make sure you have this on your list of things to do.The day of your visit needs to be a clear fine day and make sure you take your camera!To visit here from the Danube you can take the funicular railway from the Buda side of Chain Bridge. When you reach the top turn left and walk through the wrought iron gates. I wasn't expecting to see such stunning views, but there were. Take a look at my photos!The views from the front carriage of the funicular train, looking down on Chain Bridge with St. Stephen's Basilica in the back ground are also amazing so make sure you do this. I suggest that if you want to take the best photos, you will need to be in the front carriage even if it means waiting for the next train. Take a look at my photos and you'll see what I mean.

Beautiful Location. While this is one of the world heritage sights, for the FIT visitor there is a lack of information as to what is available at the location and certainly few if any maps or sufficient reasonable signage for you to navigate your way arround this vast site.For the first time visitor, I would recommend reading up on the location first, finding a good guidebook with maps so you can find what interests you.If its hot like it was during our visit, be sure to be prepared fo lots of walking in the hot sun.We enjoyed out visit and especially the spectacular views over the city. The trip down the hill on the old and very charming funicular railway was a pleasure. Although it appears most visitors use the many tourist busses as the funicular was very lightly used despite the large numbers of visitors to the Palace.

Below Expectations. Budapest has lot of history and was expecting much more from the castle. However, there was no guided tour available and most of the area was closed. The guard changing ceremony was a face saver, but I've seen better ones in Prague & Vienna. However, a good place to click pictures with a view of the city, Parliament and Chain Bridge. The shopping area around castle is nice.

coffee. quite nearby there is an open terrace where u can get tea and coffee , very good prices and the views are fantastic , u also get a free tickets to the toilets which would cost 2 euros otherwise.

Unable to give a true review as we decided to go there on a Monday - unaware that the Castle is closed on this day. We w. Had the weather been good the day we went, there would have been good views over to Pest.
Wow. It is an amazing complex....take the hop on hop off bus to it then walk back to the hotel
Must see. Well - it should be on your list. Budapest sights are condensed and easily accessible, so to get the whole picture - this is a must

Lovely part of Budapest. You must come and see this part of Budapest. When I went I didn't realise all the museums were free on the day I was there otherwise I would have gone around them. Lovely to have a stroll around this area - the old town is immaculately kept.
Castle visit not to be missed. There is so much to see and do - it's a real treasure trove

Dont expect to much but Worth a visit!. It is not a real palace like you used to in many countries but pretty beautiful kept. There is a fountain statue behind it. When you go further into the streets you can find lots of traditional houses and lots to see!

Nice setup for craft fairs and expos. There are frequent expositions here that range from horse and craft shows to wine and palinka tastings. It's more of a place to be savored with a stroll than to check out inside.
AMAZING!. Must visit this spectacular site that overlooks the city.....
The Castle. Fantastic architecture, great history brilliant views over Budapest.
The views were amazing from the Castle. Another historical beauty....steeped in Rich architecture...

Good views. The castle largely only provides good views of Pest but some of the things are noteworthy such as the Mathias well. The guards outside the president's official residence do a sort of "dance" involving swapping rifles that's quite entertaining. Avoid buying anything from the shops/market stalls in the castle precincts, they are a serious rip-off.
Budai vár. If you are in Budapest, you must visit this. From the castle nice view to Pest. And the castle district is also good place for walking around
A must see. A trip up to the castle is well worth the time spent; the history, architecture and the views are amazing. Would recommend taking the funicular to the top!

Impressive building.. You can see Buda Castle (a palace rather than a castle) from all over the city. The building is enormous and the surroundings are worth walking round, even if just for the views of the city from on top of the hill. Most of the interior is taken by the Hungarian National Gallery, which contains only Hungarian artworks. It's surprising how few of them are really original in style - they ape other European art over the centuries. Worth seeing though. Cafe is currently beign refurbished.
Great building...... with a museum inside which is very informative about the history of Hungary. Worth a visit.

Palace museum. We went in spur of the moment and I'm so glad we did. The wood cravings were the best I've ever seen. And there were all these wonderful artists I'd never heard of and wonder why. (I've been to a lot of USA museums and a few European ones).
Great views. Not much to do at the castle, but some great views of Pest and the chain bridge below.
breathtaking. just don't get conned with individuals offering a special tour - buy a map and walk around - and go down to the labyrinths after

Not the most opulent of palaces. Bombed and damaged, the palace is not the highlight of a trip to Budapest. But the walk over the Chain Bridge and up the stairs is nice, and the views from thbe Buda side overlooking the Danube and Pest are beautiful.

Interesting Museum. This museum is in the former Royal Palace that was rebuilt after it was destroyed. It has a good collection of Art from may Hungarian Artist that depects the country's struggles. The most interesting thing about this place is how close you can get to things. They really have lax security and children were touching the paintings! It is much less crowed in here than the other sights so it is worth a visit.
Amazing. What a beautiful place the views were breath taking. My favourite place in Budapest

Castle area is a great place to spend a few hours. I loved walking around this area! You can visit the Church, the Fishermans Bastion (don't pay extra to go to the top level), there is an interesting walk thru the caverns under the street (called Labrinthum) as well as numerous museums, shops and restaurants.

Getting better by the day. A pleasant place to while away half a day or more but beware, the restaurants looked a little pricey. The Hungarian National Gallery which was virtually empty, probably because of the appalling lack of signage outside, contained some incredible wooden sculptures. However many galleries were closed off, leaving a feeling of disappointment. An overload of fairly ordinary Madonna and Christ paintings did not help to lessen the disappointment.  The labyrinth of Buda Castle provided a rewarding experience. Many exhibits depicting life from thousands of years ago displayed throughout a mass of rock embraced caves. l visited on a day when the outside temperature was high and the coolness was appreciated almost as much as the contents of the caves! The Funicular railway connecting the Castle area to the Buda end of the Chain Bridge, is a pleasant way to access or leave the area. Castle Hill is probably one of the best points from which to observe this fine Capital City, without charge.
Beautiful Views. We walked the grounds and held the eagle. This is a great location for pictures. We even stopped and tried the archery that was there.
Gorgeous. Spend a few hours waking around this area and take in the view from the Fisherman's wharf. The Royal Palace and castle are world class in beauty.

If you like Art Nouveau, you must go here. This house is an interesting triple combination of museum, shop selling some objects and very pleasant cafe with good patisseries.The museum areas are quite extensive, both upstairs and in the basement. Don't miss the downstairs loos with small exhibition of Art Nouveau hand basins!

Buda Castle Grounds-A Spectacular View of Budapest. It might be better to call the Buda Castle the Castle Grounds because it's really a whole complex including walls, grounds, fountains, and, of course, buildings, instead of being a medieval-style castle which many people envision when the term "castle" is used. The Castle has been damaged many times in history, with the most recent damage being inflicted by the Soviets in WWII. Because of this it has been rebuilt many times in different styles. Most of the buildings have been devoted to museums, such as the Hungarian National Gallery, which houses some of Hungary's most famous and important artifacts and works of art. Sitting on the Northwest side of the Danube on a hill, the Castle affords outstanding views of Pest across the river, as well as the lower part of Buda. The breezes blowing off the river are refreshing, and as a result of the elevation and the river breezes this area is often cooler than the rest of the city in the hot summer months. My favorite part of the Castle grounds is the Matyas Fountain, depicting King Matyas and his men with their hunting dogs. The figures are so lifelike I can almost imagine the dogs are panting. Visitors to Budapest should not miss the Castle as it is one of the most important historic sites in Budapest.
Fairyland. The whole castle district is like something out of a fairytale, Definitely worth a visit.
Visit it at sunset. The views are always amazing, but we had the luck of visiting it at dusk. Except for the many mosquitoes, I am glad we did it.
Nice place to have a walk. The architecture is great and there are some beautiful statues and some typical hungarian craftwork nearby.
not much left. just a few old walls from what i could see. mostly been built over by their national gallery, but worth a walk round whilst youer up in the old town

Worth a visit for the view alone. Excellent views over the Danube and city make the visit worthwhile alone. Hungarian National Art Gallery definitely worth seeing. Make sure you walk along to explore the Old Town as well, have an expensive cup of coffee at the Fisherman’s Bastion for a unique perspective across the river!

Great architecture, views and surroundings.. Loved walking around the castle, amazing views from the ramparts. A little touristy in places but easy to find quiet spaces to enjoy the surroundings and views,
another gem. another place to see at day and night from ground level and the river
Not much to see. The tramlift up is not covered by transport card and it's largely feasible by foot to avoid cost and queuing. No access into the Palace unless you go into the museum which is inside.

Impressive but was entirely under construction when we were here in mid-2011. Hopefully all the construction works have ended. The streets and surrounding buildings, not just the castle, are all worth exploring as it retains a medieval presence about it.
Fun. Where up here for the palinkafestival. Expensive drinks and food. Had an real good time with some new local friends. Absolutly beatiful setting for this type of event.
Astonishing view over the city. It a must see if you are in Budapest! I recommend to visit it at night, because the view of Pest is just amazing then!

Impressive art museum. I did not know much about Hungarian art before visiting Budapest, and this building houses what is essentially the national museum of Hungary. The galleries are well-lit, the art is nicely spaced, and the collection is impressive.

Changing of the guard must see!. Funicular was around £4, otherwise you climb up hill. Great views and changing of the guard takes place next door at the Presidents quarters. Can walk to Fishermans Bastian from here too

Wonderful views. Lovely place to see the whole of Buda and Pest. Just a wonderful not to be forgotten view, a must if you visit anywhere, go here. Not sure about the merits of the Hilton Hotel built on top of a Monastery but, the clever architecture shows the older buildings in the reflective glass so there a pluses and minuses against marrying the old and the new.

Ride up walk down. Its a short funicular ride to the top. Lots to see and eat, traditional foods and snacks, shopping stalls, a delicious marzipan museum to buy local made marzipan, some of the best ! The walk down is easy, scenic and not at all long.

Wonderful area. The whole castle area is lovely. When we reached the top we were rewarded with a food festival and spent an unexpected two hours eating wonderful local food before exploring the castle and surrounding area. We walked right around the perimeter of the castle walls with views across this amazing, beguiling and fascinating city.

prepare to walk.. The entrance is almost impossible to be found if u are not in an organized tour, there is no signal whatsoever pointing anything... after you get in, it turns out to be a nice place to learn about Hungarys history and visit a decent museum.
just stay outside. go to the castle but stay outside in the gardens because inside is not great.

Nice spot with great views of (mainly) Pest. Coming from the chain bridge you a continually getting better view on funicular which can take you up the hill to the Royal Castle. You that start looking forward up get up with that adjusted tram.Regretfully in our case there was an enormous queue and we looked for another way to get up.Just right from the tunnel you'll see a path (called the Royal stepps I believe) which leads you to  Disz ter from which you easily walk to the Royal castle in about 5 minutes. We didn't visited the museum but spent some time watching the changing of the guards and the musical surrounding of that ,- the surroundings of the castle and the views of Pest you have from here.

Beautiful. This castle and palace area was reached by the hop off hop on tour. Beautiful castle. There were small cafes along the castle wall area that allowed you to enjoy the views and the weather. The views of Pest were excellent from here.
Must see the area. Lots to se in the area but disappointing to find the Fisherman's Bastien now charges a fee to go up on it
A must see attraction. Make sure to learn some history of the place. The views of Danube and Pest from above are spectacular.

If your on Castle Hill you must go. On the outside it is a nice building,which houses the National Gallery and a mseaumm. We visited the National Gallery and saw some excellant paintings by Hungarian artists

Expansive Complex. Expansive Complex at the top of Buda Hill in the Castle District. Offers some of the best views of Pest. Interesting to see the bullet holes and damage that is still visible in many of the buildings' walls.
Comprehensive. A bit different from Versailles but very interesting and rich.

Definitely one to do. Visiting the castle and the surrounding area is like stepping back in time. We walked up and it was quite warm work but enjoyable. The queue for the Fenicular tram was very long and definitely not worth waiting for when the walk takes about 10 minutes.

Fabulous view at night.. This is stunning lit up at night, but beware - they actually turn the lights off at midnight, so get your pictures taken by then!! Wait for the band outside the palace to strike up, they are great, and the soldiers in the sentry are more than happy to have their photo taken with you.
Great view..... Breathtaking view...... You can stay there for hours and take as many pictures as you like....Nice place to walk....

Interesting. the may day weekend and lots of people. We were recmended to not go in so we walked around the grounds which ws good and there was a military band playing which was excellent Glad we went but if we missed itthat would have been ok also

A wonderful taste of history. Walking around Buda Castle is reliving history. The quaint village and the upkeep of the castle is amazing. The number of buildings designated national landmarks is astounding. Take the bus to the top of the hill and walk down for a good walk and a wonderful introduction to the castle.
Great place for photos. Enjoyed the Buda side here and the changing of their guard. I didn't pay to go into any venue but it is one of the best places to shop and take photos.

An interesting piece of history. With an excellent view over Pest the castle is well worth a visit.
It has a been an important factor in European history for centuries, even until our days.
Very interesting.
Incredible views!. You stand in awe as you look out onto the Pest side of the city. Incredible views, the grounds are well kept and it is a stunning place to take some photos.
Lovely place with wonderful views...but no water. The statuary and the palace and views were wonderful but the fountains and pools had no water which was a pity.

Walk up the hill and be amazed!. This is such a wonderful area. The castle itself was pretty, but I have seen nicer ones in my life.No. This area is wonderful because of the spectacular view it offers you on the city. You'll have a splendid view of the Pest side. Search for the iconic buildings as you stand there and marvel at the beauty in front of you. The national gallery is around that area. Continue to your right and you'll walk into Fisherman's Bastion and the Matthias church, which is a MUST to check out! The labyrinth is also in that area if I'm not mistaken. You can go up to the castle by Funicular of walk up there. I, myself, walked up there and enjoyed it a lot!
Magnificent. The whole area has been wonderfully restored and is a fantastic historic area to explore with high quality exhibitions and museums with some of the grandest architecture in Europe.
A Fairy Tale!. The original Disney Castle. Stunningly beautiful with magnificent views across the city. No visit would be complete without it.
Queen of my castle. It is indeed a must see in Budapest. This is a nice way to experince what it feels like to be a queen or king for a day and the statues all around are truly remarkable
Huge building incorporating the History Museum. Fascinating museum showing history of Budapest from prehistoric times. Allow plenty of time to explore. Wear comfy shoes!

Amazing place - the most beautiful of Budapest attraction. Great place! It is very lovely and a MUST SEE! after you croos the bridge and from in front of 0 km of Hungary you can see the castle up on a hill. you have 2 options to go up either by foot on stairs or with the funicular. It is not very expensive. You need around one hour ot two, with a tour guide you need more. Is is a place amazing, with a fascinating history. There are also souvenirs shop and it also offers another amazing view over the Danube!In my opinion Budapest if one of the most beautiful european cities.Enjoy ! And you will not be sorry if you take your time to visit it.
The King of Castles. It contains an art gallery, historical museum, National Library and government offices. All this primarily thanks to Franz Josef and Sissi.
The Castle. The castle area has all kind of services like cash machines , drugstore, restaurants, shops.
Fascinating history. Take a guided tour to get the whole picture. Be prepared to spend a day in the area to savour the scene and the majestic view.
Must go and see. The view of the Danube was amazing and i would recommend you visit the Labyrinth that runs under the castle (scary!!)
amazing grounds and views of the city. another fabulous vantage point and lovely grounds to walk with lots to see!

A must see when visiting Budapest. Beautiful church with plenty of history. If you admire Mathias Corvinus, this is the place to see. They are rebuilding some areas and they are blocked from the view. No not forget to look for the roof tiles and the raven in one of the towers.

A must-visit!. If you buy the 'Budapest Card' you have the right to a free guided tour to the Buda Castle and Royal Palace area, so don't miss it! It's definitely worth visiting and my tip is go for a wine-tasting experience near the Royal Palace.

Very Beautiful buildings, and I liked the close ups. Usually buildings of this importance and/or architecture, you can only see from behind a gate whereas here you could go and touch everything.
As the President took a leave, all those soldier stuff wasn't happening.

Worth going. I'd recommend visiting this castle although the castle itself is not as grand as others in Europe, the view across the river is manigficent. You may also want to spend some time in their coffee bar.
impressive. Buda castle area is the most impressive area in the city; take your time; walk in the different routes' tastes different pastries and enjoy the views from the top.
Beautiful. The climb is nice, the iron gate is gorgeous, the castle itself is plenty to appreciate. Art museum inside is also very interesting.

Nice collection of art from various periods. Large roomy palace which was converted into an art museum. You can find here various paintings and statues of Hungarian artist from the last 400 years. I'm not an art expert, but some of them seemed really good

Beatiful statues and city view. It is a beautiful city free sightseeing, plenty of history, but without information in English. It has superb statues, and the view to the city is outstanding. You can assist at midday to the Presidential Guard shift.
Good trip. An enjoyable day out, very pleasant to walk around, great views over the city.
Very impressive. Don't forget to walk beyond the castle into the village area. There are fun restaurants and great views not to be missed.

grounds only. we only saw the grounds...did not feel like going in to see another museum.....so no comment about the exhibit....did not want to be disappointed....still recovering from my disappointment in the castle of PRAGUE which was empty! I know not necessarily the same situation.....but I did not feel like I missed out on anything.
Nice Views. Some really good views of the river and city here museum was closed the day we visited
Lovely. The histroy museum inside the palace is well worth a visit. enjoyed it very much
Sight to visit. Royal palace and the National Gallery together with a couple of smaller sights are worth visiting, while you are in Buda castle
Modern and Ancient together. You have to take a lot of comfortable shoes with you as you walk these magnificent grounds and remember the days of old....
I like it.. Nice place, nice views, interesting museums. Place of some festivals like wine festival in September.
Great view. Everything around the Buda Castel is wonderful!!! The best views, streets to walk and restaurants/ bars.
Very Impressive. Spent some time taking it all in and then went for a stroll in the park.
Spend a day. Great place to wander around the old town especially plenty of cafes etc

Buda Castle - Royal Palace. Royal Palace, Wow, This is another large, large, large building competing in size with the Parliament. In the interior of the Royal Palace, you'll find entry to a History museum. Take it. Cost was 1500 Forint which is approx. $7 US. Inside, not only will you go back in time but, on the lower level, you'll find rooms that lead deep within the Palace. Definitely fun and interesting
Like a fairytale. The castle looks like a fairytale at night and is just as beautiful in the day. Freezing in February, must be stunning in Spring.
Check it out. I enjoyed seeing this at night. Didnt get to tour it though only a certain amount of people are allowed in a day.
Worth a visit. Very pretty building and easy to see. Wonderful views of the city from this site.
Well worth a visit. Take public transportation up the hill. Spectacular views from here.

Try to meet some festival with food carts there. Interesting place - but avoid heat of the day with crowds. Very good idea is meet some festival with food carts or take your own sandwiches and battle of wine
Walk up or take the funiculaire. We walked up. Saw changing of the guards. From there nice views on Pest & the Danube river.
A must see. Not only was the castle and palace wonderful, but the best views of the Pest side of the Danube are from here.
Fantastic place to visit. By day or night. It's high up and the view is brilliant!
The Views!!. The views are stunning. The building itself is absolutely beautiful, and the statues and history of the grounds is incredible. Well worth spending a half-day in this area
worth a visit. the history of the castle. but if you have mobility problems it is bit more of a challenge

Beautiful. We didnt actually go inside but the whole area around the castle is beautiful. worth going to Budapest just for this. At night its especiaily pretty-lots of fairy lights and a great view over the city and the river danube
Buda Castle. Actually an expensive museum next to the Royal Palace. Not possible to visit the palace.
Take your time. Don't rush, take your time, there is so much to see you may need to come back again.

Easy access to external areas. I was able to get up close to the front and inner courtyard areas. Great views out over Pest and the Danube & Parlament Building. Cobbles were a little uneven in places so take care. The Guards antics with their rifles kept watchers amazed!
pretty castle. Budapest and it's castle: definitely a must see. Very nice view over Pest and the Danube. Very nice old neighbour hood, small streets, old castle and church.

Excellent views of Budapest. We went to Buda Castle twice, and I recommend to do it during the day, but also in the evening as view you will have is different. You can walk up hill (takes time and efforts) or you can use funicular for a short ride. Once you are up, you have a lot of things to see and visit, if you want to do it thoroughly, you will need the most of a day. No problems for food or drinks as there are number of place where you have it. Luckily, we were there during Wine fest, and that was just another plus to the Buda Castle visit!
Scenic. Great architecture, statuary and wonderful view of the city and the Danube.
so amazing. I love to go there especially on summer day. I go there with a book and little snack. And enjoy whole afternoon sitting on a bench on the castle. So peaceful.
Worth exploring. It was fun to poke around the castle. I found it a little funky in spots but it was worth visiting.
stunning views. The views over the city from the Castle is amazing - and there are some lovely lunch restaurants on top of the hills
beautiful!. go & see if u can! enjoy little troley that takes u up and beautiful city's panorame [royal palace is located on the hill]
Majestic. When I am in Budapest, I always go for a walk in the Castle. Very relaxing and beautiful.
Beautiful walk.. The palace and the view from it are mind blowing. Make sure you walk all the way up and down, and don't take the Siklo.
Best place. It's best place to make a lot of photos (palace itself, main church, many statues, many beautiful buildings, panorama of Pest and river).
For History buffs.. My 16 year old son, who accompanied me, is a huge history buff. This was his favorite. Even though no king ever lived in the palace. ( another vanity of kings.)
Great views. Nice walk up. Great views of the city. Lots of picture opportunities. The city is beautiful in the fall. The walk up is fine unless you are excessively lazy or handicapped.

Wonderful vista. There is a cable car, starting at the northern end of the chain bridge. Take it, big fun. There is an other, vefry little knovn lift from the west wall of the castle, directly up to the inner yard of the castle . Not easy to find, but it is worth while, to avoid the climbing. Cost something like 0,5 Euro, from the back of the Dozsa Gyorgy statue. Most, but naot all HUngarians will know it and show it to you

I had my breath away all corner are so beautiful !. You will find a great view to the other side of the city (Pest)
The visual is such wonderful. The sight on the town by day is very nice, by night it is just amazing
I had my breath away all corner are so beautiful !
There are also a very interesting museum.

A fairy tale brought to life!. The visual of the castle will take your breath away and use all your memory space on your camera if you are not careful. Like being in a movie and transports you into a world of another time!
Lovely outside, gloomy inside. The outside gardens are lovely to visit on a nice day. The inside however seemed dark and gloomy.
beautiful castle. very interesting museum. The sight on the town by day is very nice, by night it is just amazingThe siklo to go up is nice
Buda Castle. Sight for many special events but great to see even if no event scheduled.
cool. I had a gret view to the other side of the city (Pest)

Very nicely illuminated exterior. Great palace-thinking that noone ever live there!We took the Ciclo lift in the afternoon and the palace was very nicely illuminated,has a wonderful view to Danube and Pest.
Spectacular catsle. Another must see that can be done on the same ticket if you buy a bus tour.

Historical museum is excellent. We were worried about this museum at the beginning as we did not understand any of it - there was very little in English. However, this changed when on the first floor as there was a massive exhibition on the history of Budapest which was very interesting. Would definitely recommend this museum. Also visit the cafe as it is very cheap for a museum!!!! With very good cake and mulled wine...

Guards show. When you are not used to it these soldier guards rituals look very much like a tourist entertainment show. The changing of the guards ceremony with the dedicated drummer made us start singing a traditional soldier song!
NICE!. Didn't have time to go inside, but it is gorgeous at night when it is all lighted up and it looks like a gold castle!!
Grand site.. Such a site for a palace . not equalled anywhere in the western world. I hope someday they will endeavour to restore the interiors.
significant. sets the scene for budapest & tells the story of the city
Don't go in December Closed, weather poor. Closed for the Holiday season, weather made it difficult or impossible to see.
Good touristic area. A lot of things to see in that area. Very nice and historical
Just the view. Not that impressive castle-palace. Just the view. Watch out for the iron birds.

A very nice walk. I spent a whole morning wandering around the buildings of the Palace, eating pieces of the delicious rolled sweet pastry called kurtoskalacs (or something like this) one can find in a ciosk near there. The view of the city is splendid. The place might be a little overcrowded, but one can simply walk a little farther, and take a glimpse of the everyday life of Buda. I didn't use the funicular, I though that walking was the best way to enjoy this part of the city

Beautiful Former Hapsburg palace with beautiful views of Budapest. Walk from Elizabeth bridge up to the back side of the palace (the side u can see from the Danube). You will be rewarded with great views of the Parliament and the bridges below. B sure to take the underground labrynth tour!

Good view. The view from the castle is amazing where you can see the pest site and the river. when you get to the castle there is a cable car to take you up and it is expensive. You dont need that as it is a very short walk up and it is not tiring at all, it is actually a better experience to walk up.
Grand Architecture. Buda Hill easy exploring. Easy to get to on the HopOn HopOff bus. Restaurants and Ice Cream are reliable treats.

Obviously has been rebuilt (in the communist era). The trip up on the mountains is well worth the effort for the views it offers. To me the castle itself was a disappointment. From across the Danube it all looks OK, but the renovations have not brought back the grandeur you would expect from such a royal castle for instance, it has been fitted with very ugly windows.

A Castle with A View. The castle is dramatically perched in the hills of Buda overlooking the Beautiful Brown Danube and the splendid architecture of Pest. You will encounter few annoyances in comparison with analogous tourist attractions in other European cities but you will not be the only one there (unless you prowl the streets at night and then the district is shockingly empty). Fabulous exhibits and some of the best atmosphere in urban Europe. If you have the time, you should stop in at Ruszwurm for some kremes.
Great views. Great views from the top of the hill overlooking the Danube and the Pest side.
Really lovely architecture. However a shame it hasn’t been left as palace.

Two interesting museums in a magnificent building. We wisited the two museums in the Royal Palace ( The National Gallery and the History Museum of Hungary). The building is an impressive one, with an extraordinary panorama of the whole city. We liked the most the National Gallery which has an impressive collection of paintings from the 17th and 18th century. Visiting the Royal Palace is a must do for every traveller in Budapest.
Very good. Took guided tour and expanded my knowledge as to how important this area of europe was in past years.
budaas castle. these castle are very nice u have a beautiful look out the city from this place there are around 7 castles to c u will have fun.

worth a visit. We spent a day vsiting the castle district and enjoyed it very much. The palace itself now houses a museum which we didn't actually visit but seemed very popular. Easy access by tram form the centre of Budapest.
Bring Your Camera. You will want to take pictures. It's really one of the most remarkable city views anywhere.
OK. A little busy for my liking. A few good restaurants, though pricey due to the location. Worth spending a day walking around. Pretty views of the rest of the city.

History not to be missed.. Like all the Budapest renovated sites, it has much to commend it. The history and way things have been put together is wonderful. Best to take the funicular or you can be tired after all the walking and not appreciate the vast amount to take in.
lovely views of city. very touristy but it HAS to be seen if only once. Take a tram and bus and avoid the Funicular which has a long queue and is quite expensive for the short trip

Imagine life....back in the day. This is a stunning castle. What a story it tells....what a view it has. Did not have time to go inside, but I did poke my head in. The gallery looked absolutely magnificent. Will check it out next time for sure.

One of a kind!. The castle itself is stunning but the entire castle hill is well worth the visit. Like time stopped; Cobblestone streets, small corners to explore and an absolutely amazing view!
A few restaurants there but more touristy, I would not suggest getting anything besides a coffee...go into the city to get some good, reasonably priced foods.
Huge place. Have walked around the gallery a few times. You take the lift up from the road or you can walk up, a bit steep.
Great museum. Grand and very substantial building with interesting museum on the site
nice towers, mideaval athmosphere. Very nice, you must have seen this when you visit budapest.
beautiful views from the top. Nice architecture. A fantastic overview of the city from the terrance. A must do!

Nice view. The Buda Castle complex does have a lovely view, and I would recommend going up there for that. Fisherman's Bastion looks like a sandcastle, and was fun to wander around. I thought the price for St. Matthais was a bit steep when you could see so many of the other beautiful churches for free, so we didn't go in. Plus, my daughter was sick of churches. The only museum we had time for was the Budapest History Museum. We went because it was free with our Budapest Card. It was OK. Just so you know, the labyrinth under the castle hill is closed. You can walk up the hill, but it looks like quite a trek. The funicular wasn't included in our travel pass (and it didn't actually look like it was running when we were there. I never saw it move, anyway), but there's a bus that will take you to just down from St. Matthais, which will save you from being tired before you even start looking around. The walk down from the castle was very nice, though, and the path came down just at the end of the chain bridge, which makes it very easy to just walk back across to the rest of town.
Ok. Nice to walk around the grounds as aprt of overall tour of castle hill area.
a room with a view. sights that will always stay with me looking acrooss budapest on a sunny day
Castle but without much furniture. Disappointing due to relative emptiness. It was heavily looted in past. However location is good on the top of Buda Hill with good views over the Danube

Spectacular view. One of the most beautiful areas in Budapest. It was so nice to buy hot wine over there and then admire spectacular view from this castle hill. All this area it should be the main point visiting Budapest.

Stunning architecture. Beautiful place just next to the Castle Hill. Its around 10 min walking from there. Stunning architecture. Wonderful view. Lots of photographers. You can see the separation of the both cities from there - Buda and Pesta! I will definitely visit again.
Beautiful!. The Castle district was my favorite part of the whole city. It is a must see area and plan on spending some time walking around. It will be worth it.
must see!. very cute and has a great view.. definitely a must see place.

Excellent in september with the wine-festival!. You have to go here in september when wine-festival is coming to town. For a minor cost you can taste lots of differents kinds of wines with coupons and you have your own glass to take with you home. Really an experience and a memory for life. We loved it!
AMAZING!. It's amazing! On the top of the hill, beautiful beautiful view, you can see the whole Pest side! Restaurants incredibly expensive but good quality for sure.

Amazing architecture and breath taking view. Beerfest was held here this year and lucky for us it started on the day we arrived in Budapest. It was a one of a kind experience with so many kinds of beer to try and drinking with the beautiful castle on one side and overlooking the Danube and the Pest on the other side. There were lots of things to see and do: you can visit the museums, just walk around the castle grounds and admire the fountains, the garden and the beautiful city beneath, or you could venture into the Castle District with its quaint little buildings and shops and walk your way to the enchanting and intricately design Fisherman's Bastion.

Buda Castle- a center for mutch activity in Budapest. We was so lucky to be in Budapest an visit Buda Castle during the Beer Festival.Fantastic weather, fantastic view and a hugh number of different beer to taste.Còud not have been better.

Nice walk and lots to see. Our hotel was overlooking the Chain Bridge and we had a great view of the Royal Palace from our bedroom window.There are many ways to get to the Royal Palace and we opted to walk across the Chain Bridge and catch the travelator ( a hundred year old carriage going up a steep incline) up the hill. Once at the top we were instantly in the grounds of the Palace. You need to spend at least a day here maybe more as there is so much to see besides the Palace. My favourite was the WWII bunker set into the citadel which also had fantastic views. We were told that the Royal Palace was flattened during WWII if this is the case they have done a fantastic restoration job because it looks authentic. Take a tour inside the Palace it is well worth seeing also.
its really nice place with a great view @ whole city. i really loved the architecture, the gates, details, the view and also those fountains ...

wonderfull sight specially at night. The buda castle is a wonderfull place to walk through and the sight from the castle toward the danube is lovely specially in the evening when the sun goes down and the lights come up on the bridges. One may go up with the Siklo , but there is also an easy to climb, trail (about 120 steps) from Adam clark square up to the castle. A lazy walk from south end of the castle to the north end would take arround an hour. We walked the whole thing both ways and stopped at all the sights , and it took us about two hours. The Labyrinth is also worth a visit. Entrance fee is reasonable (2000 forint each) and it is cool inside and unique ,we spent arround an hour getting lost inside.

Beautiful architecture and a Nice walk up.... Beautiful architecture and a Nice walk up the Hill to the castle itself. The scenery and view of Budapest is really nice. I would recommend walking up the Hill rather than taking one of the guided bus tours to the castle. It's very touristy though which is kind of annoying. All in all - Nice place but not my favourite place in Budapest

Very nice exterior and grounds, but didn't pay to go into museums. The castle grounds and the exterior of the old Royal Palace were very nice, but we didn't pay to go into the museums now built inside. Beautiful views of the city from there, both of the Pest side and Buda hills. Make sure to visit the Fisherman's Bastion from here. Funnel cake was delicious!

Nice to walk around, good views of the city. We actually went both at day and night and it was cool to get views of the city at both times of day. The Hungarian history and art museums are located here as well. To get there, you can take the funnicular or walk up. If it is at the end of a long day of walking, you may want to spend more for the funnicular (around 800 forints 1 way or about 1400 round trip). I especially don't think it is worth it to pay extra for a return trip since it's a pleasant walk down.

Interesting Views- not much to learn. We took the funicular to the top of the hll, wandered around using our gudie books, nice to see the location- chose not to go ito the museums. Famous fountain didn't have any water in it... Vieew was the most intersting part

Great place to visit!. I took the trolly car up to the top, however, you can walk up if you would like. The view is spectacular!! It is worth it just for the view. I didn't go into the Palace, however, spent a long time walking around and looking at the various statues and the views.

A large piece of Buda history. The place has been rebuilt so many times over the last 1,000 years that you need a guide book to tell what is old, not so old, and new. It has been looted many times including by the Turks, the Nazis and the Soviets. Study up on it before you see it and it will register a lot more, or get a guide. IF you know what you are looking at, it is a wonderful site.
